I rinsed my mouth with it and spit it out.  My mouth felt clean, although I can't say it felt any cleaner than it normally would after brushing and rinsing/gargling with mouthwash, which I did after finishing brushing and flossing with the AirFloss Pro.  I had no difficulty keeping the liquid bursts in my mouth during usage.  You can turn the AirFloss Pro off by pressing the power button on the bottom of the handle, or it will turn itself off if you put it on the charger.The AirFloss Pro claims to lead to healthier gums within 2 weeks of regular usage.  Time constraints for writing reviews prevents me from waiting that long to see what happens, but I can say the product is easy to use, takes very little time or effort to use, and is something I can easily incorporate into my usual twice daily dental routine.  I definitely prefer to use something like the AirFloss Pro rather than flossing with string, so if it will make my gums healthier without having to use string floss I will be very pleased over time.  The price for the AirFloss Pro is about what you would pay for a quality electric toothbrush.  I do think Philips should include a plastic travel case for it at this price point, like they do with their Sonicare toothbrushes,, but this is a relatively minor quibble.  It would also be nice if a second nozzle was provided and a stand built into the charging base to store nozzles on it so it would be easier for others to share the AirFloss Pro.  Overall, I think it is a great product for flossing without string, and it would be ideal for those who hate to use string to floss (like me) or who can't use string floss due to wearing dental appliances or for other reasons.  I really like the AirFloss Pro and will be using it regularly from now on.

I use binoculars mainly for usage while target shooting and occasional bird watching.  Up to now I have been using Minox Bv 10x42 binoculars, so I was curious to see how the Bushnell Legend Ultra HD L-series binoculars, which are priced similarly to the Minox, stack up.These Bushnell binoculars arrive nicely packaged in plastic with two covers, a soft bag cover and a firm fabric cover.  Included are rubber lens protectors for both the eye cups and the objective lenses.  The covers for the eye cups are removed completely for usage of the binoculars, although they do have a ring to attach them to the included neck strap to keep them from getting lost.  The covers for the objective lenses are flip-down covers that stay attached to the binoculars with a rubber ring.  They are designed so they can be easily removed and replaced if needed.Like most quality binoculars these Bushnell Legend ones have easy twist adjustable eye cups for eye relief and also a locking diopter adjustment (on the right eye cup only).  They right eye cup diopter adjustment is made with a movable ring that can be locked in place.  To unlock the diopter ring for adjustment you pull it upward (it only moves about 1 mm, so the movement is slight), turn the ring to the desired diopter setting, and then push the ring back down to lock the setting in place.  There is a knurled knob on the ring, I presume to make it easier to adjust, although I found the ring was easier to lock/unlock and adjust without using the knob.  If I were Bushnell I would get rid of the knob as it really doesn't improve function and prevents the right rubber eyecup cover from seating all the way down on the eyecup.  This is a minor quibble, though, and does not detract from the overall quality or performance of these binoculars.Compared with my Minox binoculars the Bushnell binoculars are noticeably heavier but about the same size.  They have a very solid feel with good construction.  The quality of view is equivalent to my Minox BV binoculars, and these Bushnell binoculars provide a very sharp image.  I had no difficulty focusing at both great distance and close up (within about 4 feet).  About the only downside is there is no mount to attach the binoculars to a tripod, but my Minox binoculars do not have this feature either.Overall, these Bushnell Legend Ultra HD L-Series 10x42 binoculars are very nice binoculars for their price.  They compare favorably with Minox BV 10x42 binoculars in size, features, and performance.  Being somewhat heavy and having no tripod mount they would not be the best choice for star gazing.  They would be ideal, though, for anyone wanting good quality binoculars for hunting, sporting events, bird watching, and target shooting.

This is a very pretty sterling silver pendant with amethyst (purple color) accents.  It is shipped in a sturdy presentation box, and the pendant is actually larger and far more pretty than the picture depicts.  The design is quite elegant, and the amethyst accent gives it very pretty color.  The price is reasonable for the quality of the pendant.  Highly recommended.

To maximize and optimize the flavor of wine it needs to be aerated.  One way to do this is to open a bottle of wine and let it sit for an hour or two to aerate.  Another method, often used by wine enthusiasts, is to decant the wine into a special wide-based decanter that allows for air to contact s larger surface of wine for aeration.  Even with this method the wine needs to sit for a while to let aeration bring out its maximum flavor.This Tanors wine decanter aerator arrives nicely packaged for gifting.  It aerates wine quickly while pouring by exposing wine to air more directly and quickly as it is poured into the device.  There is a removable plastic upside down umbrella that has numerous small holes in it that works as an aerator as wine is poured through it.  The aerator introduces air into the wine and brings out its optimum flavor without having to let the wine sit for an hour or more.  I found this aerator system works better than an older Venturi aerator that I had been using up to now.  There is no question wine tastes better if poured through this aerator into a glass, but it tastes even better if allowed to sit for a half hour or so to aerate further. A small plastic stand is included to store the aerator upright between uses.If you enjoy drinking wine and prefer not to wait for an hour or longer to get the optimum flavor this aerator will help optimize its flavor quicker.  It is easy to use, works well, and is easy to clean and store between uses.  It is inexpensive and would make a nice gift for anyone who enjoys drinking wine.

We have five adult cats ranging in age from about 3-1/2 years old to 12 years old.  They typically like to eat fish, chicken, and beef cat food in various preparations.  I took this Nutro Company Adult Cat Chunky Loaf food and put it out with other canned cat food that our cats usually love to eat to see what would happen.  Our cats devoured the Nutro cat food like it was a rare treat.  The other food I sat out for them went largely untouched.  So based upon our cats' apparent preference I would say this Nutro food is very much preferred (by my cats, at least).  It is not cheap, but it is comparably priced to other premium cat food.  If you want to serve your cats a nutritious, premium canned cat food this Nutro product s well worth consideration.

I have well over $15,000 invested in my home audio system.  For a long time I have looked for a set of headphones that can provide the audiophile sound I expect from the rest of my system.  I think I have found them in these Philips X2/27 Fidelio Premium Headphones.The headphones arrive attractively packaged in a black box.  They come with a detachable cable with standard 1/8" stereo plugs on both ends and a gold-plated adapter for use with conventional amplifiers and receivers that use a 1/4" plug.  The cable is too long for listening with a portable mp3 player and too short for listening with a home audio system from across the room.  I will be looking for a suitable extension cable to use with it since I plan to use these headphones solely for listening with my home audio system.  Sadly, there is no bag or carry case included, which I think is a major oversight for headphones this expensive but not a deal-breaker.The headphones are quite large, but very comfortable to wear.  The head band is designed with comfort in mind, and the velour ear cups are very soft on my ears even with prolonged listening.  I have been listening to a wide variety of music with them, music with deep bass, music with predominant midrange sound, and music with delicate high notes.  These Fidelio headphones reproduce all of it with ease with no noise or artifact.  Unlike other high-end headphones I own, there was no break-in period to hear music the way it was meant to be heard.  There is no muddling of sound at all.  Listening to music with these headphones I am hearing things that have for years gone unnoticed while listening with high-end tower speakers.  It's like having all new recordings to explore.If you love music and have the ear to appreciate quality sound reproduction you will find these Philips X2/27 Fidelio Premium Headphones to be well worth the expense.  They are comfortable, versatile, and sound fantastic.  I am extremely happy with this purchase.

We have 5 cats ranging in age from 3-1/2 years old to 12 years old.  All but one usually likes cat treats.  I gave all five these Wellness Kitties treats to try.  Three cats ate them readily.  The other two pretty much ignored them.  One of the two that ignored them was the one who normally doesn't like treats anyway, so I consider this a 75% thumbs up in our household.  Compared with Whiskas Temptations, which our cats absolutely love, these treats are expensive and were not eaten as readily.  So before buying a bunch of these expensive treats you may want to have your cat try a few to see if they even like them.

This is the third time I have purchased this exact model of clock.  I keep buying them because I really like the ceiling display which makes it very easy to tell the time while laying in bed at night, but the digits of the ceiling display just do not hold up well over time.  I think the longest one of these has lasted is about 3 years or so.  The clock is easy to set and maintains time well by setting itself by synchronizing with an atomic time clock.  The ceiling display can be turned on or off. The front LCD display is easy to illuminate by tapping the bar on the top of the clock.  It is operated on AC (adapter included) and also has a battery backup that can also power the clock in the absence of AC power.  The overall design of this clock is kind of goofy and looks like something that would have fit in better in the 1960's.If you want an alarm clock that can display time on the ceiling this Oregon Scientific clock is worth considering.  But plan on replacing it every few years as the ceiling display does not hold up very well over time.  The LCD display seems to hold up better, though, and the clock can still be used without the ceiling display.

I bought this tool set on sale during Amazon Prime day.  It is smaller than I thought it would be, but it does have some useful bits for working on smaller items.  The bit sizes are about what you would see on a jeweler's screwdriver, although this is clearly a much larger assortment of bits.  Quite honestly, though, the construction of this set feels very cheap and does not look like it will hold up very well over time.  It looks and feels like a tool set that one might find in a discount bin somewhere for $2 and not the $11 I paid for it.

I bought three sets of these hangers for some heavier jackets and coats I own.  For the price these hangers are very nice looking and sturdy.  All arrived in perfect condition.  Yes, they are made in China, but compared with other similar hangers I considered on Amazon these are truly the best value for the money spent.  These would be ideal for hanging up a nice suit jacket & pants to prevent damaging the nice press of the suit jacket.  In my case, these are ideal for hanging up some nice leather jackets I own.

I have never used Axe branded products before but have always been curious about them.  This Axe White Label body wash has a very strong but masculine smell.  Actually, I really like the scent a lot.  So does my wife.  The soap is purple, which I could tell even before using it as some leaked out during shipping (disappointing, Amazon -- something like this really should be wrapped in a plastic bag prior to shipping).  The soap lathers well and rinses off nicely.  It does not make my skin feel overly dry.  Definitely a product I would recommend for any man.  The scent is quite strong and lingers, though, so if you can you will want to smell it before purchase to make sure it is a scent you like.

These tags are perfect for what I needed them for.  I have a large collection of firearms in a safe.  Each one is stored in a fabric bag to prevent rust.  These tags enable me to label each bag with the firearm brand, model, caliber, and even the serial number with room to spare.  The wires attached to each tag are long and thin enough to easily run through the fabric of the bag without having to punch any holes.  Using these I can easily identify each firearm in my safe without having to remove it from the bag.These tags will also be perfect for attaching prices to items for our next garage sale.  Retailers would find these very useful to mark prices on items for sale.The tags are advertised as "shipping tags."  While they are definitely handy for attaching identification to items, the cardboard tags are very thin and would not likely hold up well if attached to items for shipping.  The hole in each tag is reinforced, but I think the paper tag itself would rip right off around it pretty easily.  So for that purpose I can't say I would recommend them.  But for price tagging or identification of items that won't undergo rough handling these are great.

I was first introduced to Philips earphones with their Philips NC1/27 Fidelio Noise Cancelling Premium Headphones with Ergonomic Memory Foam Cushions, Black, which I absolutely love.  I do listen to music and watch movies on my iPad while riding an exercise bike, so I thought these ActionFit Earbuds would be worth a try.The earbuds arrive in a nicely packaged box that is easy to open and reseal.  The earbuds are fully assembled and come with three different sizes of ear tips for a more custom fit.  The band is designed to be worn behind your head, and hooks go over each ear to keep the earbuds secured in your ears.  The cord is sturdy, seems tangle-free, and has a handy clip to secure it to your clothing if desired.  A lightweight mesh bag is included to store the earphones when not in use.I found the earbuds very comfortable to wear, and the design of the band keeps them in my ear no matter how much I move my head.  There is no adjustment to the positioning of the ear tips, though, and I found I could not get a good seal in my ear no matter which size tip I tried.  The end result was no sound isolation and very little bass response, although midrange and treble were good.  The cord is very well-insulated, and there was no noise artifact when it brushed against my clothing with movement.Pros:solid constructionband keeps them secured in your ears wellcord is well-insulated with no artifactmultiple sizes of ear tips providedwaterproof and sweatproof designCons:lack of adjustment in earbud tip may prevent sound isolation for some peoplepoor bass reproduction (could be due to lack of good seal in my ear)somewhat bulky (can't be folded up for compact storage)In summary, these are comfortable earbuds that are clearly designed for wear while exercising.  They are well-constructed and fit very securely no matter how much you might move around.  While they do have different sizes of ear tips included to help customize their fit these earbuds have no swivel at the tip which may prevent a good seal in your ear and, as a result, may compromise sound isolation and bass response for some people.  If you want sturdy earphones that will stay in place during running or other exercise these may be a good choice if they fit your ears well.  If sound quality is more important to you then you will definitely want to try these out before purchase.

I have used a wide variety of wireless routers from DLink, Mediabridge, and TP Link up to now.  For years I have wanted to try Linksys to see if their routers are worth the extra money.Unlike the other routers I have used up to now, the new Linksys AC2600 4x4 MU-MIMO dual-band wireless router uses technology that sends data to multiple devices simultaneously.  By doing so this technology is supposed to speed up data transmission and prevent delays and buffering while downloading large amounts of data while streaming movies, etc.  I will say after installing and configuring this router it does seem to speed things up.The router arrives in a large cardboard box and is protected on all sides by large cardboard boxes.  The size of this router is huge.  It is about 1-1/2 times the size of my previous routers and over twice the size of my cable modem.  The only assembly involves screwing on its 4 antennae.  The included AC adapter is large and heavy.  The router has a power on/off switch that is nice compared with some of my other routers that require you to unplug the power cord to turn them off.  The user manual is in digital format written in numerous languages on an included CD.  Quite honestly, I found the manual to be largely useless compared with other routers I've owned.  This is disappointing, and for the amount of money spent I think more comprehensive and detailed manual should be provided.There is a quick install card provided that provides very skeletal information but enough to get you connected initially.  The setup for this router is not as user-friendly as it is on other brands I've used, but if you are reasonably computer literate it is pretty easy to set up.  Once you have connected the router (in Windows - I do not have a Mac on my network) you have to go to your network settings to add it to your network.  Linksys provides a temporary name and password for the router which you can change later.  Once your computer has recognized the router, and you have logged on to it with your password, you then open a web browser and log in to linksyssmartwifi.com to finish configuring and setting up the router.  You can allow the router to do this all automatically for you (the preferred method) or, if you want to do so manually you can do so.  The automatic set up was quite fast and easy, and I had no trouble reassigning a new name and password for the newly connected router.  You can also sign up for a Linksys Smart Wi-Fi account that enables you to log on from anywhere and make adjustments to your router settings.  The ability to access and change router settings remotely is handy and a feature not available on other routers I have used.Unlike most of my old routers, the AC2600 provides 2.4 and 5 gHz access along with guest access for each of those frequencies as well.  You can assign different passwords for each or keep them all the same if desired.  The router also has USB connections for adding a USB printer or hard drive to share on the network.  This is especially handy for attaching newer 1 terabyte or larger USB hard drives for easy backup among multiple computers on the network.Once your router is completely configured it is easy to access the settings using a web browser to make changes.  There is also a built-in speedometer that can show you how quickly data is downloaded and uploaded.  Range transmission is excellent.  I have excellent signal strength showing throughout my home.Overall, I am very pleased with the Linksys AC2600 router.  It does seem to speed up transmission between computers connected to my home network, and I have had not delays or issues streaming music, movies, or TV shows with the Amazon Fire box connected to my home audio-video system.  It does add an extra guest account in the 5 gHz range that my TP Link router lacked.  The firewall security is excellent.  This Linksys AC2600 router has a premium price tag attached to it, but it is comparable in price to other brands of routers offering similar features and performance.  If you have a lot of wireless devices in your network using a shared Wi-Fi connection, especially if 3 or more are operated simultaneously, it may be well worth the added expense to prevent delays in data transmission.

For many years I have appreciated audiophile sound and have owned very high-end audio equipment to enjoy music at home.  My hearing is good enough to detect subtle sound differences from both speakers and headphones.  Over the years I have listened to music through a wide range of headphones from those that are inexpensive to those costing several hundred dollars, and I can hear the difference between all of them.  Now that I have started streaming music on my iPad and iPhone for less formal listening I have been looking for some nice headphones for that purpose.The Skullcandy Grind headphones arrive in a cardboard box that opens much like a cereal box.  You have to rip off a tab on the bottom flap of the box to open it, which kind of cheapens the presentation of the product.  Inside is a folded, rigid plastic tray that contains the headphones.  In a small plastic bag is a straight cord to plug into the headphones and two pieces of paper folded up very tightly, a warranty description and a sheet of very brief instructions printed in several languages.  There is no case or bag to keep the headphones in.  This is a no-frills item, to say the least.Seeing the headphones packaged in such a cheap way I was instantly skeptical about how they would sound.  I plugged them in to my iPhone 5c and streamed some of my music from Amazon's cloud for listening.  I was immediately blown away by the excellent sound reproduction through these headphones.  The mid-range was clear, and the high frequency sounds were very audible and crisp.  Bass was full and firm and not at all muddy or booming.  I listened to several different types of music from Pink Floyd to Allman Brothers to popular vocalists, and the music consistently sounded absolutely great. The sound was consistently good whether I listened at high or low volume levels.  There was no rattle when I cranked them up loudly.  I could not help but compare them by listening to the same music through other more expensive headphones that I own from Sennheiser, Bose, and VModa and was shocked at how much better the Skullcandy headphones sounded.  Usually, most headphones require a break-in period of several hours of listening before they will sound right.  These Skullcandy headphones sound perfect right out of the box.  Truly amazing.Clearly, these headphones were designed for usage with smart phones and other mobile devices.  The headphones have a built-in microphone (which I did not test as I don't use headphones to talk on the phone) and a button on the left ear cup that allows you to answer and end phone calls, turn sound on and off while listening to music, and switch between music tracks.  They are lightweight and comfortable to wear.  The headband adjusts easily.As I pointed out, this is a very no-frills product.  The packaging is cheap, and there is no case or bag to keep the headphones in.  The headphones cannot be folded up for compact storage. The detachable cable has standard 1/8 inch stereo plugs but no adapter to 1/4 inch size is included, so you will have to purchase this separately to use these headphones with a home receiver.  The cable is straight and not coiled or non-kink, but it seems sturdy enough to hold up over time.  It is not long enough for listening across the room from the sound source, but keep in mind these were designed for use with mobile devices and not a home stereo.The sound from these headphones, though, rivals that from headphones costing far more than these, and you get that wonderful sound right out of the box.  If you are looking for good-sounding headphones for not a lot of money, these Skullcandy Grind headphones are a steal for the sound reproduction you get in return.  I was truly amazed by how great they sound and have thoroughly enjoyed listening to music with them.
Exactly like the one that came with my HJC helmet that I lost.  It is inexpensive and works well to protect the helmet and visor from scratches.

For many years I have been in search of a quality, compact grooming kit.  Over the years I have had kits given to me as gifts, and have purchased kits myself, but all have been the typical Chinese junk one finds at the local discount stores.  For a long time I have had to settle for nice nail clippers made in Japan, which I really like, but I have still lacked the nice matched set I've wanted.  So when I received the opportunity to review the Zwilling J.A. Henckels grooming set I got very excited.  The set arrived in today's mail and was perfect timing as my nails have very much been in need of a trim, and I have been waiting for the set to arrive.First off, this is not just over-priced junk.  This is a very precision-engineered grooming set manufactured by the same company known for its premium chef knives.  This grooming set falls in that same category of quality craftsmanship where you get what you pay for.  So before fainting at the price keep in mind you are paying for very high quality.The set arrives in a nice box for gifting, and the grooming tools are neatly arranged in a stylish, thick leather case with a zipper closure.  There are only 5 tools in the set, but the case is overly large and has extra slots in it that lead me to believe it was designed to hold additional tools (a comb and/or razor, perhaps?).  Each tool has its own slot with the longer file and cuticle pusher needing to be kept at the edges of the case or it won't close.  The case is a bit bulky for this grooming set, but the leather is very nice and no doubt contributes to some of the high cost of this set.The nail clippers are very unique and frustrated me at first.  Unlike other clippers, these are designed to fold completely flat for storage and arrive that way.  To open them you must gently pull back on the top half of the clipper (there is a small ribbed area on it to give you a surface to pull it backward with) which allows the two pieces to separate a little bit.  This is where I got initially frustrated as the tool will not clip or work properly without taking the additional step of lifting the back end of the upper clipper upward and then pushing it forward to lock it into a clipping position.  I don't know if the one I received had a stuck spring or if I just didn't use it correctly at first, but once I figured it out I had no problems using the clipper.  The manufacturer really should provide a little instruction sheet with this set as I have no doubt many have been frustrated thinking the clipper was useless from not knowing how to open it correctly.  The clippers are so lightweight and frail-feeling that I was afraid they might break easily, but I quickly found that very little force is needed for them to precisely cut my nails.  And when I say cut, I mean cut.  These have very precise and sharp edges that cut the nail off with absolutely no jagged edges or tearing like ordinary clippers.  Even the fine Japanese nail clippers I own do not cut this easily and precisely.  After clipping my nails I found little need for usage of the nail file, although the file in this kit is equally nice and works great.The scissors in this kit are also remarkable in their precision and sharpness.  The rounded tip makes them very safe for trimming eyebrows, nose hairs, and hair that always seems to grow out of men's ears as we get older.  There is nothing particularly special about the cuticle pusher/nail cleaner or tweezers.  They have the same look and feel as the other tools in the set, but for my purposes won't see that much use.  In a perfect world, for the cost involved, it seems like a small stainless steel comb should have been included in this set.Overall, this is a very fine grooming set.  I would say this is what I have had in mind in my years of searching for a quality groomng set.  The cost of this set will not be appealing or likely appropriate for many men, but for the man who appreciates quality and wants a nice grooming set to stay well-groomed this Zwilling J.A. Henckels grooming set is definitely worth its cost.

I have a Harley Street Glide that I use this with to keep the jiffy stand from sinking in asphalt.  The pad is a little bit difficult to position under the jiffy stand mainly due to the ridge that sticks up on the top of the pad.  Once it is in position, though, it works well to keep the jiffy stand from sinking into asphalt on a hot day.  There is a hole on one end of the pad and, like another reviewer suggested, I have some paracord attached to it that I tie onto the handle bar so I can easily pick the pad back up while seated on the bike.I would like this pad better if it didn't have the ridges sticking up on it (I really can't see any use for this) but outside of that annoyance it does its job well.  If you ride and park a motorcycle on asphalt in hot weather (who doesn't?) you really need a gadget like this if you don't want to find your bike laying over sideways after a few hours parked in the heat.

I have a Ford F150 pickup that doesn't get much use in the winter.  In the past I have had trouble keeping the battery adequately charged during those months so it won't be dead in the spring.  This Forney trickle charger is fantastic.  I wish I had bought this years ago.  The charger is smaller than I though it would be, and is also quite lightweight.  My pickup sits in our driveway, and I was able to connect the charger to the battery and close the hood to my truck to prevent theft while charging with an extension cord.  After a few hours of charging my truck fired up without a moment's hesitation.  This is a great charger and well worth its very affordable price.  If you have a garaged vehicle that you want to keep charged you can leave it connected to the charger.  There is absolutely nothing to dislike about this charger.  Everyone should own one.

I bought this drive on a Gold Box offer to use as a backup drive for my laptop.  It is completely plug n' play.  It works perfectly right out of the box with no software or drivers necessary to use it.  I have had no problems with it whatsoever, and it is cheap insurance for when the hard drive crashes (which will happen with any computer eventually).

We have a Pioneer Pet fountain for our cats that we have used for years.  The original pump burned out, but this one is a perfect replacement and as, so far, held up very well.  If you own one of the big stainless steel Pioneer Pet fountains this is the pump to buy if you need a replacement.

I use inexpensive microfiber towels that I purchase from a large club store to detail my vehicles and clean firearms.  The ones I use, though, are solid color, smaller, and not suitable for use as a household towel.  So even though the DII towels are more expensive I was curious to see if these would be worth their higher price for household and kitchen usage.The towels arrive neatly folded in a large plastic bag.  The photo of them on Amazon really does not do them justice as the pattern and coloring of the towels is much more attractive than the photo suggests.  These are attractive towels, and they make for nice hand towels in the bathroom and kitchen.  Being microfiber they are very soft and will not scratch glass, so they are ideal for cleaning and polishing anything including glass or plastic.  They are much larger in size than the bulk towels I have bought locally which makes them more useful for larger jobs or for usage as a hand towel.  They do shrink a little after laundering, but this was to be expected, and the shrinkage is not excessive.In summary, the DII microfiber cleaning towels are large in size, very attractive in appearance, and a great value in bulk purchase for usage as hand towels and cleaning towels around the home.  While they may cost more than ones you can find at the discount club stores, these towels are larger and much more attractive for usage inside the home making them worth the additional cost.

We have a Bissell cordless stick vacuum that has worked fairly well, but it has a Ni-Cad battery in it and doesn't hold a charge very long.  So when I saw the Electrolux Ergorapido Lithium Ion Plus cordless vacuum I had to give it a try.The vacuum arrives almost completely assembled.  You simply have to remove and replace a single screw to attach the handle assembly to the main body of the stick.  There is a cord that runs from the handle to the removable hand vac so the vacuum can be turned on/off from either the handle of the upright frame or from the detachable hand vac itself.  It's a pretty clever feature, actually.The instruction paper that is included with the product is pretty poorly written, but it is not difficult to figure out how to use the vacuum and all of its features.  I tried several times to register the vacuum and download an electronic version of the instruction sheet but was unsuccessful despite numerous attempts.  The Electrolux web site and product support is quite poor in this regard, and I hope they will get this corrected.The instructions advise charging the vacuum for 24 hours prior to the first usage.  After that the vacuum can be recharged in 4 hours and will run for about 20 minutes on a single charge.  Unlike our Bissell unit, the Electrolux Li-ion unit can be left on its charger, and the light on the charger will blink very slowly to indicate that the unit is fully charged and has switched to a maintenance charge to keep the battery up.  This is a nice feature and should not shorten the life of a lithium ion battery.The fully assembled stick vacuum is lightweight and pushes easily across the floor.  There are brushes in the head of the stick to facilitate vacuuming.  This type of vacuum really works best on hard floors and really can't compete with a conventional vacuum on carpet except for very low pile carpeting.  We have hardwood floors and flat rugs in our home, and the vacuum works really well for quick clean-up jobs.  The head swivels very freely and is extremely easy to move around obstacles on the floor.  The stick is designed so the vacuum can be left standing upright without it falling over.The hand vac section is easily removed from the stick body and is handy for small vacuuming jobs.  There is a thin plastic extension included that fits into the opening of the handvac to extend its reach into smaller areas.  There is also a small, soft plastic brush attachment that fits into the end of the plastic extension so the hand vac can be used for dust removal.  The instructions don't show it, but there is a little wedge in the back up the upper part of the stick handle to hang the extension for storage when not in use.The container in the hand vac body that collects debris is pretty small and does not hold much before it needs to be emptied.  It is no smaller than other similar hand vacs, though.  There is a double filtration system in the debris container that can be washed with water if necessary, although it has to be fully dried before using it in the vacuum again.Overall, my wife and I are very pleased with the Electrolux Ergorapido Lithium Ion Plus vacuum.  It is versatile, lightweight, easy to keep charged, and works well.  It costs about twice what one might spend for a quality cordless hand vacuum, but being able to use it as both a stick vacuum and a hand vacuum makes the added cost worthwhile due to the added versatility.  The Electrolux web site does not provide very good product support due to its web design, but I would hope they will improve this over time, and I would not let that sway you from buying this product.

I love tacos and for years have wanted a way to heat the shells without the shells deforming and collapsing.  This rack solves that problem.  It is simple to assemble, and it separates into four flat pieces that are easily stored in its original package in a drawer.  Functionally, this rack is perfect.  I can heat up to 6 taco shells standing them upright on a baking sheet.  The shells keep their original shape after heating them making it easy to fill them with taco meat.  Even better, I can toast the shells, fill them with meat, and then melt some cheese on top by putting the rack back into the oven for a minute or two.  Overall, I absolutely love this taco rack.  It seems over-priced, but for me the higher price s worth paying for the convenience of creating perfect tacos in the oven.

I bought these to wear while exercising.  They fit well and do a nice job of absorbing sweat and helping to keep my hands dry.  There is a wide assortment of colors.  I've been using these now for about a year, and they are holding up really well.  My only complaint is they seem to disappear in the laundry like socks, so I have already purchased more.

Years ago I owned a "Mickey ticker" that I loved but lost, so when I came across this watch while perusing Amazon one day I had to buy it.  The watch looks much nicer than the photo makes it appear.  It's very stylish in appearance and has a heft that makes it feel very well-made.  There is no date feature on it, but it seems to keep time well.  My only complaint with this watch is the leather band that comes with it is far too small for most men.  My wrist is not that large, and I can barely strap it on.  So if this watch will be used by a man you should plan on purchasing another wrist band.  Aside from that, though, it is a very nice watch and fun to wear.

I wanted a set of larger hex key wrenches to keep on hand largely to work on my motorcycle but also to have available for other uses if needed.  This Tekton set meets my needs perfectly.  Like other Tekton tools I own, these hex key wrenches feel sturdy and well-made.  I like the idea of having a ball head for use in tight spaces where it might otherwise be difficult to use a wrench.  Each set, metric and SAE, has a plastic holder to store the wrenches and keep them organized.

I bought this tool after reading about it in one of the gun magazines recently.  It is a handy tool to keep in my range bag when shooting my AR-15 rifle.  Most of the implements swing out like a Swiss Army knife, and there is a small compartment built in to hold small things like screws.  I will likely never use most of the implements on this tool, but it is nice to know they are available if needed while at the range.  Like the other Avid tool that I own for handguns, this AR-15 tool is well-constructed and well thought-out to meet a shooter's essential needs without a lot of baggage.  This tool comes with a tough fabric carry case that can be attached to a belt or pack if desired.  I'm very pleased with it.

I purchased a carton of these furnace filters a year or so ago and just got done ordering another carton of them.  They are well-made and filter air well.  I have used each filter for about 3 months before replacing it.  In our home a carton of these will last a year and a half.  Compared with the brand name filters these filters filter as well or better for a lot less money overall.  I like them very much and, as stated, have already ordered more.

I purchased two of these recently, one for my wife and one for myself, to keep handy for personal protection purposes.  My wife often has to work until well after dark, so I wanted something small she could easily carry in he purse and hold in her hand while walking to her car.  This Sabre red pepper spray fits the bill perfectly.  The device is much smaller than I thought it would be, which is a real plus.  At first I thought the built-in hand strap was too small, but I quickly realized it stretches making it easy to strap it onto even my large hand.  Usage of the spray is quick and intuitive.  You merely turn a lever on the top with your thumb, and it is ready to spray.  I tested it out and not only did it spray without a problem but the spray shot out a good 10 feet or more.  I have no doubt this little sprayer would work very well against any close encounter threats.  Add the fact that the sprayer can administer over 30 sprays per canister and you can't beat it for the money spent.  Compared with a Kimber product that I bought a few years ago, that was far more expensive, much larger in size, and had fewer available sprays to it, this Sabre red pepper spray is perfect for a non-lethal form of self defense.  I highly recommend it and will be buying more of these in the future.

Of men's colognes the ones I like are those with light scents that are more subtle and appreciated most up close rather than the strong, harsh scents that can be smelled from across the room.  Up to now I have liked one from Taylor of Old Bond Street quite well, but my wife wears perfume from Calvin Klein that smells quite good, so I was curious to see what Calvin Klein's euphoria might be like.euphoria arrives nicely packaged, and its bottle is larger and heavier than I would have expected for only a 1 ounce supply.  Its mister sprays a light amount of cologne.  Not knowing if I would like the scent or not, I first used it right before exercising figuring I could easily shower it off afterwards if I didn't like it.  I found the scent to be quite pleasant with a faint hint of citrus to it, but the scent is far more complex than that.  The scent is light when applied, and I found it intensified when I started sweating during exercise.  I like the scent, and I was surprised to find that it persisted even after I showered after exercising.  It lingered for many hours afterward as well.  So there is no question this cologne will stay with you throughout the day or evening.Describing the scent of a cologne is a lot like trying to describe a color and really needs to be experienced to understand and appreciate it.  I can say I really like the scent of Calvin Klein euphoria.  It is light, pleasant, and lingering yet not overpowering.  It is an ideal scent to wear for any intimate occasion.  Because the scent is subtle yet pleasing, I can easily envision women wanting to get closer to smell it.  I know my wife likes it.I will say Calvin Klein euphoria is quite expensive compared with any other cologne I have used up to now.  Before purchase one would be wise to visit the perfume department of a local department store to sample it before spending this amount of money on a new cologne.  The largest size appears to be a much better value for the money, so if you really like euphoria you would be best off spending a little more up front to get the larger size bottle.  It should last a long time even with regular usage.

The copy of "Reagan: The Life" that was sent to me for review was a softcover "gallery" print meaning that it is not a finished product.  For that reason some of my comments in this review may not accurately reflect the finished hardbound version of this book.  I presume the gallery print is pretty complete, though, so I expect the bulk of the content of the book I received is essentially what a purchaser of the finished product would read.The book proclaims itself to be a comprehensive biography of Ronald Reagan.  It does start off with his childhood and progresses rapidly into his adulthood.  The author spends a lot of time juxtaposing the politics and surrounding events of each time period  in Reagan's life that he is trying to depict.  This happens so frequently that the book reads more like a history book with comments about Reagan along the way rather than a biography with a primary focus on Ronald Reagan himself.  As such one does not finish this book feeling they have learned a lot about Ronald Reagan as a person.  This is sad as I have long felt Reagan was not only one of our most important and influential presidents in modern times but also a man of high ethical standards and morals.  The author hints at this a little bit but really doesn't flesh this out very well.  In fact, there are times when the author presents Reagan in an unflattering light, implying he was a poor student, a poor athlete in school, and an unsuccessful actor.  Any mention of Reagan's first wife, Jane Wyman, is so brief that one would easily miss it.  There is equally brief mention of the two children he had with her and literally no mention of his family life with her.  A little more text is devoted to his second wife, Nancy, but even she, who so profoundly influenced Reagan's life and decisions, is discussed very little.  The book I received had no photos in it whatsoever, which I think is a staggering omission in a biography about such an important person.  I sincerely hope the final print has some photos of Reagan throughout various stages of his life to help bring him to life a little better.While very lengthy, almost 800 pages, I did find this an interesting and easy book to read.  Unlike a typical history book, this biography presents a lot of political history along with information about Reagan in a manner that is interesting and not dry to read.  The author does seem to do a good job of highlighting some of the most important events that occurred throughout Reagan's early adulthood, his years in radio and acting, and his political life but barely mentions much of his private or personal life.  There are numerous sources of information listed in the final pages of the book, although none of these sources were footnoted in the text that I received.  One would hope the final edition contains the relevant footnotes.Overall, I found "Reagan: The Life" to be a biography worth reading.  It does not flesh out Reagan, the man, as well as I would have liked, but it does a good job of describing Reagan, the great communicator, and Reagan, the leader.  I enjoyed reading it.

My order of Jolly Rancher candy arrived in today's mail, and I am sucking on a piece of this tasty candy while writing this review.  Those familiar with Jolly Rancher candies know exactly what to expect with this candy.  It is hard candy, and their flavors are always very intense, fruity, and delicious.  This blue raspberry flavor is no exception.This particular product is an 88 ounce (almost 5 pounds) bag of candy.  That is a lot of candy.  As another reviewer pointed out, the bag it arrives in is not resealable, so if it is not going to be used up all at once at a party or some other large gathering you will probably want to store it in a bag or container that can be sealed so it will stay fresh, although I doubt candy this good will remain uneaten for very long.  I see Jolly Rancher also offers a similar bag of candy in watermelon flavor, which I am sure would also be delicious.  I think this size bag of candy would be a more attractive offer if there was a mix of flavors rather than just a single flavor in such a large bag.My only complaint with this product is its cost.  I have a hard time picturing someone spending $25 on a bag of candy.  That's about $5 per pound, which seems pretty expensive for candy other than gourmet chocolate.  But if cost is not an issue, and you need a big bag of hard candy, you will never go wrong with Jolly Rancher.

I love this game! It is a great time killer that progressively gets harder and harder! It is very addicting. The game animation is very very cute! Be warned... the game gets very challenging the further you progress.

This package of 300 poop bags is an amazing value! I have not been able to find a comparable deal anywhere else. This set os two super strong suction cups work great to sticking strongly to the side of my shower. I use it to hold a wash cloth. It attached easily, and has a really strong suction. There is a button "pump" to increase the suction power. The package I received had two different suction holders in the box.

Levolor makes the best curtain rods. It doesn't even pay to try any other brand. These curtain rods were true to size, and installed easily with the included hardware. I have no complaints... they do the job!

They both use awesome ingredients that leave my hair feeling super soft and clean feeling. You can definitely feel that your hair is well moisturized after showering.After using both products, they give your scalp that cool "tingling" feeling from the Tee Tree oil in the product! I like that.  The smell is more minty than medicine. Both products lather up well, and wash out easily with no build up.Comparable shampoos and conditioners cost much more...as compared to Aveda and such.Try them out... I do not think you will be disappointed.

The fact that this game was "Actually Free" made it compelling to try out. I have been playing Jetpack Joyride for a while on several of my different devices. It still is a lot of fun, but the fact that it was totally "unlocked" took some of the fun away for me. There was no "challenge" to accumulate coins to unlock new gear, because everything was already unlocked. It's a great idea, it just does not always make sense for some of these style of games.

I have used Spigen cases on all my Galaxy phones. I really like this case because it complements the beautiful gold finish of the phone, while providing a clear back so you can see the phone. It offers great protection, and I like the fact that Spigen uses a textured interior coating so that it does not "bubble" on the inside.The buttons on this case are much better than the buttons on previous Neo Hybrid cases I have used. They are less "sensitive".The case fits really well...allowing me to have full access to all the features of the Galaxy S6 Edge +.

These curtain rods worked as expected. They are well made, and were easy to install. The package included the necessary hardware to hand them. They seem fairly well made, and I had no issues hanging my curtains with them.

These batteries work great. And having the charger is a huge help! The batteries charge up fast. And they last failry long in the devices I am running them in. I have a Cree LED light and a laser pointer. The supplier was very helpful answering questions. Again... this is a great kit.

Great short story! I really enjoyed this futuristic sci-fi thriller. It was somewhat complex for such a short story. I am looking forward to reading the other stories in the Wool series. I want to say more in my review, but am afraid of "spoilers" and ruining it for other readers. Pick this book up and give it a try.

Levolor makes the best curtain rods. It doesn't even pay to try any other brand. These curtain rods were true to size, and installed easily with the included hardware. I have no complaints... they do the job!

Please, if you find this video and review helpful in your buying decision, please hit the YES button below. Thanks!Grilling in the dark sucks! This Super Bright LED BBQ Grill Light is a huge lifesaver for those after dark grill sessions. Very handy and it attaches easily to almost any grill.IPOW has never let me down in the quality of their products, and this is no exception! This LED BBQ grill light attaches to your grill lids handle with a simple screw down clamp. It is very adjustable so you can aim the beam wherever you need it. It is sturdy and well built, so it will stand up to the elements if left outside on your grill. It operates with a single on/off button. It is all plastic construction, but solidly made. It has two different LED sets, each with 5 LED's for a total of 10.Turning the light on is easy by just gently hitting the on/off button. This is great when your hands are full with dinner, and you don't want to fumble with greasy meaty hands.Also... this light can also just as easily be used on a bicycle, camping trip, or power outage.The light runs off of three AA batteries which are not included in the package. There is also an included little Phillips screw drive to open the battery door.

If you like the video and review, please hit the YES button below! Thanks!This Ausdom Bluetooth headset is pretty nice. They are well made, and fit your head very comfortably. What I like is that the plastic/rubber band that runs behind your head holds the earbuds in your ears nicely.These headphones run on Bluetooth 3.0, and not the newer 4.1 standard. You do not really notice any difference in regards to the audio quality. The quality of the audio is very good. Call quality was nice too. The package includes extra/different sized rubber ear pieces, and a Micro USB cable to charge them up. You can expect to get about 7 hours of play time. The Bluetooth range is about 30 feet from your device.Pairing your device with these headsets is relatively painless. They paired in just a few seconds with no problem.PROS:- Fold up small, small footprint- Light weight... less than an ounce!- Great sound- Great ear fit, stays on the head when jogging.- Voice promptsCONS:- There is no real "tactile" feel to the buttons when you press them. No "click".- The control buttons are really small. Hard to find with my big fingers.Ausdom sent me these headphones for free in exchange for a unbiased review.

The Apexel lens kit expands the photo opportunities of your cell phones built in lens. Great quality lens set, at a fantastic price.The attachment clip that comes with this kit will fit most phones and/or tablets. This is a really good thing. Because most other special effects lenses on the market are usually geared towards a specific phone type, and are built into a special case you need to use for the lenses to work.With this design, the lens clips to your phone, and the lens attachment covers your camera. You can focus the lens by twisting them while in the adapter.I found each of the 3 lens combination to work great, and as advertised. I was actually quite please with the result. The kit includes a micro fiver lens cleaning cloth, a small case to store everything, the clip, a wide angle lens, a fish eye lends, and a macro lens.The lens I was really most impressed with was the macro lens! It works amazingly well! Almost like a microscope. I attempt to demonstrate all the lenses in my video review. It's better to see it than describe it here. Suffice it to say, this is a great kit for the money. I really have no cons to offer.

This is a pretty basic wall mount for a smaller flat panel TV. I liked that is has a bubble level built into the mount. It made the job of installing it much easier. It has all the necessary hardware needed to successfully mount the TV to a wall. The only thing I used that was not included was a stud finder to find the proper place for the screws in the wall.This mount is a really great value, as compared to the prices they charge for similar items in Target and Walmart.

I enjoyed this book by Douglas Richards. It was very suspenseful, and it get you really thinking about where we are headed with technology. I am looking forward to jumping into the sequel to see where the story is headed.

6:50 Mins Never get stuck with a dead battery again with this 12,000mAh 400Amp battery jump starter set from DB Power.If you find the video and review helpful...please hit the YES button below this review. Thanks!Being stuck in a dark parking lot at night with a dead car battery, waiting over an hour for roadside assistance is a scary prospect. That is why having the security of the DB Power jump start external battery is worth its weight in gold!This battery is solidly built. Fit and finish is top notch. The kit comes with a set of jump starter cables that you attach to your dead battery. The red light on the jumper cables will turn green, and you start your car. Super easy. This device is rated at 400 amps peak power, and at 12,000mAh, you should get multiple jump starts from one charge. I set a calendar reminder in my phone to make sure I check the charge of this every two months.There is also two 2amp outputs built into this device that provides charging power for your phone or tablet. There is also a built in LED light that is very handy, as well as a compass. Moreover, this Jump starter with built-in AI technology can deliver the power intelligently once you connect the power cord and clamps on to the car, so you can directly trigger the engine button to jump start the car without pressing the ON/OFF button.This DBPower product is super solid, and works great. I have also communicated with the manufacturer, and they truly listen to the feedback of their users, and I was told they are working hard to include the accessories I mentioned above.

4:46 Mins The Neon Portable Remote Control Plug-in Wireless Doorbell is a pretty good product. It works as advertised, with not a lot of hassle involved in getting it setup.If you find the video and review helpful...please hit the YES button below this review. Thanks!Setup is straight forward... just put in the batteries to the transmitter. It includes the necessary mounting hardware. The package claims that the transmitter is waterproof, put i saw little in the way of weather protection. You can place the receiver about up to 1000 feet from the remote.You then plug in the receiver in a AC wall outlet. And that's pretty much all that's necessary to get this door bell running. You then can set one of about fifty different "chime tones".You can adjust the volume on the receiver as well. This thing can be pretty loud...and you will most likely hear it from anywhere in the house.I like this setup because it's much easier to install this if your doorbell is not working, than to troubleshoot and repair your old one.

There are over 6,000 other reviews for this book They are going to make it into a movie directed by Steven Spielberg. There is not much more to add then to say this is one of the best books I have read in many years!!! I could not put it down, and was upset when it was done. As a child of the '80's this book was a huge reflection back to my childhood. I can't wait to see this story play out on the big screen.

4:05 Mins This stylish bamboo Qi wireless charger is a classy addition to any environment that you need to recharge your Qi enabled device.If you find the video and review helpful...please hit the YES button below this review. Thanks!Wasserstein makes a really nice product. This Qi bamboo wireless charger looks more like a wooden coaster than an electronic device. The charger is powered by MicroUSB cable. The cable is included in the box. But there is no AC charger.You set your Qi enabled device onto the charging pad, and the light turns green indicating your device is sitting properly and is charging. You should get a notification on your device. The output is 1A, so this is definitely not a fast charger. But it gets the job done.The charging pad itself is very well made, and last you a long time.

2:36 Mins I was really skeptical when I received these to test out. I have tried other devices similar to these, and not have work well, or have actually caused me considerable pain after wearing. If you find the video and review helpful...please hit the YES button below this review. Thanks!These Snore Vents worked great. I had no discomfort. And I was able to breathe well. It took a few tries on my part testing out the different sizes supplied before I found the one that fit perfect, and did not cause me discomfort while sleeping.There are 4 supplied sizes in the package as well as a carrying case. I used the 2nd largest pair, and they worked well. They manage to do what they are supposed to, and that is to keep open your nasal passageways while you are sleeping. I suffer from bad allergies, and have difficulties breathing in the evening. I have been using Breath Right strips every night up until now. But, at $13 bucks a box, it starts to get expensive, and I did not like the adhesive it left on my nose every morning.These Snore Vents are very reusable, all you need to do is rinse them in soapy water, and let dry.They stay in my nose, and after a day or two using them I forgot they were there.

This super bright LED solar light from OxyLed is an amazing addition to a dark spot on your yard.As you watch my review you will see that it took me a few minutes to figure out how to actually turn this light on. Make sure you read the instructions!! There is a small pin included in the package that you need to use to turn on and set the correct mode of this light. The two models are either a constant on mode when it gets dark, or the lights comes on when it detects motion.But once this bad boy comes on it we blind you! There are a boat load of LED bulbs that are very bright.The bottom half of this light is plastic, as is the mounting bracket. The upper half where the large solar panel is is made from brushed aluminum. Its a good looking package over all, and is very well built and sturdy. It should provide years of service.The light does a great job in illuminated the side of the house where I mounted it. I set it to come on at sundown. So far it seems to be running great after several hours of it being on.I was sent this product for an unbiased review.

My friend Simon sent me this rugged waterproof Bluetooth speaker to review. There are a lot of cool accessories that come included in the box: a caribeener (to hang), a USB to USB cable, and a Aux Audio cable.The housing is a metal speaker grill,What is really, really cool is that there is an included 5200mAh built in battery that you can use to recharge your wireless devices! You can do all this while listening to your music over the excellent sounding Bluetooth speakers. Bass in strong, and these speakers are really very load.This speaker has excellent fit and finish. It definitely feels high end. The whole speaker is encased a rubber housing to help it withstand drops and bumps.Pairing the Bluetooth is fairly easy and straight forward. The speaker includes Bluetooth 4.0, so it provides for superior sound transfer.I really like this speaker... it is well made, it sounds great, it is affordable, and it has a built in battery to recharge my devices. It does so much.I was sent this speaker in exchange for an unbiased review.

This little low tech stud finder works like an absolute champ!!! I was easy able to find the stud bolts in my wall to identify where I wanted to mount the TV wall mount. Once I found the stud, the stud finder "stuck" to the wall like magic, which allowed my to place my drill marks. The addition of the built in level is nice touch, and a huge help. This is a must buy! Great value.

This wall mount is a truly excellent value! Not only do you get a sturdy and well made wall mount, you also get a level, and a 10' long HDMI cable! I went shopping for a wall mount in both Target and Walmart... and neither one of the stores had a TV wall mount for less than $79. This one came to me for about $35 bucks with free 2 day Prime shipping, with the extra goodies. The only other thing I had to buy was a stud finder.The wall mount is very easy to assemble and install. This was the first time I has attempted an install such as this, so I took my time to make sure my valuable investment would not fall off the wall. My 50" tv is not securly hung on my wall, and I can easily changes the viewing angle.The only small hiccup I had was that mu Google Chrome dongle stuck out the back of the TV a little to much, and I had to use the TV's side HDMI input... not a big deal.

I really enjoy the David Brunnel series. This was another solid edition to the Seattle Prosecutor. It was an interesting twist on how he had to win a trial when there was no body as evidence. I wish he would get the characters back together again... I enjoyed his relationship with the coroner.

OxyLed makes really great solar products for the home. The are sturdy, weather proof, and work as advertised, and are a really great value. If you find this review valuable and helpful, please hit the THANKS button below.This light is definitely no exception to the previous lights I have reviewed for them. This solar yard light has 8 bright LED'd powered by a large solar panel collector. There is the ability to set it to come at night or to act as a motion sensor, turning on the lights when motion is detected in the area. This light works great in both modes.The light throws a really bright beam, and I am using it in a very dark area along the side of my house. The light has a pretty compact size, and is very easy to install. There are just 2 screws needed, and they are provided in the package. There is also a large piece of double stick tape included if you want to mount it that way.All in all, a great product from OxyLed. A definite recommend from me.

I love this TRONFY 1080p DIGITAL LED PROJECTOR! It is a truly solid product in a small package that is truly affordable. I did a full HD video review on YouTube. Just search for "TRONFY 1080p DIGITAL LED PROJECTOR REVIEW". If you find the video and review helpful...please hit the YES button below this review. Thanks!First off... I think this projector does a really good job at what its designed to do... and that is to project images onto a screen at a high resolution. And this projector does that.I use this projector perfectly with my Google Chromecast dongle. It takes about 30 seconds to get setup, and I am watching Netflix on a wall in my house at about 100 inches. All you need to do is to adjust the focus, and adjust the viewing angle. Both very easy to do.There is also a very comprehensive menu system in this LED projector, so you can tweak settings as needed to get a picture you want.This projector has a output of 1000 Lumens. This is just fine for a home environment with the lights off in the room. Which is how I tend to watch movies anyway. So again, no issues with this box.There are multiple input sources for you to get your video on the screen. Again, I easily use a Chromecast dongle. Sound on this projector is OK, and you can add a external speaker if desired.The remote control is great, and is very responsive. It makes setting up the menus much easier.All in all a really good product for under a $100 bucks!I received this product for free in exchange for an unbiased review.

Anglink sent me this newly released compact selfie stick to do a review for.So, to start off... The packaging is great. I really like the design of the product and the concept.The handle of this stick has built in Bluetooth shutter controls. You unfold the rest of the handle, and there is a spring loaded "X" that opens to hold your device. It held my iPhone 5 just OK. I was not 100% comfortable with the safety of my phone in this cradle setup.Additionally, the extension part of the "pole" is super shaky! I wish it wasn't, but I could not hold the phone steady to take a good picture or video.Bluetooth pared easily with my phone. I was able to take pictures easily and effortlessly with the Bluetooth paired.All in all... a great concept, but this selfie stick was way to shaky for me to use regularly.

This book is absolutely amazing! Short of actually getting out on the water and sailing, or taking a traditional class, this book does a great job of teaching the basics of sailing a boat. It is laid out in step by step chapters that walk you through the basics, and get you up to advanced skills you will need to know including navigation and weather.It is a large book, with many illustrations, photos, and references. You will want to keep this book handy on your boat for when you do not have internet access, and need to remember what a certain buoy looks like.

My review really should be 3.5 stars. I liked the book much more.This story ends exactly where the last book ends. So they do not miss a beat in the story line. And thus begins the journey of pages and pages and pages of Harry and Jack running and dodging "goons" (their words) from Global Alliance. The story is one not so long (its not a very long book) cat and mouse story where they have to find boats, cars, and bike to get to their final destination. The end was more interesting when they finally made it to their destination, and were not having to run away at every black Range Rover that seems to be around the corner. In this apocalyptic state, with no electricity, internet, radios, etc, it is a little too far fetched that the "goons" were always easily able to find these guys.Anyway... the end of the story leads into the third book. I am already invested into two of them, so I will more than likely read it to see how it all ends.

I really enjoyed this quality made sleep mask from Smarter Rest! It does a really great job at what is designed to do, and that is to keep out the light while trying to sleep.This sleep mask is made from a really nice grade of very soft satin. It feels amazing. The mask is very light weight. The inside (or the part that touches your face) is a super soft cotton material. The Velcro straps are adjustable. The straps are also wide for a better fit and comfort. There are a pair of soft memory foam ear plug included, and built into the sleep masks straps (so you can't loose them)! The package also includes instructions and a guide, as well as a satin storage case for your mask.The masks performed wonderfully! It successfully blocked out all ambient from a well lit room. It stays in place, even after tossing and turning on a pillow. In fact, it is a little disconcerting because it is so dark when you open your eyes, I have to remember I have the sleep mask on. I did a full video review that I posted to You Tube. You can find it by searching for "Smarter Rest Sleep Sublime Eye Mask Review". If you find the review helpful...please hit the YES button below this review. Thanks!All in all, this is a great product. It does what it is designed to do, and it does it well. It is well made, and should last for a long time with repeated use. They have a web site with tons of tips and ideas for getting better rest. What more could you ask for!

Edgy has come come out with a neat little tool to solve a single problem... and that is getting the foil off the top of a wine bottle. I did a full video review on You Tube of this product if you are interested in viewing. You can find it by searching for "Edgy Wine Foil Cutter Review". If you find the review helpful...please hit the YES button below this review. Thanks!This is a great gift for a wine lover in your life. It's super cheap, and does an amazing job for which it is intended. The body of the Edgy Wine Foil Cutter is made from plastic, but has four small metal cutting blades that easily through the foil easily, neatly and efficiently.It comes in a really nice gift box. A lifetime warranty. And a responsive support staff. You can't ask for more.

The pictures on Amazon do not do this speaker justice! This speaker kicks out crazy deep bass, and is really loud. This speaker from Arespark really belts it out! I did a full video review that I posted to You Tube. You can find it easily by searching for "Arespark Camo Bluetooth Speaker Review". If you find the video and review helpful...please hit the YES button below this review. Thanks!First of all, the speaker ships in a really nice hard plastic package. I am keeping the packaging so I can store the speaker when I am not using it. In the package there is the speaker, instruction, a MicroUSB charging cable, a Audio to MicroUSB audio cable, and a carabiner  so you can hang the speaker someplace for easy listening.Pairing the speaker is very simple. Controls are are large and are located right on top of the speaker, so they are very easily accessible. The only small complaint is that to raise the volume, you have to push and hold the skip forward button for three seconds. A separate volume control would have been a nice addition. But, once you crank the volume up, listening volume is easily adjustable via the controls and Bluetooth on your phone.Sound is very crisp. With the volume turned up this speaker is very loud, with very deep bass. You can feel the bass pumping through the table top the speaker was place on. Thankfully there is a rubber base on the bottom of the speaker to prevent it from sliding around due to vibrations.I like this speaker... a lot! I think I was a little surprised. Not sure why. But I think you will be very happy with this Bluetooth speaker from Arespark as well.I received this product for free in exchange for an unbiased review.

The 18650 battery and charger set work exactly as advertised. I had never used this sized battery before. I purchased a high powered laser pointer, and it required a 18650 battery. The price was great for this set, especially taking advantage of my Amazon Prime benefits. So far no issues. The charger charges, and the batteries fit my laser pointer perfectly, and run great.

This was a good sequel to the first Escape book. I really liked that it filled in many of the blanks to the Abbey's personal background. I also like how it setup the plot line for the 3rd book, which I am looking forward to reading. Sad a certain someone was killed off.

This is a truly COMPLETE set/kit of almost everything you could possibly think of as it relates to sun glasses and eye protection from XQ-XQ.I did a whole video review of this product on You Tube. You can find it by searching for "XQ-XQ Polarized UV Sports Sun Glasses Product Review". If you find the video and review helpful...please hit the YES button below this review. Thanks!This kit really has just about everything you can think of as it relates to a set of sunglasses! It includes 5 color tinted UV400 protective lenses for a bunch of different environments (sun, snow, shooting, surf).  There is also a lens holder for people who myopia.The whole kit comes in a really nice case with slots for all the lenses, and ample space for the extra straps.The standard frame is is nice with a soft silicon bridge piece where the glasses make contact with your forehead. The arms that go over your are comfortable and sturdy. You can remove these arms and replace it with the included elastic headband. This is great for more active sports where you don't want your glasses flying off your head.In the package there is an additional next strap, so your glasses can hang from you neck. There is also a very necessary micro fiber cleaning cloth to clean the lenses. There is also a small fabric satin like case you place your glasses into for extra protection from scratches.Changes the lenses is fairly simple. They unsnap, and snap back in relatively easily. Be forewarned that you will get fingerprints all over the lenses when you do this. It's pretty much unavoidable. Not a big deal, just use the included cloth to clean them.I found the included lenses to be really nice. They each function as they are supposed to. I could easily see out of them, and felt that they covered and protected the my eyes well. Personally I do not need all the different lenses, I am really just using the dark polarized lens. There is also a little card in the box to test the polarizing aspects of the lens.I think there is a lot of value in this kit. You get a lot of options in this kit, that are well made, for a very fair price. You can't go wrong.I received this product for free in exchange for an unbiased review.

Got A Bike? Need some extra storage? Then this is the item for you from my friends at the BicycleStore!I did a full video review of this product. It is on You Tube, and you can find it by searching for "BicycleStore Bicycle Cycling Handlebar Bag Review". If you find the review helpful...please hit the YES button below this review. Thanks!This is a very well made bicycle handlebar bag. They used heavy duty polyester material for the construction of the bag. A lot of thought went into the function and design. There are two external water bottle holders. There is a clear pocket on top for maybe your phone, wallet, or map.The inside is a smooth plastic lined material. It appears to be thermal insulated so that it will keep colds cold, and hot items hot for a while. The zipper enclosure is very secure.It is attached to your bikes handle bars with three adjustable Velcro straps. There is also a gray reflective piece built into the exterior to function as a reflector.The bag is easily detached from your bike, and can be folded up small to carry anywhere. This is great for traveling to the beach, or biking to a picnic.I like this bag, and I know you will too!

4:38 MinsNever get stuck with a dead battery again with this 12,000mAh 400Amp battery jump starter set from RoyPow. I did a complete video review of this product and it is on You Tube. If you search over there for "RoyPow J12 All in One 12000mAh Car Jumper Kit Review" you can find it easily. If you find the review helpful...please hit the YES button below this review. Thanks!Being stuck in a dark parking lot at night with a dead car battery, waiting over an hour for roadside assistance is a scary prospect. That is why having the security of the RoyPow J12 jump start external battery is worth its weight in gold!This battery is solidly built. Fit and finish is top notch. The kit comes with a set of jump starter cables that you attach to your dead battery. The red light on the jumper cables will turn green, and you start your car. Super easy. This device is rated at 400amps peak power, and at 12,000mAh, you should get multiple jump starts from one charge. I set a calendar reminder in my phone to make sure I check the charge of this every two months.There is also two 2amp outputs built into this device that provides charging power for your phone or tablet. There is also a built in LED light that is very handy, as well as a compass. Moreover, this Jump starter with built-in AI technology can deliver the power intelligently once you connect the power cord and clamps on to the car, so you can directly trigger the engine button to jump start the car without pressing the ON/OFF button.The only two negative I will speak off are:- I will there was a storage case to place this in along with the cables. I want to keep this in my trunk, and I do not want it to flop around.- I would have liked to have seen a AC and/or a DC power adapter included. I have reviewed a few other of these types of devices, and they all included AC and DC power adapters and cases.Aside from that this RoyPow product is super solid, and works great. I have also communicated with the manufacturer, and they truly listen to the feedback of their users, and I was told they are working hard to include the accessories I mentioned above.I was sent this product in exchange for an unbiased product review.

These washcloths are very soft!  They're good for a shower or bath but I like to use them to shine shoes!  The build quality is nice.  I wish that the towels were a little thicker and wider though but they are "baby" washcloths.  The colors are nice!

Unlike larger and thicker dry bags, this dry bag brings a unique advantage to the table! Its super lightweight and extremely portable. It includes a stuff sack for while not in use. For photographers, etc. that need to travel light and need to protect expensive gear from rain, this is a great accessory to throw in the bag! Its also great for backpacking, kayaking and other applications where dry storage may be needed. Its worth noting that this material is thin (it feels like the material that most backpacking tents are made from), so for rugged use, a larger and thicker dry bag would be optimal. For enhanced portability and convenience, this dry bag is a great option!

This is a great bottle opener! The best part is that the kit comes with two bottle openers!
