Both are of super strong build quality and are well-suited for opening an abundance of beer and/or soda bottles. Both sizes would likely fit well inside of ones pocket.especially the smaller one. If youre a bartender or just want a quality bottle opener for the home, boat, etc. this is a great set in my opinion!

This is an affordable LED headlamp that is powered by three AAA batteries. The head strap wears comfortably and there are two brightness levels. By twisting the little ring around the light, the beam can be toggled between spot and flood.  The build quality seems to be somewhat water resistant but I would definitely not expose it to strong rain or submerge it in water.
This is a truly huge jar of coconut oil.  It has got a great flavor to it.  The best way to enjoy it in my opinion is to add a tablespoon or two to a smoothie.  Tastes great!

I use my iPod Touch to fly my drone and wanted something to better protect my iPod Touch while in transport and also while in use.  This iPod Touch case adds a minimal amount of size and weight to the iPod Touch.  It's a soft but not too soft jelly-like material.  It's not too soft where it gets easily caught up in pockets, etc. but not too hard to where it's more prone to crack.  I love the blue color but it comes in other colors too!  It was easy to insert the iPod Touch and it fits it like a glove!  I'm 100% satisfied with this case!

This is a great monopod for GoPro cameras. My only gripe is that the top piece that connects to the GoPro doesn't seem to screw down tightly enough. That was a quick thing to fix though. I simply replaced it with a plastic GoPro tripod mount piece....PROBLEM SOLVED! The monopod itself is great! It's a very sturdy build quality and collapses very compactly for travel. The grip feels nice too!

A GoPro camera is somewhat useless without an assortment of mounts.  Purchasing GoPro mounts individually can add up quickly from a cost perspective.  This GoPro mounts bag from Puluz contains an assortment of essential GoPro mounts.  The head strap, chest mount and suction mount are some of the most common mounts that it includes.  It also includes a LOT MORE plus adhesive mounts as well.  I love how it contains an assortment of GoPro-style thumb screws as well.  Those are always easy to lose while in the field and it's great to have extras handy!  I wish that it contained a frame-style housing but other than that, it's the perfect assortment of essential GoPro mounts IMO.

This is an excellent snorkel and mask kit for travel!  My wife and I previously traveled with a set with much larger fins.  The fins not only added weight to our checked bag but they also consumed a lot of space.  This smaller snorkel set is optimal for travel and it likely costs less than renting inferior snorkeling gear, while in a tropical destination.  I like how the bag is vented, so that it dries quickly when wet.  I also like the build quality of the mask and the snorkel.  I wish that the part behind the foot was a little better made though.  It seems as if the snap will likely wear out after extended use but for a few weeks to various tropical destinations, this snorkel kit seems like it should hold up well!  I like the blue color that I purchased but there are a variety of other color options to choose from too.  I wear a size 12US tennis shoe and the large size fits me perfectly!  I would definitely buy the same set again if I needed another.  It's worth mentioning that although Cressi is touted as an Italian brand, my set said "made in China."  That's not an issue for me but I wanted to mention it.

This is a great way to charge USB devices such as iPad, iPhone, iPod, GoPro batteries and most any USB-rechargeable device. It's great because it consumes a minimal amount of space and has 6 USB charging ports. I prefer charging devices with this vs. a computer's USB ports, since devices won't attempt to synch with the computer while they are charging. The build quality is very top-notch and it looks right at home on my desk alongside my Apple computer equipment. This would also be great for a nightstand, kitchen and/or most any other place where smartphones and/or other USB devices are left to recharge.

This headwear is configurable in multiple ways.  It's a great way to better protect one's head from the sun while on a boat or just out in the sun in general.  I like to soak mine in water to stay even cooler in the hot sun!  Included instructions show how to attach to one's head in various configuration.  The build quality is nice and the pack comes with multiple colors.

If you use a Feiyu gimbal for the GoPro, then this is a must-have add-on.  Just like holding a short monopod vs. a longer monopod, the longer monopod produces smoother and more watchable video in my opinion.  The Feiyu gimbal itself is smooth but while walking, etc. there still can be some noticeable shake.  These poles extend the length of the Feiyu gimbal's handle to make the quality of the video even smooth.  One or two of these extension poles can be screw on.  Actually, if someone wanting to make it even longer, they could buy more poles.  I light how these are small and lightweight to travel with.  My two minor complains are #1 Even though the poles that I received were new, it seems that they left the factory with some sort of oily/sticky substance towards the ends.  That seemed to be surely cosmetic though and I was able to remove it with a paper towel #2 This kit includes a power switch but unfortunately you have to screw off the top handle to turn the power on/off (the switch remains inside and there is no switch on the exterior).  For the intended purpose, this add-on works great and has greatly improved my production quality but those are two minor things that the manufacturer should address to make it better.

This is a great case for traveling with the DJI Phantom 3, as it has wheels and a pop-out handle for rolling to and from an airport, etc.  It comes in a variety of colors but the bright orange is nice, as it's easy to see.  Should it fall into the water, this case will likely be easier to see and retrieve than a darker color.  For added security, up to two TSA-approved locks can be attached using the included holes.  The interior is perfectly setup for the Phantom 3 (Advanced or Professional) and most common accessories.  This is the type of case that will likely be able to handle most any abuse (careless baggage handlers, rain, etc.) associated with travel.  It's a very solid construction in my opinion and is greatly superior to inferior quality aluminum Phantom 3 case, Phantom 3 backpacks, etc.

This kit came with everything that I need for cleaning my cameras and lens filters except for the cleaning solution.  I purchased some of that separately and poured into the included spray bottle for my field bag.  The air blower works really well and the abundance of included cleaning clothes is great!  The brushes are nice too and to be quite honest, all that I'll use from this kit is the retractable brush, cleaning clothes, air blower and squirt bottle for my lens cleaning solution.  Great value and I have encountered no issues with build quality!  It's a must for the camera field bag and/or studio to keep lenses spotless for optimal video and photo quality!

Previously I had purchased an egg timer and modified it for my GoPro panning time-lapses.  I was looking for something that could support the weight of my RX10 II camera and found this.  The build quality is nice but is nothing exceptional.  It's small and light enough to toss inside of my DSLR backpack along with other gear and not really notice that it's there.  The ability to connect a tripod to the bottom is a huge plus!  Operation is very straight-forward and it doesn't require batteries. Simply rotate and 360 degrees is 60 minutes, 180 degrees is 30 minutes and you can do your own math for other degrees of rotation.  It makes a ticking sound while in motion which isn't a problem for me, since I record videos without audio.  It's also nice to have an audible acknowledgement to know that it's working.  One feature that I would like to see in a future version is the ability to choose different rotation speeds.  Sometimes I may not have an hour to spare for a 360-degree time-lapse and some cameras' recording duration and/or battery life could become an issue.

In the past I only used a UV filter.  That helped to better protect my camera's lens from damage but it didn't do much more.  This filter helps to make beach photos and video look a lot more colorful in my opinion.  Take a photo without this filter and then a photo with this filter.  The visual quality improvement is highly noticeable in my opinion.  I use the 62MM version with my Sony FDR-AX100 and Sony RX10 II cameras.  Also worth mentioning is that there are other brands available but the weight and overall build quality of B+W is the best that I have found.  These filters screw on and off smoothly and the glass seems to be of extremely high quality.

I like to take optimal care of my lenses.  Even the slightest smudge can potentially ruin an otherwise excellent photo or video.  This stuff works great and I even pour some of this into a smaller sorry bottle for my camera field bag.  Unlike using water, etc. that may contain impurities, this stuff leaves a lens looking perfect from my experience.  I have also used for my glasses and it works well for that too!  These containers are a reasonable size, so I likely won't have to order more for a while.  Very satisfied with this purchase!
These batteries work as expected.  I like how they are individually wrapped in a blister-style package for storage until they are used.  I use them with my garage door opener and they work great!

There are a lot of less expensive ND filters on the market but for the best visual quality, I've started to stick with the B+W brand for a few reasons.  For starters, they have a very heavy build quality.  They screw on and off easily, unlike some less expensive brands.  Also, the glass is of very high quality.  Most importantly, the photo and video quality speaks for itself.

I had the same hat in a different color but mistakenly left it in my boat while driving down the highway and it blew away.  I loved the hat so much that I bought the same hat in this blue color and love it!  It does an excellent job keeping the head cool and not blowing off due to the chin strap.  The material is of good quality and it cane become pretty much flat for storage when not in use.  I'll definitely buy again if I lose this one too!  The blue color looks great and the XL size fits my larger head perfectly!

I've used inferior sunscreens in the past that would run down into my eyes and cause severe pain.  Once rubbed in, I have not encountered that issue with this sunscreen.  I also love how it is a larger container and doesn't have a pump lid.  This container is great for travel and the lid doesn't break offline many pump lids do.  It has provided great sunburn protection for me too!  I always make sure that it's rubbed in thoroughly before I enter the water and reapply every few hours.

These stuff is quick to heat up on the stove top and makes a quick and satisfying lunch.  I usually sprinkle Parmesan cheese on top to make it even better.  The meatballs help to make it more filling.

I love these things because they don't require refrigeration unless opened.  I travel with these because they're light and compact.  One pack makes a great small snack for me and I often eat multiple packs as a substitute for a small meal.  Both the crackers and cheese taste fresh.

These are quality pedals.  They are the one-piece construction vs. the mainstream plastic meets metal construction that tend to separate.  I was able to install toe clips as well without and issues.  I'm using with my Trek mountain bike and have about 100 miles on them so far without any issues.  The pedals are grippy but don't have the little metal spikes like some do that tend to destroy the bottoms of shoes.

Installation was a snap!  Simply place between the legs on the Phantom 3 (works with Advanced or Professional models).  The included zip-ties can be used for added security but I found that it stays in place without them.  I've tested and this does not appear within the camera's frame while filming, even when the camera is pointed straight down.  It's made out of carbon fiber, so it weighs next to nothing yet is a strong material.  I did not notice degraded flights times/flight dynamics while flying with it installed.  Should the Phantom 3 crash and/encounter unexpected objects during landing, this may better protect the Phantom 3's camera and or gimbal from damage.  It looks neat too! I did not encounter any issues landing with this attached vs. off.  I'm very pleased with this product!

I travel with my DJI Phantom 3 in a variety of environments and even swim with it at times.  A Phantom 3 case that can handle abuse during transport, as well as abuse in the field is a must for me.  This case not only features latches on the top but has latches on the sides too!  The optional shoulder strap makes traveling with this case even more comfortable.  This case features custom cut-outs for the DJI Phantom 3 and most accessories.  I was even able to utilize the custom-cut holes to accommodate my after-market Phantom 3 prop guards and more!  I love the orange color but this case is available in other colors too.  It has two holes where TSA locks can be attached for travel.  To make things better, the case makes a great landing pad for the Phantom 3 too!

This screen protector is a must, as the Sony RX100 IV's display is exposed even when the camera is not in use (it doesn't flip over with a hard plastic backing like larger DSLR cameras and camcorders).  As soon as I pulled my RX100 IV out of the box, I immediately attached this screen protector to it.  Looking at the RX100 IV, it's next to impossible to tell that a screen protector is installed.  Installation was simple!  It was simply  a matter of visually confirming proper alignment (you may want to turn the camera on to make alignment easier), pushing down and then gently rubbing to ensure that it has adhered properly.  This will likely better protect the camera's display from scratches and should this screen protector ever become severely scratched, it should be easy to remove and replace with a new one.

These batteries are great!  To make things better, they come with a wall charger and car charger.  Alternatively, they could be charged using the charger that comes with the Sony RX100 IV.  These batteries are 1600Ah and the battery that came with the Sony RX100 Mark 4 is only 1240 mAh.  I own Wasabi Power batteries for all of my other cameras too and they have never disappointed.  I highly recommend these batteries for the Sony RX100 IV or other compatible cameras!

The handlebar grips that came with my new Trek mountain bike were not great.  They started to wear out and fall of quickly.  I purchased these and they look and perform better than the factory grips in my opinion!  I did make a mistake though.  I should have not used silicone lubricant to install but instead should have used alcohol.  I like how they are somewhat thick and feel padded in my hands!

They say "if it ain't broke then don't fix it" and that is very true in regards to toothpaste.  I've been using Crest toothpaste for my entire life and refuse to switch to any other brand.  It works well for me and the formula seems as if it has not changed.  I prefer this original formula because the cost is typically lower than the "fancier" Crest toothpaste varieties.

This mat sits on my vanity and my flat iron sits on this every day. It protects my wood vanity extremely well, and I have no reservations about it. It does pick up lint easily, but it can easily be wiped off.

To actually say that I love a shower head is weird, but I really do love this one. I like that I can instantly see when the water is hot (it turns red) and I never get in a cold shower again. Also, I like the removeable hand held unit, and I run both of them together. Love It!
If you get lash extensions and do not want to go back to the salon to have them removed, I recommend this. I left the product on for a little while and viola! The lashes came off with no pulling.

The only reason I purchased this is because I needed a space saving solution. I expected the actual salad spinner to not work well, but I was pleasantly surprised since the spinner works really well and the whole thing collapses down to about 2 or 3 inches. Perfect!

As the First Mate of our boat, I use this probably on a daily basis during boating season. This clip is wonderful. I can move the bumpers really fast as this clip takes all of two seconds to attach to the rail. The are well made, sturdy plastic and have not cracked or weakened. I highly recommend.

After breaking my IPhone when it fell to the floor from a CHAIR, I decided to buy a sturdier case. I ordered this one, and yes it very protective, but it makes my IPhone 6s plus, feel really heavy and bulky. Yes, I know, this is what ultimate protection feels like. If it protects my phone, I'm ok with it. My gripe however, is once your phone is in this case good luck getting it out. I actually broke the bottom piece that is next the plug trying to get the phone out. Now, I'm skeptical. If I can break it with my bare hands, how well can it protect my phone? I'm sending this back and waiting for Lifeproof to come out with their case.

I needed to replace my older mike stands, and I decided to go with classic mike stands. These have a small footprint, and work just like you would expect. The only negative was the way they were shipped. The base is heavy, and I ordered two. The box was literally coming apart. The poor UPS guy was running across the lawn trying to get it to the door before the box broke.

I wanted to love this. I really did. The rollers do create really pretty modern curls, that initally look great, but for me fell within minutes. The next time I used the rollers I kept them in for over an hour, and when I took them out, my curls fell immediately again. I really wished they would work for me, but without a ton of hairspray my curls would not stay.

We use this on our boat to cool us down on the really hot days. My husband mounted this on the dash, and because of the dual fans that swivel, one can cool him down, and I can use one for me. Excellent!

0:24 MinsEDIT 2/25/2015I have uploaded a snippet of video showing the Scooba cleaning my foyer. You can see how wet the floor gets, how the Scooba travels over the floor. Please note there is no audio on the video.Original Review:I have done a lot of research on floor cleaners/scrubbers over the past few days. I will be the first to admit that this product does not get the best reviews here on Amazon, and mixed reviews elsewhere on the internet. I purchased this model for a few reasons:1. The seemingly good customer service from iRobot2. The great track record of the Roomba - I just got my first one today3. I hate mopping my floorsOnce UPS dropped this off, I immediately unpacked it, read over the manuals and let it charge. Oh boy was I anxious. This is a LOT of money to spend on a toy. I didn't want a toy, I wanted a real solution to a real problem, cleaning my floors.I took the Scooba to a bathroom that is about 100 sq. ft. I figured I might as well try it out there, as there is really no obstacles in the room and its a relatively small sized room. I used two capfuls of iRobot Cleaning Solutions, warm water in the tank, and I set it down and pressed 'Clean". It's good to note, that if you get lost in what you are supposed to do with Scooba, just press the 'I' and it will tell you in plain english what to do. If you set the option for cleaning a small floor, it will clean a room that is about 100 sq. feet in 20 mins. The larger room setting will clean a room that is about 300 sq. ft in 40 mins.At first, my heart sank, as the Scooba just kind of went in circles and no water was on the floor for the first couple of minutes. Then, water started coming out, but still, it was not soaking the floor as the description says it should. Finally, the floor was pretty well saturated with water, and I could see the swirls of the brushes in the water on the floor.The patterns that it chose to follow, seemed haphazard at first, but if you read the manual, you will see that Scooba follows a few circular patterns kind of 'mapping' out the floor. It then proceeded to use an almost random pattern to clean. It got around the perimeter of the room, under the cabinet, and around the toilet. Boy was I impressed. There was not a dry spot in the room.The machine even vacuumed up small hairs and lint that it encountered alog the way, while laying down the soaking layer of water. It would be a good practice though, to vacuum the room first, or let your Roomba roam before you start the Scooba.  The Scooba will suck up small particles, but I don't think it's meant to do a real through vacuum. It is a bit hard to see the cycles that it goes through, because there is no 'starting point'. The Scooba will pass over the floor first sucking up the small particles, laying down the presoak, scrubbing  and finally sucking up all the water that is left. By the end of the cycle, my floor were dry. I could walk on them to retrieve the Scooba and put her back on the charging stand.The final and deciding result was that my floor was really clean, the room smelled fresh and I was pleased. We are going on vacation tomorrow, and this is one job I can cross off my list. Just like many of you, I like to come home to clean house, but I ALWAYS neglect to mop the floors, because frankly, who has time?The Scooba will certainly do well with tile, marble, or stone floors, and they even say hardwoods, but honestly it does lay down a LOT of water. I'm afraid to use it on my bamboo flooring so I purchased a Braava for that. Maybe one day I will try it out on my hardwoods.It does come with 1 virtual wall, but if you have virtual walls from another iRobot product they will work. It is a good idea to use them to confine the Scooba to a smaller space so that it cleans effectively.Some tips to remember:1. Don't expect this to work on your 1000 sq ft floor. It works best on smaller spaces. If you watch the promotional video on IRobot's website, you can see that the spaces that they have it in are smaller. It works best on spaces up to 100 - 350 sq ft.2. If you are expecting to clean your whole house while you drink a glass of wine in the bath, I'm not so sure that this is right for you. Yes, it takes the work out of cleaning your floor but it still needs to be monitored. It may get stuck under something or it may knock something over. But you can still drink your wine while periodically checking on it.3. Make sure you "Scooba-tize" your room. Don't expect it to clean your floors, with shoes in the way, mats on the floor, etc. It works best unobstructed.4. Be Realistic - it will not scrub your floors clean that you have not cleaned in the past year without running it a few times. Get in a habit of doing it frequently.5. The battery life is decent. You will probably get one 40 min cycle out of it before you have to recharge it. It recharges in about 2 hours, so go do something else while you wait for it to charge.Overall a great product and I am glad that I purchased it. Now, if they can finally make a clothes dryer that folds my clothes, I'll have it made!

This pillow completes the oasis that is my jacuzzi bath. Almost every night I take a long bath. I light candles, have a glass of wine, and watch at least an hour long TV show.I never had a pillow before, and I'm glad I waited to buy just the right one.This pillow is vinyl and suction cups to the edge of the tub from the long rectangular piece, and the rounded part folds down into the tub and sticks there.It is relatively soft, so that you feel like you are relaxing on a real pillow. The vinyl makes the pillow easy to wipe clean and the suction cups are strong, I have not had to restick them since I bought the pillow.I'm glad I purchased this pillow.

I love these headphones. First off, they are worn behind the head, and not over your head. They hook slightly over your ears, and are lightweight.I have used these headphones on the treadmill, while cooking dinner and listening to the video on my iPad (my kitchen is near my living room and the family is watching TV while I am cooking dinner), I have used these in my jacuzzi bath, while listening to music or watching a video. I have also used this while cleaning the house.The range is great. I can walk all over my house, and listen to whatever I want, while my device stays in another room. The sound is great, and you can easily control your device - sound, song skipping, and pause and playback from the buttons on the side of the earphones.Pairing is easy, I have it paired to both my iPad and my Kindle Fire with no problems whatsoever. I have not paired it to my phone, as I would not use it for phone calls.Lastly, the battery life is awesome. They stay charged for a long time, and stand up to hours of usage without failing.

I purchased this for my husband, as he constantly writes work emails on his iPad and constantly complains about how hard it is to do on the onscreen keyboard. Pairing was quick and easy and maintains the pairing even after not being used for a long time.The battery life is great, and I typing is very easy. Very similar to a full sized keyboard.I will say that since we purchased this, my husband's laptop has been used less and less. Good Buy!

Plain and simple. This does not work. My husband was so excited to get in the mail, because he knows that his snoring disturbs me at night. The day it came in the mail, we eagerly ripped open the package and put it on his pillow, and viola! This is gonna be so awesome...or so we thought.I swear it wasn't 5 minutes after he went to sleep he was snoring. ALL.NIGHT.LONG.If you want to spend money for no reason, but this, otherwise invest in a good pair of earplugs and try to keep your sanity.

I purchased these to put on my vanity to protect the top from various makeup bottles and brushes. These really nice looking, and look upscale. Everyone complains about the crease that is down the middle. If you lay the mat flat, over time it will go away, or you can use the hot water method to ease out the crease.These mats are plastic, but you would never know without touching it. I feel like these will hold up well in the long run.Great Buy
My husband loves this ring. It is highly polished and shiny, and it fits well.It has become one of my husbands favorite ring.

As the company says, "throw the germy mess away". I love these, and I love even more that they come in such a large quantity. I can place several packs of these in all of the bathrooms, and not have to run out quickly. Being able to stash them around the house, makes spot cleaning easy.When you use these, you can see them start to break apart quickly, so you can see they will not be a problem for your plumbing.They also have a lot of cleaner in them, you can see it foam up and there is enough for clean the bowl without feeling like you are running out of cleaner.Good Buy

This could be the best hair tool I have ever had. This dryer is powerful and will blow dry your hair straight, fast! You will not have frizzy ends, and you will also have shiny hair.My hairstylist recommended this blow dryer and I thank her for it. I love it so much that I take it on vacation with me.

Where have I been that I did not know these existed? If I had known about these I would not have purchased the big laundry baskets I have now. These are great, they take up no space, and can carry a lot of clothes. They are really easy to carry since they kind of bend a bit and makes the load a bit easier.The handles seem to be good quality, and are strong. I've had these for a few weeks now, and they are still in good shape.
What? I can't hear you!These babies are great. I can't hear my husband snoring right next to me.Has saved my marriage, and my sanity.

I have the Bio-Restorative cream, and I think that it is really good, but this serum does not seem to have any benefit. While I am no stranger to expensive beauty products, I just do not see any benefit at all to this product. My face does not seem be any better than using the cream alone.I will not repurchase.

I just took the middle and large suitcases on a week long trip to Las Vegas. After arriving at our destination, we waited anxiously for our bags to arrive on the carousel, and hoped they weren't destroyed.Surprise, surprise! They still looked really good, so I am hopeful that they will stay relatively nice looking for a while. Sure they were a little banged up, but they weren't horribly scratched up, and they were not dented at all.I am taking off a couple of stars because the zippers on the inside of the suitcase, the ones that close off on side, seem to be catching and don't look to be too sturdy. I feel like they are going to break soon.I've only taken one trip with these suitcases, but I'm not sure they are going to go the long haul.

My husband and I stay in hotels a lot, and we like our Starbucks coffee. We went on a trip to Las Vegas where our fancy 5 diamond hotel does not have coffee makers in the room, and our only choice is going to the lobby for Starbucks for at least $3 coffee. We also like to have several cups in the morning, and we needed a solution.We purchased this kettle and purchased the Starbucks VIA Ready Brew Italian Roast Coffee (50 count). Not only does this kettle get the water extremely hot, but it boils quickly and has auto shut off too! Now, we don't have to worry about burning the hotel down. On the plus side, the Starbucks VIA is the best instant coffee I have ever had. Pretty close to fresh brewed coffee.The only con about this little baby is that it is small. You cannot make two 10 oz coffees at one time. However, for size you will gain function and portability.The kettle also comes with I guess they think should be travel cups and spoons, however, they are best fit for a kids tea party and baby food containers.

These cords are well worth the cost. First of all, can you say 10 feet? That's the difference between placing your device on the night table able letting it charge while you just look at it, or you can charge your device and actually use it.Yes, it also syncs your device. Works for both iPhone and iPad.

I had high hopes for this, but when I connect this to my home network (set up was easy) I found that my internet speed dropped a lot, and some of my devices would not connect to the extension at all. Returned!

These are OK. Yes they shine nicely, and the size is believeable and the price is just right, whats not awesome is the basket the CZ sits in. It is really high off your ear, and it not a traditional basket that a diamond would sit in. Of course, you can only see this if you are looking at the side of someone's head, but nonetheless, I don't really like it.On the other hand, I lose these types of stud earring all the time, so like I said for the price, they're ok.

Beautiful Watch. Invicta makes good watches and my husband is a collector of all types of watches and loves this watch. He thinks the stying is eye catching and the "Rolex" sweep of the second hand makes the watch look expensive. Keeps good time as well

I must admit, I originally started to reactivation as part of my kindle unlimited subscription, but quickly was immersed in the story. The characters are well written and thought out, and the book has just the right amount of emotion to balance the story. The author is an excellent writer and I look forward to other books he has written.

This keyboard is a great companion to the Apple keyboard that does not have the numeric keys on the side.......IF  you are plugging it into your MacBook directly.  I use a thunderbolt display and plug the usb directly into the Thunderbolt display. The keypad works initally, then will not work at all. I tested it by plugging directly to my MacBook Pro and it worked flawlessly. However, if you use a Thunderbolt display, you use that as a docking station and plug all your accessories there. Unfortunately, this keypad does not work in that fashion. Back it goes.
These babies are cheap, work great and come with batteries.

I purchased this case for my husband for his new iPhone 6, and initially he was very happy with the case. However, after a few days when the phone was slid into the case, the phone could easily slip right through out the other side. My husband went back to the listing on Amazon and found that the company was offering replacements for the case. I immediately went online and sent an email to the company, and they responded quickly, and offered to replace the holster or replace the case altogether with a different case. We chose a different case, and the company has sent it us. I have yet to receive the case, but I am confident that the case will be fine, and I wholeheartedly appreciate the quick response from the company.In the meantime, my husband used a Command strip (with only the paper taken off of one side) on each side of the case, to make the case a little smaller, so that his phone does not slip through while we wait for the new one to come.

I mean it's toilet paper. What else can I say? We purchased this for our boat, and yes it dissolves and not we have not had an issue with it, and we use a vacuflush system.Now, if you're like most boaters, nobody is allowed to doody on the boat, so most times the toilet paper never even goes into the tank.But, if it does, you'll have no problem.

Ok, I have a love hate relationship with this case. The material feel great, the phone fits snug, and it does what it says its supposed to do. The separate credit card 'thingy' that you're supposed to carry around with you to jam into the back to make the phone stand up in landscape view is annoying and dumb. Really? I'm going to carry this thing around with me? Dumb, just make a kickstand.I am on the fence about this case, because after I threw my phone on my handbag, a later found a scratch on the screen protector that I had put on the phone the day I bought it. If I had a case with a cover, that would have not happened.So, if you want a simple case that will cover your phone, and protect against drops, its great. Otherwise, keep looking.

I LOVE this mirror. This mirror is 5X magnification, versus 10X, which makes me feel like I'm looking in a funhouse mirror. My eyes aren't so bad yet, that I cannot see my face, just yet. On the other hand, the 5X, will definitely make you see EVERYTHING on your face. It's also great to be able to see your WHOLE face too. My other mirror allowed me to see sections of my face at a time. Hated that.I love how it comes on when you come close. No reports yet of the mirror coming on when a ghost is near like some of the other reviewers, but I'll keep an eye out.I love the feel of it. For a mirror that costs as much as this one, it should feel heavy and sturdy, as this one does.I charged it initially when I purchased it and have not needed to charge it since then.Overall a good purchase and I'm happy I bought it. I'm considering the travel one as well.

Eh, it's ok. I had a case similar to this for my Galaxy Note, and it was great. You can manipulate the screen through the cover and it just worked. This case for the iPhone 6 does what it says, it allows to see who's calling, I have had only one success of being able to answer a call while the cover was closed, by sliding my finger along the metal contacts, but thats about it.My issues with the case are not so much with the case, as it's with the phone. Apple does not allow the iPhone to be put to sleep with the case, so if you close the case, you're phone is still on.The case does not stay closed, however on the other hand, you know this going in. If you want a case with a dedicated snap closure, get another case.The materials feel nice, but feels more felt-like than suede or leather.My phone can be viewed in landscape mode easily. I got the blue one, and overall I like it.

I purchased these after a manicurist used them on me during a procedure. I previously used to soak off my gel nail polish with a bowl of acetone. That seemed to take forever. These little babies are awesome. Dip the little pads in the polish remover, and wrap around your nails. The wraps will be somewhat secure, as secure as tinfoil on your nails can be. I found it easier to do one hand at a time, because it can be somewhat hard to wrap both hands at once. Wait for about 15-20 minutes and your polish will be melted enough to remove easily. Yes you can probably achieve the same effect with tin foil and cotton balls, but that's a lot of effort when these are already pre-made. I recommend!

I purchased the Bose QC 20s a while ago, and while I had used them almost exclusively for noise cancelling, I almost never used them for listening to music. Weird right? Well...my husband snores, and rather than killing him, I though it best to wear something to block out the noise.The QC20s allow me to lie next to my husband and never hear his snoring. At All. In fact, I take them off, thinking he has stopped and am surprised to hear that he is still going strong. I also wore these on two flights and all the noise from the flights were silenced almost completely. I barely heard the wailing babies, and the guy behind me who thought it ok to crank up his Ipad because he forgot headphones.I often use my QC 20s to be in the same room with my husband and boys who love to watch football and basketball games, and I honestly cannot hear a thing.Well, just lately, I started using these to listen to my music collections, and it seemed, flat. I feel like I have to crank up the volume to hear the 'color' of the music. I'm not an audiophile, just a regular person that likes to really hear music. In fact, when I listen to my music on my Ipad with the QC15s or the QC3s, and switch to the QC20s, the drop in volume and tone is astounding.Well, I went to Bose and ordered both the QC 15 and the QC 3. The QC 3 blew me away with the beautiful sounds of my music, but the noise cancelling was just so so. I could still hear my husband snoring, the cheers from the televised sports games. Also, the on ear design of the QCs left my ears hurting. I still wanted to use them just so I listen to my music like I never heard before.I received the QC15s and was thinking that the over ear design would surely offer better noise cancelling and great sound for music. Boy was I surprised. I put the 15s on and I could clearly hear my two employees talking across the room. I switched to my QC20s and they sounded like they were far far away. But of course my music sounds great! *Sigh*I am clearly upset as I want both great sound and noise cancelling, but I guess I have to choose. The 15s and 3 will go back, and I will stick with these. It makes more sense to pay for the noise cancelling, rather than the music sound.

I have 3 cases for my 10 day old Kindle Fire HDX. Why you ask? Because it is a crime to saddle down this beautiful lightweight tablet with  huge bulky case. I have tried a leather sleeve case, which I like because sometimes I do not like to have a case at all, mostly when reading. I purchased the Amazon Origami case, which makes my HEX feel like a ton of bricks and increases the thickness of the tablet a lot, it's going back tomorrow!What makes this case so great? Here it is in no particular order:1. It's lightweight - does not add much weight to the HDX at all2. It's slim. Your tablet will fit snugly inside the case and it does not increase the thickness .3. Felt like inside cover will protect against scratches on the face4. Camera will operate  in the case5. Button cut outs allow for easy access and use.6. It's slim and lightweight - did I say that already?I love this case. I think you will too.

My daughter uses her iPad at school and complained about having to use the on screen keyboard. I purchased this and she loves it. Her IPad sits like a little laptop on the keyboard, and it backlit. When closed the case forms a nice case/cover for the iPad. One issue we did have however, was that the keyboard lost the bluetooth signal, and we had to 'forget' the bluetooth settings and then turn the iPad on and off and reconnect the bluetooth before it would work again. Otherwise, good keyboard.

Love this set. the pattern is really nice and the clear plastic see through lid is nice. The set has a lot of different sizes for all types of uses. The lids snap securely and the stack nicely in your cabinet as well. The dishwasher does no harm to this set either. I am thinking of purchasing another set or at least a set that has larger sizes in it for freezing.

I will start out saying, I am a techie, I have several Android tablets and phones, and both Apple iphone and ipad (several versions). I purposely waited to purchase the PRO over the RT version because I knew that the PRO was a full function computer.I needed/wanted a Windows tablet as I work for myself and I wanted a more portable solution. I frequently may need to work with my staff while from a remote location and I also need to work on Office documents and access files from my desktop computer.I have tried (and tried) to use my Ipad and while it offers functionality, nothing beats a Windows Machine. I also wanted a more 'airport friendly' device than a laptop. I'm tired of dragging it out for TSA and trying to beat the other 100 travelers trying to get their shoes and belts back on.I have owned the Surface for 2 days and I couldn't be more pleased. I 'tried' it out by taking it to an office training class, and streaming the web training session, all the while working with my office and answering emails, and looking up accounts.I have set up my computer (Yes I don't call it a tablet) with the office 365 trial, and I have been able to create documents, save to my computer and skydrive and send out via email. Ah!The ONLY issue I have had with my Surface is that my Outlook would not open (the profile) would not open AT ALL. I have been searching in vain for the reason for it, and without getting too technical here I believe it is an issue with the Surface. Google it.I have however, been able to set up the mail and calendar app, and yes it works perfectly, so in retrospect, I don't really need outlook.To answer most FAQs:1. Yes it is small. Too small? No, just right. It is supposed to be portable. Just adjust browser and document settings and you are good to go.2. IT IS A COMPUTER, MORE THAN A TABLET. You have full function capabilities that you would have in a desktop/laptop. I have installed programs, and yes I use a mouse. You actually can use it without a mouse, however I think the combo of tablet gestures and mouse works. I like the wedge mouse, it's small and Bluetooth, so no dongle sticking out of the ONLY usb port.3. I am using the type cover. It is a respectable keyboard and easy to use. I would use this over anything else, since the keyboard is the cover and when you fold it back it disables the keys and you don't accidentally type as its folded back.4. Using it without the keyboard cover is good too. I am actually liking the windows 8 tiles, which took a little getting used to. But now I wish I had windows 8 on my desktop. I lay in bed and use the Surface frequently without the keyboard and it is a good tablet.5. Screen is glossy and gets fingerprinty fast. Use of mouse and the pen works but only so much. I wish the pen had more of dedicated holding spot instead of the charging port. I can see myself losing it, and soon. I bought a carrying case to hold all of the accessories when not in use. Screen protector will probably work to cut down some of the fingerprints but I haven't gotten one yet.6. Battery life.....eh. Not awesome. Today I used the surface while working and it lasted about 5 hours. I did not decrease the screen brightness as I like it high regardless. Yes, I would carry my charger with me.7. Charger has a usb slot to charge another device while charging your Surface. Pretty awesome. I used this to charge my phone while I needed my phone's hotspot to get internet for the Surface the other day.8. It is not a TOY. This is not a kid's tablet or play toy. Yes you can get apps (all types from games to business) but it is a full function portable computer. I'm mad I didn't think of purchasing this for my high school daughter instead of her ipad that she takes to school every day to take notes on.9. Love the kickstand. Some people hate the kickstand, I however think it is perfect for sitting in a chair or laying in bed and not having to prop it up or have some bulky case on it to prop it up. Don't want it, push it in, done!10.I have not watched any movies or played any games on it, and I probably won't. I'm just not a game or movie tablet watcher unless i'm on a airplane.11. It gets a little hot. The battery gets a little hot and its a little heavy. But we are all used to the slim weight of the Ipad and android tables, but compared to a laptop its not heavy, at least to me.12. It is not comparable to an Ipad or any other type of tablet. It is a computer. You will be disappointed if all you are getting it for is to play angry birds.13. Side note about Skydrive (Microsoft's cloud drive) if you set it up on the computer you use and the Surface you can choose/open documents that are saved in the Skydrive as well and the documents that are stored locally on the respective computer. I just found this out today, and it has a great feature. No longer do I need to use Log me in, or the remote desktop tool on the Surface.14. There was an HP Printer app on my Surface which allowed me to connect to the HP Printer in my home right away. I was able to print in seconds, from email, documents, etc.14. I typed this whole review on my Surface, while sitting on my patio.Conclusion: This a a great solution to the tablet world and the real computing world. I'm sad that microsoft wasn't first to market, then everyone would be comparing everything else to this and not the Ipad.

I downloaded the book from my prime membership because of the reviews. It's a gripping story from the beginning and stays that way the whole book.The main character's Patrick despair feels real and palpable. All the characters are well thought out and the action in the book moves swiftly.My only complaint is that i guessed the ending of the book early on, however it was still an entertaining read.
Fr On my way! Reason cold sake sets are hard to find. This set comes in a nice box and each piece is delicately wrapped. Very nice for a reasonable price.
When we first bought our Keurig we had a sample cup of Sumatra in the pack and once we tried it we were hooked. No bitterness, but a strong bold cup of java. All my husband will drink now.

If you are in doubt, get buy this. I went to Las Vegas for 1 week and took wayyyy to many clothes, but packing and unpacking were the easiest ever with this Pack It Folder.I probably had about 10 shirts, 5 dresses (nice evening types) and a few t shirts packed into this. My suitcase has never been so organized before. Once I got to Vegas, nothing had shifted and I just simply opened the Pack and hung up the dresses & shirts and placed the t-shirts in the drawer.I can't really lie and say there were slightly wrinkled from being folded, but nothing that when they were hung up the wrinkles didn't fall out of.The pack is very durable and the velcro that holds it closed is strong. My husband used one and he must have had twice what I had, and it barely closed however it stayed shut.We are both fans and I would recommend this to anyone.

So, yes this does hold my keyboard up much higher, and no the keyboard itself does not move, however the whole stand slides. I do have it sitting on top of my desk pad (the clear see thru kind) but the keyboard can move quite easily if slightly pushed.Not really a fan of that.Otherwise, it looks good and works fine, the sliding issue just makes me a little annoyed.

Does what it says, charges your device and keeps my phone from getting lost in the paper monster that is my desk. You cannot uses case with this, except the OEM samsung note flip cover case. My slim case does not work with it or does any other case I have.You can use it to charge another battery also, as it charges your device quickly.Good product

This is my first book by Joyce Carol Oates, which is sad since I found out she is from my hometown of Lockport, NY. Subject matter aside, this book is a bit hard to read. It is written from the prespective of the main characters and sometimes seems a bit jumbled. I think that may be the style of the author, but I'm not sure. The abduction scene played out so many times with almost the same wording I thought I had someone retread the same page many times over.Of course the subject matter is quite disturbing, but in all fairness fascinating as it was told. Yes, I agree with others that the ability of Ms. Oates to get in the head of the kidnapper is extraordinary. There is no graphic detail sex in this book, but the way it is described is probably more graphic than an actual blow by blow description.I can't say that I was surprised by the some parts of the ending, but the actual ending I did not understand.maybe someone can enlighten me, so as not to spoil it for others.I will say this book kept my attention and even had me thinking about it when I was not reading,but I can't say as though it was the best book I've ever read, but it did keep me entertained.
These are well made cards, and I believe you will not be disappointed if you purchase them.Quality is fine.
This is good tea, however, if you brew the largest size it will be too diluted, and I dont think its sweet enough. I put a packet of equal in and it suits my taste.

Louise started dating Liam when she was fourteen, she moved in with him at sixteen and was pregnant and ready to get married not long after but then she started to notice the changes small at first it started with yelling, insults and put downs and then when she was three months pregnant he raped and assaulted her, this was the first of many, many times and by now she was isolated, her friends and family alienated and she was totally alone.She takes it and takes it for years until it's turned on her children and then she has to act, she packs up and leaves and this is when she comes across the Ace MC and Spike in particular.Spike has his own demons and nightmares but could Louise help him heal? Louise has been devalued and abused so much at she may never be truly happy with a man again and Spike is just so masculine do they even stand a chance?This is my favourite so far and I'm glad because I've been a little in love with Spike since Diesels book and I just loved Devon and Tommy.This series had a slow start for me but now I'm truly hooked and just waiting for Amy's book but unfortunately I have a longish wait because it's not expected out until 18th March 2016.I'm really going to miss these guys since I've read these four books over the last four days now I've got to find something else to read.

This was an emotional read and it's one of those books where just when you've written someone off the author makes it impossible for you to hate them.Paige and Chloe may be identical but they're nothing alike, Paige is awful, I'm not talking just rude and ignorant she's devious and conniving and at times positively evil, there's really nothing likeable about her and although we know there's some issue, some reason why she's acting out its hard to see past her behaviour.Then she does something totally unforgivable and I'd decided that was it, there was no coming back from this regardless of her demons.Now Chloe is as different again, she's sweet and has tried her best to befriend her sister she's also had a crush on a club member for years but he's never shown any interest other than friendship but she's eighteen now is it time she let him know how she feels? But even if he feels the same it's forbidden, he's in the MC and she's a members daughter.I read this in one sitting, I just couldn't put it down I was really hoping everything for both these girls, for me it's the strongest book yet and on top of all the existing characters we're introduced to the mysterious Cade, I'm sure we'll catch up with him in the future because I'd like his story.One thing about these books and I should maybe have mentioned it in my previous reviews is that the story continues on, while each book, each character and each romance is a standalone there's always elements which continue which makes reading just one of these difficult which isn't a problem for me because I'm slowly becoming hooked.

While on the whole I enjoyed the previous book 'Diesel' I did have a few reservations and it's the same with this book.Taylor is twenty-six years old, has just moved to England from America and is opening her own hair and beauty salon, she's beautiful, confident, witty and intelligent a difficult combination to ignore which is why when Duke meets her for the first time he's blown away. Taylor is also instantly attracted to Duke but Duke doesn't do relationships, at all, like never plus his life is dangerous and that's not the life that Taylor wants so is there anyway they can battle the odds and make it work?I already liked all the Ace MC characters from 'Diesel' and this book just cemented that, it takes a while getting used this, not only is it a softer read but it's first and foremost a romance and I think that's the difference.Most of the MC books I've read have been gritty and darker with a lot of the story revolving around the club and their activities, building the tension and angst often with a very strong sometimes disturbing thread. This book is more character driven and while it's based around an MC it's the romance that's the main thread, everything else revolves around that and I think I like it for a change, with reservations of course.In 'Diesel' Harlow confused me seeming almost bipolar at times and Taylor also confused me in this book.I was moving on to 'Spike' he's one of my favourites but I've just realised the next book is actually 'Paige and Chloe' so I'll give that a go.

Harlow is twenty years old and looking for a fresh start, her mother died when she was just four years old and she was raised by her father and his MC The Skulls MC but now her father is dead and she no longer feels comfortable there, in fact the President of the Skulls 'Hawke' made her feel so scared she had to leave.Harlow's dream has always been to be a tattooist so armed with her portfolio she heads for Aces Tattoo shop.Now I have to say I struggled at first with this, even allowing for Harlow being nervous and with everything she'd been through recently she still seemed a bit off, almost bipolar. I don't want to make this a spoiler review but you'll know what I mean if you read it.Harlow meets Diesel and the attraction is instant but they both come with loads of baggage, some of it dangerous. Is it possible for these two to beat the odds?I have to say after the bumpy start I enjoyed this read, a British MC book as well its not often I come cross one of those, although I'm being honest it didn't seem that British.I liked all the Aces MC characters and I'll be reading Dukes book next, its already on my kindle waiting.This is a softer MC read, I noticed one review compared it to Mills & Boon and I suppose it is a kind of Mills & Boon does MC and while I generally prefer a nice dark and gritty MC this made a change and overall I enjoyed it.

This is actually the second book in this series and while I downloaded 'Rose' a while ago I've never actually got round to reading it, something about 'Lily' just drew me in and I started reading immediately.Lily has been in love with Daniel since she was twelve and she's nearly eighteen and therefore eligible to start dating. She needs to give a list of potential suitors to her aunt which she does but the list only contains one name, Daniel. The problem is even though Lily is in love with Daniel and admits he's the only man she'd ever consider marrying she believes he's still in love with her married sister Rose. Daniel was one of Rose's suitors for years before she married and Lily can't honestly believe that he could go from loving the feminine and ladylike Rose to loving her but she'll take him however she can.I really liked parts of this book and the sisters seem an interesting bunch and I'm considering continuing on and reading Amaryllis's book, even though this one drove me nuts in places.It was just too much, the constant 'he loves Rose not me' went on for far, far, far too long, I lost interest to the extent where I took a break and read another book, I thought Lily was never going to get it and I started to skim read just to get through it, never a good sign.##### SLIGHT SPOILER ######Not sure about the time line....they want to get married in December. Her mother suggests a Christmas themed wedding then says 'Are you thinking the beginning of the month or the end?'Yet one week later it's Christmas!Picky I know, I can't help it but that means the conversation took place one week before Christmas, the middle of December so how could they get married at the beginning?

I do love a good Mail Order romance and this one comes with an extra bit of spice.Annie Michealson left New York with her sixteen year old brother Beau, New York held no real future for them with nothing but factory jobs and she wanted more than that for him,Annie now finds herself stuck in Colter Canyon, Texas. Having left New York to become a Mail order bride, she arrived to discover her husband-to-be Eustace Fontaine was nothing like the man he'd pretended to be and Annie refuses to go ahead with the marriage.That was ten days ago and she's been living at the saloon ever since, she works at the bakery struggling to make enough money for her and Beau to travel further west but a single attractive girl living over a saloon collects attention and people make assumptions.And then there's Nick Kendal, he's tall, handsome and arrogant, the saloon girls flock to him but Annie's not sure how she feels about him, she can't deny he's attractive but he makes her nervous.I enjoyed this book as I said I do have a weakness for Mail Order brides and this one is slightly different.The 3.5 stars is not a negative and partly a reflection of the length after all it is only 57 pages long.

This is the first book I've read by this author and even though I'd read the blurb and scanned the reviews it still wasn't what I expected but then I'm not really sure what I expected.I'll admit for a long while I was confused, I wasn't sure exactly what was going on, oh I had the basics but it was the details and how all the pieces fit together that eluded me, and that's the point, we get hooked in and need to know what happened, we slowly get the answers and sometimes the questions as we continue reading.Maya Petrov is just sixteen, beaten, bleeding and strapped to a chair blindfolded when she hears her father's voice:"I don't care if you have to wipe her entire damn memory, just make her forget. I pay you to make people forget.""She is a liability, make it go away or she dies."So we know her father's not exactly father of the year material but the more we read the more we realise just how truly depraved he is.It's hard not to love both the main characters, they've been through so much and both suffered their own hell, Nikolai more so, he's brilliant but tortured, not only by his own decisions and actions but his family and their history.I totally lost myself in this book and while it's a standalone I did wish several times that I'd read the 'Elite' series and therefore had some background on some of the Italians.This is very close to a 5 star read for me the only thing that I didn't like was Nikolai's family history it just seemed a bit too much, but this is a small point and the book is well worth a try don't be surprised if you're confused at the beginning everything is explained so stick with it.

I liked the blurb but I couldn't find a review anywhere (I only found one review after I'd given up) so I put it to one side and decided to wait but I kept coming back to it and eventually I thought I'd just give it a go.I struggled at first because I didn't find Elizabeth particularly likeable, at all and then there's the writing English is obviously not the authors first language and the translation makes it difficult to read, it may seem picky but it doesn't flow and therefore makes reading slow and tedious, here's just a couple of examples but the book's littered with them.Of course! This is MY building and nothing happens here without my consent! Youre stealing me a time you cant imagine how much it costs. Your salary for life wouldnt come to so much. So do to me a favor, take your things and go to hell!'They agreed five years and then they would renegotiate. John counted every second for the five years to end, because every time she put it more difficult for him.'While I wouldn't normally review a book I haven't finished I couldn't find another one anywhere I'm posting this to give you some idea what to expect.It wasn't just the writing although I quickly got fed up with re-reading all the time I didn't like either of the main characters but I would have stuck with it had it been easier to read.

It's a long while since I last read a really good shifter book so after reading the blurb and reviews I thought I'd give this a try and it turned out to be an entertaining read.Damon Trahan is a Werewolf Guardian, all he wants is to do his job well and belong to a pack.He's on a mission when an urgent call comes through, a female werewolf has been kidnapped and he's to rescue her at all costs.Ava Renfroe is the female in question, she's been drugged and kidnapped and thinks she's hallucinating when she sees men change into wolves. She's twenty-four, has never shifted and has no idea she's a wolf.There's some great characters here, Damon, Ava, Jayden, Jeff but especially Granny she's hilarious.On the whole this is a good book, it's a bit abrupt in places and I got a little fed up of all the 'I'm not worthy' but there was only one part I really didn't understand and I'm putting it as a spoiler.######## SPOILER #######The wolves respect and revere women, they are precious and treated as such so why then when a queen finally appears:"The Were Laws state that when a Queen arises, she will be mated to the strongest Alpha in the Pack."If you dont accept ????? as your mate, you will be put to death."Thats murder."Thats the law.Now this is just ridiculous one of the things I've always loved about werewolves is the way they treat their women they adore and protect them so the ideal that a rare queen would be murdered for not marrying who she's told is plain crazy.Am I being picky?Yes I suppose I am but why put that, it's not as if we were worried we all knew who Ava was going to end up with, we knew before we even started reading.While I'm moaning I can't understand why the General continued to withhold Ava's shift, was he going to do this indefinitely?

This is a fabulous series, the only issue I had at all was Mia she really got on my nerves and it shows just how good the first book 'Close Liasons' was that I continued on because she really did annoy me in the first book.The second book 'Close Obsession' proved to be addictive reading the concept was excellent, the descriptions of the K centres wonderful. Mia still annoyed me in the beginning but this wore off as the book progressed, Korum again was, well what can I say I loved him. The new characters were great I'm hoping there's more of them in future books particularly Adam and Saret.The third and final book 'Close Remembrance' was also addictive, I won't give any details because I don't want to spoil anything for you but I loved this series.

Let me start by saying this is not your typical romance or even a romance at all and if you start this book expecting one you will be sadly disappointed.I noticed a friend had marked this to read so I thought I'd check it out but after seeing all the reviews I decided not to bother, however my friend absolutely loved it and gave it 5 stars so I looked again.I wasn't sure exactly what to expect and it's a difficult book to categorise, Alasdair Kyriakous is an old, feared and powerful vampire and he finds himself inexplicably drawn to Leo Chapel, a human, he can't stay away he tries and fails and then he feeds from Leo....Strange things happen between Leo and Alasdair and neither one of them has any idea what's going on.This is a highly erotic read the tension builds and we're teased and tormented but surprisingly there's little actual sex but this works and works well.The story drives the book and it's an intriguing read but I missed the romance even though and I can't believe I'm saying this but the book worked better without it, doesn't mean I didn't want it or missed it but it's a stronger read without it, if that makes any sense at all.I liked the history of the vampires, even the brutality, which surprised me, and all the characters, I loved Alasdair and Leo plus the story which slowly reveals itself.So what didn't I like?The cliffhanger and this is a big one so now I'm left waiting for the next book.

This is two books in one, the first one 'Snowed in with the Billionaire' ends at 59% and it's basically the blurb, if you've read the blurb you've read the book but if you're looking for a very quick sweet read then it might be for you.It's not so much that it's bad it's just not very good and at times it felt more like a rough draft waiting to be padded out.It's difficult to review because there's not much here, it's very simplistic and feels, to me anyway as if it had been written 20 years ago, don't ask we why it's just a feeling I got while reading.As you will have gathered I wasn't really impressed with this, the outline's here but there's no depth or anything.I didn't bother reading the bonus book 'Unexpected Fling' so I can't comment on that.

This book wasn't exactly what I expected, it's a harmless little romance, no surprises or shocks it just goes the way you expect from the first page to the last.The characters are nice enough, Cade is the rich handsome shifter, oldest son from a royal line who's finally, with a bit of intervention from his parents found his mate. Anna is finally single again after a bad marriage and Cade is literally her dream man.It's all very nice and very sweet but also very predictable.

Having read nothing but mediocre (at best) books of late I was looking through my kindle and came across this, it must be 3 or 4 years since I last read this book.I wasn't sure how I'd get on with Gwendolyn after all she's spent the last eighteen months having sex with a man she doesn't know, she knows what he looks like and that's it she doesn't know his name, age, job or even his marital status.Even though I had issues with this I still enjoyed this book, it has a hot guy overload not only do we get Cade/Hawk but also Lawson and my favourite Kane/Tack, I do love Tack.On top of all the hot guys we get an interesting story, great secondary characters and a book long enough and good enough to lose yourself in for awhile.It's a typical Kristen book filled with alpha men, chin lifts and 'babes' hot women and their equally hot friends and it leads on to good series, well I say that but I've never read 'Wild Man' I just didn't fancy it, at all but I enjoyed 'Law Man' and absolutely loved 'Motorcycle Man'

Shep is thirty-eight years old and although tattooing is his life he's restless and he's not sure why until a little blonde with pale eyes bumps into him, there's just something about her.Shea is trying really hard to break away from her family and be herself but the problem is after spending her entire life being controlled by her mother she's not really sure who she is and so she walks into Midnight Ink to do something different, something just for her.This started well I was intrigued by Shep, Caliph and Sass, actually I was more than intrigued by Sass.This looked to have everything covered, a six foot five hot tattooed and pierced bad boy and a beautiful good girl trying to find herself.So why didn't I like this more?I'm not a great fan of insta-love but I know sometimes it's necessary but I just didn't really buy into this, they have lots of sex though.I had several issues but the overriding one was Shea's mother, I can't find the words to describe just how awful, OTT, ridiculous and totally unbelievable she was.Why? I wondered at first if she was supposed to be funny.Here's just a few examples:"Youre nothing but an accountant who sleeps in like a whore.It would have been a good morning if youd been the daughter I wanted you to be. Not the daughter you are."Dont disappoint me by being yourself."Plans? You? Her mother laughed, and Shea winced. Honey, you dont need to lie to me. I know you have no plans. Who would want to be with you?"See what I mean, she's like a cartoon baddie and totally ruined the book for me and I can't understand why she was written this way, she could have been bad but still been believable.

I was actually looking for a different book when I came across this, the blurb and reviews were good so I thought I may as well give it a try.Since there's already a lot of reviews I'll skip my usual summary and get straight to my thoughts, which are mixed, well kind of.For the longest time I just wasn't sure, something seemed to be missing I wasn't connecting to the characters and therefore not fully invested in the story.There was enough here to keep me reading and by the time I'd reached the end I'd really enjoyed it and I will most likely continue on with the rest of this series.I've been trying to work out what was missing and I'm not sure, not very helpful I know.There's a lot here, way more than I expected even after the blurb I thought most of the drama would come from Raylin but it turns out Storm has plenty of his own drama going on.I liked both Storm and Raylin plus Hawk and Rook, I should also mention there's a lot of sex in this book it's definitely steamy.

I've been looking for a colourful salt and pepper mill for about a year now, while I've found some in the past the colours were too bold I wanted pastel colours and decided I'd rather wait to get exactly what I want.To be honest I'd stopped actively looking, I was down in London for the weekend and I couldn't believe I'd more or less stumbled across exactly what I'd been wanting.I realised I'd previously looked at these on Amazon but hadn't really been impressed I don't think I'd pictured them as tall as they actually are and the colours are beautiful, they look much nicer in person.I got this blue one for pepper and the pink one for salt, they work really well and look fabulous.

I'd been having one of those days, you know the ones I mean where you just can't settle on a book I'd started and discarded so many that when I started this I didn't check the reviews, unusual for me but I didn't think I'd stick with it but I liked it instantly and so I read on.Since there's so many reviews I'll skip my usual summary and just give my opinion, which is'It's ok'Those two words sum this book up perfectly for me.There's nothing original here but then I didn't really expect it we have Gable the tattooed bad boy who's hot but been hurt in the past so he's developed a revolving bedroom door.Then we have Scout the good girl, only one previous boyfriend also been hurt in the past but she's no pushover and although we know they're going to end up together she's going to make him work for it....well that's how it looked at the start and that's the book I expected however that's not the book I got.The first time we come across Scout she comes across as intelligent tough and independent, just the person to give Gable a hard time but then she changes and becomes whiny, irritating, immature and annoying and don't get me started on the ending.While I would have preferred dual POV's ultimately it wouldn't have mattered.

I really wanted to love this book, it had so much potential plus it was British a rarity for me since most of the books I read these days are American.Since there's already plenty of reviews I'll skip my usual summary and just give my thoughts.I loved the idea behind this, that Jessica has lived a normal life but then death awakens her and she becomes so much more than she was and so much more than anyone else, a whole new world opens up with vampires, shifters, witches and of course a prophecy.Jessica is special, the only known pureblood in existence and no one knows the extent of her abilities.There's a whole host of interesting characters, Reuban of course the tall, dark and sexy werewolf shifter, well all the council characters were interesting.So what went wrong?In a word, Jessica.It's mentioned that she has a temper, she's still transitioning and she's been through so much but seriously......at first I thought she was bipolar, she just throws a massive tantrum every time she gets upset and it drove me nuts. Apart from her temper tantrums she has a lot going for her, she's intelligent, loyal and capable of so much but every time she'd start to win me over she'd then throw another temper tantrum and I was back to disliking her again.I considered continuing on with 'Darkest Dawn' after all it's on KU and I loved all the council characters but I just don't think I can read another book full of Jessica so I'm passing for now.

Ruby lives with her mother and step-dad Frank, she hasn't seen or heard from her brother Seth in over three years ever since he took off just after his eighteenth birthday, before he left Seth had been acting strange leaving their mother to assume it was drugs.Her best friend is Carly and she knows Ruby's secret, she's the only person that does, Ruby can read people's minds and possibly see things like images or memories.Ruby's life begins to unravel starting with Seth, she discovers he's coming to collect some stuff, he's not on drugs and he's written her letter after letter which their mother has confiscated leaving Ruby feeling forgotten and abandoned.This book has some interesting characters and it's funny and it has a great cover plus an interesting blurb but unfortunately that's not enough to safe it.I had lots of issues with this including the repeated use of the word 'encase'"So, basically don't speak to Micah or Seth encase I put my foot in it,"It had a lot of potential but it was painfully slow at times and ultimately failed to deliver.There were so many things which annoyed me and so many times I nearly gave up reading and with hindsight I should have.My main issue was Ruby, I hate stupid females, she took forever to put things together which I excused but then once we'd settled into the book she made stupid decision after stupid decision. You know when you're reading or watching tv and there's always the terrible, guaranteed to get you into trouble decision and you're thinking 'don't do that, whatever you do don't do that' well Ruby makes the bad choice every single time, I'm not exaggerating, every single time, her friend Aimee is arguably worse believe it or not.I knew this book was a first in series and suspected it would be a cliffhanger, which it is but there's no point reading this is you're not planning on continuing, it raises loads of questions but provides no answers.

Having enjoyed 'Savage Ecstasy' I was looking forward to 'Defiant' but I was surprised that the first 70 or so pages were just the end of the previous book in more detail!I enjoyed parts of this book but Alisha's rambling thoughts, constant weeping, doubts and again the endless collection of "I hate you's" started to really get on my nerves.Plus I still can't believe the 'misunderstandings' were dragged out yet again, and again it's long, over long and yet despite all this I can see me reading 'Forbidden'Why?I've no idea but something about these two draws me in and I want to finish their story but the authors not helping at all.

From their very first appearance in The Last Riders books I've loved these Porter boys so I was excited about Tate's book.I love the craziness which surrounds these guys, the way they interact and the humour.Tate and Sutton fell in love one summer back when they were young, she stood by him when his parents died she helped and supported him and his siblings, he was her future.Then they were ripped apart, their futures no longer together and no longer happy and while they've both struggled Sutton truly suffered.I really enjoyed this book I wish it had been longer but after reading this I can't wait for Greer's book.In the interests of a totally honest review I have to admit I didn't like the cover and I was disappointed that Tate didn't realise what was happening at the time, ok I'll give him that but he didn't even realise later and then even after basically being told by someone he still has no idea.Now I'm waiting for Greer's, hopefully he's the next Porter brother although I'm hoping the next book released is Penni and Jackals it seems like I've been waiting forever for theirs.

I've been with this series from the beginning I absolutely loved 'November' and most of others were really good, ok 'Lilly' and 'July' not so much.So I was really looking forward to this book, I mean it's Jax after all and yes I enjoyed it but, I know there's always a but...It was missing something, the characters are great, Hope was so cute I loved her but it's all getting a bit too similar. I know there's restrictions like the instalove, while I'm not normally a fan of this it's part of the story every Mayson has their 'one' and when they find them 'boom' the whole series is based around that so I can't complain. There's always the ex-girlfriends, a delusional one, a bitchy one or in this case one with a touch of both.We met Ellie in 'July' and we knew from the reaction of Jax she was his 'boom'This can easily be read as a standalone so don't worry if you haven't read 'July' just stick with it you'll be confused initially but things will be explained.I've said since 'November' that Auroras strength is in her characters and I haven't changed my mind while I appreciate the crime parts are good ways to introduce new people, like Ellie for example they never really work for me.This is a nice sweet read, nothing new, very similar to the rest but great characters plus a cute kid and puppies.One thing this book gave us was so much potential for future books, we're positively spoilt for choice and I while Sage's sounds good it's Ashlyn's book I can't wait for but June is next and I think hers might mix it up a bit.

Cami was born and raised in the Savage Disciples MC, it's in her blood and her heart but she lost her mother when she was only six years old and while at college she meets Nate and suddenly a new life is opened up for her. They become engaged but somewhere along the way friendly easy going Nate turns into the uptight and controlling Nathaniel and Cami becomes a shadow of the girl she one was.
