These guys, the fixers, are a unique and often shady lot, but they serve a valuable and necessary function in the process.It was my expectation that this book would reveal hidden industry practices relating to oil drilling, transportation, refining, and the like, but Silverstein focuses much more on the business side.  (If I took a hint from the cover art, perhaps this wouldn't have been a surprise.)  There are lawyers and lobbyists, traders and politicians.  Sometimes the author strays fairly far from his main topic, as when he profiles Glencore, the world's largest commodities brokerage firm.  They trade in all kinds of commodities, not just petroleum, but particularly zinc, copper, coal, and grain.  Some chapters help us learn things that we already know, such as that dictators who run small Third World countries are usually in it for their own gain and not the betterment of their citizens.The Secret World also has a "thrown together" kind of feel, as the author seems to just say, "OK, I'm done with that topic -- now onto another."  Apart from their connection by the topic of the oil industry (and sometimes even that is missing), there's no clear overarching narrative.

This is the first of Peter Mayles Caper books Ive read, and what a pleasant journey it was. Basking in the Mediterranean sun, eating good food, drinking fine wine, and oh yes, helping a friend thwart the avaricious grasp of a Russian gangster/businessman. What fun!I do agree with other reviewers, though. Its a little too short, too light, too neatly tied up.That said, I would like to read the other books in this series, while doing my own basking on a beach somewhere this summer.
Four new songs from Mr. Crenshaw.  They pretty much all fit into his classic sound. One tune, "Right Here Right Now," is fairly decent.  The final track, "Going Going Gone," is worthless.

Why buy a "designer" pet food? A couple of good reasons would be concern about the quality of the food (remember the pet food recalls due to contamination in China?) and the nutritional value of the food (cats and dogs are of the scientific order Carnivora, which means  "flesh eaters", not "grain eaters"). The makers of Nutrience Grain Free Cat Food emphasize that their food is made in small batches in human-grade manufacturing facilities from local (Canada, US) ingredients.  The ingredients more closely replicate a carnivore diet of protein combined with fruits, vegetables, herbs, probiotics and other nutrients.I asked a close friend to test this on her beautiful 17-year-old cat, Amber. She's in good health for her age, with some joint pain due to arthritis.  Amber has eaten a well-known dry cat food her whole life, but we thought the ingredients in Nutrience might be more beneficial in helping her remain healthy and active in her golden years.Of course, the big question was: would Amber eat it? My friend's few attempts to switch to other cat food brands through the years had been failures due to Amber's evident and total dislike of the new food. The suggestions on the Nutrience package were followed and it was slowly added in greater proportions to her bowl of dry food. The changeover was a complete success, taking less than a week. The morsels of food are small and crumble fairly easily, requiring less effort for her to chew them. This may be one reason she now almost empties the bowl of food, something that didn't happen with the previous brand.We are hoping the glucosamine and chondroitin in the Nutrience Grain Free Cat Food will alleviate some of Amber's arthritic pain, but it's too early to tell. All we can say is she seems pretty perky for an old kitty!My thanks to Cris & Amber for participating in this trial run!UPDATE:  Although Amber loves this food, we have learned that the high-protein aspect is not so good for older cats like her.  We had to switch her back to the previous food.

(2 & 1/2 stars)Neil Finn has been making amazing music since Split Enz, and has also been an excellent live performer.  I loved seeing Crowded House in concert back in the last century.  However, Dizzy Heights is an experimental album relatively free of worthwhile melodies.  It reminded me of Paul McCartney's Fireman CDs, which were just Macca having fun in the studio, without any real regard for for songcraft (the art of making distinct melodies into memorable individual songs).  Mr. Finn's work this time out has an occasional nice tune (the last two in particular), but it also gives us a horrendous mess of a song called "Divebomber."  There, Neil warbles in a painful falsetto as a cacophonous backing track seems to trying to musically reenact all of WWII in under five minutes.  It's certainly the worst piece of music I've heard from the artist in any of his various bands and projects.

Michael J. Sullivan's science fiction novel called Hollow World begins with the main character, Ellis Rogers, traveling to the future in a time machine of his own creation.  He finds himself in a near-Utopian world where major advances in technology have completely changed the way humans exist and live.  Trying to avoid spoilers, I will say that I became engrossed in Mr. Sullivan's future Hollow World, and I was especially intrigued by the dilemmas that occur when a contemporary man pops up in the middle of a seemingly "perfect" society.  The plot also followed a surprising path -- at first I thought the author was clumsy in guiding the reader through the plot, but eventually I just "went with the flow" and stayed tuned-in all the way through.  Hollow World could be categorized as an unusual take on the Time Travel subgenre of SF, but it's really much more of a "future society" novel.  Time travel is just the way Ellis gets to the New World.

This is a review of "Emerald Rush: Lush Gardenia & White Tea Essence" body wash by Caress.  The first thing that struck me about the product was its very pleasant scent, which has the floral notes indicated in the name.  Beyond that important element, this body wash is similar to just about any other body wash you might be familiar with, although it does perhaps apply and spread a bit more smoothly than some of its competitors.  Anyway, I like it!

In her new novel, Casebook, acclaimed author Mona Simpson provides an unusual perspective of a dissolving marriage and disrupted family.  As things between his mom and dad begin pulling apart, Miles begins a series of amateur espionage activities designed to help him understand what is really happening.  He is often assisted in these endeavors by his best friend Hector.  In constructing this scenario, Ms Simpson is taking something very universal -- a child's desire to understand something that makes no sense and is disturbing to his or her life -- and approaching it in a pretty unique way.  As Miles and Hector begin uncovering more information, naturally the picture becomes more muddy rather than clear.  They also learn some life lessons about the Principle of Unintended Consequences from their actions.  Through it all, the writer's skills and straightforward storytelling style kept me interested in the characters and plot.

The one thing I did like about this Nivea shave cream was that it left my skin feeling refreshed when I was finished shaving.However, here are three BIG problems with the product:1. The shave I got from the Nivea cream was less close than with the generic shaving cream I had been using before this.  I had to go over my face again with my electric razor.2. It takes a large quantity of Nivea shave cream for a single shave.  It comes in a toothpaste-like tube, and I had to squeeze out more than a dozen inch-long squirts of cream before I was done -- just for one shave of my face.3. The Nivea cream uses some kind of sticky substance to help the cream bind to your skin as you massage it in, presumably designed to yield a closer shave.  Not only did it fail on that count, but the sticky stuff also made it bind to the razor blades as well, to the point where it was much harder to wash off than regular shaving cream.  PLUS, it stuck to my wash cloth and towel!  This problem #3 was the worst one of all, and was what made me throw the Nivea shave cream away after one use.PS - When I first removed the cap, I noticed there was no safety seal of any kind over the tube opening.  I don't know the rules for this (FDA?), but I think there should be a seal.

In his riveting new account of a headline-grabbing, early-20th-century murder story, Harold Schechter informs modern audiences about the "Mad Sculptor" case.  At the time it happened, the case held the entire nation's attention for a few weeks.  (It was that year's "Crime of the Century.")  The way Schechter wrote it, The Mad Sculptor is not a suspenseful "whodunnit" (although there is some suspense during the "manhunt" portion of the book).  Instead, it's a tale of mental illness leading to murderous obsession, also providing a view of the tabloid media of the era, what police crime-solving methods were like in those days, and how little mental health was understood back then.  One of the main attractions of the book is getting to know the unique characters who populate its pages: the drunken father/husband of the victims, the beautiful model who was the killer's main target, the famous & colorful defense lawyer, etc.  The story is also well told and apparently was well researched by the author.

Oh I am in love with this water bottle. It is such a great water bottle. I first love the size of the water bottle. I hate having to continually refill my water bottles, I like having a decent amount in there which this provides. I also really like that they give you more than one option for the top. Some days I really love having just the stopper top on there and when I'm working out I really like the straw top.The cover on this is amazing. it really keeps my water cold. This is just a really really good water bottle.I received this product for a discount for my unbiased and honest review

Very nice replacement for the Dymo label maker xl. I was worried that it wouldn't work right in the printer as it states you should only us Dymo labels but they work like a charm. The printing was clean and quick. I didn't see any imperfections with the printing. It worked great in the machine, and the adhesive is nice and strong on the labels. Over all very nice product.I received this product for a discount for my unbiased and honest review.
Really nice Remote. It looks amazing and it works great. It took just a second to sync it to my television and it worked right away on my xbox. It's awesome.I paid full price for this product

I really like this face wash. It is so amazing. First I want to say the scent is really nice. I have a hard time with really strong fragrances. If they are strong enough they make it hard for me to breathe. This was very subtle and just nice over all. My skin after using the face wash felt very nice. Not only did it feel clean but it felt moisturized. My skin didn't feel dry and with the winter season near, my skin is already starting to dry out, so that was also a bonus.I really loved thisI recieved this product for free for my unbiased and honest review.
Oh this is a very nice mouse. It's very comfortable in my hand and it synced right to my computer. It has been smooth and just a really nice design.I paid full price for this product

Oh these made cleaning up the leaves in my yard so easy. I love the handles. My hands fit in them very nicely and they make it so easy to grip the paddles. It was so easy to scoop up the leaves into my wheel barrel. The teeth at the end made it even easier than if it was flat paddled. They are just large enough to be comfortable and I really had fun. It saved a lot of time from what I was doing before, which was trying to scoop them up in a rake. Love itI received this product at a discount for an honest and unbiased review.

This is a very nice alarm clock. The letters are very bright and I actually love that it's battery operated because it's much more portable for me. The readings are so very easy to read and the alarm is loud. It's a great little alarm clockI received this product free for my unbiased and honest review.

This was well packaged and professional looking when I received it. I was so very impressed with the overall look when I got these cables that I wanted to tell you all about it. But the product themselves equal and surpass that of the packaging. I hooked up my dvr box to this easily and the connection to my tv was flawless.The quality of the picture and sound provided by the cables was excellent. I love how the cables are wrapped in the braided covering. It's amazing and I am super happy with themI received this product for a discount for my unbiased and honest review

These are an interesting produc. I think they are great for some of the exercises they show you, expecially the arm exercises. I think they are probably all effective, but I'm a fuller figured girl so it was extremely hard to get them around my hips and feel comfortable enough to use them on my legs. I know they are like the resisitance bands but I think being a little larger would be more comfortable.Having said that I was able to use this for many of my arm work outs and a couple of the leg work outs and for those they are amazing. i really like that they offer a different level of bands from weak to xstrong. I love that it helps to challenge you and to be able to change it up.Great product!I received this product for free for my unbiased and honest review.

This is just what my husband needed. He always has nose hairs sticking out and it drives me CRAZY!! This nose hair trimmer fixed that easily. It worked great. It took him just a couple of seconds and the nose hairs were gone. He said it was painless and really easy to use.The attachments are very easy to switch out. You just pull up and they pop off and you can pop the other one right back on. The side burn trimmer is just as nice. I also used it to clean the back of his neck up (his hair on his neck grows so fast inbetween trims) so it was great for that too. It cuts nicely, and I really love the fact that it's rechargeable. It's perfect for us.I received this product for a discount for my unbiased and honest review

These worked great. They were just perfect for my Dymo XL machine that I have. They look just like the Dymo labels first of all and they feel the right thickness as well. The adhesive seems to be strong and has held on everything that I labeled so far.I was able to load it into my machine easily, and then it printed with no problems. I was a little worried because the instructions say to use only dymo labels in the machine, and sometimes that is very true (like my regular printer) but this handled these labels with no problem.They are a very nice quality label, they will be replacing my dymo labels for sure.I received this product for a discount for my unbiased and honest review.

AMAZING! AWESOME! This is a very high quality product and I love it, just absolutely love it. First of the casing of the speaker is a rubber type material, or rubber it's self (I'm not really sure). It just has that general feel so that's what I'm going with, what ever it is it really protects it from being dropped and banged around. I have 5 kids and 2 of them are little so we have a few drops to experience this protection.I really like the design overall. The buttons are really easy to use and work nicely. They are very easy to see and I like how they are embossed so you can feel them a little betterThe sound is really amazing. My husband keeps eyeballing it so I'm probably going to be buying one for him for Christmas, but the sound is great. You can feel all the bass this little speaker pumps out. My kids love touching the smooth speaker face and feeling it. The sound carries through out my house and it does get LOUD!Its a great little compact speaker. It's well made and works better than I expectedI received this product for a discount for my unbiased and honest review.

Oh I love the color of this corset. It's really quite stunning. Its very rich and lux in color. That was my first impression when I pulled it out of the packaging. Then I tried it on and my impressions were just as nice. The fabric is soft but stiff and has a slight stretch. So not only did it hid some unsightly bulges it was comfortable too.I really love this waist trainer and the only complaint was that it was slightly smaller than I anticipated. But with the different options on where you can snap it closed this was barely worth mentioning. Fantastic product. I love it.I received this product for free for my unbiased and honest review.

The boots are great. They make me feel really snazzy. They are made really well which is of course a huge plus. The zipper works really smoothly, and there are no hang ups. They slid on really easy and fit over my foot very nicely. The shaft of the boot is a nice size for my calf and it fits perfectly over my skinny jeans.I love the brown color and how they look with my outfits. They go with everything and are just great with my whole wardrobe. The buckle details were perfect for the boot and I can not tell you how much I absolutely love these boots.I received this product for free for my unbiased and honest review.

Very cool little tool. I used this when it was dry and wet. Dry was my favorite and I think it's solely because I can see all that dead skin coming off. I do recommend a mask if you do this with your foot dry though.I love how easy it is to work and how easy it is to hold in your hand. It feels very nice. It even comes with a second head so when you do finally grind down the stone in the machine (which I think would take a while) then you have a back up. Great tool for you pedicures!I received this product for a discount for my unbiased and honest review

Pretty impressive little pill. They were very easy to swallow and I love how they came in this individual serving packet. I took one before I started drinking and then a few hours later took the other too. I still had a lot of fun and in the morning I woke up and felt great. I love that about the pill. What I wasn't so happy with was how much I smelled like garlic the next day. I didn't eat anything with garlic in it so I know it was the pill. So other than the garlic smell it's great.I received this product for free for my unbiased and honest review.

Wow, this thing his heavy duty. I coudn't believe it when I pulled it out of the box. This is NOT cheaply made at all. It is very durable and strong. The parts are really high quality and just tough. I really felt very safe putting my ipad in this holder.It was very easy to move around. It bent and adjusted really easily. I love how it mounts to the table. The clamp has a pad on it so that you don't damage your table, but it holds the holder tight so that you can adjust it easily. It really quite impressive. I was very happy with it.I received this product for a discount for my unbiased and honest review.

This is SO much easier to use than the rake and shovel that I had been using. Also, let me be honest, not nearly as gross. Nothing like scrapping dog poop on a shovel to kill an afternoon.This is pretty light weight considering the size so it makes it easy to hold. The grip is a pretty good size. Almost too big for my hand but not quite (I have a very small hand). I really like the teeth at the bottom so it really grabs the poop so you can clean your yard up really nicely. I was really happy with how ell this scooper was made.I received this product for my unbiased and honest review.

Very nicely designed wallet. This wallet is pretty flat, and yet there is so much space. My husband was able to put a ton of cards in this wallet, his cash and his receipts and there was still so much rum and it laid flat. That what is really important. After transferring all of his things from the ball of a wallet he had before he still had more space in this new wallet and it laid flat. He also really loved the id holder that flipped up. He thought that was not only a great space saver but looked cool. Very  nice wallet.I received this product for free for my unbiased and honest review.

Very pretty lights. These are just so adorable to start with. I really love the flower design. they are also bright and you can really make out the detail of the little flowers when they are all lit up. I have them wrapped around the stair railing of my deck and it looks stunning. There was no unlit bulbs and no problems at all with having them turn on. Just a nice product all around.I received this product for free for my unbiased and honest review

Fantastic little grinder. I have never owned a hand crank grinder before but they are great. i like the amount of beans  that you can put in the grinder. Just enough to make a pot of coffee, which is great because then Im not trying to figure out how to make sure the grounds stay fresh.The design is sleek and very modern looking. I like that the crank comes off, and this whole thing breaks down to a small and slim design. I unfortunately have a very small kitchen and space is limited, so it's fantastic it breaks down to such a small size. I love itI recieved this product for a discount for my unbiased and honest review.

Very cool solar lights. They were so easy to install. I have them mounted on the bottom of my stairs, on the railings. They look adorable and I had no problem installing them. It took about 10 minutes for me to get them up and running.The lights are pretty bright and I love that they are solar powered. Never needing batteries is always a good thing. I was actually surprised by how bright they were, but it was a very pleasant surprise.The solar panels seem to collect enough energy to last a good amount of the night. I know when ever I happen to glance outside they are working, so I love that as well. It's a great little set of lights.I received this product free for my unbiased and honest review

Very nice face scrub. And I want to say why I gave it 4 instead of 5 stars off the start. The reason is the fragrance is a little strong, so even while I was using the scrub (which the scrub itself is amazing) the scent was a bit strong for me.That being said the scrub is amazing. I didn't need but just a little bit to scrub my entire face. I was able to apply it and just rub it all over my face and it felt amazing. I think I could feel all the dead skin and ickiness in my skin being scrubbed away.After rinsing (which it was super easy to rinse out), my face felt so smooth. I can't  explain in words how soft and amazing my skin felt. It was great. I love the feeling of the scrub. It was so very nice.I received this product for a discount for my unbiased and honest review

These cables work great. My kids had destroyed most of my hdmi cables. I don't even know how but they did. These cables seem to be a little more durable. I really like the braided cord, those always seem to last a little longer.It was just the perfect link between my tv, which I have mounted on the wall, and my dvr box on a stand. I think having just the right amount of space will also help so there is no slack to play with (my kids are small). The cable plugged into both my tv and cable box easily and the picture is great. Everything looks great.I received this product for a discount for my honest and unbiased review.

I was a little worried about the camo print and how that was actually going to look in real life, because though I like camo. I like a mild camo, if there is such a thing. I didn't need to worry at all because these glasses are ADORABLE. I really love them. They fit really nicely on my face, and look great on me.I really like the polarized lenses. If you have never owned a pair of the polarized glasses before you need to. It makes the biggest difference in the world. Everything is in such sharp focus. There is not glare and everything looks so clear. You will love it, and you must try it. The case that they came in is a very soft case and great for me to be able to throw these glasses in my purse and not have to worry about scratches. Great glasses, great design, great everything.I received this product for a discount for my unbiased and honest review.

Oh i have one happy hubby. My husband has a custom bobber that he loves almost more than our children. One thing this motorcycle has never had is blinkers. This was always something that worried me, because not everyone pays attention to people on bikes and that really is terrifying. One way to help be seen more is of course blinkers.Well we couldn't have just regular blinkers on this custom bobber. It looks mean so I wanted to keep it looking mean, and there are nothing meaner than skulls. They were very easy for my husband to install. They went right in and they hooked up perfectly to his bike. It didn't take him very long at all before he had working skull blinkers.They were bright and fun. Though I am not suppose to say that about them because they are manly. But great product we love it.I received this product for a discount for my unbiased and honest review.

These ice cube trays ROCK! Oh I love them, my kids love them, even my husband (who doesn't like anything) loves them. They are just really cool to start with. The ice cubes that they make are HUGE. You only need one ice cube per glass.What I really like (other than the fact it just looks interesting) is that it seems to melt slower, and make the drink cooler faster and longer. I think because of the size of the ice, that's why. I'm not sure but that's how it seems to work.The ice cube tray is silicone so it's very easy to get the ice out of the tray, and to clean the tray when it needs it. I was able to just stick it  in the dishwasher and it handled it just find. We love it.I received this product for a discount for my unbiased and honest review.

This is such a cool idea. I really appreciate the placement of the hooks themselves. When I first saw it, and thought, "cool", but was worried that once a coat was hung on it that you wouldn't be able to see anything. This is not true, the coat hook is just low enough, to not block the camera.The video from it was fairly decent, which is why I gave it 4 stars. I wish the camera had slightly better quality. Along with a slightly better battery. Motion detection is great, unless you have pets that like to be very active at night, so my battery only lasted about half way through the night and I have had to charge it every day.It was really easy to install and though it has the sticker adhesive holding it on, it's strong. my kids have put their winter clothes on the hook and it hasn't budged so that is amazing. It's really easy to take off as well. You just slide it off and it unhooks and you pull it off the wall. Great design there. Overall not bad, and a pretty neat little idea.I received this product for a discount for my honest and unbiased review.

This is a beautiful mask. One thing I was super happy about when I got it was that it isn't stiff. When I saw this, and fell in love, I thought it was one of the stiff lace masks that wrap around your head with a band. It is not, it's soft and flexible.It was super easy to put on. Just a few bobby pins along the edges and it was secure and it looks adorable. I can't wait for Halloween and to find an outfit to fit this mask. The details are beautiful and it just looks stunning on. It's a very fun halloween mask and it just makes you feel beautiful. At least I did.I received this product at a discount for my unbiased and honest review.

Oh these helped with bath time so much. I have an almost 2 year old who is starting to transition to the big boy tub and it's a little scary for him. So I have been looking for things that will help distract him that make bath time a little less terrifying.These are fun, squishy and a lot of fun for my little guy. They were very soft and after they were wet they would stick to the side of the tub. So we would say a letter then throw it against the side of the tub and count how long it would stick. That is our current game and it is working. He gets to learn his letters, we count and he isn't screaming the whole bath time. We love it, and can't wait to make up our next game.I received this product for a discount for my unbiased and honest review.

What a very cute outfit. My son looks adorable in it. I love how easy it is to button up. That can sometimes be a challenge as he is really wiggly so I appreciate that it's a quick snap to get this closed up and he can be on his way running once again.The material is very soft and fits well for the most part, except the legs are a little short, so they look like capris on him rather than pants. The arms fit great and everything else fits just perfect, but the legs were short, which is why I put somewhat small, because everything else fit so nicely.Everything was great, (other than the leg size) there was one thing I wish they would change. i wish the fabric was just a touch thicker because the back is solid white and it's a tad sheer. Other than that I really loved it. It's so cute.I received this product for a discount for my unbiased and honest opinion.

This little camera is AWESOME! Oh my kids and I have been having so much fun with this camera. I have only used the belt clip accessory or just carried it (though my son is in the process of building a bike rams, so we will be using the helmet mount soon).I love the size of the camera. As you can see from the pictures it's small which is great and  it's very light weight. I  have put it on my belt multiple times on our walk and I forget it's there I can barely notice it.the quality of the video is great, I was super surpised by the clarity. It keeps up with all the action. I started using it to record my kids around the house as well just because it's so easy to use. It was very easy to charge and to get the data off the camera. (You do need a micro sd card so you will want to buy one before you  use this). I happen to have an extra one. I have had a lot of fun with the camera and so have my kids. It will be fun to see all the adventures meshed together when we get done with our project.I received this product for free for my unbiased and honest review.

1:19 Mins First of all I really love that there are 2 of them, because my husband never remembers to bring in his cooler at night, so having two of these freeze packs makes my life so much easier. I love the color they are lime green and that really is just a great color.Other features that I really appreciate are how flat they are. They are probably about 1.5 inches thick. That is a great thickness to lay flat in my husbands cooler but still have a ton of space left over to put his lunch in, which is great because my husband eats a lot of food.They are pretty good sized, if you look at the video I have my hand over them for a comparison and they are a nice size. They keep my husbands lunch cold all day. There was a couple days that his cooler was still chilled in the morning. They work great and come with two so you can't get much better than that.  We love them.I received this product for a discount for my unbiased and honest review.

This is probably my favorite charger. Not only does it hold two charging devices but it's fast. I am so thrilled with it. I really love how the  charger is a little bit longer and bigger than most chargers. It feels a little more heavy duty, and looks very well made.I have been charging my galaxy s5 and my sons ipad on this every evening. I would say it's taking about 25% less time than it normally does to charge both of these gadgets. it really charges the ipad fast. I was really impressed. I love the look of it as well. It is sleek and even though it's a little long it sits in the plug tight and doesn't' droop. I highly recommend this charger. It's fantastic.I received this product for free for my unbiased and honest review.

These are great. The colors were absolutely fantastic for my kids. They thought they were amazing when they arrived and they all instantly started fighting over the different colors.My kids all have iPhone and I have a galaxy. Both of the different types of charging cords fit in the plugs easily. They took both phones and charged them quite a bit quicker than the normal plugs that came with our phones. The outer casing of the plug seems pretty solid. I am not worried that my kids will break them and possibly get hurt from it.They are great chargers, the colors are fun and they charge our phones fast. Great product.I received this product at a discount for my unbiased and honest review.

I'm giving this three stars because it's a bit out dated. I didn't notice anywhere that it was for xp only so I couldn't actually get it to work. So I can't say either way if it is good or not. I can tell you it did plug in well and the connection seemed tight. It also took cards very nicely. It seems to be made very well.I can't tell you if it works well or not though.I received this product for free for my unbiased and honest review.

This is a very beautiful journal. I write a lot in journals and always keep one. I usually just buy composite notebooks because the are pretty durable. This is far more durable and it looks nicer as well.The cover is hard cover but covered in a faux leather. It looks great and feels really nice in my hand. I really like the pages. They are really nice to write in and the ink doesn't bleed through too much so you can easily write on both sides. I used just a regular ink pen and couldn't see it very much through the other side.There are a lot of pages which is also nice so that I can write in it for a long time.  I carry this around with me everywhere and the size is perfect for my purse, and for writing. It's a really good in between size. I'm really in love with this journal.I received this product for a discount for my unbiased and honest review.

This bag rocks. I love this, because first of all it's pink. It's a really cute color. Then there is the sheer size of the bag. It's taller than my dining room kitchen chairs. and very wide. It holds a very large laundry basket and more, worth of clothes.This is great for when I go to the laundry mat. I can fit so many clothes in it and it is so comfortable to carry. There are back pack straps on it that make it very easy to hold on your shoulders rather than a garbage bag or something similar. There is also a huge pocket in the front so I can put all my laundry soap in. Fantastic bag!!! Great idea.I received this product for a discount for my unbiased and honest review.

My kids thought this was hilarious. It's basically a giant hamster water feeder for dogs (or cats, which I don't have). It was very easy to put together. There is a little dish to weigh it down that you fill with water and then screw to the base. This was a piece of cake. The rest just snaps together and it took me about 5 minutes to get it put together.I have 2 dogs a shepherd mix and a shit zhu mix. My shepherd will have nothing to do with this. Its also a little low for him so it's pretty understandable. My shitzhu has used it a few times. It is was a little tricky for him at first but he is figuring it out. This is not somthing they wanted to use right away.It's definitely something you have to train your dog to use which is why I gave it 4 stars, but I love the look of it and it's so much more fun than their water dishes they have now. It looks great and it doesn't make a mess. It even has a drip tray so there is no chance of a mess. I like it, now I just have to get my pups on the same page.I received this product at a discount for my unbiased and honest review

2:10 Mins This is a great basic and essential set of brushes. I love these simple sets and i use them a lot. The bristles on the brushes were really nice. The powder or foundation brush was very soft and it applies my powder really nice. The eye-shadow brushes and a nice firm set of bristles. They would be great for like the smokey eye looks, that what I usually use those types of eye-shadow brushes for.The eyeliner brush is fantastic. It's pretty stiff as far as the bristles go, but just flexible enough so I can get that nice smooth line. It's been working out really nicely for me. I love the case. It's so pretty and the faux leather makes it look even nicer.I received this product for a discount for my unbiased and honest review.

Didn't work for me... I wanted to like it but can't. The major problem I had with this is the power button is recessed too inward so with the case on, it's pushing the power button and shutting off the Note 8 making this case completely unusable.  When you push it in again to turn it back on the unit will shut off again.The backing is ok, but I was expecting some type of material that attracts less dust.

This portable label printer is everything you can ask for. It uses an included A/C adapter or it can use 8 AA batteries. The software is build into the unit so you don't need to install any software; when you connect the printer to your laptop, a new "drive" opens up, you click on the executable and the software is "there". You can type in the label box, or you can cut and paste (the box will auto expand). The beauty of this unit is that it can support various languages (I've tried the traditional and simplified Chinese and it worked).Note is that this printer uses the TZe label (the older TZ labels WILL NOT work).All this feature will set you back less than $50.00!!!

I've had roocase for my iPad and my mini and loved it. Unfortunately the new version with the micro bubble non-slip lining is something I hate as they leave an imprint on the iPad screen. I'd prefer the older style where's it's a soft cloth like texture even if that lining attracts stains.
These are kind of cute.. think of it as Mini-Tupperware for you 18650 batteries. They batteries fit well and the lid latches nicely, perfect for transporting.
The material and build on this is okay, but considering it's only $8.00 it's not bad. The inner lining has a slight rough texture and the zippers got caught up.

This case works beautifully and I did get about 1.5x charge before it croaked. This case added about 4.5 ounces to the phone. Charging this unit (and my iPhone) worked like a charmMy only gripe is the manufacturer should have incorporated some type of kick stand.

Spigen has a nice design and this looks very "high class" especially with the silver polished finish. The base has four small non-slip circles (I think more design to prevent scratching furniture) and the magnetic charging port fits perfectly. Around this, there's a smooth black cover around the charging port (and it doesn't attract dust either)My only complain is that I wished it had some type of cable management.

Website description described this as new, but when receive it was obvious not new as there's a "refurbished" label stuck on all five of these... they worked but considering I could've paid $10 more (and that would've included an A/C adapter) it's not a good value.

I love this bike! It arrived in under three days and there's no assembling needed. You folded out, latch it in place, adjust the seat (and the brake handles) and handlebars and you're all set to go.The back frame for putting stuff is a nice too and wasn't expected from a $150 bike. The six speed shifted well and the brakes (although a bit tight) works well. I do wish the brake handles was a little longer for easier reach but overall I'm beyond satisfied.

One would think with Jackie Chan big picture on the front would mean he's the star, but after the first 5 minutes, well lets just say he turns into a magician and pulls a disappearing act. The movie feels like it was made by some Chinese high schoolers and Jackie's appearance was more of a moral support. Dumb plot, dumb acting, and dumb filming..

This is a nice unit (and lot cheaper than buying directly from Dell) and worked perfectly. I had to make a slight change in the BIOS so the drive was detected correctly else it worked with Dell's Cyberlink Media Suite.Had no problem playing back BD/DVD disc and the color matched perfectly with the Precision laptop

For under $10 this is a pretty nice knife and easy for concealment. It has a good solid feel and you can easily open it with one hand.I did have to adjust the locking mechanism as the one I received didn't lock in place.My other problem is that the seat belt cutter was not sharp enough as it required too much effort to cut through a seatbelt

I bought this because I like the cable management raceway but alas it was very disappointing. First, the top cable is a 90 degree bent so if you try and run it through here, it bulges out. If you try and force it in there's too much tension. The side raceway, there is nothing that "locks" the cable in place.For those considering, I would seriously look at other product (I bought another one that cost $12.00 that works great without any type of cable raceway)

This set is a great value; in fact it would've cost be more if I just buy the batteries alone without the charger. My battery charger does not register these at 4000mAH, but closer to 3800mAH but then again at less than $5.00 a piece the difference is not meaningful
The genuine Cisco OEM cost close to $100. I paid less than $15.00 for these and they worked just as well. the holes and the screws fit perfectly.

The unit works as described. One thing I liked about this is that the electrical probe is not protruding so it looks like a regular flashlight. You do get an A/C and D/C Charger and a 18650 battery, but I normally remove the battery and use an external battery charger.The lumens on this is not as bright as the Fenix PD32, but the Katana does have a pointy end cap you can use for glass breaking.The picture doesn't really depict the actual product; in fact the actual unit looks lot better. It comes in a decent box with a display window and at $55, it makes a nice gift to friends and family

I used the Spigen Tough Armor case (iPhone 6) and decided to give this a try for the 6+. Sadly I prefer the Tough Armor case over the Neo Hybrid. This one doesn't feel very rigid. The frame was very thin and the plastic felt very thin.It did offer good back protection and it doesn't interfere with either the wet or glass type screen protector. The cutouts were in the right area.This case would not be my first on the list but for about $20.00 I would look at other products first before settling in on this one.

The cables are nice, works great and fits right. One thin I like about this cable is that it's not too rigid but thick enough that you can feel the quality and heavy shielding. Using them with my USB 3.0 compatible scanner, it worked fine and without problems. This two pack cost less than $8.00 so they're good spare cables to have lying around

This is a good replacement to their discontinued Ergonomic keyboard/mouse set. This new model feels and looks less bulky, and has a detached keypad. the curvature of the keyboard is great, and it has a nice high tech open middle design.One problem with this unit is that the mouse has a glossy coating and after a day of use, the mouse looks real ugly with palm smudges.

These cost less than $7 each but they are smaller than a "regular" optical mouse but slightly bigger than a notebook mouse.Functional wise, it works great; very accurate and the scroll wheel (has a slight rolling sound) works just as well.

Overall this is a good design for A/C bricks. But the problem I have is when you swivel the plugs for A/C bricks, it's hard to lay it flat on a desk. Instead, I went to get A/C dongles.One suggestion I would like to make is they should make this a bit longer and just space out the plugs more.

Excellent quality and cost less than $50. The bracket can accommodate most flat panel and the included bag of screws had different length and size. Installing this took about 15 minutes. You do have to loosen a few bolts else you may end up struggling.It folds pretty flat (less than 2 inches) and extends about 20 inches although I haven't left my TV that extended for fear that my kids may think it's a monkey bar.

Heck yeah! I have their iPad Air 1 case and loved it. Unfortunately the iPad Air 2 camera moved so slightly so I had to get a new case. Of course I opted for another roocase and again I am not disappointed. This roocase is actually thicker and has some additional padding/shock absorbers on the bottom.I bought the gold and black color, and the color is beautiful. Unlike their Air 1 case, this one has a non slip interior lining for better grip but again it can get pretty dirty real quick (after less than a week, I see some dirt stains).

I'm not sure why they didn't design this iPad Air 2 case like their iPad Air case; instead they opted for a tight slot to grasp the iPad Air 2 in place.The problem it's not a good design.. The slot takes some force to set in place (not to mention you have to manually align it in the slot); ironically when you grasp the iPad Air 2 and twist it 360, it get jarred loose from the slot and you have to spend unnecessary time and effort to slide it back in its place..There's no backing on this case, so don't expect any type of protection.  The keyboard is okay but compared to their iPad Air 1 case, this one has a cheap feel to it.

9V batteries are not cheap.. I had to replace my batteries in my smoke alarms and bought this 10 pack for under $17.00.I hooked them up to a battery tester and it registered full so on surface it appears these are good batteries but only time will tell.

Good price but I do have some concern they were shipped in generic plastic bag. Although the batteries are new, there's not date stamp so I'm not sure how "fresh" they are. So far, I've used two and only time will tell. If they hold up, great. If not, lesson learned

Good information but this book is not cheap; it will set you back about $20.00. If you need quick summaries of cases (there are a handful that don't apply to US law and some that are simply outdated) this is a good source.The book has about 400 pages but in the beginning of each section it will have black letter rule and summary of each cases. You can skip them and go directly to the case summaries itself that also has the analysis and vocabulary.

Good information but this book is not cheap; it will set you back about $20.00. If you need quick summaries of cases (there are a handful that don't apply to US law and some that are simply outdated) this is a good source.The book has about 400 pages but in the beginning of each section it will have black letter rule and summary of each cases. You can skip them and go directly to the case summaries itself that also has the analysis and vocabulary.

Two things I love about this.. the price (under $15.00) and the built in leveler.  The material is good and sturdy and you get all the necessary screws and sheet rock screws,etc. The bracket is a bit big so if you have a small 24-inch TV you may need to spend a few extra minutes aligning this to keep the bracket from showing.

Good information but this book is not cheap; it will set you back about $20.00. If you need quick summaries of cases (there are a handful that don't apply to US law and some that are simply outdated) this is a good source.The book has about 400 pages but in the beginning of each section it will have black letter rule and summary of each cases. You can skip them and go directly to the case summaries itself that also has the analysis and vocabulary.One thing that's embarrassing is there's quite a few grammatical errors...

My Seagate 4TB had less than 1TB left and I needed more storage. I opted for the WD as the Seagate was unavailable.The capacity is great, but in my Dell, there's a noticeable random lag.. Not sure why but this never happened with my Seagate 4TB 5900rpm drive.

This is my upgrade to my old Epson Artisan 810. Of course the ink cartridges have to be different so I can't re-use the 810 ink.The printer are basically the same in terms of print and scan quality. This unit does have some "upgraded" features, included an automatic tilt. The USB has been upgraded and has mobile printing support.The CD tray is hidden below the paper tray, but the actual paper tray is a bit too flimsy for my taste. At $249 I was hoping for a more durable paper tray. Also, the tray only holds about 100 sheets of paper which in my opinion is inadequate; it should be at least hold 250 sheets

If you're a Netflix-holic and have a Kindle Fire, you don't have a choice, but I've tried this on two different type of Fire (HD6 and HDX) and the app had a weird problem where it would stutter for about a second every 30 seconds or so.. quite annoying

Good information but this book is not cheap; it will set you back about $20.00. If you need quick summaries of cases (there are a handful that don't apply to US law and some that are simply outdated) this is a good source.The book has about 400 pages but in the beginning of each section it will have black letter rule and summary of each cases. You can skip them and go directly to the case summaries itself that also has the analysis and vocabulary.

This case fits and protects the Paperwhite just right. The case is a good balance between protection and usability. It has a nice cover design and doesn't have that foul smell you get from those generic cases. The magnetic open/close works every time, and when you fold the cover back it doesn't leave a crease on the spine.

The Anker cable here is good. Although a bit flimsy the connector is a small profile so it works with most rugged and aftermarket case where they have a small opening.Had no problem using them as sync cable either and at $10 a pop, it's a steal

Nothing special but this cable serves it's purpose and the connector molding is correct (some cheaper cable, the connector is off shape making it difficult to connect). Quality of cable looks decent and no ghosting.
I've had problems with the Samsung SSD drives but so far, I had none with Crucial. This SSD has been reliable and quick; the price on SSD has also came way down making them more affordable.

After 9 years, my Canon $900  DR2050c finally gave out. Although I did take a look at the replacement, I was more attracted to the Fujitsu ScanSnap. After using it for a few weeks, I can attest this is an excellent unit.The flip cover is a nice touch to keep the unit protected from dust (when the flip cover is closed the scanner goes into sleep mode and when you flip the cover open it wakes up). The quick launch icon is cool. You can just right click and select simplex/duplex scan. The ScanSnap Organizer is free and has a more fresh look than Nuance PaperPort 14 (that cost $100) and has the Microsoft Office 2010 ribbon look and feel. The software is a bit limited compared to PaperPort (i.e., the ScanSnap does not let you stack/combine PDF files) but overall it works well for light duty use. The package I have also included a full version of Adobe Acrobat XI standard too.The scanner uses a USB 3.0 connect and it is pretty quick in scanning and processing.Good buy!

With each reiteration, Samsung has made improvements from their previous model. The form factor has gotten slimmer and lighter and although it only has 8GB of RAM and 1.2GHz processor, it works well for generic everyday Kindle reading or checking email. Also, note that this unit is only $149 so don't expect it to perform like a $400 tablet.

Long slow build up of a story with bad guy being smart and lucky - getting closer and closer.  It was good but I kept thinking about Stephen Kings Rose Madder.  SK adds interesting and odd characters with fun-to-read dialogue.  K Rs characters are more like regular logical people.  SK throws in odd balls and I enjoy that more.

Luc and his family are very likeable, but that doesnt mean the book will be good.  There was no chemistry for me.  Normally a DNF is 1 star for me, but I dont want to hurt the authors stats too much for something that might be more about personal preference, so I upped it to 2.  This might work better for other readers.  I read the first 87 pages and the last 2 chapters.Ava is a TV reporter doing a story on Luc a NY cop.  She has permission to ride along with him on the job for three weeks.  He doesnt want her there, and he doesnt want to be the focus of a story, but his boss demanded it.  I was hoping there would be some witty banter but I wasnt feeling it.DATA:Narrative mode: 3rd person.  Story length: 354 pages.  Swearing language: strong including religious swear words.  Sexual content: dont know.  Setting: current day New York.  Copyright: 2015.  Genre: contemporary romance.

Brenda does many awful things to Agnes and others throughout the book.  Other bad guys are also doing bad things.  But nothing is provable so no cop does anything (or they dont look for evidence).  The purpose is to give Agnes setbacks and problems to solve.  Her responses and reactions are the best part of the story.  Agnes is free with her anger.  She hits and threatens with frying pans and meat forks.  But shes a really good person inside and does some very nice things for others, like a needy boy she takes in.Someone wants Agnes dead so her Uncle Joey sends hitman Shane to protect her.  Joey and other locals used to be or still are mob related.  A romance develops between Agnes and Shane.I was unhappy with lack of explanations.  At the end all of a sudden we hear that one bad guy is in jail, another bad guy left town but we dont know what happened to him, and money was found and split among so and so.  There were no explanations or evidence of things.  See example in Spoiler.  Also I did not understand things between the hitman and his boss.CAUTION SPOILERS:Brenda stabs someone.  Agnes appears and the victim grabs her clothes before he dies.  The cop arrives and believes Agnes killed him so he puts Agnes in jail.  At the end Brenda is put in jail but there was no logic or evidence for the cop to put Brenda in jail instead of Agnes.  Sure Brenda physically assaulted two people later, but that didnt prove she killed the earlier guy.I was also bothered about the money.  It was missing for many years.  All of a sudden it is split among people at the end.  The guy who had it or knew where it was never spent it over the past many years.  Why didnt he spend it?  Where was it and why did he share it with various people at the end?END SPOILER.DATA:Narrative mode: 3rd person.  Story length: 419 pages.  Swearing language: strong including religious swear words, but not often used.  Sexual language: moderate.  Number of sex scenes: three plus two references with no details.  Setting: current day South Carolina and Georgia.  Copyright: 2007.  Genre: contemporary romance.

Sophia is going to have some unexpected and unusual magic abilities.  But we wont know about them until the second book.  There are a couple of hints in this book, but this book is mostly setting things up.  At times I was waiting for the plot to take off.At the end, someone attempts to murder Sophia but she gets away.  Story to be continued.  It wasnt a bad cliffhanger because some things were resolved.  But a lot was started and not resolved.  Two powerful characters could be Sophias enemies, we arent sure.  The story is more about fantasy and magic than romance, but there is some romance and a happy ending regarding the romance.Think Regency England in a Fantasy world.  A lot of titles and court intrigue.  Women are property to be married off.  They wear corsets.  Transportation is via horseback and portals.  Fighting is done with swords, guns, and magic.This is not YA due to the sex scenes.I believe the plan is for two books in the series, not more.DATA:Narrative mode: 3rd person.  Story length: 313 pages.  Swearing language: mild.  Sexual language: moderate.  Number of sex scenes: 4.  Setting: unknown time in the past in the country called Anglion.  Copyright: 2015.  Genre: fantasy with a little romance.

This review is a little different than normal because I am comparing this book to another book as a way to describe why I liked it - why this book worked.I love a strong smart heroine, but many authors do not do it well.  An example is A Bollywood Affair.  Heroine Mili is smart and perfect.  Hero has writers block but when hes around Mili he can write again.  He normally hates women who cry, but with Mili he loves her tears.  He does all kinds of things for her.Somebody Wonderful is very different and does it well.  Timona was kidnapped but fought the guys and got away.  She was then attacked by a gang of youths but saved by a cop coming by.  For her it was love at first sight.  She wants to marry him.  But what made this good was that he did not want her.  She was striving toward the goal of getting him to love her.  In Bollywood, they both were drawn to each other from the beginning and there was no goal for Mili to strive for.Timona was so open and honest in her desire for Mick that at one point he said Have you no pride?  Have you no shame?  And she was not bothered by this comment.DATA:Narrative mode: 3rd person.  Story length: 302 pages.  Swearing language: moderate including religious swear words but not often used.  Sexual language: moderate: Number of sex scenes: about two plus several referred to.  Setting: 1882 New York and Montana.  Copyright: 2004.  Genre: historical romance.

I loved three other books by this author: Lightning, Intensity, and Watchers.  I was hoping this would be another gem, but no.Ive read 17 books by this author.  In six of them including this story, someone having no memory (or amnesia) is a major part of the plot.  Here Bibi does a ritual to erase her memory.  She did this before the story begins.  Now to solve the plot she must remember.  Halfway there, she learns something and immediately does the ritual.  Then she is frustrated because she cant remember and needs to know what she just erased to be able to continue solving the plot.A second thing I did not like is in Spoiler below.  Not enough development (or explanation) about characters and their motivations.  Things were illogical.I was disappointed with two endings: the main climax with Ashley Bell and what happened to the bad guy.  They felt incomplete.  I wanted more or a something different about Ashley Bell.The author frequently interrupted scenes which annoyed me.  For example characters are listening to a tape recording.  During the tape, twice the author stops the scene and switches to another character and place, then returns to the tape.  Another example: The author interrupts a conversation two or three times to jump to other scenes.  I would prefer scenes/chapters finish in logical places.  You dont need formulaic cliffhangers to get me to read the whole book.  Im going to read it anyway.  Interruptions just add negativity to the experience.CAUTION SPOILER:Most of the plot occurred in a something like a dream.  In this dream bad guys were after Bibi while she tried to solve a problem.  There was no logic for many things that happened - like strange noises and shadows that appeared and disappeared and characters doing unexplained things.  An important part of writing is character actions fitting motivations.  But here there were no motivations.  For example I didnt know why a cop and teacher threatened Bebe.  Apparently they were under the mind control influence of the bad guy.  And then there was no resolution about them because the dream ended.END SPOILER.I am grateful to NetGalley for providing me a copy to review.  I was hoping to like this.  The author is a wonderful writer.  But I felt he needed a better plot.DATA:Narrative mode: 3rd person.  Story length: 576 pages.  Swearing language: strong but not often used.  Sexual content: none.  Setting: current day California.  Copyright: 2015.  Genre: paranormal mystery suspense.

Nina and Simons are psychically gifted prisoners in a medical-testing-prison-facility.  Something happens giving them a chance to escape.  The story is mostly about their actions, but three characters from the previous book (Breaking Out: Part I) help them.  This was pretty good, but not as good as the first book.  Its a little longer than the first book, but still very short.  This book ends at 80% of the Kindle count, with excerpts from other books at the end.At the end of this story, one couple hurriedly says I love you to each other.  That came out of nowhere.  These stories do not have enough relationship development to get to that level.  Its better to let these short stories be about an escape attempt - not romance.These stories do not get into the backgrounds of where the characters came from, how they became psychically gifted, and how they became prisoners.  We do not learn about the bad guys.  Both books have happy endings.DATA:Narrative mode: 3rd person.  Story length: Kindle count length 964.  Swearing language: strong but not often used.  Sexual content: one scene referred to with no details.  Setting: current time possibly U.S.  Copyright: 2015.  Genre: paranormal action suspense.

I liked the characters.  I liked the action watching their escape from a medical-testing-prison-facility.  The story ended at 56% of the Kindle count.  The rest of the Kindle had excerpts from other books.Three prisoners who escape have different psychic abilities.  Kelli can move objects and people (telekinesis), Nate can heal himself and others.  Giles reads thoughts.This is a stand alone, but there is a sequel Breaking Out: Part II.  The sequel is better if read after Part I.  The Part I characters help prisoners in another facility escape.  These stories do not get into the backgrounds of where the characters came from, how they became gifted, and how they became prisoners.  We dont learn about the bad guys.  Both books have happy endings.DATA:Narrative mode: 3rd person.  Story length: Kindle count length 549.  Swearing language: strong but not often used.  Sexual content: none.  Setting: current time possibly U.S.  Copyright: 2011.  Genre: paranormal action suspense.

It got a little slow in the middle, but most was good and the end was cool.  I loved Roses intelligence and loyalty.  There is a little romantic relationship development, and a good romantic ending.Rose had been a prisoner in a Tecran star ship for three months.  Sazo is the artificial intelligence thinking system that runs the ship.  Sazo figures out a way to communicate with Rose and helps her escape.  He tells her how to free him from Tecran control which she does.  The two of them escape.  They are picked up by a Grih star ship.I loved the way Rose was as honest as she could be with Sazo and with Dav the Grih captain.  Sazo did not want Dav to know about him.  But Dav needed to know.  Rose was in the middle and tried to do what was best for both of them.This is a stand alone story, but the author plans to write two more sequels.  I cant wait.DATA:Narrative mode: 3rd person.  Story length: Kindle count length 4,986 ( 381 to 468 pages per different sources).  Swearing language: strong but not often used.  Sexual language: mild.  Number of sex scenes: 1.  Setting: unknown time could be current time on star ships and other planets.  Copyright: 2015.  Genre: sci fi with a little romance.

You can divide the grill with larger meats on one half directly on the grill - and smaller pieces on the other half on the Mat.  I like that you can cut the Mat to size with a pair of scissors.  I used the Mat in three ways below.Chicken breast with olive oil mustard marinade.  When directly on the grill it has a steak-like flavor with grill marks.  On the Mat, it tastes more like it came from the oven - more liked baked chicken than grilled chicken.  It was still good.  It took a minute longer to cook than when directly on the grill.Salmon with olive oil chili sauce marinade.  When I sprayed olive oil on the Mat the marinade burned.  The marinated fish was better on the unsprayed Mat.  It tasted fine, but I will probably not use it for salmon in the future.  Im used to a metal fish holder which I wash after every use.  I felt a need to wash the Mat after every use so I could store it.  But if you keep it on or near the grill its probably ok just to give it a wipe with a cloth.I paid $4.99 to cover shipping, but I received this product at no charge in return for writing a review.  I grill meat almost every day so this interested me.

There are four books in The Trysmoon Saga  series.  They are one long story.  Be prepared to read them all.  The four books in order are Ascension, Duty, Hunted, Sacrifice.5 stars for Ascension.  Exciting wonderful journey following Gen an orphan.  The evil local magistrate bullies and harms Gen and others.  Warlord Khairn comes to town killing many.  Khairn forces Gen to learn to fight.  There are magical creatures and healers in this world.  It reminds me of Lord of the Rings with a little Harry Potter.4 stars for books 2 and 3, Duty and Hunted.  Still very good as they continue Gens story.3  stars - maybe 4 stars for the last book Sacrifice.  There were sooo many battles and journeys.  The main characters fight, flee and survive one obstacle, then an emergency happens and they are fighting something else.  I was getting a little weary of battle after battle.  But the overall story and how it ended was worthwhile.  The evil god Mikkik was close to destroying all the good in the world.  The epilogue was fun and very feel good.PROLOGUE IN THE 1ST BOOK:I was confused about when this occurred.  I kept thinking it was a section from later in the story.  In case someone else is confused, heres what it is.  The prologue occurs at some time prior to the start of the first book - maybe decades.  Voss and York are two characters in the prologue.  They do not appear in the rest of the story and they are not referred to.AUDIOBOOK NARRATOR:Simon Vance is excellent.  And he does females well.DATA:Narrative mode: 3rd person.  Swearing language: none.  Sexual content: no details shown but a few occurrences are referred to after the fact.  Setting: medieval time on another planet.  Book copyright: 2014.  Genre: fantasy.

Jena is accident prone.  Early in the story local cop Matt says to Jena men have a tendency to get injured around you.  Another scene had Matt thinking hed seen her during the aftermath of many a disastrous date.  All those prior dates and injuries were skipped as if they were a back story I knew nothing about.  And I read the previous books.  It wasnt in them.  I wish the author would have given us examples or short scenes of that.  I felt I was missing part of the story.I loved the secondary romance between Grunt and Claire.  Really charming.The main romance is Jena and Matt.  It was good.  But I was more impressed with the story than the romance.  Im not complaining about the romance.  It just wasnt as much fun as the Grunt and Claire romance.I was impressed the author used NO stupidity.CAUTION SPOILER: (Re: no stupidity)The bad guy kidnaps the heroine twice, and she did nothing stupid to cause it.  I liked the smarts of how the good guys followed the bad guys in one of the scenes.END SPOILERI was surprised because so many other authors doing the same scenes would have used stupidity.  This author thought it through and did it better.THE SERIES:Book 6 will be published in 2016.  Each book is a stand alone romance about people living in the small town of Invertary in the northern Scotland Highlands.  Main characters in one book have small roles in other books. Dougan suffered great evil and hardship as a boy and during many years in prison.  He survived and became a ruthless powerful leader in the crime world.  He doesn't think he's good enough to love Farah.  He believes he is too evil.I was pleased there were no problems such as stupidity.DATA:Narrative mode: 3rd person.  Story length: 356 pages. 1.  Almost all conflicts are exaggerations in the mind - like a see saw - ups and downs with no basis in fact.  Characters say things they dont mean and are silent when silence means the wrong thing.Examples:They smile at each other.  She then thinks Oh I cant let him think I like him so she insults him.  Then he is angry and does angry things.  Now she regrets insulting him but wont apologize.  She silently sulks.She asks for sex so he begins.  Then when she sees the condom she gets angsty and changes her mind.  A minute later she changes her mind back again.She says the words make love which causes him to freak out and he no longer wants sex.  Then a minute later he changes his mind, again.After one of the sex scenes, he thinks she just plans to f... me and then forget me.  That came out of nowhere.  It was made up in his head.All these thoughts were jarring - back and forth exaggerations in the mind.------------------------------------CAUTION SPOILERS: (items 2 and 3 re: stupidity)2.  Aiden is gathering evidence to give to the DA to put Morelli the mob boss in jail.  But he needs more evidence.  Ryanns father left some evidence for her with a friend.  Aiden and Ryann meet the friend to get it.  The friend gives a flash drive to Ryann but Aiden doesnt see it.  Then Ryann keeps it a secret for 10 hours, not telling Aiden she has it?  And now hes mad that she didnt show him the evidence right away?  That was why they went to meet the guy.Ryann knows Aiden is working with the DA.  Aiden meets with the DA at a strip club so the bad guys wont know what they are doing.  Aiden does not tell Ryann where he is going.  When she hears he is at a strip club, she thinks the worst, packs her bag and starts to leave town - without even asking him.  It was stupid of him to keep this a secret.  And stupid of her.3.  More heroine stupidity:  Aiden tells her not to go to his fights because she is in danger of being grabbed by Morelli and that will distract him.  So she goes to a fight.  Bad guy grabs her and holds her for Aiden to see.  Then Aiden gets hurt because he is now forced to do what the bad guy wants.  That really made me angry.END SPOILERS.--------------------------------------4.  Early in the book Ryann (a private investigator) is hired to find Aiden.  I wanted to see how Ryann discovered clues to find out where he was.  I was disappointed that was skipped, nothing was shown.  Instead, after being hired the next scene has Ryann talking to Aiden.5.  This was a minor problem but it bugged me.  I dont like authors giving female and male names to the opposite sex.  Throughout the book I had to concentrate to remember that Ryann was a girl.  Aiden is a little more generic but I kept thinking Aiden was the girl.  It didnt fit the tough fighter.WHAT WAS GOOD?I liked the character definitions and personalities and the good sexy chemistry between Ryann and Aiden.  I liked the plot and set up.DATA:Narrative mode: 3rd person.  Kindle count length: 5,350 (402 pages per Amazon).  Swearing language: strong including religious swear words.  Sexual language: strong.  Number of sex scenes: 11.  Setting: current day New York City, Las Vegas, Wisconsin, and Minnesota.  Copyright: 2015.  Genre: erotic contemporary romance, mixed martial arts.

This is book 2 in the series.  I read Desperate (book 1) which is the back story before the three sisters became bounty hunters.  I was eager to read about their first attempt at bounty hunting in this book.  I wanted to see how they learned what to do, the mistakes they made, and how it worked out.  I was hoping to see feminine style hunting.  I was so disappointed to see that this book skipped a year and simply states that the sisters brought in twelve bounties during the past year.  It skipped the bounty hunting activities.  Wow.  That is not what I hoped for.So, what is this about?  Meg and Ruby catch Simon, but Zach the sheriff takes Simon away from them.  Then Meg follows Zach and takes Simon again.  Its mostly Meg and Zachs relationship, wanting each other and fighting each other  - with the bad guy Simon as a secondary story.  The relationship was fun to watch, but for some reason I skimmed a lot.  It didnt hold me the way a good book should.Zach was not logical in his actions regarding Simon.  That might be ok.  I dont require perfection.I did not like the big misunderstanding.  Zach should have told Meg something earlier.  When she found out she went nuclear.  It felt exaggerated to increase the conflict.DATA:Narrative mode: 3rd person.  Kindle count length: 3,239 (301 pages per Amazon).  Swearing language: moderate.  Sexual language: moderate.  Number of sex scenes: 2.  Setting: 1877 Texas.  Copyright: 2014.  Genre: western historical romance.

This novella (119 pages) introduces three sisters ages 15 to 19.  The mother died seven years earlier.  Their dad occasionally does bounty hunting to make ends meet and pay the yearly mortgage payment.  They live on family farm.  The dad dies.  The girls get jobs which dont turn out well.  By the end of the book they decide to become bounty hunters.  The bounty hunter activities will start in the sequel.I love the idea of these women as bounty hunters.  So I bought the sequel Deadly and was disappointed.  Deadly jumps to a year later and just tells that they caught twelve bounties during the prior year - with no details.I received this book at the RT convention.DATA:Narrative mode: 3rd person Story length: 119 pages.  Swearing language: strong but not often used.  Sexual language: moderate.  Number of sex scenes: one attempted rape.  Setting: 1876 east Texas.  Copyright: 2014.  Genre: western historical fiction.

The first third was very good.  But the middle and end were kind of ordinary.  Not much story.  Some parts were repetitive.Lovingdons wife and daughter died two years earlier from typhus.  He is hurt and grieving and never wants to love again.  Grace is nine years younger and has loved Lovingdon since she was a young girl.  She still loves him but knows she cant have him.  She has a large dowry and asks Lovingdon to help her choose a husband from the many who are after her.CAUTION SPOILER:Early in the story we learn that Grace has scars.  She fears a husband will find them repulsive.  Later we learn the scars were from removal of a breast due to breast cancer.  Not much was done with the breast cancer subject, but it was mentioned.  I mention it here in came some readers might want to know.I received this book at the RT convention.DATA:Narrative mode: 3rd person.  Story length: 372 pages. Metal is a former SEAL and medic - now working for a private security firm.  Hes a great cook.  She is used to eating takeout. This is typical LM Rice with her alpha hero totally turned on by his sweet lovely heroine.  The plot was typical, but I had fun.  I didnt want to stop reading.  I had a smile on my face most of the time.Two minor problems.  The cover picture does not match the guy.  He has tattoos around his wrists, cover guy does not.  The second problem was a scene where someone unlatched a seat belt, but on the next page after the car rolled, she was hanging upside down by the seat belt.  I also did not like that the heroine gave almost all her money away - to scholarships for art students.  Too many authors do things like this to make us admire the heroine.  Its not smart.  She needed cushion for future financial security for her family.  She can give to charities over time.I received this book at the RT convention.DATA:Narrative mode: 3rd person.  Swearing language: strong including religious swear words but not often used.  Sexual language: strong.  Number of sex scenes: 3.  Setting: current day mostly Portland, Oregon plus Florida.
