The story is told in 1st person from the viewpoint of Justice Drake.  He is angry and aloof.  I feel like he is condescending toward his women clients.  Im not sure what he is feeling.  Women come to his resort to learn how to please their rich husbands sexually.  I believe all or most of the husbands are getting sex outside of their marriages.When reading 1st person I identify with the narrator.  But there is a disconnect for me when the narrator is a man.  He talks about his feelings toward women and being turned on when looking at a woman.  So I have to spend energy keeping a certain mindset.The biggest problem was 1st person present tense.  I dont like any 1st person, but 1st person present is the worst.  Here are some examples from the book of 1st person present.I drain my beer before crossing the courtyard to my home...I swim the length of the pool...I see Allison bend down to sit at the edge of the pool...I turn to watch, amazed at the sight of the fragile gazelle at the watering hole.  (Pages 26 to 28)How much nicer this story would be if done in 3rd person past tense.  He drained his beer...He swam the length of the pool.  Some authors say their muse pulls them to write in 1st person or its easier to write in 1st person.  My response is do a draft in 1st person, then rewrite it in 3rd.  Its a skill to write in 3rd.  Many readers dont like 1st person.  In fairness, I have given 5 stars to some 1st person books, but those are rare.I received this book at the RT Convention.DATA:Narrative mode: 1st person present tense.  Story length: 274 pages.  Swearing language: strong.  Sexual language: strong.  Number of sex scenes: not counted.  Setting: current day Arizona.  Copyright: 2015.  Genre: erotic contemporary romance.

This could have been a good story.  I liked the plot, the magic, the events, and the characters.  The ending was happy and complete.  But I had three problems.The biggest problem was 1st person present tense.  I dont like any 1st person, but 1st person present is the worst.  Here are some examples from the book in 1st person present.I want to run, but my legs dont feel attached to my body.  I leave the kitchen and climb the stairs as fast as my wobbly legs will allow...  My stomach releases another angry yowl, reminding me that I havent eaten since sometime yesterday.  I take a big bite of the fruit.  Its sandy and mostly disgusting, but I force a smile.  (Pages 19 and 38)How much nicer this story could have been if done in 3rd person past tense.  She wanted to run, but her legs didnt feel attached to her body.  Some authors say their muse pulls them to write in 1st person or its easier to write in 1st person.  My response is do a draft in 1st person, then rewrite it in 3rd.  Its a skill to write in 3rd.  Many readers dont like 1st person.  In fairness, I have given 5 stars to some 1st person books, but those are rare.Second problem: The middle dragged at times.  I started skimming to get to action and dialogue.  Im not sure why it was slow.Third problem:  I wish the author described more details about why Phin ran into the swamp at the beginning of the story.  It was briefly mentioned later in the book but not enough details.  I wanted more background about the abuse from the father - what the father did and said to the mother, Phin, and Sterling.  What happened to cause him to leave.  I cant remember if he died or left.I was intrigued with the shine in the swamp.  I would have liked more details and history about it.  Learning more about the magic could have been neat.I received this book at the RT Convention.DATA:Narrative mode: first person present tense.  Story length: 325 pages.  Swearing language: mild including religious swear words, but rarely used.  Sexual content: none.  Setting: current day Louisiana.  Copyright: 2014.  Genre: paranormal fiction, young adult.

I read the first 110 pages and then jumped to the last 22 pages.  My problem was nothing got my emotions going.  Its like the main character Jessie is doing everyday things, going here, going there, meeting and chatting with people.  The author didnt get into the characters feelings in a way that got my feelings.  I wasnt drawn in, my mind wanted to wander.  This is a murder mystery.  Things are discovered to provide clues.  The bad guys are caught at the end.  There is a tell all on the last few pages providing answers and whys.I received this book at the RT Convention.  I thought it might be romance.  But its not.  There is a couple who meet and work together on a murder case.  But there is not enough relationship focus to call it a romance.  No showing or growing of feelings between them.  Maybe something happened in the pages I didnt read.The ghost of the murder victim appears several times.DATA:Narrative mode: 3rd person.  Story length: 310 pages.  Swearing language: mild.  Sexual content: none that I read.  Setting: current day New England coast.  Copyright: 2012.  Genre: paranormal mystery.

It reminded me of a Sandra Brown romantic suspense but with better romance.  And the ending was good.BUT I had a problem with three instances of stupidity.  I was willing to go with it, but I was shaking my head.  This might have been 5 stars without the stupidity - see Spoilers below.CAUTION SPOILERS - Stupidity:1.  Innocent man sees a murder weapon in the middle of a pool of blood on the floor.  He picks up the murder weapon and someone takes his picture while he is holding it.2.  Bad guy puts a forged note in heroines backpack.  It says to meet hero in a secluded place at 3 pm today, signed by the hero.  She is with hero after the note was put in her backpack.  He had no reason to leave a note.  After he drops her off at work, she sees the note and believes it was from him.  So she goes to the secluded place.  All this time she knows the killer is after her.3.  Bad guy is attacking female.  Good guy arrives and pulls bad guy off and knocks bad guy unconscious (he thinks).  Good guy should have tied the bad guy.  But he doesnt.  Instead he goes to female to comfort her.  Bad guy gets up and attacks good guy.I received this book at the RT convention.DATA:Narrative mode: 3rd person.  Story length: 437 pages.  Swearing language: strong including religious swear words but not often used.  Sexual language: strong.  Number of sex scenes: two plus two referred to.  Setting: current day mostly Virtue Falls, Washington.  Copyright: 2014.  Genre: romantic suspense.

I usually avoid reading 1st person books, but I was given this at the RT convention, so I thought Id give it a try.  The entire population is reincarnated over and over for a thousand years.  Everyone remembers their past lives.  Then Ana is born and she has no past life.  She is a new soul.  She is an undesirable.  The council forced her mother to raise her.  The mother was evil, starving Ana, beating her, and not educating her.  There are fantasy creatures like shadows who burn you when they touch you called sylphs.  Ana meets Sam who helps her.As happens with many 1st person books, most of the conflict and mystery is in the mind of Ana.  She doesnt know what Sam is thinking or what Sams friend is thinking.  Conversations are not clear.  Ana ponders and wonders instead of asking questions.  Sam does not answer clearly or explain.Parts were interesting, like when the sylphs attacked Ana.  But overall it needed better plot development and better character development.  Instead of developing other characters, we have Ana wondering about them.DATA:Narrative mode: 1st person.  Story length: 372 pages.  Swearing language and sexual content: none in what I read.  Setting: unknown time and place.  Copyright: 2012.  Genre: young adult fantasy.

Good ideas.  Reminded me of a world similar to Harry Potter.  Various magical creatures live on earth and some of them enjoy hurting humans.  The main character is Gage.  At age 6 he was taken from his human parents to live and learn magic at a warlock school.  His mentor Simon was evil.  Gage ran away from school at age 16 to live among humans.  The warlocks reluctantly allowed this and said he could not use his magic except in self defense - or they would kill him.  The story begins a few years later with Gage and his friends Bronx and Trixie running a tattoo shop.  Tera comes to Gage asking for a tattoo of angel wings on her back.  Her picture is on the cover of the book, but she is a minor character - only a couple of scenes.  Things happening to and by Gage are the main event.The story is told in 1st person past tense in the head of Gage.  I am female and I was very uncomfortable when I (as Gage) was admiring the breasts of Trixie.  Then during sex I (as Gage) was feeling sexuality as she kissed me.  It was unsettling.  Maybe other female readers can compartmentalize or something better than I can.  But this one gave me an ick feeling.  (Lesbian readers: you might like this.)This book is done in 1st person.  Can you imagine the Harry Potter books being done in 1st person Harry Potter?  HP was much richer being done in 3rd.  And I think Angels Ink would have been better in 3rd.  We could get inside some of the other characters for a change.A few times it dragged.  In the beginning it was ok, but a few times I was annoyed.  Characters kept beating up Gage and used magic against him, but he couldnt fight back because the warlock council didnt want him using his magic.  It was too much helplessness.  He frequently broke the rules and used magic - like helping others.  But when the mafia had him tied up, he did not use magic and I wished he would have.THE SERIES:The Asylum Interviews: Bronx (The Asylum Tales #0.5)  87 pagesThe Asylum Interviews: Trixie (The Asylum Tales #0.6) 100 pagesAngels Ink (The Asylum Tales #1)  338 pagesDead Mans Deal (The Asylum Tales #2) 371 pagesAnother reviewer suggested reading the two novella prequels to this story.  I did not read them, and I think this story is ok as a stand alone.  But if you really like this book, then Id suggest you go back and read them.  Angels Ink has a good ending and felt complete.  Although there are some open things that will continue in the next book.CAUTION SPOILER - re stupidity:There are some important things that Gage must keep secret.  But at the end of the book he is sitting outside with his two friends telling them everything.  Someone could have been listening nearby.I received this book at the RT convention.DATA:Narrative mode: 1st person past tense Gage.  Story length: 338 pages.  Swearing language: strong but not often used.  Sexual language: strong.  Number of sex scenes: one.  Setting: current day fictional town Low Town, in a state similar to Kentucky.  Copyright: 2012.  Genre: urban fantasy with romance.

This is steam punk London.  Its a retelling of Dr. Jekyll Mr. Hyde.  Dr. Eliza Jekyll works as coroner/medical examiner/investigator for the police in 1800s London.  Apparently she takes an elixir to turn into Miss Lizzie Hyde.  The book starts in 1st person in Hydes voice for one chapter talking about a murder scene.  The next few chapters are 3rd person from Jekylls point of view while she investigates a murder.  I was bored.  Its too much about descriptives instead of interesting character development or conversation.  I had no interest in the plot or characters.  I dont know what was wrong.  I just had to stop.Steampunk examples: Jekyll has a robot dog who acts like her assistant.  She dictates a memo to him and he will go to telegraph office to send it.  He is made of metal and cogs.  There is an electric omnibus.  Jekyll has mechanical tools and does something with lighting a chemical substance.  Those things could have been fun, but they werent done in a way that interested me.I received this book at the RT convention.DATA:Narrative mode: mostly 3rd person, with 1st person Hyde.  Story length: 440 pages.  Swearing language: strong including religious swear words.  Sexual content: dont know.  Setting: 1800s London.  Copyright: 2015.  Genre: steampunk mystery.

This is the second book in the Wicked Lovely series.  The main characters are not together at the end, so its not a romance.  The ending was complete, not a cliffhanger.  But I would have preferred characters being together.This story is about the dark court.  Dark court faeries terrorize and kill humans.  None of that is shown.  Its not that I want a lot of gory detail, but that part was vaguely referred to.  I was frustrated because I wanted to know what the faeries did to humans.  There is also addiction and reference to rape.I read some reviews for the sequels.  Book 3 has low reviews.  Books 4 and 5 sound better, but I've lost interest in the series after this one.DATA:Narrative mode: 3rd person.  Story length: 325 pages.  Swearing language: mild.  Sexual content: none, other than a reference to a past rape with no details shown.  Setting: unknown time probably current day in fictional town Huntsdale, Pennsylvania.  Copyright: 2008.  Genre: fantasy fiction, young adult.

I just called Spare One, and spoke with Robin Ko at their Customer Service Dept.He confirmed that this Spare One cell phone is a "G2" Network device, and that the"G2" Network will be disabled within about one year (by December fo 2016),rendering all of these Spare One Emergency Cell Phones USELESS and totallyUNABLE to place ANY call... which means UNABLE TO CALL 911.He said they were working to come out with a "3G" or "4 G" Network phone thatwould work into the foreseeable future.I asked him this:"How can you, in good conscience, continue to sell thousands of people theseEMERGENCY USE cell phones, providing 911 access for a claimed'15 years of reliability on one AA battery'when you KNOW these phones will be non-functioning junk by December of 2016?Don't you understand that people are trusting you with their LIVES, believingthey will be able to call 911 in a life-or-death situation, using your EmergencyCell Phone... and when that call cannot go through after Dec. of 2016...many of them may die?  How can you continue to sell this without disclaimingthat fact?"He said that he would pass the complaint along to the owners.Yeah.  Great.This is a class-action lawsuit waiting to happen.I love the idea behind this phone, and I am shocked that there are notmore companies producing a AA-Battery-Powered cell phone... foremergency use, or even for regular use.However... DO NOT buy this current "G2" model of Spare One cell phone.It will NOT work at all after December of 2016, when the nationwideold G2 Network is disabled, and only G3 and G4 cellular networks remain operational.Shame on this company for selling people an Emergency 911 phone that will not workas of 2017... and not disclaiming that fact anywhere. That's like selling someone a handgunfor personal protection, and knowing the gun will not work in several months, and not tellingthem that fact.  It's like selling someone parachute that is designed to not function,without warning, several months after they buy it... and they bet their life it will work.Amazon should take this item off its website... if not for moral reasons... at least for legalliability reasons.

The instructions say to spray this onto the cutting head of you electric razorAFTER you have shaved, and washed the razor head clean... just before youput the electric razor away.  I followed those instructions precisely for overa year, and it certainly did keep the razor head nicely lubricated and fresh-smelling.A few months ago... I decided to try something different:I still clean the cutting head with liquid soap and water, and rinse it cleanafter each use, but I stopped spraying this "Shaver Saver" onto the cutting headjust prior to putting it away.  Instead... I now spray the "Shaver Saver" ontothe clean and dry moving blades of the cutting head JUST BEFORE I SHAVE.The result is much better.  So much so that I don't understand why the manufacturer'sdirections don't suggest this as the ideal method of use for the product.When you spray the "Shaver Saver" onto the blades just BEFORE you shave,you can hear the motorized cutting head get slightly higher-pitched indicating thatthe blade assembly is moving slightly faster, and the lubricant also noticeably helpsthe electric razor to glide smoothly over my face.So my advice is... disregard the instructions... but use the product... its works very well.

I used this tube of Liquid Nails LN950 Polyurethane adhesive to bond aheavy rubber parking block (also known as a curb stop, a parking stop,or a wheel stop)... to the concrete floor of my parking spot in my condo'sparking garage, to prevent the front of our car from being able to touchthe concrete block wall at the front of our parking spot.After prepping the concrete floor by pouring water and Windex onto theconcrete, and scrubbing it with a scrub brush, and rinsing it clean, andallowing it 24 hours to dry... and prepping the rubber parking block byspraying a solvent onto the side that would be bonded to the concrete,and then rinsing it with water... we were ready to use the Liquid Nails.I put down a thick bead of LN950 on the bottom of the rubber parking block,and placed it on the cleaned area of the concrete garage floor.  About24 hours later I checked to see if I just pry it off the concrete, and I could not.This appears to be an excellent product for bonding heavy rubber to concrete.

This is the best Triclosan-Free, Naturally Antibiotic Liquid Hand Soap on the market.An interesting story about how we came to discover this product...I recently purchased an expensive liquid soap pump dispenser and I was disappointed tosee that after just a couple of months, the pump mechanism had deteriorated andwas rendered inoperable.  I called the manufacturer to complain, and the rep asked me,"Are you using a liquid soap with TRICLOSAN in it, such as Liquid Dial?"I said "Yes".  She said, "The Triclosan is eating-away at the plastic and metal in yoursoap pump, just as it eats away at your hands.  We get people calling about this all the time.Triclosan is also a cancer-causing agent. Don't use mass-market anti-bacterial soaps.We recommend E.O. Brand.  It will not destroy your pump... or your hands."With that advice, she sent me a free replacement pump.I immediately purchased a sample of this E.O. brand Peppermint and Tea Tree Oilliquid soap, and after several months of use... everything is working fine.  It appears thatshe was right about the Triclosan in Liquid Dial eating away at the pump mechanism.What's really great about this E.O. brand Peppermint and Tea Tree Oil soap, is thecombination of tea tree oil... which is said to be an all-natural antibiotic with nocarcinogens, together with natural peppermint oil, which masks the otherwiseastringent smell of soaps which use only tea tree oil... resulting in a soap that providesall the natural germ-killing effectiveness of tea tree oil, but with the far more pleasant smellof peppermint.  Perfect.  Who could ask for more?

When you see a necklace and earring set for under $15 total, you may betempted to assume that the quality must surely be very low.  That would bevery wrong in this particular case.  Of course, these are not sterling silver,and the little stones are not diamonds or even high-end CZ's... but for under$15, I am just astonished at how nicely-made, highly-detailed, andperfectly-finished this necklace and earring set is.  It looks more like aset that should cost closer to $50 in my estimation.The very high level of tiny detail is complimented by an enamel finish ofrich cobalt blue and cherry red and bright silver and smooth white... all ofwhich stays within-the-lines very neatly.  The hand-applied enamel colorsare clearly done by someone who spends considerable time on each set.Yes... I know that's probably someone in China... ironically.  :)My wife wears this on Independence Day and Patriot Day, etc... and werecently bought another set to give to her friend, to commemerate herfriend's passing of the U.S. Citizenship Test.  Truly, this set is worth every dollar.

I always maintain a good supply of these disposable covers to use asfoot protection (not shoe protection) when going through airport security.I am just amazed at how every time we go through the TSA metal detector area,after following the required procedure of removing our shoes;my wife and I are consistently the ONLY people in sight who are unwilling to thenplace our bare feet (or socks-only feet, depending upon the season) directlyonto that CARPET where ten thousand other bare-footed (or sock-footed)people have just walked with their sweaty, athlete's-foot, toenail-fungus-laddenfeet upon that same carpet.  It is disgusting.  If even one percent of those peoplehave athlete's foot or other fungal infection (and I promise you it is much morethan one percent), then that carpet is just teeming with infectious pathogens.Do you honestly think that they shampoo or steam clean that carpet more thanonce every several days... at the most?  Of course not.  And would it even matterif they steam cleaned it earlier that same day?  No, it would not.Everyone seems blissfully unaware of this obvious reality.You don't have to be a germ-a-phobe fanatic to understand how outrageouslydisgusting and dangerous it is to place you un-shoed feet on an absorbentpublic carpet that many thousands of people have just walked across withtheir own un-shoed, and often infectious, feet.  It's just common sense.The last time I went through with my light-blue disposable "booties" on my feet,the TSA guy put his hand on my shoulder (they are very touch-oriented, you know),and told me that was the SMARTEST thing he had seen any traveler do all day,and he commented that he too could not believe that so very few people protect their feet.We wear them for about two minutes, and dispose of them.  It is the best 20 centsyou will ever spend when traveling by air... I promise you.  We would never dreamof going through airport security without a pair to wear when leaving, and pair to wearwhen returning home.That being said, regarding this specific product's quality ... I must add that thewhite "treads" on the bottom are just a image.  It looks like it was printed on it.There is no actual tread there... no grippy material... it's just a visual design, which issomewhat deceptive.Regarding their durability over time... I have no idea, and I don't care, because I've neverworn a pair more than two or three minutes.  Regarding their ability to fit over shoes... again,because I only wear them over my feet with no shoes... my size 10 feet fit in them with a LOT ofroom to spare. Bare feet (or socks-only feet) of almost any size will fit with room to spare.(And for what it's worth... yes, they will also fit over my size 10 shoes.)I strongly urge everyone to buy some of these for foot hygiene and foot protection every timeit is necessary to go through airport security.

I bought this Huntington Brass faucet for my under-the-counter-mounted reverse osmosiswater filtration system.  It is a high-quality and solid design which is fairly heavy for its size.This is a dramatic upgrade from the standard cheap and lightweight faucets that tend tocome with even an expensive water filtration system.It works very well, and provides a very strong stream of water which is actually greaterin stream diameter than you might think from looking at the diameter of the faucet.No visible part of this faucet is plastic... it is 100% a lovely metal finish.  The faucethandle is well-designed also, enabling you to adjust the intensity of the water stream,and also to let go of the faucet handle in a middle-intensity-stream position, and thehandle will stay put where it is, in the middle, rather than bouncing back to full-on or full-off.Most importantly for me; while nearly all the thin drinking water faucets of this varietyare usually 12 to 15 inches tall... this one is just 10.5 inches tall from the base to themaximum height of the curved top portion.  That keeps it hidden behind the backsplash-bar top area behind my kitchen sink, rather than sticking way up in the air above it,which would have looked quite odd in my kitchen.I noticed that many of the similar-looking solid metal high-end drinking water faucetsoffered for sale are priced absurdly higher than this one... many commanding$175 to $350.  That is simply not necessary when a faucet as first-rate as this oneis available at a small fraction of that price level.

This book is insightful and fun to read.  It is also a book that is easy to pick up and read a bit, and put itdown and come back later to pick up where you left off, because it is broken into many very short chapters,each of which contain a key idea.  It's hard to describe this book, because it is so unique in its approachto telling the reader "how things ought to be" concerning everything from civil planning and city layout,to floor-plans, to architectural design, to furnishing.  The author is very opinionated and does not shy awayfrom boldly telling you what is wrong with the physical constructs of our urban, suburban, and rural areas,and how all of that should be properly done in his imagined ideal world.In some ways, this book is like reading the professional diary of your crazy uncle who is constantly rantingabout what's wrong with the world, and how he thinks it should be set right.  However, after reading it fora while, you get the impression that the author is not really crazy, so much as he is a brilliant eccentricwhose experience and understanding is based on an extremely broad appreciation of how human beings chooseto craft their surroundings, and how we get it right, and how we get it wrong, and why.Be forewarned... you are not going to agree with everything the author says.I don't agree, for example, with his outlandish claim that living in a home that is more than four storiesabout the ground will eventually make you crazy, because I have loved living on the top floor of myhigh-rise condo for the past ten years.  I also don't agree with his idea that all kitchen cabinets shouldbe open shelves with no doors, because the doors just get in the way, hide what is contained therein,and are essential useless.  I must admit, however, that I love reading the author's insights on thingswith which I disagree with him, and I have to admit that even on such issues... he's got good points!Many times I find myself saying "Almost, thou persuadest me."To be fair, I actually do agree with the author's views regarding the vast majority of his observations,as they are all just good common-sense approaches, and I must admit they often leave me thinking"Yes, that's such a beautifully simple truth... why don't we always build it that way, or do it that way?"This book gives you the benefit of the sage wisdom of an author who is genuinely worth readingand considering.  Even though this book is decades-old, most of its observations are timeless.It's so hard to classify the book.  Is it a Western approach to Feng Shui ... without all the questionableEastern Spiritualism, and more of practical philosophy on how to best craft your environment?Or is it better described as foundational reading for everyone from a City Planner, to an Architect,to anyone building a house, to anyone one looking to make their home a more pleasant place?However you choose to classify it... this book is a unique, delightful treatise on how things shouldideally be in order for human beings to be more comfortable, productive, and happy in their surroundings.

These sunglasses are absolutely not polarized at all.  The manufacturer's claim thatthey are polarized, is disproven by the polarization test card that they include withthese sunglasses.  When you use the provided test card, you immediately see that theyare, in fact, not polarized.  Why the manufacturer would make a point of including in thepackage with the sunglasses, the polarization test card that proves them to be liars,is an absurdity to me.  There is no excuse for kind of misrepresentation.Having said that, you may be wondering, why then did I give these sunglasses4 out of 5 stars?  It is because, other than the false claim of polarization, these areexcellent sunglasses.  The frames are metal, not plastic, and they feature a veryattractive and elegant "twisty" metal cable-like design in the middle.  They do nothave a cheap look or feel... they are high-quality, beautiful sunglasses.The lenses feature an interesting gradient design which starts at the top withwhat I would describe as a dark olive green (with just a hint of blue-gray)...transitioning smoothly to a much lighter amber-yellow at the bottom.This gradient color combination makes them well-suited for driving onovercast / partly-cloudy days, because the darker olive green at the topfilters out brighter daylight from above, while the much lighter amber-yellowat the bottom provides less tint so as to not excessively darken your viewof the road, or your view of the instrument panel on your dashboard.This gradient also provides a good approach to driving at twilight, andpossibly even at night in a well-lighted city environment, because thegradient gives you the ability to tilt your head downward to block theoccasional, and often high-beam, headlights from oncoming trafficby filtering it through the darker tint at the upper portion of the lenses...and tilt your head back up to then view the evening road with a lessdarkened view provided by the much lighter tint at the bottom.It should also be noted that these glasses come with a very nicehardshell case, and a soft fabric bag, and a cleaning cloth, and asmall screwdriver adjustment tool, and a visor clip for storage...and all of that comes in a well-made outer storage box.(And again... for some unknown reason, they inexplicably come witha polarization test card, which proves their polarization claims to be false).So while I am upset with them for false claims of polarization... I am soimpressed with everything else about these gradient sunglasses,from their uniquely elegant design, to their overall high quality,to all the extras they come with... that I still have to give them a"thumbs up".I would say that slightly darker sunglasses that these would be moreideal for driving or beach-walking on a bright sunny day...and somewhat lighter "yellow" lenses might be more ideal fordriving late at night in areas that are not well-lighted, such as outin the country...but these glasses with their versatile gradient dark-to-light lensesare most ideally suited for overcast / cloudy daytime driving,twilight driving, and urban area / city nighttime driving.Of course, following my observations might necessitate keepingthree pair of sunglasses in your car... each pair ideally suited foreach of those three types of conditions: one dark, one light, andone gradient dark-to-light such as these.  If these were truly polarized,I might be tempted to just keep these in the car as a "shoot for the middle"compromise for all driving conditions... but alas, they are not polarized.

When shopping for polarized sunglasses, you have basically three categories of product:1.) Super-Expensive Fashion Name Brands (such as Ray Ban, etc.) which cost $150 to $200 or more, and are truly polarized2.) Value-Priced Sunglasses (such as these Duco brand) which cost $25 to $50, and are truly polarized3.) Super-Cheap Sunglasses, usually all around $10, which are decent but almost never really polarized in spite of claims to be polarized.Your best value is the middle category, which usually gives you quality, without paying an exorbitant price premium toget some name brand, which requires you to contribute to their huge brand-advertising budgets and storefront shop rents.These Duco sunglasses even ship with a polarization test card which demonstrates beyond a doubt that these lenses arefully polarized.  The polarization pattern, which is not visible with the naked eye, pops out dark and clear with these lenses.Other cheaper lenses I have, which claim to be "polarized" are just very, very slightly polarized, as they make the test patternvery, very faintly visible at best. You get what you pay for.These Duco sunglasses also ship with a protective hardshell case, and a soft fabric case, and a screwdriver adjustment tool,and a carry-clip.  They look great, they fit comfortably, and they have a nice quality feel.  I really feel like I am getting about90% to 95% of the quality of a name-brand Ray-Ban-like product... for about one-sixth of the price.

The first thing I noticed about this Hopkins FloTool Super Funnel was the$144 price tag, which Amazon had generously (indeed, amazingly) reduceddown to just $4.  Wow.  That's 97% OFF, boys and girls.  Yeah!Yet another benefit of being an Amazon customer.As soon as it arrived, I eagerly opened the box, breathless in anticipation ofmy $144 "Super Funnel".  I wondered what special powers it might have thatset it apart from mere standard funnels and made it a "super funnel".I quickly discovered why this masterpiece of craftsmanship usually warrantsa $144 price tag.First of all, the black plastic from which it is made can only be described as"exquisite". Like fine obsidian, or a black sapphire, its depth of color andhigh gloss are simply mesmerizing.  Not like that cheap European plastic...this plastic super funnel hails from none other than... The Orient.That's right, the exotic Far East is the origin of this elegant work of art."Made In China" is proudly proclaimed upon its sleek body, and one canonly imagine the generations of craftsmen in the fine Oriental funnel shopsbeaming with pride at the thought of their handiwork being appreciatedaround the globe.Beyond a superficial appreciation of its stunning good-looks, when you pickit up, the superb balance is immediately noticed.  It rolls smoothly from handto hand without any trace of a wobble or imperfection.  You can rest assured,this is no "cone of uncertainty" as the meteorologists say... this is the embodimentof a standard of excellent to which few funnel craftsmen ever aspire, let alone attain.Now, I know what you're thinking:  "Yeah, yeah... but can it funnel liquids?"Oh sweet mercy... can it ever funnel liquids!  You name it... this thing can funnel it:water (yes...both hot and cold),milk (skim, 2%, whole, and even buttermilk),wines (red, white, blush, and also champagne),all manner of oils, from olive oil, to motor oil, to lamp oil, to aromatherapy oils,juices, carbonated beverages, as well as beers both pale and dark,vinegars ranging from plain white to apple cider to fine aged balsamic.And ... are you sitting down?... I kid you not, this thing even funnels... fine beach sand!Dude... that's not even a liquid!  Un-freaking-believable.It's like a funnel from some other dimension of reality... or maybe... from the future.And the cherry on the sundae... it's got a little tab at the topwith a hole in it, so you can hang it from a nail.(Obviously, you will want to display it on your wall when it is not in use).I would not hesitate to buy this funnel at the full M.S.R.P. of $144,but at this absurdly low price of $4... well, Amazon is just giving them away.I know what all my friends and family are getting for Christmas next year,and I suspect there will not be a dry eye to be seen when they opentheir gifts and see this masterpiece.Yep... this here is what they call "a game changer"... a "paradigm shift".It won't be long until Apple starts pumping out a competing product,no doubt called the "iFunnel", and priced at $299.It you're smart... you'll jump all over this Hopkins Super Funnelbefore Amazon realizes the crazy mistake they've made in pricingthis treasure at four bucks.

This is an extremely high quality soft-sided and padded long-gun case.I first purchased a hard-sided case that cost three times as much as this case, and I had to return itbecause it was just very disappointing build-quality.  I quickly realized that unless you are willing tospend over $200 on a high-end hard-side case (such as a Pelican case), anything below that price pointis going to be mediocre and very disappointing.  You cannot build a "cheap" high-quality hard-sided case.This soft-side case is so very well padded that it actually offers excellent protection.It is designed for rifles with a scope, but I use it for my 12-guage Chiappa "Triple-Threat"triple-barreled shotgun with extended sharp-crenelated breaking chokes, and laser site.I don't want to scratch that pretty polished walnut stock.  :)

I bought this "quiet" hair drier as a Christmas gift for my wife.She is very happy with it, and she say that it dries her hair just slightly slower thanher very loud previous hair drier, but the reduced noise is a very welcome improvement.This is not a "silent" nor a "near silent" hair drier.  Because drying hair is a function ofprimarily wind speed, and to a somewhat lesser extent, also heat; it is impossible tohave a hair drier that is nearly silent, and yet still dries hair in a reasonable amount of time.That' just physics... there is no way around that simple fact of reality.This hair drier is, in my estimation, about one-half the loudness of a standard 1,500 watthair drier... but make no mistake, cutting the decibels by 50% is still a huge reduction in noise.Particularly when you consider that the source of this noise is a device that held up closeto your head and your ears... every decibel of sound reduction is a precious and welcomereduction, providing a far more comfortable and pleasant hair-drying experience for my wife,(and a far less irritating experience for her husband who is trying to watch TV in the adjacent room.)We have also noticed that the pitch of the noise it does make is a lower and more pleasant noise,as opposed to the high-pitched shrill noise of a standard hair drier that is reminiscent of the leaf-blower that our landscape maintenance workers use (and they use ear plugs all day).As long as your expectations are reasonable, and you are not clinging to any fantasies abouta nearly-silent hair drier, you should be very pleased with this Centric Q Zone Quiet Hair Drier,and I am quite certain that you cannot find a quieter hair drier... at least... not one that can alsoactually dry your hair.

These are the best gun cleaning patches I have ever seen.Most gun cleaning patches are made of thin regular cotton rags... much like a little piece of a white T-shirt.They are frayed on the ends, very thin, and not as absorbent as they ideally should be for gun-cleaning purposes.In contrast to that... these are "100% cotton flannel" so that have more of a "Jersey Knit" kind of feel to them.They are more absorbent because they are very slightly "fuzzy", though they do not pill or fray... they keep their integrity.This provides a bit more bulk to fill the gun barrel, so it picks up more debris on each pass through, and it will alsoholds more cleaner or oil, if you are using it for that purpose.  You may find that you don't need quite as big a pieceof these flannel patches, as you might otherwise need when using the cheaper, thinner, "cotton T-shirt piece" varietyof gun cleaning patch material.The significant difference in quality between these flannel patches, and typical cotton patches is immediatelynoticed when you pick up the package and squeeze a few patches with your hands, or touch the surface ofthese patches.  Once you have used these flannel patches... I don't think you will ever want to go back to themore common thin cotton variety of gun cleaning patches.Unless you are a professional gunsmith that goes through dozens of patches every day; the modest price differencebetween these top-quality flannel patches, and the cheaper thin cotton patches, really just amounts to pocket change.I also noticed that these patches are made in the USA.  Very nice.

Somehow, I managed to get an annoying case of "tennis elbow",even though I do not play tennis on engage in any repetitiveswinging or flexing elbow movements.  I decided to try thesehigh-recommended Thera-Band Flexbars, and use them topractice the widely-endorsed "Tyler Twist" exercise that studieshave shown will cure "tennis elbow" within a few weeks in most cases.You should do a Google or YouTube Search for: "Tyler Twist" for videos that show thisvery quick and simple exercise, to make sure you understand how to do it properly.It is particularly important to remember that you must hold your armsextended fully straight (not bent at the elbows) in order to gain maximumtherapeutic benefit of the exercise.Doing it properly, you should... as weight lifters say, "feel the burn" at leasta little bit, in the muscles of your forearm and elbow.The Thera-Band Flex Bars come in four color-coded levels of resistance.Blue: 25 pounds resistanceGreen: 15 pounds resistanceRed: 10 pounds resistanceYellow: 6 pounds resistanceThe yellow (6 pounds) is only for people who are severely injured and are unable totwist against any slight resistance without experiencing significant pain.The red and green are of very similar medium resistance (10 & 15 pounds),and they are popular choices for those experiencing a typical level of pain.The blue is a heavy resistance (25 pounds) and it is a good choice for thoseexperiencing only light to moderate pain... or for those who have strengthenedtheir forearm and elbow muscles using the lesser-resistance bars,and are ready to advance to a "maintenance and prevention" level ofexercising to keep tennis elbow from returning.I found that after just a week of using the red... I was ready to advance to the blue,so I now own both the red and blue Thera-band Flexbars.It should also be noted that you can further vary the level of resistance greatlyon any particular color of Thera-Band Flexbar, by simply grasping and twistingthe bar a bit more... or twisting it a bit less... to change the level of resistance tensionwithin the rubber.  This technique alone can increase the resistance by as muchas a doubling of the resistance level.Each Thera-band Flexbar comes with an instruction booklet offering a widerange of additional suggested exercises, but honestly... most of those additionalexercises seem a bit silly and superfluous to me (rolling the bar behind yourneck to ease a sore neck... really?).  Using these bars for the "Tyler Twist" tocure tennis elbow is truly almost the exclusive use of this product... but it is the idealproduct for treating tennis elbow.

I was ready to advance to the blue,so I now own both the red and blue Thera-band Flexbars.It should also be noted that you can further vary the level of resistance greatlyon any particular color of Thera-Band Flexbar, by simply grasping and twistingthe bar a bit more... or twisting it a bit less... to change the level of resistance tensionwithin the rubber. Using these bars for the "Tyler Twist" tocure tennis elbow is truly almost the exclusive use of this product... but it is the idealproduct for treating tennis elbow.

I am impressed with The Winchester Deluxe 68-Piece Gun Care Case.This kit contains a generous assortment of bronze brushes for14 different calibers (or narrow caliber ranges),and matching mops for those 14 different calibers, which include:the typical riffle and small handgun calibers:  .17, .204, .22, .243, .270/280, .30and the typical medium to large handgun calibers: .357 / .38 / 9mm, .40, .44 / .45,and the somewhat more unusual larger calibers: .50, .540as well as the popular shotgun calibers: .410, 12 gauge, and 20 gauge.Each of these 14 bronze brushes and matching 14 mops has their respectivecaliber stamped directly into the metal shaft tip for permanent identification(rather than being on a cheap sticker on the implement's plastic tube),and I think that is a sign of quality and care on the part of the manufacturer.You also get a 13-piece solid brass jag set, for precise matching ofany caliber ranging from .17 up to .50The included brass rods will accommodate both handguns and long guns(rifle or shotgun), and they seem sturdy enough for reasonable regular use.I certainly prefer these brass rods to the competitor's pull-through-string devices.There are also many other things included, such as a variety of utility brushesmade of bronze, and nylon, and stainless steel ... pick the right one for yourapplication, or your personal preference of gun-cleaning technique.150 cotton cleaning patches (50 each of 3 different sizes) are included,along with 4 different sizes of slot tips for those various patches.The only essential that is not included is the liquid gun maintenance agentsof your choice, which are typically: a Bore Cleaning Solvent and a Lubricating Oil.You can purchase a little 2 to 3 ounce bottle of each of these (such as Hoppe's, etc.),and there is room inside this Winchester Kit to put them in the accessory case provided.I don't fault Winchester for not including this, because the choice of brand ofliquid gun maintenance agents can be another arena of opinionated personalpreference, and each one only costs about $3 in the 2 to 3 ounce size,and again... there is ample extra room for two such small bottles in the case...so just add those two bottles, (and perhaps also add a nice cloth to wipeyour guns down with, and a small microfiber towel to put down on your work surface,and tuck those two things into your case as well... there is room for them) and you're done...you have everything you need.  Well, maybe put a bore flashlight in there, too.One humorous side note: the packaging boosts of a "machined aluminum handle",which is clearly a typographical error, as the carrying case is made of nylon,and there is no metal involved in the manufacturing of the case at all.I spent a couple hours researching all available options, and I wasmore impressed with this kit than any other kit on the market at anyprice up to twice as much as this one.There are many gun cleaning kits on the market, and every last one of them hasseveral people that have provided highly critical and negative product reviews,along with people who have provided glowingly positive reviews.  Rarely have Iseen any product with buyer's opinions so polarized to extremes of positive andnegative views of the same product... as I see with reviews of gun cleaning kits.One person says it is high-quality and perfectly designed, while another persondescribes it as cheap and flimsy and disappointing.  I'm not sure what it is exactlythat people are expecting from a gun cleaning kit that causes such disparity ofopinion in regard to what is essentially a simple and straightforward product.Hypothetically, yes, we could seek an over-the-top, ultra-high-gradegun cleaning kit for the professional gunsmith to use daily for many years.We can imagine such a fantasy kit, with titanium rods, and mops made of onlythe finest imported lamb's wool, and brushes with handles featuringinlaid exotic woods... mother-of-pearl, or perhaps even carbon fiber.Indeed, I think that it would take that level of awesome magnificence to get afive star review out of some of the most demanding reviewers out therewho seem perpetually displeased with every gun care kit on the market.Such a fantasy kit would, however, command an equally impressive price...and I'm not aware of such a kit existing at any price, outside of thecustom-made bespoke craftsman's workshop.For less than $60, this Winchester 68-piece gun care kit certainly offersa great deal of value for the price, and a very impressive range ofcaliber accommodation, all arranged in a neat, well-organized,well-crafted case.

For years I have enjoyed, recommended, and even purchased as gifts for others,the doubled-walled drinking glasses and mugs of Ozeri's much older and morefamous primary competitor, the Swiss company, Bodum.My online research has revealed that both Ozeri and Bodum have their double-walleddrinking glasses manufactured in China ... regardless of where the companies have theirrespective executive headquarters located.  So both company's glasses are Chinese products.I have found the Ozeri double-walled drinking glasses to be of similar quality,similar weight, and similar fragility to their longstanding rival, Bodum.I must say that, I do prefer to Ozeri glasses for two reasons:1.) They are significantly less expensive than Bodum.2.) Ozeri's unique around-the-center indentation makes it much easier to grip and hold  the Ozeri glasses, providing a nice place to anchor one of your finger, so the glass  cannot slip out of your hand too easily.These Ozeri Serafino glasses are now my favorite go-to drinking glasses for daily use.

Miracle Gro is owned by Scots, and since 1868 they have been selling gardening materials,with their current sales at nearly $3 Billion per year.  Their flagship product is "Miracle-Gro"fertilizer... a bright blue granular compound that is mixed with water (making the water blue),and applied to plants, trees, shrubs, and lawns.  "Miracle-Gro" has become a household wordover the past few decades, and it continues to reign as the almost unchallenged King of Fertilizers.I have personally mixed up hundreds of 5-gallon buckets of this magical blue potion and poured itover many kinds of plants and trees, as well as lawns... with spectacular results.  It has been myexperience that a quality fertilizer in liquid form (as this becomes when you add water) is anorder of magnitude more effective than sprinkling "slow-release" granular solid fertilizers onthe surface and waiting for the rain to slowly wash them into the soil.I usually mix Miracle-Grow at about twice the recommended level of dilution, and still itnever burns or harms anything, and the result is quick and impressive levels of growth.Miracle-Gro is not generally used in large-scale commercial applications, because itwould be extremely cost-prohibitive and impractically time-consuming to use overseveral acres of property.  For the private home owner however, with a yard ofless than an acre or two; I do not believe there is any other product that is readilyavailable to the consumer and in large-scale production that will yield results superiorto Miracle-Gro.  Even for the condo-dweller looking to boost the health and vitalityof a few potted plants... Miracle-Gro is the way to go.

This 15-foot hose is just the right length to be used for cleaning off our balcony.Usually, the smallest hose available at most stores is 25 feet.This 15-foot hose is less bulky due to its shorter length, making it easier tocoil up into a ring and store inside the small hose storage box on our balcony.If you have a small area for which you need a high-quality hose of a short length,I would recommend this one.

I purchased one of these outdoor rug pads that was twice the dimensions of the rug,so that I could double-it-over for extra lift and extra cushioning.  I recommend thatyou also do that, particularly if you intent to put it under a small rug.It provides exactly what I expected:  extra lift to help the outdoor rug dry-out quicker,and extra cushioning so it is more pleasant to stand on.There is a lot of empty space in this product... the holes are large...and that is done purposefully to assist in airing-out the rug to keep it dry.While it looks odd because of this design, that actually helps it to serve itspurpose well, and you will never see it anyway once it is under the rug.It delivers a surprising amount of cushioning, due to its rubbery consistency.It should be noted that these outdoor rug pads are actually a bit shorter thanthe dimensions claimed by the manufacturer... for example... 4 x 6 feet is actuallya few inches short of 4 by 6 feet... the intension being that it would go under atruly 4 by 6 feet rug, and stop short of going to the very edge.  That should bedisclaimed by the manufacturer in the product description.Nevertheless, with that in mind, it is a good outdoor rug pad.

The insulated double-wall glass helps to keep hot beverages hot,and cold beverages cold... a little longer.Another great benefit, is this double-wall of glass helps to prevent condensation ringson any tabletop surface, so in most cases, you don't need to use coasters to protectsurfaces with these Bodum mugs and glasses (unless there is an extremely large differencein beverage vs. room temperature, for a very prolonged period of time, in which case a veryminimal amount of condensation may still occur).It should be noted that these thin-glass mugs and glasses are somewhat fragile,and if you drop them, they will shatter into several pieces.  They are, however, strongenough that lightly knocking them together will not break them, and they arecertainly dishwasher and microwave safe.  We have washed ours hundreds of timeswith no problems.I've been using Bodum double-walled glasses and mugs for several years, and I justordered these two mugs as a gift.

This is just a great idea.  This outlet strip offers 8 outlets, of which 6 are controlledby the remote, and 2 are "always on" and not controlled by the remote.I have my classic old stereo system components plugged into it, and I can leaveall the individual stereo components in the "ON" position, and turn everything ON or OFFwith just one click of the outlet strip's remote control.This outlet strip also offers surge protection... but again... it offers something onestep better than regular surge protection: the remote control will totally disconnectanything plugged into 6 of its 8 outlets from power when you click the OFF button.Being completely disconnected from power (when not in use) is even better thanbeing connected to power, but with surge suppression... it is one additional layerof protection from electrical surges and spikes.

I purchased these remote control outlets to replace a similar product that was not working ideally.These work from a great distance (easily from over 30 feet away), and they work the first timeyou click the button to turn the power on or off.They do not take up nearly as much space as similar products, (they are far less bulky), and if youplug them into the top outlet, they leave the bottom outlet accessible.

I am impressed with this leather-bound ESV Pocket New Testament with Psalms & Proverbs.It is well-constructed, and the print is of high quality.The Words of Christ appear in a dark red, and the text of the scripture is typeset in asingle-column format, rather than the double-column format seen in nearly all Bibles.There is a generous use of spacing between sections of print, which makes it easier tokeep your place when reading the small type.Given the inherent physical imitations of any "pocket-sized" NT, I would say thatCrossway has done as good a job as one could realistically expect with this printing.My company, The Bible Museum ( GREATSITE.COM ), deals in rare & antique Biblesand we also publish affordable facsimile reproductions of ancient Bibles... but we onlydeal in ancient English translations, such as the King James Version, and the severalEnglish translations that are OLDER than the King James Version.When people call me and ask me to recommend a good modern English translation(which we do not sell), I always refer them to the English Standard Version (E.S.V.),as it is widely regarded as the most accurate modern English translation, while stillmaintaining a smooth "readability" of the scriptural text.If they are looking for a complete Bible in modern English, I recommend the"Reformation Study Bible - E.S.V." as published by Ligonier Ministries.If they are looking for just a pocket-sized New Testament, I would recommendthis lovely ESV Pocket NT with Psalms & Proverbs.  It is the best example ofsuch a printing that I have ever seen.

After 7 years, our cheap builder-grade built-in soap pump finally died.We replaced it with this high-quality MOEN unit, which is ten times better than what we had originally.The metal is thick and solid and heavy.  It has a great feel and a great look.The pump mechanism is also very smooth, responsive, and solid-feeling.I doubt that we will ever have to buy another soap pump for our kitchen sink.Our previous low-grade soap pump unit put a huge amount of soap in your hand with each pump,which was wasteful.  This MOEN soap pump puts out a smaller and more appropriate amount ofsoap with each pump, which we certainly prefer.The soap reservoir which mounts under our granite countertop is also of a generous size,such that we can put a whole bottle of liquid dish soap into it, so it does not need to berefilled frequently.  We are very pleased.

I have owned two of the 9-inch Telnote Caller ID units for several years,and they have provided me with years of trouble-free service.When I saw this 14-inch model, which is able to show longer caller names,I purchased one for my home-office.  It looks great.  It works perfectly.My only suggestion would be that the manufacturer upgrade the unitso that this RED LED 14 inch model will also show the caller ID forCall Waiting.  Currently, only their BLUE LED 9 inch model showscaller ID for Call Waiting.  That's not a big deal, though.These Caller ID units are bigger and brighter and clearer than 99% of thecompetition on the market today, which use the inferior "LCD" technologywith a back-lit screen.  This bright LED technology makes the Caller IDvisible from across the room... and the letters are huge at about8/10ths of an inch tall.Be careful when you are unpacking it to note that your additionalface-plates are hidden under the main packaging area in a kind ofsecret-compartment that is very easy to overlook and accidentaly discard.Take all the packaging material completely out of the box to besure that you retrieve those well-hidden extra faceplates, before discarding the box.

I thought this would make an eye-catching and amusing door-stop.I was wrong.  The photos of this product are very misleading.If I could give it "zero stars", I would.The very thin golden-colored covering is extremely fake-looking... like a poorly-made toy,rather than an even slightly convincing replica... it just looks silly and extremely fake.It's like a thin and super-cheap golden "plastic chrome" covering over a grey composite core.Beyond that, the corners are rubbed and worn down so badly that the grey solid core materialunderneath shows through in several places.  Although these novelty items are being soldas "new"... they look like they have been sitting in a warehouse for 40 years... andbeing carelessly thrown around for much of that time.  Mine arrived covered in a verythick layer of dust, looking like it had been "used" for decades.But again... even if this product were brand-new and in "mint" condition (ha ha)...it still would be a very poor-quality, silly-looking, fake-looking, low-grade novelty item.The response of someone seeing it would NOT be what you might hope for, such as:"Oh that's so funny... I had to look twice...that can't be real... where did you get that?"Rather, the response would surely be more like:"What is that silly-looking thing? You should put that in the garbage, not on the floor by your door."I returned it immediately.Definitely do not buy this very disappointing piece of junk.

This is the ideal pancake-turner, or fried-egg turner.The extremely wide and large surface-area enables you to support the whole fried-egg,or the majority of even a large pancake, for easy and supportive flipping without breaking.The nylon material insures that you will not scratch non-stick cookware surfaces.The somewhat "sharpened" ... or perhaps a better word might be "beveled"... thin front edgehelps to actually get underneath the egg or pancake (rather than just pushing it forward),much like those super-thin metal flippers do... but with the advantages of a more firmly supportiveand non-scratching ridgid nylon design.We are very pleased with the design and performance of it, but note that it is a specialty tool forflipping fried-eggs or pancakes.  If you are looking for something to manipulate smaller objectslike cookies on a cookie sheet; a smaller general-purpose spatula would be more appropriate.This is a BIG one... designed specifically for moving or flipping large and delicate things.

This is my wife's favorite kitchen spoon.The soft but firm spoon tip will not scratch our non-stick cookware.The large and wide spoon is ideal for stirring a pot of just about anything.The length of the handle insures it cannot fall down into even our largest pots.Good design, quality materials... just a great general-purpose kitchen spoon.

My wife likes to try new recipees that she finds online, and she takes herMacbook Pro computer into the kitchen to follow-along with the cookinginstructions, which sometimes can be a bit messy.  This keyboard coverprotects the computer from any spills of liquid or dusty baking powderor flour.  (I can only imagine the havoc a gradual build-up of such powderwould eventually cause on the insides of a Macbook Pro).If you use your computer in the kitchen, workshop, or just outside withthe pollen in the air... this may be the best few dollars you ever spentto protect your $1,500+ investment.It is amazing how extremely thin this keyboard cover is.Though just a fraction of a millimeter thin, it has a pleasing soft tactilefeel which does not hinder keyboard use at all, and does not feel odd.I cannot imagine how this product could possibly be better than it is.

We bought this pair of Silver-Pewter-On Glass Fire Department Coffee Mugsas a congratulatory gift for our friend who was recently promoted to "Captain"in the New York City Fire Department.These are very high-quality... the pewter emblems are thick and finely detailed in theirtexture and the red-enameled areas are also very well done.  Our friend was very impressedwith the gift as well.

This is an extremely light-weight portable fan ... almost entirely plastic, except for the motor unit.It is very efficient, and it moves a tremendous amount of air, at a reasonable noise level.The height is very adjustable, and it can oscillate smoothly (though we never use that feature).I am amazed that you can buy a large, floor-standing, adjustable, oscillating fan of this quality for under $40.We had previously purchased the 16" diameter Lasko fan on Amazon, and we were so impressed with itthat we bought this 18" Lasko fan... to give us some relief on those rare occasions that our air conditionerstops working and needs repair.I must say: even though the 18" model is just 2" larger than the 16" model... it moves at least 50% more air.I encourage you to choose the 18" model for maximum effectiveness.  It is a very impressive fan.

These are very well-made, and just the right size, at 1.25 ounces, for taking on a flight.You don't need 2 ounces or 3 ounces of hair gel, or shampoo, or hand lotion, etc.if you are only going to be gone for 3 or 4 or 5 days... and space is at a premiumwhen all liquids must fit into a one-quart bag. (Though if you do need them inlarger sizes... they are also available in larger sizes).These soft, thick-walled, flexible and very "squeezable" little 1.25 ounce squeeze tubesare not too large, and they are far superior in their construction compared to thetypical cheap hard-plastic shell bottles that are often sold for airline travel.These squeeze tubes feel like they will last for many years of regular use.They are also super-easy to clean-out, or to re-fill, because the top unscrews to reveala very wide-mouth opening.I cannot imagine how this could be made better than it is made.

I bought this because I thought Scott Bakula did a great job playing "Captain Jonathan Archer"on the decade-old 98-episode TV series "Star Trek: Enterprise" (the best most realistic of allthe Star Trek TV series offerings in my humble opinion... check it out on Netflix)... and I alsoenjoy the comedy of Ray Romano on the classic old sitcom "Everyone Loves Raymond".I was not as familiar with the work of the third co-star, Andre Braugher.To my surprise, I discovered that the actor I was not familiar with, Andre Braugher, turned out tobe perhaps the most interesting of the three characters in this TV show, (though all three ofthese actors do a fine job).  This "slice-of-life" comedy / drama is some of the best TV I haveseen in a long time.  There is no laugh-track... it's not a "sitcom"... it's just good, compelling,believable, intriguing TV... which is rarely seen today.I am in my mid-forties, and although I cannot personally relate to any of these three charactersbecause none of them are anything like me; I nevertheless really enjoy seeing them deal withthe obstacles of their respective late-forties lives and mid-life crisis situations.  Great actors.Great scripts.  Truly enjoyable TV-watching.  My wife also enjoys this TV series.... it is not justa show that only men would like.  I wish there were more of this style of quality, realistic,intriguing, not-overly-dramatic, window-into-their-world style of TV programming available.

Unlike it's superior counter-parts, "Snowy Ambience" and "Stormy Ambience",which are high-quality background screen images featuring realistic-looking rainfall orsnowfall super-imposed across nature scenes... this "Autumn Ambience"does not measure-up.It has fake leaves falling across the screen, super-imposed in front of autumn nature scenes,but the leaves look cartoonish and fake.  It's not terrible... I've seen worse... but it issimply not nearly as impressive as this same company's Storm and Snowbackground scene apps.  Plus... in what world do leaves continuously and rapidlyfall without any let-up... like snow-fall or rain-fall, on-and-on-and-on.  It's kind of silly.I recommend this company's snowfall and rainfall screen app products instead.They are  far-better products over this much less impressive offering.

This is a realistic and relaxing background screen.It features high-quality images of various snowy winter scenes,with a super-imposed snowfall across the front of the images,which looks quite realistic (not cartoonish).You have many scenes from which to choose,and some are far better-looking than others.It is very pleasant.  This will make an ideal background imagethis coming Christmas.

This is a realistic and relaxing background screen.It features high-quality images of various nature scenes,with a super-imposed rainfall across the front of the images,which looks quite realistic (not cartoonish), and alsofeatures a pleasant realistic sound of rainfall.

These are thick, high-quality, braided HDMI cables with gold-plated ends.I am very surprised that they are so low-priced.I would expect to pay far more than this for a two-pack ofwhat seems to be fairly "high-end" HDMI cables.

This is a great little Blu-Ray / DVD player, by a respected name-brand: LG.It has a small footprint (about the size of an average hardcover book).It provides excellent picture quality, and excellent sound quality.It is super-simple to connect and set-up, and very easy-to-use.Just add your Internet-Streaming Digital Media Player (Amazon Fire or Roku),on top of it, and you have two high-quality products that are each dedicatedto what they each do best... not packed together as a compromise-product.Here is the back-story:I used to have one of those all-in-one Blu-Ray AND WiFi Digital Streaming boxes from Sony.Like most of those all-in-one units, it had a needlessly complicated user interface,and in spite of being made by a highly respected manufacturer,its ability to actually connect to the Internet to stream digital content (like Netflix, etc.)was extremely poor-quality, and it crashed about 50% of the time, often totally unable to log-on at all.I dumped that, I bought Amazon Fire (a shockingly tiny box), with its powerful processor inside,and that thing connects to the Internet to stream Netflix and other services EVERY TIME without fail.I also have a Roku3, which is just as reliable.  That's what those devices were built to do.I don't know who decided that these two TOTALLY UNRELATED things:playing a Blu-Ray or DVD... and... Streaming Internet Media like Netflix,should be packaged together into a single product, spawning the"Smart Blu-Ray Player" or 'Wi-Fi Streaming Blu-Ray Player", but to me,that makes about as much sense as having asmart phone that is also an electric toothbrushor a Blu-Ray player that is also an alarm clock.  Bad idea.You are much better off buying a separate Internet Media Streaming Device thatspecializes in doing that one thing very well (the Amazon Fire TV with a powerfulcomputer processor inside is the best such device on the market, and the ROKU 3is a close second in its power and ability).When you do that, however, you may then need a Blu-Ray / DVD player...and it seems that about 95% of them have an unreliable, low-quality,(and if you followed my advice above... totally redundant and unneeded)WiFi Streaming Media capability built-in.This LG BP135 (and its similar model LG BP125) is a rarity because:it is JUST a Blue-Ray / DVD player ... it does not wirelessly stream other media,so it can focus on doing what it does in an excellent manner.It is so simple to connect:  the back side has only two things:the electrical plug, and one HDMI cable jack.  That's all.  And that's all you need.A child could hook this thing up in one minute without reading any instructions.Just plug it into the wall, and run an HDMI cable from this unit,to the HDMI jack on your TV... or to the HDMI jack on the backof your AV Receiver Unit on your home theater system.  That's it.  Done.You've now got a great little Blu-Ray / DVD Player ... and IF you also wanta high-quality, dedicated, WiFi Streaming Device, you can deal with that asa separate and unrelated issue, which is absolutely the best way to do that,at this point in time, given the products currently available to the consumer.

These OXO salt & pepper grinders are extremely well-designed, and high quality, and beautiful.Yes, they are pricey... but they are worth it.The grinder is on the top (brilliant!) unlike most other grinders with bottom-mounted mechanismsthat leave bits of salt & pepper all over the table when you set them down.  These therefore stayclean and neat after use.They are made of a silvery metal at both ends that is either stainless steel or aluminum, with athick transparent acrylic center column which looks and feels like glass, but is shatterproof.Also, the bottom is a dense black rubber that gives it a firm slip-resistant base, and protectswhatever tabletop surface it rests upon.Originally, I purchase from Amazon, a far more expensive and very similar-looking salt & papergrinder set made by Cole & Mason.  They brag that they have been making the finest grindersfor over a century in England... and I fell for it.  When they arrived, the packaging revealed thatCole & Mason now proudly outsource all their manufacturing to China.  Within just a few months,the grinder mechanism detached from the top, and no amount of super-glue could fix it.It's very sad to see a proud and ancient English company like Cole & Mason sell-out to China,and ruin their reputation by producing pretty, but low-grade, Chinese garbage at premium prices.These OXO grinders are a much better choice... and they also hold twice as much salt & pepperas the inferior, yet pricier, Cole & Mason grinders.  I recommend that you go with OXO.  I haveseveral other OXO brand products in my kitchen that I've had for many years, and they all stillwork, and they all still look brand-new.  I researched them online and discovered that OXO is basedin New York, and owned by a parent company based in Bermuda.

This "Rainy Drops" app is pleasant.The image is not detailed (purposefully).  It is a naturally blurred window,with streaks of rain drops building up and running down slowly.It is not something you would "sit and watch", but rather, it isa nice background image with a pleasant rainfall sound.If you are reading or resting or meditating, and you just want abackground image and sound that is not distracting... this is a good choice.- John J. (Greatsite.com)

This "Virtual Fireplace" app is better than the one on Amazon Fire called "Fireplace".Still, this one is not high-resolution, and offers no adjustment of the image.It is a simple and adequate but not overly-impressive app.- John J. (Greatsite.com)

This app is OK.  It is not high-resolution.  It does not offer any adjustment features (like adjusting the speed of the flames, such as you can do on other fireplace apps).  It is adequate, but not overly impressive.- John J. (Greatsite.com)

This is a very high-end, high-quality USB Cable, at a surprisingly... indeed shockingly... low price: under $10 at this time.Even at its full MSRP of $25... it would be a bargain.The gauge (thickness) of the wire is 24 AWG, which is a bit better than that of most other USB cablesthat are usually 26 or 28 AWG (remember: the LOWER the AWG number, the THICKER the wire).The ends are gold-plated for maximum preservation of transmission quality,rather than being the typical silvery-base-metal ends of lesser quality cables.The cable is also fully shielded and wrapped to prevent signal interference.It is manufactured at the maximum recommended length for a USB Cable:  5 meters (16.4 feet).This cable is perfect for connecting a home computer to a Digital Analog Converter, (D.A.C.), so you canplay your computer's digital music collection through your stereo components, at the highest possible quality level.(That's what I am doing with mine).  If this is your purpose, the fact that this cable is USB 2.0 rather than USB 3.0 isessentially irrelevant for digital music playback, so don't worry about that.If you have checked the price of "audiophile" grade USB 5-meter cables... they are also 24 AWG andgold-plated, and fully shielded... just exactly like the specs on this one... however they are priced atclose to $100 or more... and some are several hundred dollars, for just one 5 meter USB cable of thisthickness, shielding, and length, with gold-plated ends.Indeed, this very high-end cable is an absolute steal at this low price level.

This is a high-quality product, but it is important to understand exactly what this is: a special-application product.These are NOT the tiny soft rubber bumpers to use on your cabinet doors to soften the impact of closing the door.They will not work well for that purpose at all.  They are not impact-reducers.  They are not really "bumpers" at all.These are very firm, dense, hard-rubber, designed not to reduce impact, but rather, to give excellent grip and supportto STATIONARY heavy glass panes that never move and that rest on top of these firm rubber squares.The large footprint (large size) of these 1 inch by 1 inch squares provides a lot of gripping space to hold a heavy pane of glassand keep it from sliding or moving at all.  Also, because these are very clear (very nearly transparent), rather than being theoften-seen milky-white color, they aesthetically look far better under your heavy glass tabletop, or similar application wheresupport and grip is needed, but looks are also important.I have used these under my 1/2-inch-thick and heavy panes of custom-cut glass that support my stereo components,and they work perfectly and look great for that application.

The Shure SRH1440 Headphones are good headphones.They are not "blow-you-away" headphones that "immerse you in an ocean of deep and rich sounds,leaving their competitors on the dust", or other such superlative audiophile reviewer babble... no...but they are simply good, quality headphones.  I found them to be acceptable.  I am keeping them.Here is the back story:Earlier this week, I ordered and received the $180-more-expensive (nearly $500) Sennheiser HD 650headphones.  I was impressed by their almost unanimously great reviews.I found the Sennheiser HD 650 to be totally unacceptable for two reasons:1.) The HD 650 was very uncomfortable - like a tight vice grip on my head.2.) The HD 650 has a whopping 300 ohms of impedance, which to my surprise, I discovered wastoo much impedance / resistance even for my $250 TEAC model UD-H01 D.A.C. - Headphone Amp Unit tobe able to power them beyond just a moderate volume level.So, I returned the HD 650, and instead I ordered and received the Shure SRH1440 Headphones.They were much less expensive (at $300), and much more comfortable on my head,and because their impedance is only 37 ohms... which is about ONE-TENTH of the HD 650's 300 ohms...I was able to power them with my TEAC model UD-HO1 Digital-Analog-Converter - Headphone Amp Unit.The Shure SRH1440 headphones have very comfortable and soft velour cloth ear pads(a better choice than genuine or fake leather, as velour cloth breathes well against your skin).They are not too tight, not too loose, very flexible and adjustable... easy to fit to your head.They produce a nice balanced sound... not too full of bass... not too full of treble...(though if you have an old-school equalizer like I do, that is easily adjustable to suit your taste anyway).I did not like that the cord is only 2.1 meters (6.9 feet) long, as I could have ideally used justan extra foot or two... but I can make that work for me.  I did not like that the cord has a cheap,thin, rubber-coated, strangely "bendy / bouncy" quality to it, rather than being a cord that drapesdown more smoothly and uniformly, as it should.  That being said... it is a very lightweight cordthat does not tangle and does not weigh you down... and both ends are gold-plated... so it is acceptable to me.It is unexpected and generous of Shure that they also provide SRH1440s buyers with a second set of cords,and a second set of velour ear-pads... so you can swap-out your cords and ear pads in a few years,when your first sets gets old, and you then have the feel of a new set of headphones... that was thoughtful.You also get a semi-rigid carrying case.  You also get an adapter to convert the tiny 3.5 mm termination jack(which fits into an iPod / iPhone / iPad etc.) into a 1/4 inch classic big headphone jack such as thosefound on most home audio components, receivers, and headphone amps.In closing... I would like to point out one thing, on a related note, concerning what Ilearned this week about the required amplification of a good set of headphones:Although these Shure SRH1440 headphones, at just 37 ohms of impedance,are able to achieve a higher volume level than the Sennhesier HD 650's withtheir crazy-high 300 ohms of impedance... I still found that my new TEAC headphone ampwas only able to power these low-impedance Shure 1440s headphones to what I wouldcall a "moderately loud" listening level, if I turned the headphone amp's volume controlall the way up to 100%.  That's loud enough for me... but it might not quite be loud enoughfor some people.Apparently, in order to get really good (distortion free) somewhat high volume out of good headphones,you really need to buy a high-end, very powerful headphone amp, capable of delivering morepower than my $250 headphone amp / DAC combo unit is capable of delivering.I found that discovery to be very surprising.  That's not the fault of these headphones... but it issomething that the buyer of quality headphones should keep in mind.  A powerful headphone ampis necessary to realize the full potential of quality headphones.Happy listening!

I needed a hose nozzle that was not the typical large "gun" type nozzle with a squeeze-trigger.Those large "gun" type nozzles are best for a hose that you use frequently and/or forextended periods of time... but my application was for a small and short hose on my balcony,which is used only once a month for a few minutes to clean off the balcony.  As such, I wantedthe most compact and least visually obtrusive design I could find.This Bullseye Power Nozzle is exactly what I needed.
