Otherwise, SEQ gets my best toner recommendation without reservation because my results look salon worthy. If you absolutely must drive to Sally's right this minute, then by all means use T18.  But if you truly want the best outcome, order SEQ and be patient for a week.  I promise you it's worth the wait.

I might as well have mixed up my regular color and developer to do my roots.  Although this method is less messy, the medium blond shade did not match at all and left my hair very brassy.  This product gave me ugly hot roots so I had to go ahead and use regular hair color to match the rest of my hair.  I should have known that this product would contain the same inferior drugstore hair color product that I have strenuously avoided over the last decade.  I use a salon brand of hair color, Wella Koleston Perfect, that's nothing like the box kits or the junk Sally's sells.  One of the main reasons for this is that my brown hair has a lot of underlying orange pigment that comes out when it's lightened,even two levels.  This results is a lot of warmth, i.e. orange, so I use a Koleston shade with a blue base, which neutralizes the orange.  Something that drugstore kits and Sally's brands can't do (there's no blue base available).  I wanted to touch up my roots without getting messy, but this roots touch up product is no different that using a bowl and brush.  I would much rather spend the extra $5 for my regular hair color than use this stuff again.  If I needed to remind myself why I switched from drugstore color years ago, this is the perfect time.  I will not make that mistake again.  So I ended up doing my roots twice, once with this Root Rescue garbage, and once with Koleston.  Thank goodness the Koleston product got me back to my usual shade, otherwise, I would have given this stupid product a negative star.  My advice is to touch up your obvious roots with your regular formula.  Despite its claims to do so, it cannot match the existing shade and the color choices are limited.  You'll be much better off if you just bite the bullet and do a full on touch up with your regular brand.  I'm glad I didn't waste muc money on this inferior product but even $6 is a waste if it doesn't give the results you want.  Good thing I had plenty of my usual shade on hand because I couldn't have left the house with my orange roots.  From now on, I'll just touch up the regular way.  Or use Rita Hazan's root concealing spray (which is awesome btw) in the meantime.  This product gets no recommendation from me and in fact, I advise against using it.  There's nothing worse than roots that don't match the drapes, lol!

This developer works really well and gives me a nice even end result.  It seems to condition as it works, leaving my hair soft and supple.  I use it with Wella Koleston Perfect hair color and I haven't noticed any difference between the Koleston developer (much more expensive) and Color Charm, so I suspect that they're likely the same exact formula.  This developer gives me the proper viscosity so that the color mixture is thick and creamy and doesn't drip.  I have never used the clear formula developers, always the cream version, and this one seems to have plenty of conditioners.  It also gives me the full two levels of lift (lift is dependent on the nature of the hair and for some people this may not be true) and my hair is always shiny and soft after coloring.  So I see no reason to spend more for Koleston developer because Color Charm works just fine.  If you have a sensitive scalp, I recommend Ion Sensitive Scalp developer or you could add two packets of Sweet and Low to the color mixture.  All in all, I'll continue to use this developer, which I purchase at Sally's.  It does everything I need it to and is very inexpensive.  A great product that I definitely recommend.

This is just glorified eye shadow.  And the powder doesn't even stay on very well at all.  If used as directed, it wears off halfway through the day and my silver strands once again are visible.  There's also not much product in this packaging, which means it doesn't last very long at all.  The only way I can make it work is to spray a generous amount of hairspray, and while it's still wet, apply the powder.  Otherwise, the powder doesn't stick to the silver strands at all.  I color my hair dark blond and my natural color is a medium brown.  The dark blond Color Wow powder is really too warm for my neutral shade but I went ahead and used it anyway (I should have returned it immediately, my bad).  I went through a considerable amount of the powder before trying a method that worked (somewhat) and the powder never really covers the medium brown hair at all.  I used about half of this powder before giving up and buying Rita Hazan's spray root concealer in Dark Blond.  This is a much, much better product.  First, it's the right color for me.  Second, it definitely covers both my natural color and the silver strands.  Third, it lasts until I shampoo it out, which means I only have to use it twice a week.  I try to go about 3 or 4 weeks between color touch ups and the longer I wait, the better the results.  But my roots start to peek out the second week, so I need a cover up for about two solid weeks every month.  Rita Hazan makes a much better product and the spray is much quicker to use.  The powder blends in seamlessly so no one can tell that my roots are once again making an appearance.  I have thrown away what remained of Color Wow and have made Rita Hazan my go-to root concealer.  It does everything it's supposed to do and is less expensive than Color Wow.  But if you insist on using Color Wow, I urge you to purchase a regular eye shadow instead.  Not only will you get the same exact results, you will get a much better color match and save yourself a considerable sum in the process.  Even a drugstore eye shadow is better than Color Wow (I know, I've tried it).  But spray some hairspray first, otherwise the powder won't stick.  A large fluffy eye shadow brush is the best applicator.  However, if you really want a convenient way to cover gray then get Rita Hazan's spray.  It works like a charm.

I bought this spray in the hopes of adding some body and volume to my medium textured hair.  I wanted some thickness and that tousled, sexy, bedhead look that's so on trend right now.  I read in a magazine article that if you use a curling iron to create loose waves, that layering a styling spray and a thickening spray is the best way to get a more voluminous look.  I used Living Proof No Frizz Weightless Styling Spray and then added a generous amount of Thick.  I then let my hair air dry overnight and in the morning used a 1.25 inch curling iron to create loose waves that I then loosened with my fingers.  Thick definitely added heft and gave me more thickness and also amped up the texture, giving me the desired Victoria's Secret waves.  My hair is cut in a layered lob and Thick definitely helped define the layers and gave me more volume.  Thick didn't leave my hair stiff or sticky and the waves held well all day.  I think it added just that bit of oomph that I needed to get the tousled, beachy look I was aiming for.  The sprayer did stick a bit and it was somewhat difficult to unclog it, but once I did, I guess I sprayed the perfect amount because I had a really great hair day that day.  I haven't tried using it on my roots and I'm a total klutz with a blow dryer and round brush, but I suppose that I would have gotten even more volume had I use a dryer.  Thick even smells pretty nice, which is a big plus in my book.  I think this spray would work really well for really fine hair and would not be overly stiff.  It does dull the shine a bit, but this is easily remedied with a shine spray.  I will have to see whether my style lasts for a couple of days, which would be really awesome.  So far, I think Thick does what it promises, amplifying body and texture and adding more thickness to each strand.  There are really great positive reviews of this product, which is why I decided to try it.  I bought it at Ulta, where I could have returned it if it didn't perform the way I'd hoped.  However, it did do exactly what it was supposed to, so I'm definitely going to keep using it.  The trick for me is layering it with a styling spray which gave me the hold I needed because my hair is extremely resistant and the waves will fall out if I don't use something with a significant amount of hold.  Using the two product together seems the perfect combination.  So the article in the magazine was right, layering is the way to use this spray if you need hold.  All in all, I'm pleased with my purchase and with Thick so far.  I definitely recommend it for people with my hair type as well as for finer hair.  I'm giving it four stars because I haven't yet tried using it alone, which may or may not be better than layering it with a styling spray.  However, I'm concerned that I may not get the amount of hold necessary for my waves to last all day.  I will try it by itself and if the results are good, I'll update this review.

This product is not as light as Wen.  It sort of weighed my hair down and I also didn't feel that it rinsed out cleanly.  I bought this at Target and ended up returning it.  The lavender fragrance is very strong and it irritated my scalp somewhat (although the stinging subsided once I rinsed it).  I know this product is supposed to compete with Wen but it's very different and no match for it at all.  My hair didn't feel clean and felt heavy and didn't have much body at all.  If you're looking for a cleansing conditioner that's really light, like Wen Sweet Almond Mint, try VO5 Kiwi Lime conditioner, which I think is awesome as a cowash.  You can find it at Kmart for $2 and sometimes even at the Dollar Store.  It smells amazing and because it's so cheap, you can use a generous amount, which is the only way a cowash works well.  Leave it on for at least 10 minutes and then rinse well.  A cowash only works well when you use a significant amount of conditioner and you must leave it on for many minutes for it to work the best.  I found this out through trial and error with Wen.  When I first started using it I didn't use enough and my hair never felt clean.  I then discovered the secret through a post on a hair forum that said you have to be very generous, otherwise it doesn't work well.  Once I did this, the difference was like night and day.  I do love Wen but it's so expensive and I discovered VO5 through the same hair forum and have used it ever since with great results.  I cowash a couple of time a month (mainly because I missed the lather of regular shampoo, although I only use sulfate free formulas now) and my hair always looks great and behaves the way I want it to.  After rinsing, I use Agadir Argan Oil Treatment serum to eliminate frizz and provide thermal protection.  It works better than Moroccan Oil for a fraction of the price (on Amazon).  I then apply my usual styling products and my hair looks and feels great.  It has bounce, shine and body and my waves stay in place all day.  This regimen has saved my hair, which has never looked better. VO5 is a great beauty cheapie that packs a huge punch.  It's affordable for everyone.  But if your hair is dry, there are other VO5 formulas you may like better.  Check out naturallycurly.com for recommendations of cleansing conditioners for every hair type.  My hair is normal with dry ends and Kiwi Lime works great for me.  I much prefer it over this Renpure cowash and I've had no scalp issues with VO5.  If you want a comparable product to Wen, then VO5 is the way to go.  And anyone can afford it and everyone will have the beautiful hair to show for it.

I bought this brush at Sally's for the sole purpose of brushing out the residue from dry shampoo.  It works really well for this purpose and it's very soft so it doesn't stretch or break my hair.  The residue from dry shampoo clings to the bristles and is easily brushed out with this model of brush (plastic bristles don't work for this maneuver).  However, my hair is medium in thickness and because this brush is super soft, it doesn't really get through all of my hair.  It does work for distributing the natural oils from the root to the ends and it doesn't cause any damage.  But for brushing through my curls, I prefer a plastic vent brush with just a few bristles because this boar bristle brush would wreck my waves, stretching them out and keeping them from being well defined.  The best purpose for this boar bristle brush is to eliminate the residue from dry shampoo.  However, I do have to wash the brush regularly otherwise the white powder builds up on the bristles and if it's not relatively clean, it will put residue in rather than taking it out, lol!  Still, this is an excellent brush for the price.  If I could actually use the brush another way, I would have given it five stars rather than four.  But for less than $5, you can't beat it if you're a regular dry shampoo user.  If you are, you've likely discovered that plastic bristles are no help in brushing out the white residue.  You have to use a boar bristle brush if you want to get every last speck of powder out of the hair so that you don't end up with a grayish cast.  This brush is great for this.  I definitely recommend it.

I like this brush quite a lot.  It distributes the natural oils from my roots to the ends and it also gives my hair a nice sheen.  The mixture of nylon and boar bristles means that it also gets through tangles and snarls without breaking my hair.  The nylon bristles also give my scalp a massage.  I like everything about this brush.  I bought it at Sally's on sale for $7 and it's definitely worth much more.  I can't afford a Mason Pearson mixed bristle brush so this is the next best thing and is great for the price.  I use this brush to brush out the residue from dry shampoo and it works really well for that purpose.  It definitely gets the white powder out (plastic bristles don't work for this maneuver) and doesn't break my hair in the process.  This is a really gentle brush and the cushion means that it's very comfortable to use.  I don't know if it would be suitable for really thick hair though.  Mine's medium thickness and it works just fine for me.  The bristles are also long so they get through the whole thickness of my hair without pulling.  My hair is much shinier since I started using this brush.  However, it should only be used on dry hair because wet hair is very fragile and it would be too strong and would likely stretch and break the hair.  I like the large head because it covers a large surface area.  I think this brush would also work if you wanted to blow dry your hair straight because it does hold on really well and if you aimed the dryer right at the brush, it would definitely give a smoothing effect.  All in all, I really like this brush and think it's a great one for the price point.  I have other mixed bristle brushes but they have shorter bristles and don't get through my hair as well as this one.  If you want to distribute the natural oils down to the ends, you can't do better than this brush.  I definitely recommend it.

I've always gotten along fine with my wide tooth comb.  When my hair is wet it's very vulnerable and so I've always used a wide tooth comb, taking care to detangle my hair very gently and working my way up from the bottom, rather than combing from the top down.  My conditioner does a great job of detangling my strands so I really don't have to put much effort into combing them through.  However, the Tangle Teezer has been the talk of the hair forums for some time now so the last time I was in Sally's I decided to purchase one.  I thought it would perform better than my wide toothed comb but it really doesn't.  My hair doesn't seem to be in any better shape than it is when I use my old stand-by.  Yes, it detangles easily and I suppose it would be beneficial for those whose hair gets super tangled.  But I was always told by my stylists not to brush wet hair because that is when hair is at its most vulnerable.  So I don't see much difference between the Tangle Teezer and a regular plastic bristle brush.  I also notice that more hair appears in the Tangle Teezer than is trapped in my comb.  Whether this is because the Tangle Teezer is more rough, I have no idea, it's simply a fact.  So I think the Tangle Teezer will remain in my comb/brush basket and won't be used very much at all.  It feels like I'm pulling my hair out when I use it, so I think I'll either pitch it or give it to someone.  As far as I'm concerned it was a complete waste of money.  This is just a gimmick and is not as good as a wide toothed comb and at least for me, feels much more damaging and rough.  So I'll pass.

I bought this 1.3 ounce dry shampoo powder on clearance at Ulta for $10.  I really prefer the powdered dry shampoos over the sprays because the sprays are messy and always leave my dark blond hair with a grayish cast no matter how hard I try to brush the residue out.  Also, most of the weight of the sprays is propellant and I'm sure they contain very little actual powder so this 1.3 ounce sprinkle on product lasts a lot longer than you might think at first glance.  I apply this powder to my oily roots in 1/2 partings from ear to ear.  I then sprinkle a little of the powder onto my fingertips and work it into the back. I put on my makeup for the day, which takes about 15-20 minutes, during which time the oil is absorbed.  I brush whatever residue remains (usually not much) out with a 100% boar bristle brush (plastic bristles don't work for this maneuver).  My hair looks much cleaner and feels fresher and has a nice amount of volume.  I've also used a bit more of this powder at night when my hair is extra oily and in the morning, almost no powder residue remains and if there is some, it's easily brushed out.  It works well both ways.  I also happen to really like the mango scent because I want my hair to not only look like I've washed it, I prefer that it smell that way too.  I've had this powder for several months and I use it several times a week and I still have half the container left, so it lasts a lot longer than you might think.  I also like the Alterna Talc Free dry shampoo powder in the purple bottle, which in contrast is very, very lightly scented and works just as well as this Alterna Bamboo product.  These Alterna products leave my hair soft and amenable to styling, not stiff or sticky at all.  I can still use a curling iron with good results on 2nd or 3rd day hair.  The only thing I don't like about dry shampoos is the matte finish so I use a shine spray on my finished style.  Other than this, I have no complaints.  I think this Mango dry shampoo powder works really well and it makes my hair feel as clean as possible without actually shampooing.  My hair is color treated so the less I shampoo the better my color looks and the longer it lasts and that makes me very happy.  The only question now is what to do with the spray dry shampoos I have left over? (Batiste, Not Your Mother's Clean Freak, Amika, R&Co, Beyond the Zone, Tresemme, Dove, AG).  I wasted a lot of $$ on these sprays, both drugstore and high end, and none of them delivered the results of the Alterna powders.  I guess my only choice is to recycle them, lol!  I certainly don't want to use them up because I can't leave the house with telltale gray roots.  Rather than making my hair look and feel clean, these sprays made it look tangled, matted and in desperate need of a wash, which is the complete opposite of the goal.  I'll stick with the powders from now on, thank you very much.  If you're looking for a really good dry shampoo product to use in lieu of the sprays, then this is a great one to try.  I definitely recommend this Alterna Mango dry shampoo powder as well as the Alterna powder in the purple bottle.  Both are really good and worth a try if you haven't had good results with the sprays.

I like this dry shampoo.  I really prefer the shake in powders over the sprays, which are messy and it's hard to control how much powder they disperse.  They also don't last very long and always leave a grayish cast in my dark blond hair no matter how much I try to brush the residue out.  With this one I can control the amount and as long as I wait 15-20 minutes for the oil to be absorbed, there's very little powder left over to brush out.  Plus it smells amazing and gives my hair that fresh scent like I just washed it.  While it's true that this container is tiny, there's more powder in it than you might think.  It has lasted me several months and I use it at least twice a week.  I also like the Alterna Talc Free dry shampoo powder that comes in the purple container.  It's a much larger size for not much more $$ (at least on Amazon) and it works just as well as the Bamboo, maybe a little better.  It also has a really nice fragrance and leaves my hair feeling clean and bouncy.  I will never go back to the messy spray dry shampoos.  These two Alterna products also give me a nice amount of volume that I can revive with a simple fluff of the fingers.  They give me that tousled, sexy bedhead look that's so on trend right now.  However, all dry shampoos leave a matte finish so I combat this by using a shine spray after I've finished brushing out the dry powder.  I hate products that dull the shine so this step is a necessity.  Otherwise, I'm really loving the loose dry shampoo powders made by Alterna.  I think they're a much better product than any of the spray dry shampoos I've tried.  There is simply no comparing the two.  If I need to use dry shampoo, I'll reach for one of these.  I definitely recommend them both.

This is a good dry shampoo and far superior to the spray formulas I've tried.  I had just about given up on dry shampoos altogether until I discovered some that were loose powders.  Sprays are very messy and it's hard to control the amount.  Moreover,  they always leave a grayish cast on my dark blond hair because I can never fully brush out the white residue.  I've tried Batiste, Not Your Mother's Clean Freak, Amika, R&Co and Beyond the Zone and none of them worked very well at all (although Amika was the best of the bunch but it's $25 so, uh...NO) .  Each time I used one of these products, I ended up wearing my hair in an updo and hoping that no one would notice the change in the color of my hair, lol!  Although I wasted a considerable amount of cash trying these sprays, I was in Sephora one day and saw the Bumble and Bumble Pret a Powder dry shampoo and decided to take the chance and give it a try.  And I absolutely love it!!  However, this is not a review for Pret a Powder so I'll get right to the point.  BB is really expensive and although the 2 ounce bottle lasts a lot longer than you might think, it's still a pricey product.  I was searching Amazon for alternatives, when I noticed this Alterna dry shampoo powder.  It's 2.65 ounces, so it's significantly bigger than BB and the Prime price was $14, so I had to order it and was hoping it was as good as BB.  I apply the Alterna powder in 1/2 inch sections from ear to ear and then I put some of the powder on my hands and do the back.  I then rub it in like regular shampoo and let it work for 15-20 minutes while I put on my makeup.  After waiting the required time, I brush out what little powder remains with a 100% boar bristle brush (plastic bristles don't work for this maneuver).  The powder absorbs the oil and no white residue is visible after I brush it out.  I also get a nice amount of volume.  Alterna also smells really nice (as do all their products) and makes my hair felt fluffy and clean.  I also like the fact that this product is talc free because not only am I sensitive to it, it's also a known carcinogen!!  This powder works so much better than the spray variety and I'm so glad I discovered an alternative.  Alterna doesn't work quite as well as BB but I'm willing to forego buying BB because Alterna is so attractively priced on Amazon Prime.  I bought 4 bottles of Alterna so I have a few backups in case the price goes up.  The Alterna powder is not quite as fine as BB so there's a little more residue to brush out, but this takes just a few minutes to do and is therefore no big deal.  Alterna also has a nicer fragrance (the scent of BB is virtually undetectable).  So I'm relatively satisfied with Alterna and will continue to use it as long as it's so fairly priced.  The bottle lasts a couple of months, even though I use it a couple of times a week.  I've tried the Alterna Caviar Moisture Replenishing shampoo and conditioner but they weren't anything special so I was a little hesitant to try this dry shampoo.  However, the reviews were really good so I decided to take the plunge.  I gave BB five stars but my budget doesn't always allow me to spend that much and so I'm making Alterna my go-to dry shampoo for the time being.  I'm glad I have several bottles in readiness and if you're smart, you'll search out the seller that has such a phenomenal price.  Ulta sells Alterna dry shampoo powder for $22 so there's a significant savings on Amazon.  I definitely recommend this product and you can't do better for the price.  Powdered dry shampoo beats the messy sprays hands down.  Try this product and you'll see what I mean.

I originally bought this product to use as a root lifting spray but soon discovered that it's a styling product, not a finishing one.  So I had no idea what to do with it.  However, I recently saw an article in a fashion magazine that suggested layering a styling spray with a thickening spray for beachy waves.  My favorite styling spray is Living Proof No Frizz Weightless styling spray, so I used it as usual and then layered a small amount of Superstar on top.  I don't blowdry my hair but instead let it air dry overnight.  In the morning I used a curling iron to create loose waves.  I could definitely see that Supestar added some nice volume to my hair and did make it look a bit thicker and fuller.  I will have to experiment with the amount of both products to find the ultimate combination, but for now, I'm pleased with the results.  My waves did stay in place all day (with the addition of some flexible hold hairspray) and the two products did give me that beachy look.  The next time I use these products, I will use less of LP and a bit more of Superstar so see whether there's any noticeable difference.  Superstar did dry a bit stiff, but once I brushed through my hair, the stiffness was gone and it felt soft again.  I sometimes hate buying hair products on Amazon that I haven't tried because they can't be returned.  However, I did read the positive reviews before buying this spray and it sounded like something I had been looking for.  Although it isn't exactly the type of product I wanted (my search for a root spray goes on)  I can hopefully make it a good part of my regular routine.  But if it ends up not making a huge difference, then I guess I"ll have no choice but to pass it off to family and friends.  It would be a definitely waste of money in that case.  But so far, the results seem promising and I'll keep trying to get the combination of styling spray and thickening spray right.  Superstar does add heft so it would likely be great for fine hair.  And it's certainly not heavy at all so it won't weigh hair down.  I'm giving this product four stars, for now.  If I really get great results, I'll update this review.  As it stands now, I certainly recommend this product for thickening thin locks.

I love these boots!!  I've been looking for a low heeled bootie that can be worn either casually, with denim, or with sleeker leggings and trousers and this style definitely fits the bill.  I can wear them all day without any issues and the leather and suede let my feet breathe.  I love the somewhat rocker chick vibe that the straps give this bootie, which toughens them up without crossing the line into the biker look.  They are sleek and very chic and I will enjoy wearing them everywhere and with all kinds of outfits.  I probably won't wear them with skirts because the heel is really low and I'm not sure that the proportion would work.  However, this bootie goes with all my jeans and they're even suitable to wear with sleek and skinny black pants/trousers and even my leather leggings.  The toe is comfortably rounded and will be in style for a long time to come.  The leather and suede and are top quality and the booties have a nice sheen.  I'm surprised that I found this pair for such a reasonable price.  They were in my budget but look much more expensive.  Thanks Amazon!  I ordered my usual size and they fit perfectly, in both length and width.  There is moderate arch support which means they are comfortable to wear for long periods.  I've been searching for just this style for some time and am so glad I decided to check Amazon.  They are exactly what I wanted.  I highly recommend these booties for all the reasons I've stated.  The leather/suede is really nice and the fit is great.  What more could you ask for?

This is the same company that makes the Harry Josh Pro dryer that's $350.  This is a great hair dryer that dries my hair quickly with no frizz whatsoever.  It's light, quiet and ionic, which makes a huge difference.  I don't normally do the round brush and dryer thing, I'm too uncoordinated.  But at night, I dry my hair about 80% and then let it air dry the rest of the way.  My hair is medium thick and this dryer does the job in just a few minutes, saving me at least half the time of my cheap Conair dryer.  In the morning, I do use a round brush to shape my bangs and this dryer and the brush give me tons of volume that lasts all day.  I also use fewer frizz fighting products since I've gotten this dryer.  I'm not thrilled at the outrageous shipping charges but Amazon saved me at least $50 over other online sites.  This is the first high end dryer I've owned and I'm really happy with the quality.  It seems solid and its performance has been amazing thus far.  Even if I don't do a traditional blowout, this dryer prevents the frizz that the Florida humidity seems intent on delivering if I don't use it.  I thought about buying a Sedu but decided against it because the reviews for this dryer were just as good and why spend the extra money if I'm not going to get better benefits?  I would never buy this dryer just because Harry Josh's name is on it (who is he anyway?) and I'm so glad I did some research before deciding to purchase this Velectra model.  It's everything I'd hoped it would be and more.  There's definitely a tangible difference between cheap dryers and this one.  It was worth every extra dollar as far as I'm concerned.  If you want a great hair dryer that works like magic to calm frizz, is quiet, and lightweight, then look no further.  I'm pleased with my purchase and hope that the relatively unknown name will soon be more prominent.  The quality is excellent and the good results I've gotten were not possible with my drugstore dryer.  I definitely recommend this hair dryer.

This product is just so-so.  It's really nothing special.  It doesn't absorb excess oil very well when used on 2nd day hair that has some oiliness at the roots.  I sprinkled some of this powder on my roots from ear to ear in 1/2 inch partings, avoiding my actual part.  I then rubbed it in well (like actual shampoo) and let it sit for 15-20 minutes while I put on my makeup.  I then used a 100% boar bristle brush (plastic bristles don't work for this maneuver) to remove what powder remained.  I didn't get much volume, despite the fact that I used what I thought was a generous amount of product.  It didn't really absorbed the oil very well at all and I was disappointed overall.  I have since found a superior dry shampoo powder, Bumble and Bumble Pret a Powder, that does absorb oil and makes my hair look much cleaner.  It also adds considerably more volume that lasts all day and can be revived with a fluff of the fingers.  Pret a Powder also has a very subtle scent that doesn't interfere with my perfume.  Yes, it's expensive.  However, looks can be deceiving because it takes very little powder to do the job so the bottle lasts a lot longer than it may appear at first glance.  I use it about twice a week and although I've had it for several months, I still have half the bottle left.  But who wants to pay even a small price for an inferior product?  It's money wasted!  I'd rather fork out the cash for a product that does what it promises, so I'll definitely be purchasing Pret a Powder from now on.  I wasted $10 on this Sexy Hair product and I have no idea what to do with what powder remains in the bottle.  I supposed I could try it on clean hair because it certainly doesn't work on dirty hair.  I have a hall closet full of hair product FAILS and I've put Powder Play right there on the shelf with all the others.  I'd much rather pay Sephora for Pret a Powder and use a product that makes my hair look refreshed and volumized than try to slide by on the cheap with something that doesn't deliver the proper results.  And I can't stand spray dry shampoos.  I find them messy and they always leave my dark blond hair with a grayish cast that I can never fully brush out.  The light tinted formulas are just as bad and leave behind a yellow tone.  So I much prefer a powder dry shampoo where I can control the amount.  I've also have pretty good results with Oscar Blandi Pronto and Alterna's powder dry shampoo, both of which I gave four stars.  But if you really want a 5 star product, go with Bumble and Bumble.  I definitely don't recommend Powder Play for anyone who wants the benefits of a true dry shampoo.  It simply doesn't absorb the oil and leaves my hair feeling matted and dirtier than when I started. Yuck!!

This dry shampoo powder is pretty good.  It absorbs oil and gives my hair some nice volume.  It also a bigger size for less money than Oscar Blandi Pronto dry shampoo powder, Bumble and Bumble Pret a Powder and Osis Dust It.  I sprinkle a little of the Alterna powder into the roots of my hair in 1/2 partings from ear to ear and then I put some of the powder into my hands and work it into the back.  I then rub the powder in really well, just as if I were using actual shampoo.  I then wait about 15-20 minutes while I put on my makeup.  During this time, the oil absorbs most of the powder.  I then brush out what little powder remains with a 100% boar bristle brush (plastic bristles don't work for this maneuver).  My hair  then looks much cleaner and it smells fresh and has some nice volume to boot.  I've also used it at night when my hair is quite oily and in the morning, the powder has pretty much disappeared and so has the oil. My hair is color treated so washing it too often fades the color and I certainly don't want that to happen, hence the dry shampoo.  I also love Pret a Powder by Bumble and Bumble (I gave it five stars) which is also a dry shampoo powder.  However, there are 2.65 ounces in this Alterna container for $14 (on Amazon) versus 2 ounces in the BB bottle for $29.  So there's no comparison as far as pricing goes.  I'm willing to make a four star product a regular part of my routine because I can get two bottles of Alterna for less than one of BB. So I think you see my point.  In any case, the Alterna product works well and I'm satisfied enough with the results to purchase it instead of BB.  I've also used Oscar Blandi Pronto powder, which works well too and is $22 for a little more than 2 ounces.  So from a dollar standpoint, you can't beat Amazon's price for Alterna so I'll be sticking with it for the foreseeable future.  I've already purchased 4 bottle of Alterna, 3 to have as backups just in case the price goes up.  And the Alterna bottle (and the BB and Pronto) lasts longer than you might think.  It takes very little product to do the job and I like the fact that I can easily control the amount of powder, something that's not really possible with spray dry shampoos, which I find very messy and they always leave my hair dark blond hair with a grayish cast.  I can't imagine that any of them would work for those with medium to dark hair.  This Alterna powder is absorbed pretty quickly and leaves very little residue and what little powder remains is easily brushed out. Alterna also has very little fragrance, which I find somewhat disappointing.  I would prefer it if my hair smelled really fresh and clean, like I just shampooed.  But I guess you can't have everything, lol! (Pret a Powder has very little scent as well.)  All in all, this is a good product and far superior to any spray dry shampoo I've tried (Not Your Mother's Clean Freak, Amika , R&Co, Fructis Volume Extend, Batiste, Beyond the Zone).  It's also superior to some other powder dry shampoos, namely, Beyond the Zone Volumizing Powder and Osis Dust It.  I definitely recommend Alterna, not only for its performance, but also because of the very reasonable Amazon price.

If you have a greenish tinge to your hair as a result of chlorine buildup, this is the perfect shampoo to use to get rid of it.  Chlorine is very damaging to hair and can certainly weaken its structure significantly.  You'll need the chelating effects of this shampoo in order to compensate for the damaging effects of chlorine.  If you swim regularly, you should always wear a swim cap but even if you do this, you might get your hair wet anyway and you could get the horrible greenish tinge, known as "swimmer's hair".  Regular use of this shampoo will keep your hair from changing color.  However, I've found this shampoo somewhat drying when used regularly so be sure you're using a very moisturizing conditioner and that you're using a very hydrating mask every week with heat for about 45 minutes or so.  This shampoo is not suitable for color treated hair because it will definitely fade the color.  For those with colored hair, this is a dilemma:  dyed hair is more susceptible to the off tones created by chlorine but this shampoo is very strong and can definitely fade the color.  The best solution is to wear a swim cap and use this shampoo sparingly, perhaps every third or fourth shampoo.  And you can plan on doing the color more frequently to compensate for the fading.  I also really like Malibu's swimmer's shampoo and treatment, which I find a bit gentler than Ion, just fyi.  However, if you have virgin hair and are plagued by the inevitable greenish chlorine tinge, this is a great product to use.  I definitely recommend it, just be sure you're regularly hydrating your hair well with a nourishing conditioner and mask.

I have very, very sensitive skin so trying to find a sunscreen has been something of a battle.  I use the La Roche-Posay Toleraine moisturizers (the Ultra formula for around my eyes) and the Murad Sensitive Skin Serum but needed something that protects me from the harsh Florida sunshine.  I bought this sunscreen serum at Ulta, hoping that it would be suitable for my highly reactive skin type.  My skin is also somewhat oily so I was looking for something that would soak in well without leaving my skin greasy.  I also needed something that could be used under makeup.  This sunscreen serum is a tad bit greasy and it does take quite a few minutes to completely soak in.  However, it causes no reaction and seems to be fine under makeup as long as I use a mattifying primer (Lorac Porefection).  It only takes two pumps to cover my face and neck, which means this product will last quite some time.  I'm giving it four stars instead of five because I seriously doubt I'll be able to use it during the summer months because it'll simply be too hydrating for me.  If you have drier skin, this may be the perfect formula for you.  As it is now (in the fall of 2015) this sunscreen serum seems to be serving its purpose well enough for me to keep using it.  I do blot my face before applying my foundation because the sunscreen does leave a rather oily finish, even once it has soaked in for 10-15 minutes.  In the summer months, I plan on using Obagi Matte SPF 50 sunscreen which truly is matte can be used well under foundation.  This LRP sunscreen would be an excellent choice for those with dry skin but in the winter months, it'll work well enough for me to justify keeping it.

This bootie is exactly what I was looking for.  They will add some edge and a rock and roll twist to many different outfits.  The quality is excellent and I can't believe they were such a good buy on Amazon. The heel is the perfect height for all day wear and they don't bother my feet at all, even when I wear them for 12 hours at a stretch.  The leopard print is now considered to be a neutral and goes well with black or brown or even khaki.  I'll wear them with black pants (skinnies and trousers alike) as well as denim.  They're such a fun addition to my mostly neutral wardrobe.  I've been looking for a pair just like this for some time and I'm so gladly I finally took the plunge and bought this SE pair.  The quality is excellent and the leather will stand up for years to come. I highly recommend them.

I bought this blush at Sephora and use it daily.  I love the way it goes on so smoothly and blends so easily.  I use a compact blush brush to apply it because it's easier  and then I blend it with the sides of the brush.  This gives me a much smoother finish than using my fingers.  I barely touch the brush to the product because the gelee is so concentrated and it only takes the tiniest amount to get a nice flush of coverage.  This blush also lasts all day, even though I have oily skin.  It barely fades after 8-10 hours and I've found no need to reapply it during the day.  I love products that I can apply once and I'm done for the duration.  This color mimics a natural flush and it gives my neutral complexion some much needed rosiness.  Blush is the one makeup item I simply can't live without because it makes such a huge difference.  I'm thinking about trying the berry shade now that the fall weather is approaching and makeup colors are getting darker and more intense.  I do use foundation and this blush glides right over it without dragging or getting splotchy.  It's simply a superb product and worth every penny.  I think this small container of blush will last me several years.  I've been using it for 6 months and have barely made a dent in it.  It has supplanted all my powder blushes because the clear, rosy color makes me look healthy and like I've just run 5 miles.  This color is a sheer pink wash that would be universally flattering.  It's far superior to other cheek stains I've tried (like Benetint) and much, much easier to apply.  I highly recommend this blush and this color.  It would work for anyone.

I love this dress!! I've wanted a DVF wrap dress for a long time and I finally settled on this animal print wonder.  It has black, white and a beautiful tobacco brown, a combination that I can wear with a lot of different accessories.  The fit is typical of fit and flare styles, with the skirt having a definite A line.  This style is very flattering for most shapes and helps to define my waist, while simultaneously accenting my cleavage.  If I want to be a little more modest, I can add a cami underneath.  I took my regular size and it fit perfectly and doesn't even need a tiny bit of tailoring.  The hemline hits right above the knee, which is the perfect flattering length for most women.  The fabric is really nice and is a medium weight jersey that doesn't wrinkle.  It will be great when I travel and need something that can stand up to suitcase living.  Right now, it's autumn and I'm planning on wearing the dress with black booties, which I will exchange for tights and tall boots once winter sets in.  I'm thrilled that Amazon had this print, which I searched several other DVF sites for and couldn't find.  This is the perfect cool weather dress.  I find dresses easier to wear than pants because all I have to do is throw one on, add some jewelry and I'm done!!  I plan on buying several other DVF wraps including a solid black one, which can be dressed up with statement jewelry and sky high heels or dressed down with flats.  I highly recommend this cool print and DVF dresses in general.  You can definitely tell that this designer knows what's flattering.  This dress is a classic style but still modern and impossibly cool.  I will enjoy wearing it very much.  I saved about $150 buying it on Amazon.  Yipee!

This is a great dress!!  It gives my straight up and down frame a nice hourglass silhouette and is perfect for work or play.  It can be dressed up with red or black (or any other color) statement jewelry and sky high heels or it can be worn with flats, booties or with tall boots.  I love pairing it with red heels, which is a classic combination.  I absolutely love animal prints and this one is perfect.  The fabrication is excellent and it skims the body easily and doesn't show every bump or bulge.  I own several wrap dress copies, but nothing takes the place of an original DVF.  The woman definitely knows how to dress women and what is flattering on almost every body type.  The invention of the wrap dress was a definite coup in women's fashion and I'm so glad I finally own the real thing.  I tried to find a similar print on the Saks website but didn't so I'm glad that Amazon had one that worked for me.  This dress has a double wrap, which cinches in the waist a bit more than the original single wrap design, which is great for someone with a figure like mine.  The deep V can show significant cleavage or the dress can be worn with a camisole underneath for a more modest look.  I ordered my regular size and it fits perfectly and the hemline hits me just above the knee, which is the perfect length.  I don't even need to have the dress tailored in any way.  The sleeves hit just below the elbow which is great for gals my age who are a bit shy about baring their upper arms.  All in all, I'm very pleased with my purchase and I save about $80 by ordering this dress from Amazon.  I'm so happy I finally own a real DVF wrap dress!!  Yay!!

This is a great dress!!  DVF invented the wrap dress and despite the fact that I own several similar dresses, the fit of the original is much more flattering.  This dress is rayon so it skims the body easily and shows just a little cleavage, which is very sexy.  However, this dress is perfect for a work environment and the style is flattering for almost all body types.  DVF invented something timeless that has become a classic style.  They say that imitation is the sincerest form of flattery.  But the imitation wrap dresses I have do not fit like the original.  The Amazon price is about $100 less than other online retailers so I decided to take the chance and buy this dress.  I'm so glad I did.  It can be dressed up with sparkly statement jewelry and sky-high heels or dressed down with flats or tights and boots.  The hemline hits me just above the knee, which is perfect for my 5'7" frame.  I ordered my regular size and it fits perfectly.  I decided to get this dress in basic black because I wanted something that was versatile yet chic and this dress definitely fits the bill.  I've been wanting an original DVF wrap dress for a long time and am so happy to finally own one. It puts all my copies to shame (I might never wear them again, lol!).  I've decided that I'm going to start collecting this style in some of the signature DVF prints, perhaps something black and white or black and red to start with.  Although I don't really have a waistline, this dress gives me the illusion of an hourglass shape and I couldn't be more thrilled with the effects.  All in all, I'm truly ecstatic about my purchase and will look forward to buying another DVF wrap dress soon.  I definitely recommend this style and the DVF brand in general.  The quality is top notch and the fabrication is amazing.  A great purchase!!

If you have light blond hair, you may like this dry shampoo a lot.  If, like me, you're hair is a dark, neutral blond or even medium blond, it's just as noticeable as the white dry shampoos.  Batiste works better than other drugstore spray dry shampoos and if you're especially organized and think ahead, it works best if you spray it on at night and then brush out the residue in the morning.  But if you only have 15-20 minutes, this is not the formula for you.  It does smell rather nice and adds a bit of volume at the roots, but it's just as messy as other spray dry shampoos and that's not what I want.  I've found a dry shampoo that works in a short amount of time, smells fresh and adds a lot of volume:  Bumble and Bumble Pret a Powder.  It's a powder that you sprinkle on the roots (it's easy to control the amount) every 1/2 inch or so.  It absorbs oil while I put on my makeup and what little residue remains is easily brushed out with a 100% boar bristle brush (plastic bristles don't work for this maneuver).  It gives lasting volume and can be used two days in a row without buildup or leaving my hair feeling matted and dirty.  My hair is color treated so I try to shampoo as little as I can and with Pret a Powder, I can skip shampooing for two additional days.  The first day I use it I wear my hair down and it gives me that tousled, sexy bedhead look that's so on trend right now.  The second day I use it, I wear my hair in an updo and it adds a nice amount of grip that makes the updo possible (usually a french twist or a chignon).  Yes, BB is expensive.  However, the 2 ounce size is deceptive.  First, it doesn't contain propellant, which is a significant portion of spray dry shampoo.  Second, it doesn't take much powder to do the job.  I use it twice a week and the bottle is still half full and I purchased it a couple of months ago.  So it's more economical than you might think at first glance.  Of course, buying an inferior product at the drugstore, one you don't like and probably won't use up, is a waste of money.  Wouldn't you want something that meets or exceeds your expectations and wouldn't you be willing to pay a little more for it, rather than wasting $8-$10 on products that don't do what you want?  I would.  If you purchase BB from Sephora, you can always return it if you don't like it.  If you have darker blond hair, this Batiste product won't work any better for you than it has for me.  It leaves a strange residue that's not exactly gray but is a very light yellow.  Yuck!!  I want my hair to look like the color it actually is, not like a wig, lol!  Pret a Powder does everything a dry shampoo is supposed to do so I don't mind paying more for it.  I've tried several drugstore spray dry shampoos (Fructis Volume Extend, Not Your Mother's Clean Freak, Loreal, Dove, Psssst) and not one of them worked well for me (although Clean Freak was the least bad).  Think of all the money I wasted!!  I used each one a couple of times and then ended up throwing the rest away.  I looked at the reviews for each of these products and I think those people who gave  them positive feedback have very low expectations, lol!  Pret a Powder is far superior to any of these sprays and it will be my go-to dry shampoo, even if I have to carefully budget to buy it.  Sometimes high end is simply better and that's true in this case.  If you're a very light blond, then this Batiste dry shampoo will likely give you a pretty good result if you use it overnight.  But if you're blond hair is in the medium to dark range, you'll absolutely hate it.  My suggestion is to save your pennies and try Pret a Powder.  You won't be sorry.

This wax pencil is indispensable to me.  My wayward brow hairs have a mind of their own and refuse to lay flat in a nice line.  I've tried brow gels but they don't have enough hold and they wear off during the day (somehow my brow hairs migrate out of line within a few hours, lol!).  But I've found a routine that works for me and lasts until I take off my makeup at night.  I use Brow Fix generously all over my brows and then I comb the hairs into the desired shape with a spoolie.  I then use the Anastasia brow powder duo in Taupe to fill in and give my brows a nice polished appearance.  The wax doesn't interfere with the powder at all and it goes on very smoothly with a stiff angled brush.  My brows hold their shape through the application of the powder and when I've finished filling in, I go over them again with the spoolie.  If there are some wayward hairs, I simply reapply a little more Brow Fix and that tames them into submission.  I live in Florida, where the humidity can reach ungodly levels but Brow Fix stays put no matter what the weather.  It also makes the powder last all day without smearing, despite the fact that sweating is inevitable.  The only downside to Brow Fix is that it has to be sharpened, which definitely wastes product.  However, if you put it in the freezer for several hours before sharpening, much less product is wasted and you'll get a sharper point.  I don't mind spending more for this wax pencil because I know it works well and is strong enough to tame even the most unruly brows.  You can apply a little bit or a lot and you'll still be able to use powder to fill in your brows (if that's in fact what you want).  The wax is somewhat soft, and is invisible and gives significant hold that stands up to any kind of weather.  I really love this product and can't be without it.  I recommend it to anyone who has brows that need to be tamed once and for all.

This texture spray is available at Target for $10 so don't pay an inflated Amazon seller's ridiculous price!!  It's a decent product and does what it claims to do.  Most dry texture sprays have a matte finish but this one adds shine, which is something I really like.  I have a layered long bob (a lob, lol!) and I've been trying to find something that would define the layers while adding subtle volume at the crown.  This spray definitely does exactly what I've been looking for.  It also adds light, brushable hold that lasts all day.  I've tried AG High and Dry, Fructis Texture Tease, Redken Wind Blown and Beyond the Zone Vamped Up, none of which do exactly what I want.  And they all give my hair a matte finish, which I definitely don't like.  When my hair is clean, it doesn't have the volume it does when it's a little dirtier so I've been using a texture spray to dirty it up a bit and to hopefully get that sexy, bedhead, tousled look that's so popular right now.  These sprays give me varying degrees of bedhead and are good for updos, but a couple of them build up so badly that I can't get a brush through my hair the next day while others are so light that they make no difference at all.  This Umberto spray is different from all of them and  I can definitely use it a couple of days in a row and it also builds volume, all the while adding a nice sheen.  I prefer it to any of the other sprays I've tried.  I think it's definitely worth the $10 price tag and I'm sure you can order it from Target.com so you don't have to pay the exorbitant Amazon price.  It's a really good product and it gives my hair the exact look I'm going for.  It separates the layers, giving them piecey definition and adds volume when sprayed at the roots.  I couldn't ask for more.  It also smells nice, which is a huge plus.  I really like the fact that I can use it several days in a row without making my hair a tangled mess.  And it washes out with no sticky residue.  Who could ask for more?  I'm pleased with my purchase and will make this spray a regular part of my routine.  I recommend it for anyone with a layered cut who is looking for separation, definition and shine.

This is a beautiful pair of boots.  I've been wanting a pair of over the knee boots for some times and finally found this pair when I was out shopping over the weekend.  The leather is gorgeous and soft and there's a wonderful sheen to it that only expensive leather has.  The boots hit me in the perfect spot and they are so soft and luxurious.  They are also very comfortable and I can wear them all day, even when walking a considerable amount, and they don't pinch or negatively affect my tootsies in any way.  I ordered my regular size and they fit perfectly, including the width (I'm a medium).  They are a little difficult to get on at first, until I practiced a few times.  This is my first pair of Stuart Weitzman boots and I'm hoping they last a very long time.  Yes, they were expensive.  But the quality is beyond compare and they are so comfortable that I feel I got somewhat of a bargain.  I've been lusting after these boots for a while and finally bit the bullet and bought them and I couldn't be happier with my purchase.  I recommend them for anyone who wants an over the knee style with a low heel.  They are so chic and fashion forward and I look forward to wearing them when the weather turns cooler.

I like this top coat and have had no issues with the thickness or stringiness other reviewers have noted.  It goes on like a regular top coat but does take an extra few minutes to dry.  My mani typically lasts about a week with a few small chips toward the end.  This top coat has a lot of shine that didn't dull much and it lasted about as long as my regular Seche Vita without a chip.  I wanted to like it more than my regular product because I really like Essie polish but it performed about the same.  So far, the Sally Hansen Gel polishes (with their specific top coat) have lasted the longest for me.  However, I will use up Gel Setter but likely won't buy it again.  I'm pretty happy with Seche Vita and it dries very quickly, which is a good thing because I'm notorious for messing up my mani before it's dry (I'm impatient, lol!).  I even used Gel Setter with an Essie polish just so I could be sure to get the optimum performance from the top coat.  I'm giving this product four stars because I did have a few small chips after four days or so and typically I go about 5 or 6 days with Seche Vita provided I'm not doing many dishes or intensive house cleaning.  I do recommend this top coat but if you're looking for a long lasting gel polish that can be removed easily, go with Sally Hansen instead.  The only reason why I don't use SH exclusively is the limited range of available colors.  But when I want a long lasting polish and I'm in the mood for red or black, I go with SH.  I can go ten days without a chip when I use it, although I do apply the SH topcoat every few days because the shine dulls a bit over time.

This midi dress is exactly what I was looking for.  The fabric is flannel suiting material which will hold up well over time.  I live in Florida and because this dress is lightweight wool, it will be perfect for the winter months here in the south.  The style is very flattering, giving me the illusion of a waist and the fabric skims lightly over my hips.  The length is perfect also, hitting me just below the knee.  The skirt of the dress is rather flowy and has movement, which I love.  I wear a size 8 and that's what I ordered and it fit me perfectly.  Yes, Theory is expensive.  However,the quality is second to none and is on par with luxury brands in my opinion.  I have many Theory items that I've had for many years that still look new and I still wear them all the time.  I buy classic Theory styles that I'll be able to wear for the foreseeable future so the return on my investment is huge.  Theory also has a high resale value.  This dress can be dressed up or down depending on the accessories.  It's equally great with a high chunky heel or tall boots, even booties.  There are so many ways to accessorize it and the style would be flattering on any body type.  Theory is definitely worth the high price tag but Amazon has some great prices so I'll be sure to keep my eyes open.  All in all, I'm pleased with my purchase and will look forward to wearing this dress many times throughout the colder months.  I definitely recommend Theory as a brand and this dress style in particular.  It fits like a dream and creates the perfect hourglass shape.  The fabric is beautiful and the color is rich and deep.  It's worth every penny!!

I ordered this dress from the Nordstrom website but was surprised to find it here on Amazon as well.  I love the classic style of this dress, which will always be in style.  The fabric is a wool blend that has a bit of stretch and the color is a deep black.  I ordered my regular size (8) and it fits perfectly.  The silhouette is very flattering, giving me the illusion of a waistline.  I think this fit and flare style would be universally flattering though.  I have worn Theory for many years and still have numerous classic pieces that still look brand new.  I consider my personal style to be classic and I don't really invest in many trendy pieces so this dress is a really good addition to my wardrobe.  I will enjoy wearing it throughout the fall and winter months.  The length is perfect and it hits just above my knee.  The fabric floats gently over my curves without being too revealing so this style of dress is perfect for work.  Because it's such a simple style, it can be dressed up with heels and statement jewelry or dressed down and made a bit funky when worn with a scarf and booties.  Basic black can also be enhanced with a bright bag or other jewel toned accessories.  There are myriad ways to wear this flattering style of dress and I look forward to exploring them all.  Theory is at the top of my budget but I always get a great return on my investment.  As long as you have a good dry cleaner, Theory pieces will last a long time.  They also have a high resale value.  The quality is second to none and is on par with luxury brands in my opinion.  Yes, this dress is an investment, but it's super flattering on every body type and the fabric is gorgeous and rich.  I definitely recommend Theory as a brand and this dress in particular.  You won't be sorry you invested in such a classic style.  You'll wear it happily for many years to come as will I.

I ordered this velvet blazer in anticipation of the holiday season and plan on wearing it often during the winter months.  The velvet fabric is gorgeous and rich and the color is a very deep black.  I work in a conservative office but this jacket will work with black or gray trousers and a simple cashmere sweater or a blouse.  For holiday parties, it can be dressed up with a sexy camisole underneath.  A velvet jacket is classic and timeless and is therefore always chic and stylish.  I own a considerable number of Theory pieces and I'm always impressed with the quality of the fabric and the attention to detail.  I bought this jacket on the Nordstrom website but was surprised to find that Amazon carries it and a good selection of the brand at such great prices.  I have worn Theory for two decades and think it's well worth the price.  It lasts for many years and has a high resale value. I will enjoy wearing this velvet blazer, which can also be worn with skirts and heels or dressed down and worn with jeans or leather pants and boots.  The style of jacket is timeless and I'll look forward to wearing it for many years.  It's a perfect addition to my wardrobe.  I definitely recommend Theory as a brand and this jacket in particular.

I bought this Theory jacket because I needed something that would dress up jeans and khakis.  I love the quality of Theory clothing and this stretch wool blazer is no exception.  I'm a size 8 and ordered the medium and it fits me perfectly.  It is slightly nipped in at the waist and therefore gives my stick straight frame the illusion of a waistline (which I love).  The bottom edge of the blazer hits right at the hipbone  and the sleeves can be rolled back for a more casual look.  The color is a true navy and is medium in tone.  Right now, it's stylish to wear navy with black so I'll definitely wear this jacket with my black leather trousers and a cashmere sweater.  This jacket is a classic style that can be dressed up or down and is therefore very versatile.  I have worn Theory clothing for two decades and have always appreciated the quality of the fabric and the attention to detail.  I have many Theory pieces that I've had for a long time that still look brand new.  I will definitely wear this jacket a lot and I'm so glad I found exactly what I was looking for on Amazon.  This style is timeless and classic and will therefore always be chic and stylish.  I definitely recommend Theory as a brand and this style in particular.  It's definitely worth the price tag.

I was pleasantly surprised that I actually found a color match in this foundation.  Soft beige works great with my light neutral skin tone and is a perfect match.  I've tried so many drugstore foundations and have never found one that works, so for many years I've shelled out obscene amounts of money for high end products.  But this foundation has so many of the features of my favorite high end foundations and performs so well, that's it's hard for me to believe it's so inexpensive.  It goes on smoothly over primer (Lorac Porefection) and blends easily with my Real Techniques sponge.  It is also buildable so if you want more coverage, apply a thin layer and then repeat the process.  It covers any redness I have and gives me a nice glow, just like high end products.  I have very sensitive skin and I have to say that this Rimmel foundation causes no reaction at all and doesn't have a strong fragrance.  This foundation also has SPF 15, which isn't much, but at least it's something.  I set this foundation with loose powder (Urban Decay Naked or ELF HD powder) which keeps the shine away for several hours, although I do end up using a blotting paper or two during the day (I have to do this with every foundation).  I would say my skin is normal with some minor oiliness in the T zone.  This foundation also does not oxidize (turn darker or orange) like a lot of drugstore products.  All in all, I'm pleased with my purchase and am really shocked that this foundation is so inexpensive.  I haven't had any luck at all with any of the other drugstore foundations I've tried and had really given up and decided that I had no choice but to fork out big time cash for high end products.  Although I do like the high end foundation I'm using at the moment, I also really like this Rimmel foundation.  I find myself reaching for Rimmel more often  and if there were a blind test, I'm not sure I could tell the difference between the two.  I'm giving Rimmel four stars instead of five because I do have some oil breakthrough sooner than with the high end foundation, but that is the only difference and I can definitely live with that.  This foundation would work for anyone who has normal to dry skin but I don't think it's suitable for oily skin.  It has good coverage and imparts a nice glow.  I definitely recommend it.

I bought this foundation on a whim because I've tried nearly every other drugstore foundation out there and I thought, why not?  It was really cheap but the quality is much better than the price point implies.  And strangely enough, it does match my light, neutral skin tone really well.  I do use rather expensive foundation but I prefer to conserve it so if I'm just running to the grocery store or the dry cleaners, I'll use this Rimmel foundation instead.  But it goes on just as smoothly as high end products and it blends easily with a Real Techniques sponge.  I do use a primer (either Smashbox or Maybelline Baby Skin) so that may have something to do with it.  This foundation wears well for many hours before I have to blot my T zone but it doesn't oxidize (which makes foundation turn dark or orange) which is something that other drugstore foundations I tried have done.  This foundation is so inexpensive that it may make you wonder how it could perform on par with $50 products.  Well, good makeup products can be found at all price points, it's just the experimenting that gets expensive.  If you buy an expensive foundation from Sephora or Ulta, you can return it if you don't like it.  Drugstores don't have the same policy, so you're pretty much taking a chance with your money because if it doesn't work out, you can only pass it on to someone else, or pitch it in the trash.  And if you're really searching diligently, the cash can add up.  Most drugstore foundations are around $10 and if you try 5 that don't work out, there's your $50!!  But this Rimmel foundation not only matched my hard to match neutral skin tone, it also performed really well.  And this was very surprising.  I will keep this product in my foundation arsenal because it works.  And I should mention that my skin is super sensitive, especially to fragrance, but I had no reaction at all with this foundation.  My skin type is normal with some oiliness in my T zone and this foundation lasted well all day, although I did set it with loose powder but had to use some blotting papers after several hours (which is no big deal).  All in all, I'm thrilled with my purchase and can't believe that I actually discovered a drugstore foundation that works as well as high end products.  I definitely recommend it.

I use the Toleraine lotion for normal skin and it works wonders and doesn't cause a reaction of any kind.  After using a retinol product more than a year ago, my skin is now super sensitive and all of my regular products cause red blotches and swelling under my eyes.  But Toleraine lotion and Ultra do not do this at all.  I use the Ultra product as an eye cream, because, after all, an eye cream is just a heavier moisturizer and the Ultra formula works really well for this purpose.  I apply Toleraine lotion after using Murad Sensitive Skin Serum, which hydrates and helps reduce redness.  I then use the Toleraine Ultra cream around my eyes and let these products soak in for about 5 minutes before applying Anthelios SPF 50 Serum.  I live in Florida so a sunscreen is an absolute necessity and my regular brand breaks me out so I'm now using Anthelios and haven't had any reaction so far (although it's a bit greasy in my opinion).  However, the Ultra cream does eliminate the dry scaly patches I have under my eyes and now thanks to this routine, my skin remains clear and free of redness.  Toleraine products work as well or better than the prescriptions I was given by my dermatologist.  If you have dry sensitive skin, the Ultra cream is the perfect product for you. It's thick and rich and for my eyes, I only need half a pump.  I apply it on my lids and under my eyes and it also takes care of the dryness on my lids and makes them much more smooth.  Yes, it's expensive.  However, if you have sensitive skin you've likely tried many different products that have caused a reaction of one kind or another and spent a considerable sum in the process.  I've had this dispenser of Ultra cream for many months and there's still a considerable amount left.  If you're using it for your entire face (it would be especially great in the wintertime) you would likely use it up faster.  But when you consider all the money you've likely wasted searching for products that are gentle enough, you can now be assured that this cream will hydrate without causing a reaction of any kind.  If it works for my hyper sensitive skin, it will work for anyone.  I highly recommend it.

My skin is super sensitive after using a retinol product more than a year ago.  Before this, my skin wasn't sensitive at all and I usually had no reaction to skincare product whatsoever.  However, I now get red blotches and swelling under my eyes if I use my regular products.  So I had to find products specifically for super sensitive skin.  I found this Murad serum at Ulta and thought I would give it a try.  It's very light and not greasy, probably because it has a generous amount of aloe in it.  It definitely hydrates nicely and helps to minimize redness.  I use it after washing my face with Olay Sensitive Skin Cleanser (which is awesome btw) and I then use La Roche Posay Toleraine Daily Moisturuzer and the heavier Toleraine cream around my eyes.  I let all this soak in and then use La Roche Posay Anthelios SPF 50 Serum as a final step.  Thankfully. my skin has had no reaction to any of these products and I think they make for a good regimen.  The Murad serum feels nice and cool on my face and it dries quickly, leaving no sticky or oily residue.  It hydrates well and leaves my face feeling soft and looking less red.  It's a great initial step in my routine and I will definitely repurchase it.  I don't know whether Murad makes other sensitive skin products (this is the only one that my Ulta carries) but I will definitely check up on it.  If you have very sensitive skin, I highly recommend this serum.

This fantastic powder definitely makes my hair look cleaner and absorbs excess oil well and imparts a nice, fresh scent.  It's better than any of the spray dry shampoos I've tried and doesn't leave a grayish cast in my dark blond hair.  The powder absorbs oil in about 15 minutes and if you use a scrubbing motion (just like washing your hair) there will be very little visible powder to brush out.  I don't use a lot of this powder, in fact, I think the trick is not to overdo it but I've found that if my hair is very dirty and oily, I get much more volume using this product.  If my hair is too clean, I don't get much volume at all, hence the four stars.  I did have to make the opening in the bottle a bit bigger because nothing was coming out, but that is small negative thing and shouldn't influence your purchase of this product in the least.  I widened the opening with a pair of small scissors and from then on, it worked fine.  This trial size is quite small but it doesn't take much product to do the job so it will last longer than it might at first appear.  I've already purchased the full size and have used it quite often (several times a week) over the last several months and I have nearly half a bottle left.  Yes, it's expensive, but it's so far superior to spray dry shampoo I can't begin to tell you.  Sprays are really messy and the white powder is always a telltale sign that I've used dry shampoo, something I'd rather people not know just by looking at my hair.  I can never get all the white residue out no matter how much I brush with a boar bristle brush (plastic bristles definitely don't work for this maneuver, just fyi).  But Pret a Powder is different.  The powder brushes out easily even though not much remains after 15 minutes or so.  And it definitely makes my hair a bit fluffier to boot.  All in all, I'm really pleased with this product and definitely recommend it for those people who are fed up with spray dry shampoo.  I've also tried other volumizing powders (Beyond the Zone and Osis Dust It) and neither one really took care of the oil or created much lift.  Pret a Powder is better than any other similar product I've used and for me, it's definitely worth the price.  It's also light enough for fine hair and definitely won't weigh it down as long as you use it with a light hand.  I'm happy to go another day or two without washing my hair, which saves me tons of time in the morning.  It makes my hair look fuller and cleaner and that's the whole point, right?

This is a nice bootie and the low heel means I can wear them all day without worrying about my poor feet.  They were a great buy, priced twice as much on the Aldo website.  They will be great with a leather skirt and with pants and jeans as well.  I like the Chelsea cut and the mod 60s feel.  They fit fine, which is unusual for Aldo shoes because oftentimes they don't come in half sizes, which is what I need (8.5) and the width is fine as well (my width is medium).  I will wear them with socks as well as with tights and they'll be great both ways.  I only wish they were real leather, however, the faux leather looks real and they will be better in winter weather because salt doesn't stain vegan leather like it does the real thing.  All in all, I'm pleased with my purchase and these booties will be great for work because I can't wear heels for more than a few hours and I work long days so something with minimal height works best for me.  I recommend these booties for anyone wanting to channel a little bit of the 60s cool girl vibe.

This spray hardly made any difference at all.  It's super light so it might be great for texturizing really fine hair but for me, it didn't do much of anything at all.  I like Redken Wind Blown much better and adds considerable grip and heft and gives my hair that tousled, bedhead look that is so trendy right now.  AG does add some subtle texture and it would likely be fine for adding texture the 2nd day when there is already considerable product in my hair because it's so light.  However, it's not any better than Fructis Texture Tease, which is a fraction of the price (although there's not much product in the can, unfortunately).  High and Dry does allow me to get a brush through my hair, whereas Wind Blown really doesn't.  A few sprays of WB and my hair has that piecey separation that works so well for layered hair.  High and Dry would be great for updos, adding just enough grip to clean hair to make it easy to style.  All in all, I received this can of High and Dry gratis from a friend, so I can't return it, but I'm not sure it'll be my texturizing spray of choice.  I really prefer Redken Wind Blown because just a few sprays and my hair is bedroom sexy and has that beachy texture everyone wants these days.  I think High and Dry is OK but I'm not planning on purchasing it.  If you really want volume and texture, try Wind Blown instead.

This spray doesn't do much at all.  I was looking for a dry texturizing spray that would add substantial heft and grip to my layered lob but this isn't it.  It doesn't add much texture at all, even when I spray a generous amount and it certainly doesn't add any of the promised volume.  It also has a very strong scent.  I have no idea who would use this spray because it doesn't really "do" anything.  I much prefer Redken Wind Blown which adds tons of texture in just a few spritzes and gives me the sexy, tousled bedhead look #Iwokeuplikethis.  I was looking for something a bit lighter than Wind Blown but this AG spray is no better than Fructis Texture Tease and is certainly way more expensive (although you do get more product in the AG can).  I consider this product to be a failure, at least for my needs.  I will try to use it again when my hair is clean and my waves are freshly curled to see whether I can get that slept-in texture that's so trendy right now.  But if the second go around fails, it's going back to Ulta.  There's no way I'm paying $22 for a product that will simply sit unused on my bathroom counter.  I will simply buy another Wind Blown, which seems to work better for me.  I do recommend this spray if your hair is really fine because it's super light and will probably add the perfect amount of grip to finer hair than mine.  As for me, I'll give it one more go and if I change my mind for the better, I'll update this review.

This root concealer works really well for me.  It's the perfect neutral dark blond, which will blend with many different tones of blond hair.  I was looking for a product that would hide my gray and darker virgin hair which begin to show through two weeks after coloring. I've tried several other root concealers but none of them was really satisfactory.
