Sometimes I don't know the questions to ask, and by thumbing through, finding myself enjoying the puzzle and quest, this book provides a source of discovery.All translation is interpretation.  If you don't have a strong facility with the original languages a concordance like this one provides the closest way you'll find to get at original terms, how they are used, and how the translators use them in different contexts. By having a dictionary as well (though a basic one that also involves interpretation), this provides an excellent starting point and overall resource for most general needs.

I have all sorts of electronic tools. Laptops, tablet, smartphone, and so on. I'm in that middle age range, I suppose, where I'm very comfortable with technology but still like paper.I'm a professor, so this calendar fits my patterns nicely. It has what I need without distractions. It looks professional, so that when I pull it out I don't feel, or look, like I'm in junior high.  I'm using this to keep up with my admittedly unique schedule, while also using it to track my time with other various tasks.  Accountability for my various goals.  I've not used a planner like this for a long while, but I'm excited about this one because it's so straightforward and immediately useful.  Small things I like, having 2 bookmarks and the holiday schedule.  Holidays always seem to catch me off guard in my planning, so this has helped me plan far ahead. It's the little things that add up, and this adds up to a lot.

I begin with a qualification, this is not a review of Habermas's ideas. I will admit to finding more affinity with Luhmann than Habermas, even as I find Habermas essential for understanding not only contemporary sociological trends but indeed his influence runs deep into many other fields.This current text primarily explores Habermas's perspectives on the European Union, it is an argument, a plea, and the standard moral posturing. In effect, the arguments utilized a logical and thoughtful combination of encouragement, insight, and shaming. It is his life's work applied to what may be the most direct application of his thought in what is, and questionably will remain as, the European Union. Although he is reaching an advanced age, he seems as sharp as ever, while decidedly interested in his legacy.As such, this book would be of interest to various concerns. Those interested in Habermas would certainly find this text worthwhile, for a recent example of his work as he enters into his twilight. Those interested in European politics, recent history and underlying political theory, will find this an excellent resource. And those interested in the broader application of sociology, especially as there is an increasing tension with the approaches from the late modern era as expressed in postmodern contexts.As I mentioned, while I'm not ultimately convinced of Habermas's theory or his arguments here, he is the leading edge of the discussions even still, a powerhouse that has made claim for sociology, and with it other social sciences, to have a reforming and ethical task in our societies. It's mostly related to issues around the core theme of the EU, with a couple of interesting essays with a focus on Jewish contributions: an essay on postwar German Jewish philosophers and sociologists, and an essay on Martin Buber in particular.The book itself is quite readable, if you are used to Habermas or other such theorists. The translation is straightforward. Though I don't have the original German to compare it with, the sentences retain a fair amount of academic German feel in style and structure. This means that the book could gain from being edited in terms of style and readability, making it more approachable to an English reading audience, but that is another layer of editing that such texts rarely receive.The content itself is generally more grounded in application and context, making it relatively accessible. As such, it's also a good starting place for Habermas, with his other works providing more theoretical construction. Not that this text lacks such, but it is not the main focus.

With two young kids in the house, a 3 year old and a 10 month old, there are a lot of smells that accumulate.  Not all of them are sweet and nice.We have long used Febreze on our couches, so came into this with a lot of hope. Not disappointed.The aroma is pretty strong at first, though it's also long lasting and spreads around, so don't judge it based on right when you spray it. My wife is much more sensitive to smells these days (sensory overload as she calls it) than I am, so she reacted a fair bit more strongly when I was trying it out for the first time.  She was sitting in the room and exclaimed how strong it smelled. That being said, yesterday she asked me to spray in our daughters room while they were out at the store.So we really like this. It does the job it promises.  I've learned a little goes a long way and that I should use it when my wife is gone so that all  a much more balance scent is left in the air after a little wait and we can all enjoy the benefits.  The aroma is perfect for us, as it doesn't add extra aroma but simply leaves the house smelling clean. Ah... the smell of clean...

For the price, this is a very useable and sturdy way to store hand tools, like chisels. I also have a couple screwdrivers, making this, for me, a go to kit for my smaller hand tools. Easy to manage, easy to store, easy to bring along. Nothing fancy. There's leather on the inside, where edges would scrape at the material, adding extra protection for both the roll and the tools. Very straightforward and works just fine for my purposes.

I got this as a party game for my son's first birthday. He's worthy. That's a little ways off, so I had to, of course, open it up and test it out. Immediate fun. Needs 3 AAA batteries which aren't provided, so make sure you have those on hand. Once installed, this hammer really is great. It's a built in party game. The hammer itself is made of a thick foam, so you can hit it on a variety of surfaces without worrying about breaking the toy or what you're hitting. It really takes a hard swing to get the highest score, so this isn't just for kids. Yet, it's not intimidating for kids. My 3 year old daughter was able to get some mid-level scores, which makes me think there's a combination of the swinging motion and the impact that ranks the total points.Good sounds, with a dramatic sound that turns on, and one when it's totaling the score. I wish there was a small sound when it was ready to smash again. Sometimes I would go too quick and it wouldn't register.It comes with a target on the back of the box, but as the hammer was a little tricky to get out, I ended up tearing the target a fair bit in the process. It's supposed to be cut out. Would have been a nicer to have a target included in the box, something plastic that would last. That's a minor frustration for something we didn't really need.For the fun and for the price this is a great toy. Great for parties or to have around. Good for stress relief too at the office or elsewhere. Though, of course, keep an eye on kids (or feisty adults) who use this, the foam is a bit inviting to try to get a high score using a friends arm or head.Oden definitely recommends this.

La Cuisine is an Irish company, with this Cast Iron Casserole noted as designed in Ireland, but likely produced elsewhere (China?). The quality is there regardless, with the color a deep blue that fades into black. It is heavy, but it's cast iron, so of course it's heavy. I didn't notice any ragged or sharp edges on the lid or elsewhere, with everything fitting together nicely and quite manageable to use on the stovetop or in the oven.As far as cooking, it delivers as only high quality cast iron can. Even cooking throughout and offers a wide variety of cooking options and dishes. After opening the box and handing it I knew this is likely going to outlive me. After using it, not only will it be something that lasts, it will be treasured. Highly recommend

We've had a selection of blackout curtains over the years, both for insulation and for light blocking. The latter is are current most important consideration as we live in a place that has a lot of outside nighttime light coming in. With young kids, early bedtimes, and late sunsets, it's also a consideration.That being said, these are high quality curtains. Soft in feel, nicely colored, though a little more vibrant green than what I'm seeing in the picture. But that washes out a bit with a light on, so it looks good and ends up matching the decor in my daughter's room a bit better.  It blocks the light really well.  I'm not as big of a fan of the grommet style, as some light gets in through there, but that's not a big deal. To keep light from coming in from the sides we used a darkening wrap rod.Definite thumbs up from me, and I was admittedly wary at first. It's the curtains we're keeping up in my daughters room, replacing her older blackout curtains, so that's the best review possible.

Our bedroom windows are west-facing, so we get late afternoon and evening sun.  In the summer, this becomes an issue because our 3 year old daughter goes to bed around 7, and it's still bright outside.  We also have a neighbor who likes to, for whatever reason, to keep a flood light on all night in their yard. It's not pointed at us, but there's enough light that pours our way to keep it from getting dark.  I like to sleep in the dark. Weird, I know.So, we've invested in blackout curtains over the last few years, and have seen the variety in style and quality. These are a good set.  It's really more of a "milk chocolate" color, a bit lighter than other chocolate colored products we own, but it's pleasant, and matches enough.  The nickel grommets are pretty bright, more so than they appear in the picture.The key is they block out the light, and they do a good job of that.  These are shorter than the ones we've been using, and that fits our windows better. The width is great, and as you're getting two panels, the price is very reasonable.The material is soft and feels like curtains, so doesn't stand out as being different in that way, so these are really win-win-win for us.

I'm a little handy, but not that handy.  Needed, and wanted for a long while, a new faucet but was a little intimidated by the process.  I've done other repairs, so no real need for concern, but anything new is still a bit uncomfortable.  No concerns at all here. Everything you need except a few tools and sealant/sealing tape is included, with the faucet itself the various attachments, including a drain plug.  Instructions are in that "no words but descriptive diagram" pattern that works no matter your language, but is a bit more confusing than you'd wish.  Even still, it didn't take too long of staring and deciphering to get at what was next.  And then it works, it just works, and works so nicely, and with style.The warranty covers leaks and drips "to the  original consumer for as long as the original consumer purchaser owns their home." So, a limited lifetime warranty for that with a five year warranty for other parts.  Now to get one for the other bathroom...

After a couple years of low rain and a lot of other concerns, my lawn had fairly departed. I started a rebuilding phase, with reseeding and getting it looking good, then realized it wasn't just the grass I planted.  I found this turf builder a great solution and am repeating it this year as a way of keeping my lawn healthy and what I want it to be.  I'm a renter, so I'm not going to invest a lot in a lawn, but I have young kids, and a bit of pride, so I'm wanting it to stay healthy into Spring and Summer. This gives it a great start and something I'm using again and again.

This is an easy to assemble option for use with a trundle bed or as a rolling bed/cot for other places.  As I said it was easy to assemble, with clear instructions and tools included.  I actually went backwards and got this before the daybed frame, as we needed a useable frame for my daughters room, underneath her bunk bed and I wanted to get something that would persist in use.Use is fine, if you're using underneath a daybed, watch the height, otherwise the comfort depends on the quality of mattress. We have a foam twin mattress pad that we pull out for using this, part of the bedding we add.  My only question is durability, but that will obviously take some time to assess.  Very pleased so far.

Very useful and interesting text, written for a more general audience, making it quite useful for college intro classes or general surveys or church discussions.It is worth noting that this 2013 edition is in English, as the cover image reflects, not in French as the title description notes.

Got this for a Sony Nex-5T.  Thought it would be great (especially as it said it would fit).  The rigid case was larger than expected, the lens part of the case is centered in the middle, offset for my camera, meaning that the camera could fit, but at a weird angle and very awkwardly.  Overall, not something that worked either functionally or aesthetically for us.

Relatively easy to attach with instructions that give steps for a variety of different attachments. The blades are packed loose in the box, so no extra packaging to deal with (which is great!), the blades themselves have a plastic sheath so are protected while being shipped from nicks or damage. It wasn't quite as smooth as others I have used to put on, but with a bit of a tug there was a satisfying click, and all was fine.  The blade slides nice across the windshield, no streaking at all, even when my windshield was a little dirty and I was testing it with windshield spray.  In a light rain, worked perfectly fine.Here in southern California we get the occasional heavy rain alternating with dry and sometimes hot. Summers get very warm here in the valley, so the test for me is how well these will hold up over time.  I'll provide an update if problems arise.These two packs are meant to provide a complete set for a given make/model.  There are some complaints about the sizing guide on the website. I recommend looking in your car manual or other authoritative source and going by that.

We live in SoCal, eastern suburbs of LA County. It gets hot here.  It never gets cold, though it does get cooler at times, just never cold. My lawn took a beating in the drought this last year and so even as we get a little rain, there are some patches (well, about half my small back yard) that there's no growth going to happen.  We rent, so I'm not interested in invested in anything, but I want a decent lawn for my kids and myself.Scotts seed has worked great for me before, and so I happily am trying out the Bermuda seed. The bag itself is pretty small, but well packed. It's about 50% seed in weight, and about 50% water smart plus fertilizer coating.  So, it absorbs moisture and has about 3% nitrogen content.For re-seeding, it will cover about 1,000 square feet, about a third of a tennis court. New lawn, bare ground, it coves about 1/8 of a Tennis court. So this size works if you have a small lawn area or just some patches along the way. I have a very patchy small lawn, so this works perfect for my needs.The seed works well, and I'll update this later after a couple months to talk about longer term results

Don't tell my dentist, I don't floss regularly.  List an excuse, I've used it and still do.  I get the importance, so it's not a matter of that.  It's just that I don't do it.  I don't like it.  I don't like the whole process.That being said, I'm the perfect market for this.  I love it.  That's about as clear as I can get.  It's great. So easy to use.  Charge it up, the charge lasts from 11 days to many weeks (depending on the setting). You can have it go 1 burst, 2 burst, or 3 burst. Put it between a couple teeth, press the button on top, there you go. Fill it with water or mouthwash. It comes with a small bottle of mouthwash.  Very easy to hold and easy to manage. Though, my interest in watching it work the first couple times resulted in some splashes on the bathroom mirror.  It shoots a quick burst of air mixed with liquid, and that's it.  My mouth has never felt more clean, that's the truth.I like gadgets and tend to use a gadget if it makes things easier and more fun. This really is a quick and easy and thorough method. It's a little pricey, to be sure, compared to regular floss.  But, it's something that I'll actually use versus regular floss. My teeth and gums are worth it.

I'll admit it. I don't like eating my vegetables. I'm already tall and strong, so the traditional arguments don't help. Except, well, there's my high blood pressure that's nagging at me if I don't keep on top of it with diet and exercise. Those servings of greens become necessary. But I don't want ta eat my peas!This fits in nicely to my goals. I want to keep my weight down in general, and take probiotics and fiber pills as well. Now, every morning, I get a glass full of veggies and so much other goodness. The price is high, higher than I'd want to add to my budget, but I realize this doubles up some of the other stuff I'm taking.The taste is about what I'm used to with powdered drink mix. There's a slight berry taste that is fine, but mostly it is a bit bland. No sugar added means it's not going to taste like soda or juice. If you're having the normal amount of sugar for our society, that's too much anyhow, so it takes a bit of time to get one's sweet tooth more sensitive. I wouldn't say it's necessarily good, but it's not bad. Fairly neutral. No vegetable taste at all, however, which is a boon for me.What one serving provides: 20g of protein, 6 servings of greens (yay!), 50% daily vitamins (so it's not replacing a multi-vitamin), 25% daily fiber, 1.5g omega3 (so no more fish oil supplements), a whole lot of antioxidants (equivalent to 3.3 cups of blueberries), a daily amount of probiotics, all at 160 calories. This is meant for providing a balanced nutrition to the day, and it really offers a lot in one serving.Worth the cost? Depends on how you're getting all this offers. For me, the price is high but since I'll drink this daily but very rarely get enough greens on a given day, it's a good investment for my health.

Interesting, and well written, but closer to "extraordinary possible origins of things that I quickly researched."  It's hard with a book like this to fact check everything without spending significantly more time than I have, but I know a few things about certain things, and those things tended to have details wrong.  Big things? Maybe not, but enough small details to make me question the veracity of the topics I'm not familiar with.  Some issues might be differences of opinion based on murky history (I thought the first section on superstitions had a fair amount of supposition presented as fact), some minor things that are clearly wrong but not a huge deal (Tertullian was not a priest, he was possibly a lawyer and certainly a lay leader in the early church).  These add up over the course of the book to give that element of distrust, which ruins a book of trivia for me. It's not rigorously researched and reflects something fairly below even a wikipedia level of accuracy. It's a bit like having a lot of good facts for a few pages then throwing in something like "Did you know that War and Peace was originally titled "War. What is it Good For?" (credit to Seinfeld for that reference)A 'fact' that would make you sound stupid if you're talking to people who know the field.  But the trouble is that it's not clear which fits the fact category and which are "factish." Maybe a lot of this is really authoritative, but introduce a bit of clear doubt and it's not clear what the percentage is between research and "let's run with this version because no one is going to check." Indeed, wikipedia is probably a much better resource, as the mistatements and misfacts (can I make up that word) would have been edited clean.  If I can't be sure something is actually the case, then it's not really worth it to me to find out someone's opinions. This book is sitting in a living room with Panati while he tells you what he thinks about things and stuff.  He's a smart guy, very knowledgeable, but not quite as knowledgeable as he thinks. There are clearly areas that are much more authoritative, it's just a mixed bag.  I wish I didn't spend the money on it.  Which makes me sad because I love trivia books like this.

These cost a bit more money than other diapers, but in my mind the cost is providing a noticeably better product.  We have 2 kids in diapers, a baby and a toddler. With my toddler using these.First, they cover more surface than pullups, providing better overall protection. Yet they are lighter weight, so the material is better.  One might expect problems with a lighter/thinner material, but no problems here. No leak through or soak through at all, even overnight.My daughter thought these are fun and likes the design. So, everyone's goals are being met!

Great map of the world. Laminated and has metal protecting the four holes from nail tears.  Fun pictures that are mostly geographic specific.  The stickers are a nice addition, but are pretty vague and unless your child is a world traveler, not really going to find a lot of use, except for the places they want to go. The map is a little small to highlight specific sections in a state for instance (we make a lot of trips on the West Coast of the US).  That being said, it's a great way to talk about different countries and the map in general, getting your kids used to geography and even serving as a handy search and find.  Appropriate for advanced toddlers to pre-teens

We've gone through a selection of point and shoots over the last 5 years. A problem has developed over the last few years as cameras that are great for outdoor shots or provide a nice image if well-set up just don't catch those moments of toddler delight.  With a new baby in the house as of last summer, we realized that we were taking a lot of pictures with only a small percentage turning out.  Time to step up. I have a budding interest in photography, with some friends who are professionals, so I looked at the DSLR possibilities. This one went on sale over Christmas, and I made a quick decision to go with this NEX-5TL instead.  I regretted it at first. I liked the idea of the control of a DSLR, going to the next level of learning and photography with it.  This one?  Well, the day I got it all regrets were gone.The pictures are astounding.  Low-light pictures come out so very clear, with great color and focus. We don't even use the flash.  Great for action shots and portraits.  The small size means that it's easy to bring, the best camera to use is the one you have with you after all, and having had larger cameras before, leaving them at home more often than not, this is a great bonus. The camera can be set to recognize specific faces and focus on those faces, a great feature when we're taking pictures of our two kids a lot as they move around or just look cute in less than ideal lighting.My wife and I also take this camera out on dates and other outings, so have made a surprising amount of use of the selfie-tilting LCD.  I had a camera with a rotating LCD and was sad to see that go, but with the selfie feature and the above your head tilt, this really fills almost almost every circumstance I needed it.This is an astounding camera for our needs. Small enough to bring, powerful enough to get shots in all sorts of situations and conditions.  The only critique I have is the touch-screen, which isn't very sensitive so usually takes more work than hitting the buttons. That's a very minor issue for me in light of the overall quality. Without reservation I recommend this camera especially to families who want to take a lot of high quality pictures without having to spend a lot of time setting up the perfect shot.

I'm a fan of fans. I get hot pretty easy, like a cool breeze on my face, like the movement of air around me.  Even when it's cold, I don't like still air. Which has led to a fair amount of fans in my life.  Desk fans, box fans, ceiling fans, window fans, floor fans, I've got 'em.Fans serve a variety of purposes for me, some provide noise (I'm addicted to fan white noise at night), some move air, some keep me cool.  I woldn't have though much of a USB fan, as I've had camping fans that have variable success.  Fans seem to be either too much or too little, too big or too weak. Making for awkward placement.This one hits a sweet spot. It's pretty quiet, so not going to address white noise needs. But it's a perfect size, sits very nicely on a stack of books.  I have a Verilux Tazza Productivity Desk Lamp that has a USB socket, so this plugs nicely into that and they sit together (this saves me using more power from my computer).  The speed is adjustable from a minimum to a maximum, turning the knob allows for precise control more like a dimming switch (not just 3 settings like most fans).  I wish the fan had more tilt on it, it doesn't really tilt much, that's why I have it on a stack of books.  That's my only complaint.I also like this as a potential camping or car fan, anywhere you can plug in a USB. So, this might get a lot of use. I'll update if there are any developing issues or short life span.

Our place isn't big, but it's thin and long, with our router on one end of the house and the master bedroom on the other.  When we shut the door the signal doesn't drop right away but gets iffy.  In the garage, which is even further past our bedroom, the signal really degrades. I'm currently setting up the garage to do some various work projects, some on my laptop (it's quieter in there) and others using power tools. For the latter, I've been using online guides, so would love to have a steady signal.This provides a great solution for me.  Easily set up and adds a stronger signal at the end of the house. I can unplug it easy and put it in the garage for an even better signal when I need it there.  It's not as potent as my main router, either in speed or signal quality, but I don't need it to be.  My only minor frustration is that I wish I go the wireless AC speed, as that matches my router. My laptop doesn't actually pick up that signal, so it's not a big deal at all, with the wireless N working just fine for what I need.  Future laptops will likely all have the faster speed capability so paying a bit extra now might save some bother in the future.

My almost 3 year old saw this and loved it right away.  When we opened it up and I showed her the pieces and how it worked, she eagerly took it and played with it, then we played together with this set later that day.  Definitely a winner with her.Two girl bears, not a boy and a girl like I assumed for some reason.  The pieces have a great amount of variety, with fun colors and prints, suggesting a lot of different styles.  Mostly old school, with most of the accessories reflecting decades past, so this set is new but feels classic, like it's something my wife had when she was young.The box is good, with a plastic cover  that slides on and off, and different sections for the pieces.Some minor complaints.  First, the pieces aren't sized that well. Some are too big and don't fit with other piece that well.  Want a bear to have a scarf? That and shoes are all she's wearing.  The magnets are a bit weak, and so the bears aren't really going to go on any pretend adventures once they get gussied up.  And the hats, because of sizing and weak magnets, don't really stick at all.  No layering is possible as the magnets only work if they're directly on the bear.Overall, for the price, this is a fun set. Longer lasting than paper, more durable and nicer than plastic, but with a few drawbacks that I noticed but my daughter didn't seem to be bothered by. She loves it and that's what counts.

My third book is officially getting published tomorrow.  I don't exactly write for a living--my books don't sell that well--but I do write for a life.  I love writing, finding it a joy and a balm to my soul, though one that I took a while to embrace.Back when I finished grad school and decided that I didn't want to go into the field that I was educated for, I started to write, every day. And I read.  I read an essay by Jack London, I don't even remember which it was, and he mentioned how he would get up every morning and write a 1000 good words each day.  He could often write more, and early in his career he went well beyond this, only he figured that 1000 words made for a good goal and habit, a target that once reached could allow for a sense of accomplishment.  And 1000 words, he found, was what he could depend on to be good, more and they started to get suspicious.I've fallen out of the writing habit for the last couple of years--the new book was finished in early 2013--with other responsibilities clamoring for my time. Now I'm getting back to it, and thought about London's pattern again, the one that worked for me.  I saw Sarah Stodola's book and realized there were a lot more models out there.  I've read a fair amount of books by writers about writing.  Lamott and Sol Stein the most influential among them.  But not every writer writes about writing, so one is left wondering.Stodola provides a very welcomed study into the writing lives of 18 writers, from different eras and different styles.  London isn't mentioned, but I'm already familiar with his habits, so that's not a loss to me.  Over the course of the book, I learned and I listened and I watched as these successful writers sat as models for analysis.  Not really analysis, I guess, more description.  Stodola has done some wonderful research and provides a straightforward picture of her subjects.  Which I appreciate.  Some writers might want to intrude too much, Stodola is respectful to those who are giants in writing and masters in the craft.  I'm not as much of a fan of Stodola's own style, but that is a personal bias, as this is a very capable book.I gained some good tips, was affirmed in some of my own habits (they did that too?!), and sometimes had to come to terms with the very different personalities than my own, whose habits just wouldn't fit my personality or life.I definitely recommend Process if you're looking to get a substantive study of how masters pursue their craft on a daily and project basis. It's something I'm going to read again and again over the years.

Installed this in my 2010 Dell Inspiron 9100 desktop. Had taken my old network card out a while ago to make room for a better video card and have been using a TP-LINK TL-PA4010KIT AV500 Nano Powerline Adapter Starter Kit, which has been working fine with my Verizon FIOS connection.  I had the Verizon wireless N router, so the adapter kit was getting me faster speeds than wireless signal. I got a TP-LINK Archer C8 AC1750 Dual Band Wireless AC Gigabit Router, 2.4GHz 450Mbps+5Ghz 1300Mbps, 1 USB 2.0 Port & 1 USB 3.0 Port, IPv6, Guest Network in September which I connected to the Verizon router (while turning off the signal of that router).  So, I had AC speed in the air, and no way to take advantage. The next month, I got a  TP-LINK Archer T4U AC1200 Wireless Dual Band USB Adapter and have been using that in my desktop along with the wired connection, but that adapter also got use with my laptop.We have a couple laptops, tablets, phones, Fire TV, etc. getting almost constant use in the house, so having a strong, consistent signal is great and having a signal that isn't getting swallowed up by other electronics is even better.  So, I thought it time to take the step with the desktop.  I'm a big dropbox user and we have media on the desktop as well, so a lot gets transferred between computers, not just from the internet, making a faster wireless a strong desire.Easily installed, had to run the setup from the disk to get it working right, but then everything connected great.  Got both signals working, not at the same time, and of course then committed to the faster AC signal.I'm getting a steady 877.5 Mbps, with occasional bumps up to 1.3Gbps.  The router is 2 rooms over, so not that far away, and it's giving me 5 bars of signal.  No drops yet. Very pleased. Will update if I encounter any issues.

If you're wanting to punch standard 3 holes into paper, this Swingline is probably as good as you're going to get for a manual.Heavy duty construction, feels solid, locks in a closed position to save space for putting in a cabinet.  My almost 3 year old was able to push down on it and punch some holes through her coloring pages, so that shows it doesn't take a lot of force.My one minor complaint is that the tray underneath is a bit hard to close and tends to open a bit when I move it, getting little dots of paper. This is heavy enough to find its own permanent spot, though, so it's not a big deal.I'm a professor and writer, so I have a lot of paper even though I try to do most things electronically these days.  They can easily get out of hand and this is going to get some regular use in our family.

Pretty straightforward, it looks like the picture, attaches in the regular way as other straps. Given that it will be rubbing on the wrist for potentially long periods of time, this is important, as discomfort would lead me to take it off, and that entirely defeats the purpose. We have a little girl (almost 3) and a little boy (6 months) and that means we have a lot of parties ahead of us, to hold and to go to.  We enjoy cooking, and being creative with desserts. My daughter loves doing her nails.The kit is pretty nice. The box shows off all the colors and some beautifully colored pics of well manicured hands and nail art work.The pens can be used as regular nail polish with the brush and all or as pens that you can squeeze the paint out with the finest pointThe nail polish isn't like normal polish. It smells badly like normal polish but it was kind of gloppy and thick using it as the nail polish brush. My daughter complained and asked if I would paint her nails. I thought perhaps it was because she can't do it herself but it was kinda thick when I did it for her. It took a long time to dry and she was in a hurry to do nail art.Patience is a virtue in many things but especially when doing art. I like using the nail polish pen and felt like I had total control using the pen.The polish came out easily and fine. You could totally draw on your nails. I was making swirls all over a notebook to test it out.My daughter opened the top and stabbed her finger with the tip of the pen I am not sure how she managed that but I think it is because those caps are definitely safely on.The kit also comes with a star mail file and nail stickers.There are tiny stickers you can stick on your nails to accessorize or the ones you can fill in with nail polish from the fine pencil.It takes some patience and there is a learning curve. When my daughter used the pen the polish started leaking from the top.I think it is a fun kit but not for anyone under 13

This is a beautiful ring. I love the intricate design that rests upon the blue bed sitting in the silver ring.The ring is heavy and made of Tungsten Carbide.I am a size 8 so I ordered an 8. Yesterday I received these silicone egg rings to try out. They came in a box individually wrapped with Styrofoam inserts to help them keep their shape during shipping. I opened two up, gave them a quick rinse with some soap and water and dried them. Since I wasn't sure if I should spray them with cooking spray, I did anyway figuring it wouldn't hurt. Since last night I cooked eggs for my son and learned you do not need to spray them. Break the egg into the ring but make sure the ring is laying completely flat in the pan or you will get egg leakage. Basically that just means the egg white spills out from underneath the ring.  No biggie considering most of the egg stays inside.  I guess if  you are cooking scrambled eggs or pancakes the instructions say to put the ring in the batter and put down into the pan because it will start cooking creating a barrier for the egg or batter to stay inside. You can flip the eggs if necessary. As soon as your egg cooks on the bottom, slip off the ring or do like I do and put a lid on the pot to get a cover over the yolk.When you are done give them a soak in water and soap, dry them and they are ready to go again. These rings will come in handy for making pancakes, hamburgers and more.Disclaimer: I received a complimentary product for my honest opinion.

I love this book for so many reasons. As a kid I made lists of movies I saw and movies I wanted to see including what I thought about them and why. If this book had been around I would have surely asked for it.The whimsical graphics make the book very child friendly but I think any movie buff will love the idea of 101 Movies To See Before You Grow Up.Each page features a movie along with a synopsis about it plus trivia, box office results, rating, and more.  There is even a section at the bottom for you to fill out what you thought about the movie, giving it a rating and adding things like when you saw it and with who.This is a wonderful journaling book that will stay with someone for years to come.This is the perfect movie companion book for a gift and we are starting our own little family movie critic day of the week around Thanksgiving. I can't wait to see what the kids write.

I used the wax on Saturday! When I opened the top I was concerned because the directions say to remove the top and the seal over the wax. The top was no problem but the seal impossible. It was completely attached to the wax and I was unsure if I could put the seal in the microwave. It was fine. 8 seconds in the microwave and I removed the seal.After that I stirred it with the wooden spatulas and put a sample on my wrist to make sure it wasn't too hot. It was fine so I proceed with my forearm. It was the place I figured I could see easily and control the amount of pressure.I smeared some wax on it, put a strip on, took a deep breath and ripped it off. Pain yes. If you have been waxed you know there is this moment when you think OK here it goes. Then you pull or the person waxing you pulls and it doesn't really hurt as much as you think it will. It stings YES. But not that bad. I moved onto the top of my hand where there isn't much but since I already had a paper and wax ready I proceed. Not bad AND it definitely made my arm smooth and hair free.Why not move onto my legs? I did...my legs are so smooth. I could never get that kind of smooth with shaving.Today, for review purposes I decided to to my knees. I tried to open the jar and could not. Not even a little. I ran it under hot water and tried again. NOPE! I ran it under hot water for a second time and wah-la...it opened. SO I suggest you always really clean the top of the jar and place it upright unlike me who closed it and tossed the box under the sink. Applying the wax again I concentrated on my knees. Apply the wax, put the paper over it. Run your hand or finger over the paper two times and pull against the hair growth. I think it would remove even if you went with the hair growth but I followed directions.  The hardest part of ripping that piece of paper off your skin is just before you pull. You are so sure it will be excruciating.  It isn't! Hurts yes but oddly enough, I don't mind it.It is truly amazing how easily the hair comes out. Takes way less time then when you shave or tweeze and the area is so smooth!!!I will be buying this again in the future with extra paper kits so I don't have to worry about running out.

My daughter and I dabble in art. We love painting, sketching, and all forms of mixed media so getting an easel was just one of the things we knew we would eventually get. The box was tall and light so when I started opening it and saw a bag with a screw driver in it I was surprised but quickly noticed that most of it was already put together. While I worked on the tall piece my daughter fit the shelves into the fitted slots on the legs. They are removable and in order to fold and store they will need to be removed. We don't have a place to keep it out so it will be stored and taken out when we need it. Thankfully it would only mean opening and reinserting the shelves.The easel comes in 8 pieces with four of those being the shelves. The tall piece needs four screws to affix it to the base. It comes with all necessary hardware.There are two pieces that slide into the large standing piece which will become the top and bottom for your easel.Pros:It was easy to put togetherIt looks wonderfulIt is completely adjustable to the size of your easelCons:There was a small crack in the large piece. It doesn't affect it in any way and was in the back so you can't even see it.The large piece is really really tall. I would probably cut a foot or two off.The placement of the back leg made it hard to put the bottom screws in easily. They got in but my hand kept hitting the back leg.The bottom drawers bang my legs when I stand close to the easel as you would to paint.All in all I love this piece and think the price is fairly good.Disclaimer: I received a product at a deep discount for my honest opinion.

These sandals are beautiful! I must admit they are truly eye catching and in the past four days everyone who has come in has asked to put them on.They are definitely well made. The stones are nice looking, the soles firm and the mesh band adjustable and sturdy to hold your foot in place.The first time I put them on I thought, "are you kidding me?" They made me so uncomfortable and hurt badly. I thought maybe I need to adjust the way I put my foot in and the band that holds them onto your foot. I made sure my foot was lined up with all the right rocks and tried again. NOPE! Not that. My kids asked to wear them. Playdate's were dropped off and moms asked to wear them including one dad and no one found them comfortable. I tried again every time and today when I put them on, they didn't hurt me right away. Yes the moment I took my fourth step I thought...still not ready but keeping them under my desk and using them when I am sitting is perfect. I love the pressure on my feet and sometimes have to remind myself to keep tying because I enjoy the feeling of rubbing my feet over the rocks.I know reflexology it is supposed to be therapeutic so I keep trying because who couldn't use relaxation every once in a while from the stresses of life but I will tell you I think it takes time. If anyone uses them and has no pain I would love to talk to you. Maybe you could tell me what I am doing wrong.Disclaimer: I received a complimentary product for my honest opinion.

I love the Wolverine LED headlamp and honestly have wanted one for so long especially when I am putting my daughter's earrings in. It is impossible to hold a flashlight and push a tiny earring through.The headlamp looks like a little camera and comes with two headstraps. One that goes around your head and one that goes on top. Both are totally adjustable and easy to make smaller or bigger.The on button is easy to press because it is right at the top so you can have it on your head and push whenever you need to. I've seen one that was a flip switch and it was annoying to try to figure out which way it went when you just need light.It does require three AAA batteries and doesn't come with.The light is bright and clear.There are so many reasons to have one of these on hand.Taking out splintersPutting on earringsChecking for the dreaded lice (got an email this week from school. Thankfully we don't UGH)Extra flashlight.Disclaimer: I received this at a deep discount for my honest opinion.

I thought this was a very interesting product. I am not sure why tomato was chosen as I would have gone with a Cherry for Cherry lips but my kids love the tomato so I have had to hide it.It is strange to put this thing up to my lips and create a suction that at first made me nervous because my lips did in fact pull into the tomato easily. They stayed puckered and the tomato stays firmly on your lips with the suction you create making your lips plump up.How it works:Take the top of the tomatoplace the tomato top on your lips. You can work on only one or both. I chose both. You place the center of your lip at the line that separates the two bottom sections.Pull your lips into the tomato without allowing any saliva into the tomato and sit 2 minutes with your lips inside the tomato. If you lose suction and you will unless you have a perfect seal, just do it again. It is really easy.When you remove your lips not only look fuller but feel fuller.it doesn't hurt or create any bruising and while you look silly with a tomato hanging onto your lips it does definitely create a fuller mouth.Disclaimer: I received a complimentary product for my honest opinion.

I am so impressed with this makeup mirror. Let's start with the packaging. It comes in a white box with the mirror name on the front and in two parts which easily pop together with a screw at the base. The mirror and base are inside Styrofoam that fits it perfectly to protect it during shipping.The mirror is double sided with 1X on one and 10X magnification on the other. It is perfect for make-up application or facial hair removal. You can pose the mirror in whatever incline you need for the best view and it doesn't slip. The mirror stays tight even if you have it laying at a completely horizon position on it's axis. Which means I can get those two neck hairs (why do I have hair on my neck?) that sprout up almost daily.We have it in the bathroom for the best lighting but I keep finding it in my daughter's room. I guess at 10 she is deciding she needs her own mirror.I received a complimentary product in exchange for my honest and unbiased opinion. No monetary compensation was offered or received.

This cell phone holder is pretty cool. It is totally adjustable, clips to everything and securely holds my phone.The eShopMind Universal Cell Phone Clip Holder Bracket has a flexible long arms that you can configure however you need to use your iPhone, GPS device, or MP3 Player.The device has a clip that clips to almost everything as long as there is space to clip. the clip your phone sits in is padded to protect your phone but you can also use it with you phone in it's case as it is just like an alligator clip and opens to whatever size you need.So far we have used it to Facetime my dad and my daughter clips it to her desk to Facetime with her buddy so she can play her computer game with her while chatting.I have also used it to take all my product reviews over the past week It was perfect and I have a feeling I will be doing way more video's with it.This also comes with a smaller holder for your phone to sit on your desk in an upright position. This is something I need because while flat I lose it in my paperwork.Great product. Unbelievably inexpensive.

1:10 Mins I am loving this thick ribbed knit scarf and may need to get more colors.So warm and cozy plus so many ways to wear it. I like it tight around my neck to keep out the cold as I am prone to sore throats. I put it on then wrap it around again making a figure 8So many compliments on it already. Can't wait to get the white and black one.Disclaimer: I received a complimentary product for my honest opinion.

I love changing my iPhone cases like other woman change their handbags. It depends on my mood and what I am doing for the day.The iPhone 6/62 Wallet Case or Vault Slim from Silk Innovations is a favorite because sometimes I need something I can put into my skinny jeans and not worry about it but also have my ID and a charge card with me. As a sub Assistant TA I don't have a desk to put my handbag and sometimes I don't even have a desk so I need my personal stuff to stay on me all the time. This is a perfect case because it is streamlined, not bulky but allows me to keep my phone safe and carry what I will need for the day.All ports are available for use and my camera flash is totally free. In the past some cases make my flash bounce of part of the case and I get a shadow on the pic. This one is perfect.I received a blue case which I love. The color is lovely and has a leather appearance.Like other Silk Innovation cases it comes with a screen protector as well.Great case for the priceDisclaimer; I received a complimentary product for my honest opinion

This iPhone 6/6s case is a perfect little phone for those who want to personalize their cases. The PureView comes with a clear back so that you can insert your own photo into it. There is a paper to use as a cutting template to make it easier for sizing.I love the gold color and the silky feel of this case.These phones are not cheap so keeping them safe is really important to me. I love the way the edges hug the phone.The port are accessible and the flash is clear. The volume buttons are covered but with a soft plastic which you can use easily.Great price for this customize-able case.Disclaimer: I received a complimentary product for my honest opinion.

The Binwo iPhone 6 Case is definitely a secure little case for the iPhone. I haven't dropped it (knock on wood) but since these phones don't come cheap you definitely want to protect your iPhone and why not do it with style.I love the color options on this case. I received a pink and gold.It is a nice silky smooth case. Your phone slips into the pink part from the bottom of the case and the accent gold piece seals up the bottom connecting the two pieces. I love how slim it is. I can fit it in my skinny jeans pocket. All ports are clear and available.There is an anti-scratch microfiber interior that cradles your phone.The price is wonderful too.Disclaimer: I received a complimentary product for my honest opinion.

1:41 Mins These mini plastic sealers use heat from a tiny coil to reseal mylar bags and cereal bags to retain freshness.They come as a two pack and require two AA batteries.There is a pink clip protector cover over the coil so you don't burn your finger but not an on off switch so I do take the batteries out every time I have used it which has been four times. In the video you will see that the white buffer piece on the opposite side of the coil one pops off. I think I was pressing too hard as I slid it over the bag. Fortunately it goes right back in.The idea that my chips will always be fresh makes me very happy as now that my husband has given up chips they last a whole lot longer and since they are so expensive these days I don't want to waste any food.The sealers are small enough to fit in any drawer for when you need to reseal a bag.

This small charcoal odor absorber is perfect for your fridge. or small air tight place. The charcoal is inside this nifty little compact thingy. There is nothing to spill or get messy. It is long lasting, they say up to two years. You can place outside in the sun to recharge on sunny, kids in school so the fridge won't open as often days.I like that it is compact and doesn't take up any room.Decent price too.Disclaimer: I received a complimentary product for my honest opinion.

I don't agree with some of the reviews. Yes it needs to be a dim room but I was completely able to view my veins and think this would be beneficial to anyone who needs to give themselves an insulin injection or fertility meds. I am not a doctor and don't know for sure but I would think If I had to I would be able to see where the needle would need to go.If nothing else, it was pretty interesting for my daughter to see our veinsThe light has a strap for carrying.Disclaimer: I received a complimentary product for my honest opinion.

These headphones are perfect for us.They come in a great travel case that zips up and looks cool too.My son LOVES the color and sound quality.Honestly for the price this is a great headphone.The cable feels like fabric and detaches from both ends.It even has a microphone so you can use it for hands free phone calls.We love the volume, pause and play button on the cord. Makes it much easier. I always hate trying to find the volume when it is on the headset.Disclaimer: I received a complimentary product for my honest opinion.

1:41 Mins These mini plastic sealers use heat from a tiny coil to reseal mylar bags and cereal bags to retain freshness.They come as a two pack and require two AA batteries.There is a pink clip protector cover over the coil so you don't burn your finger but not an on off switch so I do take the batteries out every time I have used it which has been four times. In the video you will see that the white buffer piece on the opposite side of the coil one pops off. I think I was pressing too hard as I slid it over the bag. I seriously need at least three more of these and two for gifts. I didn't expect much when just a little acrylic organizer with a few drawers but was pleasantly surprised when I opened the box. It is definitely a 4 piece acrylic drawer organizer but it is very well made. It doesn't seem cheap or flimsy at all. It is very hard and thick. All edges are sanded with the drawers pulling out and going back in very fluidly. They don't' get stuck or off track.There is a piece of felt in the each drawer and you can either have the two draws on the top or the bottom depending on how you flip it. The felt is not attached so if you flip it the felt becomes the floor either way.I see so many uses for this. We will be using this for tweezers, scissors and things in the bathroom but it could be used for:JewelrySmall collection pieces for displayPost it notes for your desk and pretty pensCosmeticsAND more.The next one I get will be used on my desk for my post its and pens and pencils.Great piece. So versatile and a great gift idea. It even comes in a box for wrappingDisclaimer: I received a complimentary product for my honest opinion.

I love these unbreakable wine glasses and think they make a great gift idea if you are doing a wine basket, new home basket or just because you are sick of breaking yet another wine glass!When these arrived my husband actually thought it was a beer cozy and tried to put his beer inside it saying it was too tight. We had a chuckle and I told him that these were actually wine glasses.He thought for sure that they would tip if you filled them and placed them down or that you would squeeze the liquid right out of them. I guess the squeezing thing is a possibility if you want to be an animal about it but hopefully you just drink like a normal human being.I doubt any wine will be drunk out of mine because my kids have confiscated them. I guess these could also be considered great for kids too. Not too young because like I said you could squeeze them hard enough and spill your liquid.My daughter was convinced they were glow in the dark because of the color but unfortunately for her they are not.They also come with bonus items and while I failed to take a photo of them in their box (kids took them out before I had a chance to stop them). Everything came in a white box with a circular potion in motion label sealing the box. Each glass (LOL I feel strange writing glass because they are NOT) was individually wrapped and there was a bag of extras. There were two wine corks thingies, (they seal beer too as my husband proved to me) and a bottle opener.This is a great set to give someone if you are giving the gift of wine. We will be gifting to our Christmas Party hostess this year.Disclaimer: I received a complimentary product for my honest opinion.

This is a tiny little Stainless Steel trashcan which is perfect for the bathroom. I love that it has a lid. My kids use baby wipes and with a septic you can't toss them in. No one wants to see what is in that trash can and they shouldn't. It is gross. Also, those nasty Q-Tips my husband tosses in their. Gross! This hides all of that. To open the lid, you just have to step on the foot lever. With this little guy, they do!It seems well made and sturdy.Disclaimer: I received a complimentary product for my honest opinion.

I love this bag. It IS completely multi-functional. The bag comes in five different styles, we went with the camo style as my son loves military attire and I think it makes a fashion statement.The bag has many compartments and could be useful as a camera bag, hiking bag, gym bag, school bag, diaper bag, fishing bag, hunting bag, boy scout bag, pocketbook and more.  The main area is waterproof and has a drawstring to keep your contents secure.There is a mesh area with a drawstring to hold in your drink or baby bottle.You can adjust the strap and move the shoulder pad depending on your need.Disclaimer; I received a discount for my honest opinion.

We had so much fun this afternoon with this kit from Discovery Channels Gold Rush Panning Kit,The kids and I didn't have a bucket big enough so make sure you have a big bucket. I think that is key. We ended up having to dump water into the pan and swishing as we went along. We loved the idea that there could be gold in here and the girls (Goddess had a friend over) thought it was really fun.We have never watched Gold Rush but now both girls are interested and each mentioned another kit for the holidays.We found it educational and interesting to find out that by swishing and draining water out of the pan you will get down to the black sand which is where the gold hides.  The girls thought everything they found was GOLD.Disclaimer; I received a complimentary product for my honest opinion. No monetary compensation was offered.

We love these little jars and have drummed up a ton of reasons to use them.My daughter uses them for house Polly Pocket Shoes, salt for her lunch box, earrings, gems, and homemade lip glass using melted crayons and mixing with Vaseline.I love using them to share samples of beauty products with my friends. I fill them and add a label letting everyone know what they are so they can try before they buy.These are quality plastic jar with removable tight lids so nothing spills.There are too many uses to list but here are some of them:SpicesTravelingMixing makeupSharing samples of beauty productsHolding gems or beadsMaking Vaseline/Crayon lip glossAND MOREDisclaimer: I received a complimentary product for my honest opinion

Wow these are some high quality clear plastic jars for so many uses.They come 25 to a box and are packaged in rows in a cardboard box ready to be filled with whatever you can think of.I love giving samples of products to friends. This is the perfect phone case. It feels silky smooth and looks amazing. I purchased a gold iPhone because I loved the look. Of course I want to protect it but hate covering up all that color.The Willnorn Norn One Silk is a perfect fit. It hugs my phone in all that gold color exactly like I wanted. Some have written that this case won't protect your phone from falls. I beg to differ. While I have not dropped (knock on wood) this case is made of a hard a silky plastic that could only protect your phone and I think that is because there is no place your phone isn't protected. It is wrapped around the border without any spaces.It was easy for me to get my phone in the case. Slip it in from the top and wrap the bottom around the rest of the phone. You will know when it is in.Pros:Very light weight and thin so it will easily fit in your pocket.The material is silky smooth but not slippery.It leaves all ports accessible.Doesn't hinder your camera featureThe box is perfect for gift giving and the price is great tooDisclaimer: I received a complimentary product for my honest opinion.

Loving this clear phone case. Perfect for when you spend money on a phone color that you love. Yes we want to protect our phone but why cover up that beauty with a solid cover. This soft, clear plastic comes on and off the phones easily.Probably one of my favorite cases since I got a gold iPhone, I want to see it!Another reason it is my favorite is that this cover is completely anti slip. My kids using my phone doesn't scare me as much as it used to.Disclaimer: I received a complimentary product for my honest opinion.

What a beautiful phone case. I love the leather on this case AND it's not only the lovely, quilt like leather but the opposite side has a shiny brassy look. This is an expensive looking case for a few bucks.It comes in many colors depending on your style.  It fits my phone perfectly and I feel very protected in it. The case is also an easy on and an easy off and these days most of us have a few cases because they are all so affordable.I would gift this pretty case. It even comes in a clear package for gifting.Disclaimer: I received a complimentary product for my honest opinion.

Sweet little speaker. It fits in my hand but packs a punch. It is bluetooth ready for hook up to your bluetooth music device BUT it also plays relaxation sounds that last about 20 mins.I have used these sounds more than the bluetooth but love that I can do that if I want to. The sounds include rain, brook, white noise and the ocean although I wish it had a few more sounds.You can also hook up your blue tooth to listen to a call. It is the perfect speaker for when you need to take care of things around the house, want to continue your call but need your hands. The speaker on my phone makes that impossible. I love the idea of these tiny fairy lights. I plan on using them on a canvas I did with little fireflies but there are so many uses for these. You can use them inside or outside. They are perfect for a light ambiance and will work for up to 8 hours as long as the solar panel gets enough light.

This Princess Table Top Castle Vanity from Velocity Toys is so cute. Very girls! Very pink!It comes in four parts. The mirror, the base and two pink pieces to hold the mirror in the base. We love our Keurig and love coffee. Sometimes there are three to four boxes of various coffee stacked on my tiny counter. First there is no room and second it is far from organized. Now that I have this carousel I can display all the various brands so we know what we have and what we can offer to friends.This has cleared up so much space on my counter and I love looking at it.  I love seeing all the different coffee available. It makes me happy and I love that it holds 24 K-Cups.Right out of the box it is ready to be filled.  The K-Cups sit in the holes securely and even with all the spinning we are doing, none have fallen out.  The best K-Cups to use are the ones in the plastic K-Cups not the ones that have a soft filter. Whip up some good times with Strawberry Shortcake and her pals and these three tales as they try out a good luck charm, go to a masked ball, and compete in a bake-off in this delectable collection!Berry Lucky Day - The Strawberry Shortcake movies have some of the most adorable animated characters. The mini berries and the pets are so sweet along with their owners Strawberry and all the rest of the girls but when the puppies misbehave, creating havoc no matter where they go. Everyone realizes that these little pups just need a place to burn off all their energy. The girls decide a Dog Park is exactly what these guys need.  Thankfully Huck's vision and hard labor pays off everyone is happy especially the dogs.A Basketful of Blueberries - is about a masquerade ball in honor of the new Dog Park. Blueberry talks Huck into coming even though he is nervous about dancing at the ball. When she gets sick before the dance, The girls come up with a plan to be Blueberry because they know she made a promise to Huck. With two Blueberries and a whole lot of confusion the girls quickly learn to always tell the truth it brings way less drama.The Berry Biggest, Berry Baddest Bake Off - Berrykin Blue has created such a wonderful drink that the Queen wants to honor him with a ceremony.  The girls decide to go all out and make this a very special day with some deciding to each make him a cupcake using the flavors he used in his drink.  With some great ideas comes some great competition. When catastrophe strikes the girls realize that they do better working together than working against each other.Each movie is about friendship, getting along, working together and always giving the very best of yourself.  The animation is colorful and fun and the bitty berries are adorable.  This is one hour and 7 minutes of friendship and characters many have grown up with. How could you not love these sweeties?!

The Muscle Roller Stick is used for Muscle Massage in Sports, Injury and Rehabilitation. It's great for deep tissue muscle as long as you apply a lot of pressure while rolling. It is great for increasing flexibility, loosening tight muscles and increasing blood flow to use the pain of muscle soreness.  If you can roll out dough, you can roll out some muscle pain.The stick has handles on both ends with these texture like balls around it that move independently of each other and the stick.  When I use it on my husband he likes me to roll with all my might. When I use it on my daughter or son they like it just rolled without any pressure. So far no one has used it on me. Wahhh...I have used it on my calves and thighs and really enjoy it. Can't wait to have someone use it on my back though..hint..hint.The stick is also light weight and easy to stick in your gym bag or suitcase so you can bring it wherever you may need help with a muscle ache.Disclaimer: I received a complimentary product for my honest opinion. No monetary compensation was offered

We love this phone case. It is like a Wrangler Jeep, Masculine or feminine. A perfect case for a guy, girl, or child.The black and blue case feels durable and safe. I found the set up to be easy. If you look at it you will figure it out. Took me about 3.5 minutes to set it up right out of the box with no directions. After use, I was able to fold it right back up, remove the pieces I had to attach and put it right back the way it came.This aluminum tabletop easel is a nice size. It feels steadier than some of the wood ones I have used in class.Remove from the box, take everything out of the plastic (it comes in three separate pieces.The long, big piece seems confusing at first but simply open up the legs, tighten the screws. Insert the top canvas holder by loosening the screw and place it on the top slot. Slide to where you need it as it is completely adjustable.Take the bottom canvas holder and do the same. It is a matter of tightening and loosening screws to remove or add.I love it and think it is even great as a canvas holder to keep something on display.Very light too. You can take it anywhere.Disclaimer: I received a complimentary product for my honest opinion. No monetary compensation was offered.

We are huge fans of all motorized toys. Planes, trains and automobiles are favorites. Just turn it on.The control which is a trigger controller has a little wheel you turn to drive and direct the car.We love the sporty colors and think the price tag is good considering the size of this beauty.Disclaimer: I received a complimentary product for my honest opinion. We are loving our Estilo Handcrafted Solid Copper Moscow Mule Mugs. The set is not only visually attractive but keeps our drinks nice and cold even without the use of ice. My daughter loves art. I really liked the fact that Nature Cups has figured out a way to reuse ALL those K-Cups we use. In the past year I have researched different crafts to use the cups for. None of them were amazing. WE Love this set and that Mega Bloks has created a Graveyard Garden PartyWe especially love all the Monster High colors.The set comes with a colorful instruction bookThe set took me about an hour to complete with having to restart twice by instruction #9 but I think this has more to do with the fact that I have never ever done a set in my life.It would have been helpful to have the blocks already place colored in the instruction pic. I think that was why I was confused.We appreciated all the little details too. The little pink ribbon skull, the blue bracelets and phones.The Mega Bloks set features Lagoona Blue and Cleo. There are huge speakers a turntable and a table for the girls to sit and have a drink.This is a great set for Monster High fans which we are.We love the dance floor and how the light from the sound skull above, flashes light on the dance floor making it look like a light dance floor.You can add other sets featuring other Monsters and connect them. Honestly I wasn't sure how I would feel about a Chromebook. We have always had laptops here but with all of them getting older we needed to consider one and this is the perfect one for our needs.Whenever my 10 year old asked to borrow the computer I always felt like I had to move it, I had to plug it in because it may be too heavy, too cumbersome for her. The Toshiba Chromebooks 2 is incredibly light weight. It is nice and sleek, very compact and since it weights practically nothing I have no fear when I let her carry it around or sit with it at the table.It is really fast as we have cable high speed and it is not bogged down with a million programs running in the background like our computers.The kids do all their homework on here and having a second super fast computer makes everyone happy.We did a quick tutorial and set some fun, kid friendly apps up for the kids to get used to it. Now we have Netflix loaded up and when we need an extra TV we have that too because they can stream whatever they want through the Chromebook.This is so better than spending money on another laptop just to have a second computer in the house. For what they kids need this is absolutely perfect and reasonably priced.  Most people don't use all the features they have on their expensive computers anyway.

Wrist pain is always something I have had when sitting at the computer. My mouse is amazing but my mouse pad was just cute. It had been my son's and when he got a new one I inherited it. Usually I spend 6-7 hours typing every day. My finger get cold and my wrist constantly needs to be cracked.The Keyboard Wrist Pad and Mouse Pad are truly changing things for me in a big way and it only took 2 days for the change.I believe in aliment for proper body position and know that when we don't have propoer aligment we throw everything off.At first I thought it would be hard to get used to. For years my wrist was always in a weird angle for my mouse especially on days that I am cutting, pasting, photo editing and surfing.  This mouse pad is exactly what I needed. It is a nice size for my desk and mouse. Wow...just wow... talk about a smart toy!Over the summer we received My Friend Cayla as well as My Friend Teddy.  Cayla is amazing and can literally be a lifelong toy that your child will never grow out of.Due to her speech-to-text technology, Cayla takes what is asked of her, finds it online via Bluetooth where she speaks it back to you.  You do need to have an Android or iOS device so you can sync through Bluetooth but once you are hooked up the possibilities are endless.Cayla's app is easily downloaded and once connected, your child can play with Cayla, listen to her read stories, discuss her photo albums even play games.When you first sync up, you will go into settings and add a bunch of information about your child so that Cayla can communicate with them on a very personal level. Cayla has her own personality, likes and dislikes and pulls from your information to talk to your child.Pros:  Price! I expected a smart toy such as Cayla to be well over $100.00. She is under.  A lifelong toy due to her capabilities and vast knowledge thanks to the internet.  Online Protection - Cayla has a built in predefined list of bad words.  She is a pose-able, adorable doll  Speech-to-text technology  Endless possibilities of play. I asked random questions and she answered more than 90% of them  She only takes 3 AAA batteries  Two toys in one! Not just an app, but a physical doll  Positive role, sweet voice that is always kind, confident and well mannered.  Her technology will only increase due to her connection to an app. As the powers that be change things on their end, so too will Cayla change. Can't wait to see what they come up with next.  The only cost to Cayla is the doll. The app is free! There is no monthly fee to use her.  You can use her as a speaker to play your music through your smartphone.Cons:  If you speak clearly, and are patient, Cayla will answer your questions. My husband was the first to use Cayla on his phone while I figured out what was going on with mine. You can't rapid fire questions at her, you must speak clearly and give Cayla time to find the answer to you. She doesn't have a brain she has a motherboard which allows her to take what you said, input it into her database or the internet and find the answer. You will see in my video that sometimes it did take time but patience always works with Cayla and in life.There is a learning curve. We are all expecting the doll to be mega smart. The technology is there but it is important to remember she is a doll. The first three times we used her, we didn't give her the time she needed to answer. We didn't wait for the heart to blink, it is the only time Cayla can hear you.Speak clearly, be patient, and this doll will amaze you. AND...as for all those endless, random questions your kids ask  you throughout the day; send them to Cayla and let her handle them. She probably knows more than us anyway.
