If you have very dark hair that you're trying to get rid of, you might want to use the coil or another method that actually removes the hair completely, because this razor is not sharp enough to do that. Still, it works pretty great for me and will be getting a lot of use!I received this product at a discount in exchange for an honest review.

These bottles are adorable! I got some hermit crabs for my little brother recently, and they need to be sprayed with water once a day to keep the environment moist. I didn't realize until I needed one that I didn't have a spray bottle, so I had been using a cheap one I'd gotten at the store that sprayed a stream of water more than mist. As soon as I got these we switched them right away, and these work so much better. The water comes out in a nice mist spray, not a hard stream. The bottles are pretty small, but we don't use much water out of them every day, so the size is big enough that we don't have to refill them often (plus there are four of them and this is the only use we've had for them so far). The tube goes all the way to the bottom of the bottle, so you shouldn't be left with much, if any, excess in the bottle that can't be sprayed. I got a light pink, a dark pink, a white, and a blue bottle. Since they're the perfect size for small perfume bottles, I've been thinking about using the unused ones to experiment with making my own perfume. They're adorable and useful for tons of DIY projects.I received this product for free in exchange for an honest review.

These highlighters are adorable - I just wish there was a red one! The outer casing of the highlighter is made of clear plastic with a clear plastic cap. The markings on the front show the milliliters in the syringe - each highlighter part goes to 5ml. I tested them all out and they work great, they haven't dried up or anything. I am a little worried of the plastic part shattering in my backpack, so I've got to be careful with them, but I've already gotten tons of compliments on them when I take one to use in a class. They're a great conversation starter and everyone wants to know where I got them. Adorable, functional, and unique highlighters!I received this product for free in exchange for an honest review.

These would be super cute jeans if the sizing wasn't completely off. I got size 16 and could tell without even trying them on that they would be way too small. I measured the waist as being 31" in circumference and checked the size charts several different clothing store websites; these jeans are an 8 or a 10 if you go by normal US size measurements. The leg to waist width ratio also seems to be off; the legs of the pants seem to be very wide, but I'm not able to fit in them, so I can't try them on to make sure. Very disappointed in the sizing; I don't understand why it's so hard to get the sizing correct when there are tons of measurement charts out there that tell you what the measurements need to be.If you actually fit in these jeans, they're super cute and seem to be pretty good quality. The lace on the outside of the legs feels decently sturdy; I would still be careful with them, but I don't think they'll just fall apart. The design of the lace is very pretty and the jeans themselves seem to be made of decent (albeit thin) material. The button is a little loose, but the quality is no worse than jeans I've bought from Forever 21.I received this product for free in exchange for an honest review.

This is a beautiful all-you-need set that's great for beginners or more advanced artists. I gave it as a gift to my little cousin. She loves to draw, but has never really experimented with painting before, so she was thrilled to have this set to start painting with. It comes with 24 paint brushes of all different sizes and shapes in a really pretty blue carrying pouch, a white painting palette, and a small sponge. The palette is pretty good quality and sturdy with a hole for your thumb. The paint brushes themselves are gorgeous and you have such a large variety that you have a brush for whatever you might need to paint. The carrying pouch has a flap that protects the ends of the brushes and a strap to help secure it and keep it closed. My cousin is in an advanced art class in school and her teacher has already told them they'll need certain kinds of paints and brushes later in the year, so now she's all set except for the paint. Great starter set and a great gift for artistic friends and family!I received this product at a discount in exchange for an honest review.

I plan on surprising my eight year old brother with this on Christmas, and he's gonna have a blast with it! The Santa hat is really pretty and soft, but it is a little on the small side. If you have a larger head, I would recommend looking for a hat that was larger. It'll fit my brother just fine, though. The only real complaint I have about the hat is that the ball on the end is slightly pink on the side that was pressed against the red part of the hat. It is not very noticeable and doesn't even show up in pictures very well, so it's not that big of a deal, but it does make me worry about the red of the hat staining anything else. The beard that comes with it is pretty good quality as well, although the end looks a little odd. It has a stretchy strap that you put around your head and over your ears and it stays in place just fine. There is a hole for your mouth. I had to trim some of the "beard" part so it didn't overlap onto the mouth hole, but after doing that, it was comfortable and not itchy at all. This is an adorable set for Christmas.I received this product for free in exchange for an honest review.

When I first took these out and felt the material, I was really disappointed because they feel very similar to another towel I own that isn't absorbent at all and does a horrible job of drying things. I expected the same from these towels, but I tested out the small blue towel after washing my hands, and I'm thoroughly impressed. It works much better than the regular hand towel I have by the sink and is so much thinner and more compact. I got the three pack with a small blue towel (about the size of a hand towel), a larger grey towel, and an xl orange towel. I'm not the biggest fan of the colors, but considering how well they work, I think I can look past that. With all three towels in their pouches stacked on top of each other, they still take up less space than one folded towel I have in my closet. They also have loops attached that can snap undone so you can hang them up; I will probably be cutting them off because I don't need them and they'll annoy me, but it's a feature that could come in handy for other customers. They dry very quickly as well; the hand towel was barely even damp after I got done drying my hands. I will probably keep the medium sized one in my car for emergencies, but the small one is destined to be a dish towel and the large one will go in my closet with my bath towels. I had planned on keeping the whole set in my car, but I love them and want to use them more often than once in a while in an emergency!I received this product for free in exchange for an honest review.

I've been using the blue one for a couple days now, and these seem to be really good quality! I've had shower sponges before that fell apart and unraveled the first day I used them; thankfully, that doesn't seem to be the case with these. The only downside is that they are a little on the small side. They're probably about the size of my fist or maybe a little bigger (and I'm a 5"3 female, to give you an idea of my fist size - it's not very big). They get the job done, but I do prefer larger sponges to cover more surface area.Still, these aren't bad at all and they'll definitely be used! It comes with a white, a blue, a lighter pink, and a darker pink. They all have small multicolored sponges trapped inside the mesh that add pretty pops of color and help make the sponge more absorbent. This is a good thing because you don't have to use as much body wash (at least in my experience), but has the downside that they don't dry as quickly or easily, which doesn't usually matter, but if I'm packing my sponge to take with me on a trip, I don't like it dripping everywhere. If that's not a problem for you and if you don't mind the smaller size, I'd definitely recommend them.I received this product for free in exchange for an honest review.

I tend to prefer jelly type vibrators, but I'm pretty fond of this one, as well! I'm still not sure if I like the rechargeable feature better than battery powered, but it is definitely convenient when you don't have any spare batteries and to save money. However, the charge does not seem to last as long as with battery powered toys (I think the booklet it came with said an hour, and that's pretty accurate in my experience).It has three buttons, a power button and two back and forth buttons that you can use to cycle through all the different options. They do not let you loop through the options; once you reach the last one, you have the press the other button to go back. This is very handy if you're looking for a specific function, but can also be kind of annoying since it's more button pressing than you would have to do if it would just loop through all the functions instead. The power is pretty decent; it varies by setting, but it can really pack a punch at its highest. The functions are pretty varied so you'll be able to find one you like, and it has standard continuous vibration as well.The charging port is kind of difficult to find at first because it's so small. I actually thought mine was a dud and didn't have one - I had to search for a couple minutes to find it! The loop at the end makes a convenient handle to hold on to. Over all, it's a pretty good toy to add to my collection! I just wish the charge lasted a little longer.I received this product at a discount in exchange for an honest review.

This is a really nice shower head with good water pressure! The shower head we had before wasn't detachable, and I'm liking this detachable one a lot better. It doesn't have as many functions as the one we were using before, but the functions it does have are pretty unique. The rainfall is pretty standard, but the waterfall is very neat! It comes with everything you need to set it up, including the mount you can keep it fixed on in the shower. It's improved our water pressure quite a bit and looks a whole lot nicer than the other shower head. The hose is pretty thin and flexible, which is a good thing. A relative I stay with a lot has a detachable shower head but the hose is quite a bit thicker around than this and ends up being bulky and getting in the way during showers. This one is thin and long enough that you can do pretty much whatever you need to with it, great for kids, dogs, or hair coloring! It's 4.5 inches, which doesn't seem like much until you actually compare it to a "standard" shower head. It isn't huge, but it's definitely a lot bigger than the tiny one we had. Overall, a great improvement!I received this product for free in exchange for an honest review.

Overall, I'm very happy with the results I've gotten from this hair mask. My hair is still hurting from the bad at-home bleaches and many colorings I've put it through, so it needs all the help it can get!Before I go into how well it worked, I do want to mention that the packaging is a huge problem in my opinion. It comes in a small tub; when you take the lid off, the actual product is covered in foil-like wrapping, which is fine except it's nearly impossible to get off without puncturing it in the middle and plunging your fingers into the hair mask. There needs to be a pull tab so you can pull the wrapping off without the hassle.Aside from that issue, I have no problems with this mask. It smells really nice and works pretty well. I have really oily hair naturally, so I was hesitant to use this for the full 5-7 minutes for fear of making my hair too oily. I ended up leaving it on about 4 minutes in the shower before rinsing it out. I used it after shampooing, but before conditioning, and after my hair dried it looked the same as normal - not too oily at all. The difference was not as extreme as I was expecting at first (which is actually a good thing for me, since that means my hair was not overly oily), but over the past few days I have been able to tell a difference in the softness of my hair - I haven't been able to stop playing with it! I initially only planned to use it about once a week to help keep my hair in good shape, but I think I'd be okay using it 2-3 times a week without oiliness being a problem. Very nice hair mask that's perfectly suitable to use on oily hair.I received this product at a discount in exchange for an honest review.

I am in love with this thing. I spend a good amount of my time on the phone since most of my friends live far away, and I also fall asleep on the phone pretty often. I hate the in-ear type earphones that are most popular nowadays, and it's hard to find a good pair of classic earphones that have a microphone, are good quality, and don't break after a week. Even if I do manage to find some good earphones, the cord is extremely irritating when I'm trying to do stuff and I always get tangled in it when I fall asleep on the phone. Earphones are better than having to hold the phone up to my ear all the time, but this headset is infinitely better than earphones.This is the first time I've ever used a headset, and I love it so much. It comes with an extra plastic piece to put over the part you insert in your ear if you need a replacement, as well as a snap-on piece that fits behind your ear to make it more secure. I used it with this piece to begin with, but it made my ear sore after about an hour of use, so I took it off, and it actually stays in my ear even without this piece. I'm not sure how, since my earphones are ALWAYS falling out, but this thing stays in place. It's amazing.The sound quality and mic quality are also pretty great. I can hear just fine out of it, and although according to my friends I'm not quite as loud as I was with my earphones, I'm a lot more clear, so it's still easier for them to hear me. I don't really like listening to music out of it since I prefer being able to hear my music with both ears, but the music I have listened to has seemed to have good sound quality too. I would like a little longer battery life (it lasts about 8-9 hours), but it isn't too bad and will probably be fine for someone who uses their phone a normal amount in a day (I would say I use mine more than normal). It comes with a USB charger, so you can charge it with your computer. It has a LED light on the back that indicates when the battery is low, when it's charging, when it's fully charged, etc - this light is VERY small, and I almost didn't notice it at first, but it is there. The whole headset is pretty small, probably about an inch and a half long (I'm just estimating) and very lightweight.It's comfortable, lightweight, has good sound quality and a good microphone - what more could you ask for?I received this product for free in exchange for an honest review.

My grandma has knee problems, so I'm always on the lookout for knee sleeves for her. However, although I ordered her normal size in these, they were way too big, so keep that in mind when ordering! She wears a size medium, but they were as big as a size large in a different brand. You should definitely size down with this product. However, aside from that, they are great. She can still wear them and they still help, they just roll down often when she's walking, which is why she needs a medium. The fabric is light and breathable and doesn't make her hot; it's also thin enough to wear under pants without being bulky or noticeable. The compression is good, even though it's a size bigger than she needs. They seem well made and durable. She's washed them a couple times with no issues. Very good knee sleeves as long as you're careful about the sizing!I received this product for free in exchange for an honest review.

This has REALLY come in handy for me over the past week. I'm a college student and I have to have everything written down if I want to remember it. I have an on-going to do list that I keep in my notebook, but being able to map everything out on a calendar on the wall has been really helpful, since it's right in front of my face and I can't ignore it. It is pretty big, but I have a whole wall open with nothing on it, so that's where the calendar went. The square for each day is big enough for just about anything you might need to write, and if it isn't, there is a notes section with more room at the bottom (I just put differently colored asterisks to correspond with the day; for instance, if I have something long to put in the 15th that won't fit, I put a green asterisk in the 15th box and then write whatever it is in green in the notes section). It makes it very easy to keep up with everything you need to get done.It is laminated, so it is pretty sturdy and you can use expo markers on it. They wipe off pretty easily depending on the marker and how long the writing has been on there, but even if it's a little tough to get off, all you have to do is use a wet washcloth or some cleaner and it'll come off easily. I am thinking about getting one for my aunt's classroom because it would really come in handy for her to write out when assignments and things are due for her students. Really great calendar for a student, teacher, or anyone who has stuff to do!I received this product at a discount in exchange for an honest review.

Overall, I really like this band. I have tried one other band prior to this, but this one is much more straightforward and user friendly. It comes with three bands: a blue one, a black one, and a neon orange one. I really do question the color choices - I would have replaced the neon orange with a pink since that would appeal to more people (but hey, if neon orange is your favorite color or if you're dressing as a traffic cone for the day, you're in luck!). The blue and black band have only one small stopper holding them in place, and it does not hold very well. I wore the blue band at first, but the stopper/button thing fell out and got lost, so now I'm wearing the black band, which has a more secure fastening piece (I will add a picture - it fastens through two of the holes instead of just one). I have not had any problems since I switched to the black band.The charger is really neat; it plugs into a USB port to charge, but the other part doesn't plug into the band. It's actually a case that you snap around the band; you connect the two metal parts in the plastic case to the two metal parts on the bottom of the band. The case holds it in place while it charges. The screen part cycles through four screens when you push the button located on the side of the screen. The first has the time, battery percentage, date, and several other symbols I haven't figured out yet (mostly because I haven't read the instructions). The second has the number of steps you've taken so far during the day*. The third has the number of calories you've burned that day (I guess it takes into account your steps as well as your basal metabolic rate, but won't take into account any exercise you do that doesn't involve walking, so keep that in mind). The final screen has the UV index, which is really cool to me since I'm very light skinned and this will come in handy for me when deciding if I need sunscreen or not! This might not be a very useful feature for darker skinned people. Throughout the second, third, and fourth screens, the time is also displayed very small in the top left corner.*Note: This is the biggest problem I've had with the band so far. Somehow I went from 0 to a little over 100 steps while I was in bed this morning, so I'm a little suspicious of the accuracy of the fitness band. I know they cannot be completely accurate, but accumulating over 100 steps while laying down seems a little much.The app is also very easy to use. I tested out a fitness band before that had an app with tons of glitches, was hard to read, and measured in cm and g instead of inches and lbs. I've had no such problems with this app yet. There are no glitches that I've found, you're able to input your weight and height in ft/inches and lbs, and there are no painfully obvious grammar/spelling errors. You don't have to have Bluetooth on your phone on constantly for your band to work; it syncs the data whenever you turn the Bluetooth on. I'm not sure how many days' worth of data it stores (it's probably in the instructions that I haven't read), but I turned my Bluetooth off Sunday morning to save battery and just turned it on again at 12:30 AM on Monday and it synced the data from Sunday, so it stores at least a day's worth of data so you have some time to sync it to your phone.The app shows you your steps, calories burned, sleep time (although I'm suspicious about how well this works too), and UV index for each day you use it (you have the option to scroll back and forth between the days). It lets you set daily goals, goal reminders, and even has a silent alarm that wakes you up with vibrations in your fitness band. It has a ton of features and they all work great as far as I can tell. It could use a little improvement in accuracy, but overall it has a lot of cool features and a really useful app, so I would say it's worth the money.I received this product at a discount in exchange for an honest review.

I love, love, love these knives. I stay in a college dorm and previously I only had one set of utensils - a butter knife, a fork, and a spoon. I primarily ate in the college cafeteria last year so it wasn't that big of a deal that I didn't have many utensils, but this year I have a kitchen and I'm  cooking more, so these knives have really come in handy.They came in a really pretty box that can be used to store them as well. The blades are made of gorgeous white ceramic (this is actually the first time I've ever used a ceramic knife and I really like them), and the handles are curved and fit well in your hand. The blades are pretty sharp - the small one seems to be a little bit sharper than the bigger one - and they each come with a black slotted cover you can put over the blades to protect them. I have not used the bigger one as much because it is not as sharp and I haven't needed a knife that large so far. I tested it out on a chicken breast, but the small one cut better so I just used that. The small one seems to be better for slicing, while the large one would be good for chopping. (I actually lost my one and only butter knife, so the small one has also been handy for spreading butter and peanut butter as well; a butter knife would obviously be better, but it works in a pinch!).These are really pretty, sharp, and good quality knives and I'm very impressed with them.I received this product for free in exchange for an honest review.

The pictures really don't do it justice; this necklace is dainty, detailed, and absolutely gorgeous. It's always a gamble buying inexpensive jewelry because it's so hit or miss (miss more often than hit), but this necklace is DEFINITELY a hit. It looks like a much more expensive piece of jewelry. I received the silver one; it came with nice little bag to keep it in. The chain is normal pendant length, and the part of the chain where you can hook the necklace is about 2 inches long, so you can adjust the length even tighter if you wanted (if I tighten it all the way, it's a choker on me). The chain seems good quality, too; it is very dainty, so I would be careful with it, and it does get tangled very easily since it's so thin (I actually just spent thirty minutes untangling it before writing this review!), but it doesn't feel like it will snap more easily than normal. This is a gorgeous necklace and I will be wearing it a lot, especially when fall/winter comes around!I received this product for free in exchange for an honest review.

This is a really handy scale, and not just for kitchen measuring. It will measure up to 11 lbs, so it should be useful for just about any measuring you need to do that needs more precision than a normal bathroom scale. I've used it for several science lab activities for class and it's very accurate; I've had no problems with calculations. It also has a liquid feature that you can measure liquids in cups/milliliters, which is really neat in my opinion even though I will probably never have a use for it. It has an auto-off function, but all you need to do to turn it off if you don't want to wait is hold the button down. The buttons are touchpad, not actual buttons. The battery is included and has a piece of plastic in it that you have to pull out before using, so the battery isn't already half dead when you get it. The scale is small enough that it can be stored out of the way easily (I just keep mine in a drawer), but it has a big enough surface that you can measure larger items on it. Very useful and accurate kitchen scale!I received this product for free in exchange for an honest review.

I am not a fan of white pillowcases, not to mention it doesn't go with my bedroom color scheme at all, but I made an exception for this pillowcase because it's so amazing. It's so soft, and both sides are the cool side of the pillow because it stays so cool at night. I've also noticed a huge difference in my skin and hair since switching to this instead of the cotton pillowcase I was using before. My hair is a lot less tangled when I wake up, which is a really great benefit in my opinion because I'm not losing as much hair in the shower while getting out tangles; I have thin hair as it is and less hair loss is always a good thing. I've also noticed less breakouts so far. I washed my pillowcase as often as possible, and I'm sure it wasn't the only factor to my breakouts, but it's definitely not as bad now that I've switched to this pillowcase, at least so far. I will not be going back to cotton pillowcases any time soon, if ever!I received this product for free in exchange for an honest review.

I absolutely love these! I got them for my college dorm room. I was a little worried they wouldn't stay up because the walls here are not completely smooth - they're a little bumpy - but it's been a week now and they're staying up just fine. I cut the wires to make them fit the wall that I wanted to put them on, and they look great. The wires did start peeling after just a few minutes, but that can be easily solved by overlapping the birds with the wire slightly, and then the birds hold the wire to the wall. The birds are holding up just fine, and they were very easy to peel off. There were a couple of places that didn't want to peel, but if you tried on a different area (for instance, the beak wouldn't peel so I just started from the tail instead), they come off fine - no problem at all. I'm not sure how long they'll last or how well they'll hold up after resticking them because I got them all right in one try, but I'm hoping to be able to use them again next year. They're super cute and really brighten up a room.

I'm really torn on this shampoo. On one hand, it makes my hair feel amazing, very smooth and silky. But on the other hand, I'm pretty sure I actually started losing MORE hair in the shower after switching to this shampoo. This could be because I was just paying more attention to it since this product is supposed to decrease hair loss, but at the very least, it did not stop the hair loss at all, and definitely did not make it better. This shampoo is NOT sulfate free, which was also a big disappointment to me; for a shampoo that claims to be so good for your hair, you'd think they'd at least not use sulfates, which are horrible for your hair and actually accelerate hair loss. Also, my hair seemed a lot more frizzy when I used this shampoo - that could have been because of the heat, since it was pretty hot that week, but I'm not sure. I stopped using it after a week because I was afraid of losing more hair; my hair is thin enough as it is after years of bad at-home dye and bleach jobs. I will probably try it again soon to give it another chance; I will update if I notice improvements.I received this product for free in exchange for an honest review.

NOTE: I did NOT buy this product on Amazon. I received a sample directly from the seller to review.I am definitely lacking in makeup skills, so I probably won't use all these brushes, but I know enough to be able to tell that they're good quality! I had a set of brushes before these that I never used, mainly because I hardly ever needed them, but also because they were horrible brushes - every time I used them I would end up with loose bristles shedding all over my face. Now that I have these, I was very happy to throw the old ones in the trash! These have not shed at all since I've had them, and I've used them a few times to test them out. They did have an odor when I took them out of the package, but after washing them with shampoo and letting them dry, the odor is gone. I like that the tips of the bristles are white so you can see the pigment on them; my old brushes were completely black, so I could never tell if I had enough product on them or not. With white bristles, it's much easier to tell, and also much easier to tell if you've gotten them completely clean after washing them. The color combination is really pretty, they feel really nicely made, and they fit well in your hand. Like I said, I am not a makeup connoisseur, but these are definitely all the makeup brushes I'll ever need - there are 5 bigger, chunkier brushes, and 5 smaller, skinnier ones. They fit perfectly in the pouch that comes with them, so storing them and keeping them clean is easy.I received this product for free in exchange for an honest review.

NOTE: I did NOT buy this product on Amazon. I received a sample to review directly from the seller.This is a pretty good quality wig, especially for the price it's selling for. The red is very bright and the hair does not look completely real - you can definitely tell it's a wig, in other words - but it would be fine for cosplaying or as a Halloween costume. I just wouldn't recommend wearing it out on a date or to an interview or anything like that. The ends are more wavy than curly, but the style of the hair is very pretty (and if I'm not mistaken, you can style it yourself, too, although I have not tried). The bangs are a little long for my tastes, so I trimmed them and I like them much better now. It comes with a wig cap, which is very handy especially if you have long hair, and a comb. The wig doesn't tangle as easily as I thought it would, so that's a definite plus! I put it on for about an hour and when I took it off there were hardly any tangles (I know an hour doesn't seem like too long, but I've had wigs before that got tangled if you so much as looked at them). You can clean it by using shampoo just like normal hair. Overall, it's a really great wig for a costume or cosplaying as long as you aren't looking for something super realistic.I received this product for free in exchange for an honest review.

They came damaged. I have had these before and used them with no problem, but maybe I got a dud package. Half of them have slight rips in them and scratches where the color has been scratched off. The purple, pink, and teal one are in decent condition; the green and blue ones are the worst, and the brown one has a few small spots that are damaged. I am not pleased at all. I absolutely recommend these if you get a non-damaged package because they're adorable, I loved the last package I had, and they lasted forever, but go with a different seller maybe.

These are super cute containers that are great for portion control, but I do think the quality could be better. As soon as I removed them from the packaging, a few of the colored tabs fell off some of the containers (not the actual tabs themselves, just the rubber-feeling colored part) and I was not able to get them put back on where they would stay. Additionally, and a much bigger problem - many of the lids would not snap down all the way, making the "leakproof" claim disputable. On one of the smallest containers, the lid would not stay on at all; I think it's because of the size of the container, since I had the least amount of problems with the bigger ones.Aside from the design flaw of the lids, these really are great for portion control diets. Portion control of every type of foods is one of my biggest challenges and also, in my opinion, the key to healthy eating. I have a bad habit of just counting calories when I diet, not actually eating healthier, so I'll eat carb-filled calories and no healthy calories. The portion control containers allow you to have a reasonably filling meal (it's a lot more food than you would think at first!) with the right portions of every food group. These also come with a few recipes; I did not really like them, but they're a good place to start if you're new to this! They're also dishwasher safe, so they're easy to clean after using them. I do not use them for every meal because I'm a college student with limited funds and kitchen space, so it isn't really an issue for me, but if you plan on using these for every meal, I recommend buying more than one set unless you're a fan of washing dishes.I received this product for free in exchange for an honest review.

There are so many cute designs I had a hard time picking which ones I wanted - I want all of them! I ended up going with the groundhog ones though because I like the color combinations, and they're just as cute in person, although the groundhog doesn't really look like a groundhog to me (more like a bear, maybe). Either way, they're super cute and well made. I'm on my feet a lot every day and if my socks aren't thick enough, my feet start to get blisters or feel like they're burning because of the friction. These are perfect - thick enough that friction pain isn't a problem, but still breathable so I can wear them outside during summer in the south. I also like the length of these socks. I have thick calf muscles, so a lot of taller socks don't fit my calves, and shorter no-show socks leave my heel open to blisters, so these are the perfect in-between length. I love them!I received this product for free in exchange for an honest review.

I wear a size 10 so I was a little worried I wouldn't be able to wear these, but they fit me pretty well. I think the sizes need to be explained a little more clearly - these socks are apparently 9-11s, which I took to mean they fit women with shoe sizes 9, 10, or 11, when in reality, they fit shoe sizes 5-9 (confusing, right?). The ankle part is a little unforgiving and doesn't have as much stretch to it as the rest of the sock, but I think that is a good thing - for people with smaller feet, it won't be a problem at all (although it makes me, Bigfoot, have a little more trouble getting them on), and it makes them stay up really well since it's so tight they won't slip down (not tight enough to cause discomfort, though). I don't know why, but I always have the problem of socks slipping down my heel when I walk a lot, but so far I'm happy to say I have not had that problem with these socks. They are pretty thin, light, and breathable, so they're perfect for wearing during the summer. I honestly did not like the color combinations at first, but I like them better when they're actually on my feet; they're bright, colorful, and cute, definitely a step above the plain white socks I usually wear. Adorable, good quality socks.I received this product for free in exchange for a review.

I really like the design on these shirts! I got the tank top, and my only issue is that it is definitely not suited for people with boobs. It says it is unisex, but the tank top, at least, is designed more for a male. It would have been so cute, but the chest area puckers in a weird way on the side of your chest between the breasts and the armpit because it is not designed to accommodate a fuller chest. This would not be a problem for someone with a flat chest, and this would not be a problem if you got the tshirt instead of the tank top. The armpit area is also cut much lower than I would have liked, to the point that my bra is exposed.Aside from the design problems, I really like the tank top. The navy blue is very pretty, the design is unique, and the material is thick (not the flimsy kind of tshirt material that rips in 2 days) and will hold up well. I will not be able to wear it out anywhere, but it will make a great workout tank.I received this product at a discount in exchange for an honest review.

These are absolutely gorgeous temporary tattoos that hold up very well - think of them as the slightly grown up version of the temporary tattoos you plastered yourself with as a child. These are gorgeous, have a metallic sheen, and hold up very well if you're careful with them (although if you put them on your hands, they tend to not last nearly as long). It comes with 5 sheets filled with gorgeous tattoos, which could be used in an endless amount of ways if you have imagination (I don't, but that's not the point). I used them with my niece and let her choose which ones and where to put them for both of us. They go on the same way as your typical temporary tattoo - cut one out, remove plastic, put it face down where you want it, apply a wet cloth, and you've got a beautiful tattoo that holds up for a good few days before starting to look bad. I really like the concept of these tattoos; you have small designs like feathers and arrows, but you also have strands that can be worn to look like a bracelet or a necklace or other jewelry. They definitely look a lot classier than regular temporary tattoos (to me at least), and they hold up much better as well. I'm very impressed, and while I will probably not be ordering more for myself (what can I say, even though they're gorgeous I feel silly as a young adult wearing temp tattoos), I will definitely be getting some more for my niece, who absolutely loved them.I received this product for free in exchange for an honest review.

The biggest flaw about this phone mount is that you can't listen to any CDs while using it, but since that's part of the design, I don't feel like it merits having a star taken off. A friend of mine has a horrible sense of direction and uses a GPS pretty much wherever she goes that isn't in the immediate area, but in one of the big cities closest to us there's been construction done and a lot of new roads added, so she gets turned around pretty much every time she ends up in that part of town, which is often. Upgrading the maps on her GPS would cost a ridiculous amount (I think over $100, maybe $200), so I suggested that she just use her phone as a GPS instead, which is a much cheaper option. I gave her an air vent mount that I had but she didn't like it because it didn't hold her phone very well. She didn't want a suction cup mount either because she just got a new car and was afraid it would leave marks, so I got this one for her to try out. It is unfortunate that she can't use her CD player while using this mount because she likes listening to audio books while driving, but other than that flaw, it's great. It fits securely in the CD player, and her phone (I forget what kind she has but it's some sort of offbrand Galaxy S4 lookalike) fits in it just fine, even with her case (although the case is not very bulky). Everything is secure and doesn't fall out, which was the case with the air vent mount. It does swivel, which comes in handy when you need to adjust your view or let someone in the passenger seat look at the screen. Very good quality and sturdy, and definitely better than the alternatives.I received this product for free in exchange for an honest review.

I absolutely love this bag - the design, the color, the size, everything about it. It looks like a smaller bag was just increased in size; a lot of times, larger bags have odd proportions and just look bulky, but that is not the case with this bag. I was actually surprised when I received it by how spacious it was. When you receive the bag it just has the hand strap attached, but there is a longer attachable shoulder strap included in one of the many pockets it has (and seriously, it has a bunch). The color is a very pretty brown; maybe it's just the younger generation opinion coming out in me, but it looks almost retro, like something I would have found in the back of my mom's closet and enjoyed carrying around at school and showing off when I was younger. It's made of very sturdy, thick, and good quality material; I'm sure it would show some wear over time, but it would definitely take a while and a lot of rough handling before you started noticing any signs. It feels very durable, which is a wonderful quality to have in a travel bag. It's large enough that you can fit pretty much your whole house in there; I'm pretty sure I could pack for a week in this bag with no problems (and I don't pack lightly). It definitely holds more than my backpack does without being larger. It's less bulky than my backpack is, and in fact, I used it instead of my backpack on my latest weekend trip. It has tons of smaller pockets - you have to search for a good 10 minutes before you find them all - as well as a very spacious main pocket. The zippers are good quality, as are the straps, which is definitely impressive, because let's face it - the bag can be made of the strongest material in the world, but if the zippers and straps are no good, then the bag is basically useless. I absolutely love this bag and it will be seeing a lot of use from me.I received this product for free in exchange for an honest review.

I gave these to my cousin as a gift - she recently got an oil diffuser and only had a couple bottles of essential oils, so this was a nice set to go with her diffuser. I do think they could have been packaged better - when I got them they were out of the piece of cardboard that's supposed to hold them in place - but thankfully they were still intact and not leaking or broken. It comes with six scents, and I think the differently colored labels are a nice touch. The scents are basic ones that you find in almost every set, but they do smell nice. It does come with an ebook that gives you ideas for other uses than just oil diffusers; I passed that along to my cousin as well who was very excited about it since she's a very artsy person and loved some of the ideas that were in the eBook (I think she's wanting to try making scented candles with them first). This is a very nice set with a wide range of scents, and the eBook with inspiration is a very nice addition to this set. Highly recommended.I received this product at a discount in exchange for an honest review.

I've been using this cream for about a week and a half now and have already noticed results, which is a very good sign! I'm really excited to see how well it improves my cellulite in the next month or two. It's August in Arkansas, which means it's definitely shorts weather, and while I am confident enough about my body to wear shorts without much anxiety, it definitely would be nice to get rid of or at least reduce the cellulite on my inner thighs, which is my main problem area. This cream goes on smooth without being too stick or oily or plain unpleasant like cellulite products I've tried in the past, and it has a nice scent - not too overwhelming, but it doesn't smell medicinal, either, which is great. I've only been using it for a week and a half, so no miracles have occurred, but I have definitely noticed some improvement - the skin is firmer, smoother, and less bumpy than before, especially the very upper part of my thighs. It comes in a good sized bottle, so it will last me for a while longer, but if it keeps working as well as it has been, I will definitely be buying more when I run out of this.I received this product at a discount in exchange for an honest review.

I received this product at a discount for promotional purposes, but it did not work when it arrived. I like the design and the feel of it, so it's a shame that it doesn't work. I tried two sets of batteries and made sure I was putting them in correctly; it just doesn't work. The component that holds the batteries is not well made and actually slides out of it completely, connected by a wire in the bottom. I'm not sure if that's a contributing factor as to why it doesn't work, or if it's just a design flaw. I'm not very impressed and glad that I didn't pay full price for this.I received this product at a discount and DID NOT promise a review in return (just felt the need to review since mine did not work).

NOTE: I did NOT order on Amazon. I received a free sample from the seller to review.I really, really wanted to like this dress... but there are too many major issues to ignore. First and foremost, the sizing is horrible. I wear an XL in most things but sized up to XXL and it was still way too small. The waist part where the bodice meets the skirt is not stretchy AT ALL, so even if the waist part fits you, if your bust or hips are bigger than your waist, there's no way you're getting it on since there is no give. See the measurements I took below (might be slightly off, but if they are, it won't be by much); even compared to the size chart, this runs way small. If you compare the actual measurements to the size chart, this is between a medium and a large; if you wear a 10/12, the XXL will probably fit (at least in the waist!).As far as the material goes, the quality was about as I expected. Don't expect a designer-made dress, but the quality was acceptable. It was about equal to or even a little better than some pieces I've gotten at Forever 21, quality-wise. However, there was a very noticeable black stain on the cream colored part of the skirt (see pictures when they are posted). The design of the dress is very pretty, although I would say the skirt is not exactly as shown in the pictures. However, the sizing and the stain are huge issues to me, and if I had actually paid for the dress, I would have been returning it. Most (or all?) of the other reviews that I've read have not mentioned a problem with stains, however, so as long as you will fit into the dress, I would recommend it.Measurements for XXL:Bodice (from shoulder to waist): 15.5 inchesWaist: 30 inchesFull sheer skirt: 25 inchesShorter coverup skirt underneath: 12.5 inchesI received this product for free in exchange for an honest review.

This is such a neat steamer - I didn't even realize that these existed, but I wish I had found them sooner! I got the yellow and green one and I love it. It is pretty small but it can hold a surprising amount, and it can be folded up flat so you can store it easily or take it with you easily if you wanted. I've only used it for mixed vegetables so far, but it works like a charm. I wash it by hand to make sure I get the inside clean, but it's very easy to wash and then it's ready to use again. Every kitchen needs one of these.

I have gotten several pairs of seamless cotton socks from this brand for my boyfriend and he loved them, so we decided to try these out since less foot odor is never a bad thing and he didn't have any black socks anyway. He is a size 12 and these fit him great, and he says they are very comfortable. Neither of us knew what to expect from bamboo fiber socks, but they are very soft and unlike other reviewers, we've had no problem with durability. They've been washed at least three times by now and are still in great condition. The cuff is thick and tight so the socks stay up even when he wears them all day, and although it doesn't get rid of odor completely, it's definitely reduced compared to normal cotton socks. They are dress socks, so they would be great if you needed to dress up, but they're also good for casual wear; he works in Home Depot and has worn these to work a couple of times now without a hitch. He spends all day on his feet, so comfortable socks (and shoes) are super important. These definitely fit the bill.

I got these as a gift for my boyfriend because he loses socks quicker than he can buy them. They'll fit sizes 8-12.5 in men's, which is a pretty wide range; his foot is on the larger end of the spectrum (he wears a size 12) and these fit him just fine. One thing I really like about them is the fact that they're seamless. I don't think it matters much to him, but the seam on the toes drives me crazy when wearing socks, so I'm considering getting some of this kind for myself! The top part of the sock is pretty snug, so it doesn't roll down even when he wears them all day. They're cotton socks and they're a good thickness - not so thick that they're hot or make your shoes tight, but not so thin that they don't protect from rubbing. I honestly didn't like the color combination at first, but after seeing them in person I like them a lot more; they're dark enough that they don't draw attention if seen under your pants leg, but they still have an interesting design and aren't boring, solid-colored socks. He's very happy with them and we will most likely be ordering more when he starts running low again.

I gave this case to my little cousin who recently got an iPhone 6 for her birthday. She tends to like pretty design cases more, but she thought this one was really neat since it could charge her phone. She has a couple of other cases meant mainly for decoration rather than protection, but they're very hard to get off her phone, so she doesn't have one on most of the time. This one is slim and lightweight, so she carries it around in her backpack at school so she can charge her phone easily and discreetly. It's a very slim case, but I would love to see it with prettier designs; the colors are plain and I don't like the text on the back of the case. Still, it's very useful and serves its purpose, which is primarily to charge your phone, not to look pretty. It's nicely made and doesn't feel cheap like some cases do, and the cutouts are precise and clean (a pet peeve of mine is when cases look cheaply made, but that's not a problem with this case). You charge the case separately and then put it on your phone when it's running low on battery, and the charge lasts a surprisingly long time; her phone rarely dies while she's out or at school now that she has this case as backup.I received this product for free in exchange for an honest review.

This pillow is great, but if you prefer soft pillows, this is NOT the pillow for you. I love super soft pillows and I'm used to using feather pillows, so this pillow was way too firm for me and made my neck ache the first night I used it. However, I gave it to my uncle, who prefers firm pillows, and he loves it. It really is a good quality pillow, it's just not for anyone who prefers pillows that are softer. The memory foam is thick and plush, and it actually also makes a great cushion to sit on. It comes with a really soft removable cover, but I also put it in a pillowcase; the first pillowcase we tried didn't fit it because it was so thick, and it was a tight fit in the second one, but it did fit. My uncle has been raving about it since he started using it, so as long as you like firm pillows, this one is an excellent choice.I received this product for free in exchange for an honest review.

I've never really needed to use a callus remover before because I lotion my feet every day, but I have been more active outside and busier this summer and have neglected my lotion routine, so this has actually come in handy a lot. I like the fact that it plugs in rather than uses batteries; I have so many battery powered electronics that I spend a fortune on batteries every month, so I'm glad to not have to add to that expense. It works really well even on the toughest areas and fits well in your hand; it even has ridges on the side so you can get a good grip while using it. I've never used one before so I didn't know what to expect, but it isn't painful to use at all, and although it is a little gross, it works wonders to buff away the dead skin until you get to the smooth skin underneath. I always apply lotion right after using it and it leaves the skin super smooth and much softer than before. It also comes with an extra roller and a cleaning brush, which I didn't realize would be so useful until I actually used the callus remover. It says the color is red, but it is actually pink, as shown in the pictures. It works great and is really nice to have in case my feet get in bad condition!I received this product for free in exchange for an honest review.

NOTE: I received this product for free to review from the seller. I did NOT order on Amazon.I'm used to standard leashes you hold in your hand, so this took a little getting used to. I would recommend caution when using this - if you are a small person, even though the elasticity in the leash does help you not to be pulled around as much, I still would not advise using this with a big dog that could overpower you. Just use common sense and you should be fine! My grandma used this with her poodle and was fine, but she could not use it with our big German shepherd. I am stouter than she is, so I tested it out with the German shepherd, and she did jerk me around a little bit (she is very hyper!) but I was able to keep control of her. If your dog is leash trained already, you should have no problem. The belt part will fit waists up to 46", so one size fits most. The leash is a little short for my liking, which is why I'm taking off a star, but that's because I'm used to giving the dogs lots of leeway while walking. If you need to keep your dog right beside you when walking, this leash is perfect. It stretches out quite a bit, but it does put strain on you when it's stretched out all the way; however, this might not be a problem for someone stronger/taller than me. It's sturdy enough that the very hyper and huge German shepherd puppy did not break it. It's a good quality leash that works well, but it is not for everyone!I received this product for free in exchange for an honest review.

After finding myself in several situations where I had to ask someone to open a bottle for me in the past year, I decided I needed my own bottle opener, but never got around to getting one. I'm glad I waited until I got a chance to snag one of these, because they're awesome. The box came with a label warning saying it contained chemicals known to cause cancer/birth defects in the state of California, so that's a little concerning (I'm guessing it's safe to use or it wouldn't be sold?), but other than that concern, I love this bottle opener. It's a pretty big bullet, which is good because it's easier to get a good grip on it. It fits really well in your hand and it makes getting bottle caps off a breeze. There's a small lip that attaches under the edge of the cap, which makes it easy to get the it off in one fluid motion. It works like a charm and makes a great conversation piece.I received this product at a discount in exchange for an honest review.

This is definitely the best method of preventing mosquito bites that you can find. I hate bug sprays because they're sticky and I feel like I need to shower after using them, and mosquito netting doesn't work if you're out and about, so I've really grown to love mosquito repellent bracelets. I've tried patches, as well, but I definitely prefer the bracelets because they're easier to keep up with and can be worn multiple days in a row. These bracelets are particularly nice because the design and colors are actually cute and they're a practical one-size-fits-all. I've tried some in the past that were adjustable via a button, and it didn't stay on as well and it was more of a hassle to get on than these, which can just be slipped on. I often sit outside at night so I usually have at least 5-10 mosquito bites on me at any given time. I wore one of these bracelets last night when I went outside and didn't get a single bite! Each bracelet lasts up to 11 days after you open the pouch, and there are 10 bracelets in the pack, so you're protected for the whole summer (unless you share). There's a variety of colors, so you can even mix and match with your outfit if you wanted. My pack came with 3 green, 3 blue, 2 red, 1 orange, and 1 purple. They work well and I really like the design and color variety.I received this product for free in exchange for an honest review.

This is going to come in handy so much for me - I wish I had ten of them because the possibilities are endless! It is pretty roomy; out of all the items that I carry around with me when travelling, the only things that won't fit are my lotion and my conditioner, and that's only because the bottles are huge. Everything else can be stored in this easily, which saves so much space, and since the pockets are clear and it has a hook so you can hang it somewhere in the bathroom (or wherever you'll need it), it saves a lot of time digging around in a bag to find what you need. It does fold up, but it is a little bulky when you have it filled with stuff, and there is no latch or anything to keep it folded up - I'm thinking about adding a velcro strap on it myself so I don't have to worry about it coming unfolded during travel. There are ten compartments total: 2 large ones on the bottom, one long one on the next row up, three medium sized ones on the second row from the top, and four smaller ones on the top row. There's a lot of variety in size of the compartments, so you can find a place for pretty much anything from pill bottles to shampoo bottles. The compartments also zip up so your things are secure and don't spill out of the bag. I will probably keep this one hung on my bathroom door for easy access to what I need while still saving space, but I'd also like one to put in my closet for various odds and ends, and it would also be great for a first aid kit or to store office supplies in next to my desk - which is why I need about ten more! Very handy bag that is well made and has plenty of space.I received this product at a discount in exchange for an honest review.

My little brother has been wanting an ant farm for some time, so he was very excited about this one. He's only had the clear gel ant farms in the past, so this one will be a new experience for him. I do wish that the sand colors were different; especially for an ant farm called Rainbow Ants, it seems like there should have been more color variety and black and white should not have been included. It could be much prettier with a wider variety of colors included and the black and white taken out. The red, green, and blue are pretty, although I would have preferred a brighter red. The tank itself was much thinner than I expected, but that's not a bad thing; it will make it easier to see the ants, especially since visibility will be harder than in a gel tank. It is curved slightly and is a nice looking tank with a secure lid. It also comes with a mystery stick (I have no idea what it's for - maybe for moving the sand around, but it is not long enough to fit too far down into the tank) and a small magnifying lens you can use to see the ants up close. It says there is a coupon for free ants, but as with most things, free isn't really free - you have to pay $3.50 (shipping and handling) for approximately 25 harvester ants. We can't order ants right now because it is too hot where we live (you're supposed to order when temperatures are between 40 and 85 degrees Fahrenheit, I believe), so we might end up catching some ants on our own to use. Since I obviously haven't gotten any ants yet, I can't speak about my experience actually keeping the ants in the ant farm, but the materials are nice and it's a good kit (aside from the odd color choices for the sand).I received this product at a discount in exchange for an honest review.

I live in a college dorm most of the year and I use a blackout curtain to block out the light in the morning. While that setup is great for sleeping in, my last plant didn't really appreciate the lack of sunlight and didn't make it through the year. I'm super excited to be able to use it in my dorm this year so I'll be able to have a plant without giving up my backwards sleeping schedule. It fits in place of a normal light bulb, so you can put it in just about anything. I have an extra desk lamp that was never used last year that I have it in right now. I don't move into my dorm until next week so I haven't tested it out on my plant yet (I got a pack of African Violet seeds that I'm going to plant when I move in), but I have had it on one of the house plants in my grandmother's house and it's definitely flourishing more than it was before, so I'm excited to see how well it will do in my room. I definitely do not have a green thumb as it is, so I'm glad to have this light because my seeds will need all the help they can get if they're being tended to by me. It doesn't produce any heat which means it won't damage your plants or your lamp (my desk lamp will melt with normal bulbs if the wattage is too high or they're left on too long; this is the second one I've bought since I melted the first one). It's also long lasting - I can't attest to that since I've only had it a few weeks, but I'm hoping the claim is correct and I won't have to worry about buying another one for a few years! This is a great light to have for houseplants.I received this product for free in exchange for an honest review.

My hair is my biggest vanity, but I probably don't take care of it as well as I should. I'm a sophomore in college and I've been coloring my hair since 7th grade, so it's definitely not in the best shape it could be. I used to have pretty thick hair, but after using Splat hair dye and bleach for a year (this was two years ago) to color my hair blue, purple, and pink, my hair started thinning and was in horrible shape. I'm still nursing it back to health, so I was very happy to try this shampoo out considering it's loaded with good-for-you oils and vitamins and is sulfate free. Sulfates are the components of shampoos that makes them lather up when you're using them, but they're horrible for your hair. I used this shampoo for a week and I'm beyond thrilled with how it improved my hair (I stopped using it after 7 days to test out a different brand, but I will definitely be coming back to finish this bottle and probably ordering another one). It does not lather up as much when you use it because it's sulfate free, which does take a little getting used to, and you have to be careful to not use more than you need to make up for the fact that it doesn't lather as well - using way too much shampoo is easy to do and will cause you to run out quickly, especially if you're not used to sulfate free shampoos that don't lather as much. It smells nice, but the smell is very subtle and I don't usually notice it. Right before I started using this shampoo I colored my hair again (professionally - no more at-home kits!). My hair always feels thicker after a fresh dye, but it feels more coarse as well, and it usually takes 2 weeks to get it back to as soft as normal. However, after a week of using this shampoo, it was back to as soft as it was before I had it colored, which is a big achievement! Sulfate free shampoos are also great for colored hair since they help preserve the color longer. A little over a week after a dye job and my hair is soft, shiny, and looks very healthy.I received this product at a discount in exchange for an honest review.

This is a wonderful pencil set for artists of any level, whether you're skilled or just starting out. I gave this as a gift to my friend who draws as a hobby. I am by no means an expert on pencils (meaning I'm basically clueless), but the pencils have different levels of hardness, making shading easier as you can use the different pencils for varying shades. The charcoal pencils also come in different levels of hardness, so there is a lot of variety, and assuming you know how to use them, you should have everything you need to create the perfect sketch or drawing. It has a sharpener and an eraser specifically for the charcoal pencils as well as a sharpener and eraser specifically for the graphite pencils. It really does have everything you need! My friend has used it a few times since I gave it to him and loves it. He didn't have a nice set like this and used plain #2 pencils to draw with, so he was very thrilled to get this set.I received this product at a discount in exchange for an honest review.

This is a fun activity for kids of any age - my little brother loved it and I had fun, too. The package comes with two gloves (pink and green), a bottle of bubbles, a small tray to pour the bubble solution in, and a bubble blowing tool. The gloves looked REALLY small when I first took them out of the box and I was worried we wouldn't be able to use them because they'd be too small - even my little brother's hands are bigger than the gloves, and he's only 8. However, they stretch tremendously. I was able to fit one on my hand - admittedly, I do have small hands, but it still stretched an awful lot (I'll post a photo for size comparison). You might not be able to fit your hands in these gloves if you have huge hands, but most children and women should be able to fit them, as well as some men if you have smaller hands. The bubbles last a surprising length of time when you're handling them with a glove on. We shared the gloves and each put one on, but it would definitely be easier to catch and handle them with two gloves; he kept forgetting he couldn't touch it with his hand and ended up popping a lot of them until I gave him both gloves and let him continue on his own. The bubble blower is neat, I like it better than the traditional wands that are in most bubble bottles since it seems to be a little easier to use and the bubbles turn out bigger. This is a fun activity that would be even more fun if it came with two pairs of gloves!I received this product for free in exchange for an honest review.

These bags are awesome and a lot bigger than I expected - which is a good thing! I usually put my delicates in a pillowcase to wash them, which works just fine, but this is definitely a much nicer solution. The only complaint I have about them is the colors - orange and purple seem a little Halloween themed, especially the orange zipper on the largest black bag - but that's not a big deal at all and definitely doesn't merit a lower rating. I like the size variation because I can use a smaller bag if only washing a few things or the largest bag if I'm washing more - I could probably fit every delicate I own in the largest bag, honestly. It comes with five bags, two small size with orange and purple zippers, two medium size with orange and purple zippers, and one large size with an orange zipper. You do need to tuck the zippers in before washing so the bags don't come open, but as long as you tuck them in you shouldn't have a problem. The mesh is good quality and the zippers are sturdy. Also, not only are these good for washing, but they'd be great for packing, too. I am moving back to college in the next week and will definitely be utilizing these for packing some clothes since they're large enough and you can fit a lot in them. They're good quality and definitely a better option than washing clothes in a pillowcase!I received this product at a discount in exchange for an honest review.

I got my S4 almost a year ago now and have been using the same case ever since I got it because I'm so picky about phone cases. I need one that looks good, works well, and doesn't make my phone too bulky. This case fits the bill - mostly. Turquoise is my favorite color, so I love the colors on this case, and the design is nice looking; I like that the whole case isn't turquoise but it still has that nice pop of color. However, it is definitely GREY and turquoise, NOT black and turquoise, which is what was listed when I purchased. The case was a little hard to get on over the buttons since the turquoise plastic part is so hard and unyielding, and once I finally got it on over the rubber part, it didn't fit just right because the rubber was shoved out of place. The case is a little thicker than my last one, but it still fits in my pocket just fine, so that isn't a big issue for me. The buttons are still easy enough to press while in the case, but the cutouts are a little messy for the headphone opening and other openings at the top. It's a double layer case, which I definitely prefer since I find them to be a lot more effective than cases that only have either the soft silicone or the hard shell, but the plastic feels kind of lightweight and not as good quality as my old case, and the silicone part is not secured enough at the top and bottom and pops off easily. It also comes with a screen protector, which is wonderful since I actually didn't have one on my phone before - I had ordered one but it didn't fit my phone correctly (that's what I get for ordering off eBay I guess), so I just haven't been using one. This screen protector fits a lot better, so now my phone screen is protected as well. This is a good cheap options for a phone case and the design looks nice, but it is a step down from my $20 case that I'm used to having on my phone.I received this product at a discount in exchange for an honest review.

I've always heard about how great aloe was but I'd never actually tried it. I've definitely been missing out! I'm amazed by the number of uses it has and by how well it works. I'm very light-skinned, but I bought a pool this summer and have been spending a lot of time outside, so I get sunburned fairly often when I forget to put sunscreen on. I put some aloe on it and it was almost instant relief. I recommend keeping it in the fridge for an extra cool feeling when applying it. I've also used it on mosquito bites with just as much success - it really helps take the itch out! Those are the only two things I've tried it out on so far, but there are so many other things I've read that it helps with that I want to try - cuts and scrapes, blisters, and even on hair (I am a little nervous to try it on my hair, though). The bottle is pretty big so you'll get a lot of use out of it, and it comes with a pump dispenser top to make it easier to use.I received this product for free in exchange for an honest review.

This body butter is amazingly hydrating and feels amazing on your skin. I usually use cocoa butter and I like it a lot, but I think this might work even better. My only complaint is that it's a little oily - not enough to bother me on my skin (it just feels soft, moist, and not greasy at all), but enough that I can't use it on my face since I battle oiliness there anyway. I put it on right after getting out of the shower and drying off, and after one use I could already feel the difference, especially on my legs - they get really dry when I don't use lotion for a while for some reason. It also smells and feels great when you put it on, definitely better smelling than the cocoa butter I usually use! It smells good without being overbearing. I absolutely love it, it's a wonderful moisturizer and would probably even work on your face if you don't have oily skin like I do!I received this product for free in exchange for an honest review.

This is definitely one of the neatest items I own. It does take a little longer to use than a normal clip or twist tie, but it doesn't take too long to heat up and seal and it does keep things fresh longer than clips since it is more airtight. It's not just for food, either - I have several bags that are supposed to be able to be vacuum sealed to keep bugs and moisture away from clothes/blankets, but they don't actually work. They were expensive so I stowed them away in a closet, but now I'm able to pack them with old blankets that I want to store and use the mini sealer to seal them and keep them safe. It works on things with a thickness up to 3 mm, which doesn't seem like much when you first read it, but if you actually look on a ruler, 3 mm is pretty thick! I haven't found anything that I needed to seal that I haven't been able to seal yet. It does take a little getting used to when you first use it, and it's a little different on every different type of material you use it on (chip bag vs. sandwich bag, etc), but once you get the hang of it, it's really easy to use.I received this product at a discount in exchange for an honest review.

I gave these to my grandmother because she's been looking for bowls that were microwaveable and dishwasher safe for a while now, and for some reason has had a hard time finding them, so she was thrilled to get these (plus they're also airtight and freezer safe). They have a vent in the lids for when you put them in the microwave, which is really neat - I've never seen bowls designed like that before. Usually, if you use containers like these in the microwave at all, you need to take the lid off before microwaving, so it's very handy that you don't have to with these - just pop them in the microwave and you're good to go. My only complaint about these containers is that they're kind of small. The sizes listed are accurate, but I would have liked larger containers since we've found that a lot of the time these are too small to fit all the leftovers in, even the biggest size. Other than that, they have a very neat design and lots of features that make them awesome bowls.I received this product at a discount in exchange for an honest review.

This is not really a history of what we understand as physics today, but rather a history of intellectual attempts to understand nature around us on some basis other than the supernatural. A large part of the book covers centuries of metaphysical thought. It contrasts competing lines of reasoning, and explains their shortcomings in describing how the universe actually works, which is what we expect of science today. How much you like this book, and your inclination to continue reading this book, will depend a lot on how interested you are in this topic.It is only around the time of Galileo that modern science begins to emerge, with a focus on experimentation and the description of the universe in mathematical terms. This begins the story of physics that is normally taught today, although this author takes an unusual path. In this book we find the practice of physics, rather than the enduring results, highlighted. We see the public lectures and demonstrations, the influence of practical inventions on the advancement of physics, and the underlying metaphysics that evolves but never really goes away.The story continues through the development of relativity theory and quantum mechanics, and into the post WWII era of big science. But then it sort of peters out. Only snippets of current physics are covered, although the author finds room to discuss plate tectonics which, while a great discovery, is not currently considered "physics".If the early parts had been condensed a bit and the finish stronger I would have gone for four stars. But as written this book leaves me somewhat unsatisfied.I was provided a copy for review by the publisher.

This short book has two parts, the first being about the prediction of and then failure to find the Planet Vulcan. The second is about Einstein's development of the General theory of Relativity, and how it explained why there was no need to hypothesize a new planet. Despite the piece of the subtitle claiming "How Albert Einstein Destroyed a Planet", Vulcan was gone before before Einstein arose.After the fortuitous discovery of the planet Uranus, careful tracking of its orbit suggested there was an unaccounted for gravitational influence on it. Astronomers has gotten very good at using Newton's law of gravity to calculate the influences the planets had on each other, and thereby predict their orbits. But Uranus' wasn't quite right. The brilliant, ambitious, and cunning French astronomer Urbain-Jean-Joseph Le Verrier predicted the orbit of another planet, and at his request the Berlin Observatory observed it. (Alexis Bouvard has earlier predicted the existence of another planet, and John Couch Adams also predicted an orbit for it. But it was Le Verrier who convinced someone to actually look for it based on his prediction.)Successfully predicting the location of the planet Neptune made Le Verrier's career. Then another opportunity arose. His calculations of the orbit of Mercury didn't match observations. He postulated another planet within Mercury's orbit, "Vulcan", and predicted where it might be seen.Unlike the case of Neptune, where there was initially little interest in actually looking for it, many people wanted to be the first to see Vulcan. And several did, or so they thought. But it could never be found again after any of those observations. Eventually it became clear that there wasn't another planet within Mercury's orbit. The error in calculating Mercury's orbit remained a mystery.The book then jumps to Einstein, and his sudden and amazing rise to the forefront of physics. In particular, his development of the Special Theory of Relativity, and its modification of Newton's gravity. But the Special Theory didn't account for accelerating objects. Einstein spent about ten years working on and off on the General Theory. It made two significant predictions that could be measured fairly easily. One explained the orbit of Mercury. The other was that the sun would bend the light from stars twice as much as Newton's theory predicted. The 1919 eclipse allowed the second prediction to be tested, and General Relativity was established. And Mercury's orbit was understood.This is actually a short book broken into two shorter books. The stories of Vulcan and Einstein share nothing other than the motivation to explain Mercury's orbit. The first part will appeal to those how enjoy historical tales of mistaken chases. The second will appeal to those who want a brief history of Einstein's development of the General Theory. How many will enjoy both is harder to predict.Interestingly, the author didn't delve into the later controversy about another predicted planet. With one found (Neptune), and one never there (Vulcan), there was later a concern that Neptune's orbit wasn't quite right. That turned out to be an error, but it did lead to the prediction of yet another planet. When Clyde Tombaugh searched in the predicted area he found, by a sheer fluke, Pluto; Pluto actually had nothing to do with Neptune's orbit. Had astronomers known how small Pluto was, and that its orbit was eccentric, inclined, and locked into a resonance with Neptune, they might never have called it a planet. But, believing it was a large body perturbing Neptune's orbit, it was considered a planet for decades. And its demotion to a minor planet thus became a big deal.I was provided a copy for review by the publisher.

Having read American Indian Stories and Old Indian Legends (Dover Thrift Editions), I was interested to learn more about Zitkala-Sa. The only biography I could find was this one, aimed at middle school children.Much of Zitkala-Sa's early life is taken from her own writings, which I had already read in the book noted above. The later parts are somewhat sketchy, perhaps because there is not a lot of material to work from. Some insight is gleaned from her letters, and from those we learn that she could be headstrong and manipulative.
